Title: Treasury Accountant
Description:
Quantum, IFRS, AMCT Job title: Treasury Accountant Job location: Canary Wharf, UK Employment type: 3 months contract

The opportunity:

  • This role offers an opportunity to work on a treasury management system replacement project within the Treasury Finance team.
  • Treasury Finance is co-located with the Treasury function and consequently engages closely with treasury operations, cash management, group funding. Due to the highly centralised nature of the group's Treasury activities, working in Treasury Finance provides a unique opportunity to understand the group's liquidity, internal and external financing and financial risk management activities.
  • The Treasury Finance team is part of the Group Finance organisation and provides all accounting, reporting and control support for external finance debt (~$60bn), related financial derivatives, centrally held cash (~$25bn) and internal funding structures for core Treasury companies (more than 1000 cross-group relationships and ~$70bn loans). The volume and complexity of Treasury Finance activity demands a rigorous approach to controls and process efficiency, and as such provides an excellent environment for team members to deepen their financial and systems process design, control and project management skills in a high-profile and fast-paced environment.

Key accountabilities:

  • Project activity within the finance area, treasury management system replacement and associated general ledger will be primary focus.
  • Support to other team members as needed

Essential Education:

  • Qualified Accountant with post qualifying experience in Treasury
  • Essential experience and job requirements
  • Strong Financial Accountant with practical accounting experience within Treasury environment
  • Prior project experience with Treasury Management Systems (Quantum preferred) and / or accounting general ledger systems
  • Prior system test experience with ability to bridge across test, technical and functional activities
  • Good understanding of system data models and application of data attributes
  • Must be a self-starter and able to work flexibly
  • Good interpersonal skills and ability to work across business and functional teams
  • Ability to work under pressure and within tight timescales

Desirable criteria & qualifications

  • Understanding of IFRS accounting treatments for financial instruments and hedge accounting
  • System implementation project experience - Quantum preferred
  • Chartered Accountancy qualification preferred
  • AMCT qualification
  • Knowledge of reporting for forex and treasury financial instruments including derivatives.

Title: Financial Crime Manager - Investment Bank - 12 month FTC
Description:
A global Investment Bank in London are looking for a Financial Crime Manager to join their team on a 12 month Fixed Term Contract.

A global Investment Bank in London are looking for a Financial Crime Manager to join their team on a 12 month Fixed Term Contract.

The successful candidate will be responsible for testing the operating effectiveness of Financial Crime and Sanctions controls, as well as assisting in developing and maintaining a robust ABC Compliance Program.

Responsibilities:

  • Drafting reports for senior management committees on a monthly and quarterly basis
  • Assessing regulatory developments and complete an analysis of impact on the Bank
  • Drafting ABC and Anti-Tax Evasion Facilitation, policies and procedures for the UK to supplement global policies and procedures
  • Completing ABC due diligence on third-party contracts as and when required
  • Assisting in developing and maintaining a robust monitoring and testing program, including annual testing plan sampling methodologies, schedules, procedures and reporting
  • Conducting monitoring and testing to support the effective and compliant execution and sustainability of the UK Financial Crime Program
  • Promoting a risk-aware culture; ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to required standards and processes

Requirements:

  • Strong understanding of the UK FinCrime regulatory landscape
  • Knowledge of Transaction Monitoring systems and other investigative tools
  • Strong understanding of AML/ATF and associated sanctions risks
  • An understanding of anti-bribery and anti-corruption compliance
  • Relevant ACAMS or International Compliance Association qualifications preferred

Title: HRBP Corporate Enablers (Maternity Cover 12 months FTC)
Description:
Working closely with the Head of HR, Corporate Enablers and Senior HR Business Partners, Corporate Enablers, you will provide the full range of HR Business Partner support to teams within CPO (Chief People Office), which includes Human Resources and Communications and CFO (Chief Finance Office).

Department Description

The Chief People Office (CPO) department supports the business to ensure the effective management and development of the talent in our organisation, and the effective communication strategy for all our business and regions. It involves having oversight of all aspects of human capital management and corporate affairs which includes a number of areas of expertise working together collaboratively - talent acquisition, talent management and development, compensation and benefits, employee relations and organisation development, HR Business Partnering (HRBP), Corp. Comms and Editorial.

The Human Resources department supports the business to ensure the effective management and development of the talent in our organisation. It involves having oversight of all aspects of human capital management, which includes a number of areas of expertise working together collaboratively - talent acquisition, talent management and development, compensation and benefits, employee relations and organisation development.

Key Responsibilities

Employee Engagement

  • Work with the Employee Engagement team on several communication activities including the Recognition Awards (supplementing centralised comms when required); the annual communications plan; assist on the preparation, communication and updates to the management team for the annual Your Voice survey and track outputs and activities
  • Take the lead in working with CPO and CFO leaders to develop plans to address Your Voice output in a measurable and sustainable way

Resourcing and Talent Planning

  • Work with Talent Acquisition team globally and participate in recruitment and selection processes to ensure experienced and skilled talents are brought into CPO and CFO
  • Support business managers in the induction and on-boarding of new staff, focusing on assisting new staff members in engaging with the Fidelity culture and understand management practices key to successful delivery
  • Work with line managers to ensure regular talent discussions take place as part of management meetings, and development plans are in place targeting high potential employees.
  • Facilitate annualised talent data gathering exercises with CPO and CFO stakeholders and support the Senior HR Business Partners in this exercise

Learning & Development

  • Work with the Talent team and the Senior HR Business Partners to support the collation and assessment of specific training and development requirements for CPO and CFO
  • Partner with managers to deploy talent development or learning initiatives across CPO and CFO, where much of the activity can be piloted given the nature of our teams
  • Work with the Talent team in rolling out various internal/external trainings for the business where required

Employee Relations

  • Manage employee relations issues, engaging with managers promptly to address issues in a timely manner and assist in developing employee communication plans where appropriate. Contribute to and lead the HR components of change management and restructuring initiatives, which may include consultation with groups and individuals
  • Coach and build capability of managers to handle situations with skill rather than managing the issues for them
  • Support the resolution of employee relations matters e.g. Involuntary termination, Redundancy, Performance Improvement Plan, Disciplinary Meetings.

Performance Management & Reward

  • In conjunction with the Reward team, undertake market reviews of compensation and work with the business to ensure an efficient management of the end of year compensation review process is conducted for CPO and CFO. Advise and support department managers in relation to their recommendations, maintaining objectivity and fairness at all times and ensuring accuracy of data throughout process. Assist in communicating key steps of the process and updates to the management teams.
  • Undertake proactive bespoke compensation initiatives, in collaboration with the Reward team, to ensure that compensation remains competitive and retains key talent.
  • Coach managers to manage performance on an ongoing basis and to have honest, open performance conversations with a focus on constructive and transparent communication between employee ad manager.

Other

  • Support with programmatic change, when and where appropriate, including the Foundations Programme and activities related to our Diversity & Inclusion agenda
  • As required, work with the Senior HR Business Partners to support the annual and monthly budget tracking process, as well as other ad hoc projects and activities
  • Participate as an active member of the HR business partner community to identify and share best practice, which in turn will drive continuous improvement

Experience and Qualifications Required

  • Ability to work with others, both as colleagues but also as internal clients.
  • Proven experience in navigating and building strong relationships and credibility at all levels across regions and functions with managers and senior leaders.
  • The ability to inspire confidence in others based on integrity, objectivity and fairness is key
  • Ability and desire to work with a diverse and challenging client group.
  • Highly collegiate, ability to work well with colleagues across the range of centres of expertise, sharing ideas and building on best practice, with proven ability to leverage their domain experience and capabilities.
  • Naturally curious with a drive to look externally into the market and understand the latest thinking within the human capital management arena.
  • Demonstrable experience of working on the full range of HR issues, including employee relations is preferable
  • A strong track record in HR advisory roles is desirable
  • Can-do attitude, experience of working on own initiative within a changing and high-pressured environment; commitment to high standards of excellence, demonstrating a drive to succeed in a changing environment
  • Experience of working in a customer focussed, dynamic, commercially driven environment: preferably Financial Services
  • Experience of providing feedback to stakeholders, across different levels and a desire to learn about and use feedback tools such as the Fidelity Leadership Profile 360 feedback tool and Hogan is useful

Title: Front Office Senior Management Accountant (initial 6-month fixed-term contract) - International Financial Services PLC - Up to £68,000 + Benefits - City/London
Description:
Our client is a successful global brand name, an established financial services PLC who have been going through an impressive period of growth. Their London operations are now looking to hire a Fully-Qualified (ACA/ACCA/CIMA) Senior Management Accountant to work in a role with Front Office stakeholders. The role will be offered on an initial 6-month fixed-term contract with the potential to have it extended or made into a permanent role. Candidates must be available either immediately or on a short notice period (1-2 weeks maximum).

Profile Criteria:

  1. Fully-Qualified (ACA/ACCA/CIMA) candidate with management accounting experience, preferably on the revenue reporting side (but cost reporting experience is useful as well as this team looks after the entire P&L). 
  2. Experience reporting in a PLC and multi-currency and multi-entity/subsidiary environment 
  3. Good communication and influencing/finance busines partnering skills with stakeholder management experience
  4. Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
  5. Confident user of Excel with Oracle or Hyperion being a beneficial (but not essential)  
  6. A sound understanding of what a good control environment looks like 
  7. Available either immediately or on a short notice period (1-2 weeks maximum) 

Job Duties:

  • Preparation of Management Accounts of the EMEA region across the brands, asset classes and legal entities. 
  • Preparation of timely and accurate management information for key stakeholders. 
  • Reporting of daily revenue at Desk/Divisional level and EMEA Regional reporting. Reconciliation of revenue and fees processed at month end. 
  • Calculate and accrue front office variable bonuses monthly, in accordance with employment contracts.
  • Liaise with front office to determine allocation of bonus pools, ensuring relevant approvals obtained before submission to payroll. 
  • Responsible to prepare Balance Sheet reconciliations with appropriate substantiation evidence. 
  • Assist in reconciling GL to the relevant sub-ledgers or source systems.  
  • Production of variance analysis and analytical reviews (P&L, Balance Sheet and Cashflow).
  • Build a rapport with counterparts in other regions to agree and settle intercompany balances and foster the sharing of best practice. 
  • Follow & develop processed to ensure an effective risk and control framework is embedded.
  • Assist with preparation of annual Budgets and Forecasts for P&L and BS, ensuring full understanding of revenue trends and key cost drivers. 
  • Year end reporting. This will include preparation of Year end files for relevant broking  entities, business reviews and assisting with Audit queries.  
  • Assist Group Tax with the preparation of VAT returns. 
  • Build and maintain professional relationships with the EMEA Finance Team and other key stakeholders. There should be clear communication and adoption of Group Accounting Policies and ensure the Expenditure Control Framework is adhered to at all times. 
  • From time to time you will be asked to undertake any other reasonable duties as required within this role. 
  • Complete any mandatory training by the required deadlines. 

Skills & Experience:

  • Fully qualified accountant (ACA, ACCA, CIMA) with solid post-qualification experience. 
  • Experience working in the financial services sector an advantage (but not essential) 
  • Skilled in applications such as Oracle, Excel, SmartView/ASO, Discoverer
  • Experience interacting with stakeholders across different departments In-depth knowledge of what a good control environment looks like
  • Attention to detail is essential

Title: Senior Management Accountant - Global Financial Services Group - Up to £65,000 + Bonus + Benefits - City/London
Description:
With offices in Europe, Asia and the US, this international financial services PLC has a solid reputation in the industry along with a strong track record of sustained success during its history. Their finance team in London is looking to hire an experienced and well-rounded Senior Management Accountant to provide reporting and analysis to their Commodities and Energy division. The ideal candidate will be fully-qualified (ACA/ACCA/CIMA and between 2-5 years post-qualified) and should bring a solid foundation of accounting experience covering management accounting, financial/legal entity control and intercompany reporting, with bonus or compensation calculation/reporting experience a plus (but not essential).

Purpose:

This role is within the Front Office Reporting team and will primarily focus on accounting, reconciling and maintaining records for Front Office compensation and bonuses. Other duties will include the accurate and timely ledger close of our EMEA regulated Legal Entities, producing end-to-end management accounts, performing reviews, interpreting and presenting to management, improving finance processes and the control environment, finance business partnering, etc.

Profile Criteria:

  1. Fully-Qualified (ACA/ACCA/CIMA) candidate with post- qualification experience (ideally 2-5 years PQE) from industry (ideally financial services but our client will be open to sector) 

  2. Must have worked / performed reporting in a PLC environment, within a multi-currency and multi-subsidiary business

  3. Well-rounded finance skill-set covering management accounting, financial controls and/or legal entity controls/reporting experience

  4. Understanding of what a strong/good controls environment looks like, with the ability to document accounting processes and procedures 

  5. Bonus or compensation accounting experience would be ideal (but is not essential)

  6. Oracle or Hyperion would be useful (but is not essential)  

  7. Good communication and influencing skills with stakeholder management experience 

Main Duties & Responsibilities

  • Ensure the EMEA regulated entities are closed in line with the company's accounting close deadline. Accounts should be prepared in accordance with IFRS, internal guidelines and accounting policies.
  • Preparation of Management Accounts for the EMEA region across the brands, asset classes and legal entities. Take ownership for control and sign off on Financial Performance of assigned Legal/Regulated entities and business divisions.
  • Calculate and accrue front office performance based compensation monthly in accordance with employment contracts. Distribute and communicate front office bonus calculations to Desk Heads and Senior Management. Ensure relevant approvals obtained before submission of bonuses to payroll. Front Office compensation is a key cost in the Front Office; it will be essential to have a full understanding of these costs and be able to provide variance analysis in our reviews.
  • Maintain the records and ledger for the Front Office Equity plan, this is a new initiative and will require co-ordination with HR and Group Finance.
  • Distribute and communicate deferral bonus amounts to Desk Heads, Senior Management, payroll and HR.
  • Prepare monthly journal entries for Front Office Compensation and Front Office Equity Plan.
  • Preparation and review of Balance Sheet reconciliations for compensation accruals and equity plan accruals.
  • Responsible for the monthly substantiation of the General Ledger and the reconciliation of all balances back to the relevant sub-ledgers or source systems.
  • Production of variance analysis and analytical reviews (P&L, Balance Sheet and Cash Flow).
  • Assist with the Annual preparation of Budgets and Forecasts for P&L and Balance Sheet, ensuring full understanding of revenue trends and key cost drivers.
  • Assisting with team developments to improve efficiency, reporting and processes for both UK and Non UK offices in a controlled environment.
  • Build a rapport with counterparts in other regions to agree and settle intercompany balances and foster the sharing of best practice.
  • Ensure an effective risk and control framework is embedded to support our processes.
  • Year-end reporting. This will include preparation of Year-end files for relevant business entities, business reviews and assisting with Audit queries.
  • Build and maintain professional relationships with the EMEA Finance team and other key stakeholders. There should be clear communication and adoption of Group Accounting Policies and ensure the Expenditure Control Framework is adhered to at all times.
  • From time to time you will be asked to undertake any other reasonable duties as required within this role.
  • Complete any mandatory training by the required deadlines.

Qualification and Requirements

  • Qualified Accountant (ACA, ACCA, CIMA) with several years’ PQE (2-5 years PQE).

  • Experience working in the financial services sector an advantage

  • Skilled in applications such as Oracle, Excel, SmartView/ASO, Discoverer

  • Experience interacting with stakeholders across different departments

  • In-depth knowledge of what a good control environment looks like

  • Attention to detail is essential

Title: Senior Financial Modelling Analyst - Mid-size Banking Group - £70,000 - £80,000 + Bonus + Benefits + Excellent Work-Life Balance - Central London
Description:
Our client is a successful banking group offering corporate, retail and private banking services. Well-capitalised and well-managed, the Bank has seen growth in profits consistently year-on-year, operating with a solid track record of retaining and developing staff and their careers. Their London office is now looking to add a Senior Financial Modelling Analyst (ACA/ACCA/CIMA fully qualified) to their Finance function. This is a newly-created growth hire position and would work closely with the Financial Controller with financial modelling (the models have already been built but do need updating, maintaining, applying, etc.), stress testing and IFRS 9 report writing.

Profile Criteria:

  1. Qualified (ACA/ACCA/CIMA) candidate with experience from the banking or financial services sector (with ideally a min. of 4-5 years post-qualified experience) 
  2. Financial modelling experience (must be able to build models themselves)
  3. Strong grasp and understanding of IFRS 9 with understanding of IFRS 9 modelling components. This individual will be engaging in report writing on IFRS 9 (and new IFRS standards in the future)
  4. Stress testing experience with credit risk and capital adequacy knowledge and experience around the preparation of ICAAP, ILAAP & RRP financials
  5. Excellent stakeholder management, relationship building and finance business partnering skills

Job Purpose:

This role will work within the Finance team and be responsible for all aspects of IFRS 9 modelling and the associated policies, procedures and disclosures. Its primary responsibility is to liaise with Risk, external consultants and auditors to ensure that the Bank complies with all relevant legislation and consequently the accuracy of financial reports. The jobholder will also be responsible for the preparation of the ICAAP and ILAAP stress testing reports, co-ordination of the Bank’s RRP and acting as data quality lead within the team.  

Key Responsibilities & Accountabilities

  • Ownership of the IFRS 9 Operating Model and Governance process. This includes all aspects of the IFRS 9 methodology to include model inputs, staging, policies, procedures, data quality, financial statement disclosures and all associated analysis. 

  • Promote a culture of control awareness and best practice across the IFRS 9 impairment process.

  • Working with the Risk team to produce ICAAP and ILAAP stress and scenario testing modelling.

  • Co-ordinate the production of the Bank’s RRP.

  • Analyse report data across Finance to effectively identify data quality issues and liaise with Risk and Operations to implement appropriate remediation plans.

  • Assist in preparation/review of management report.

  • Review upcoming financial reporting legislation as required.

Person Specification:

Knowledge

  • IFRS 9 subject-matter expert with understanding of IFRS 9 modelling components
  • Detailed credit risk and capital adequacy knowledge
  • Detailed knowledge of IFRS and CRD IV legislation

Experience

  • Solid post qualified experience of financial modelling in the Financial Services sector.
  • Strong first-hand experience of IFRS 9 modelling
  • Report writing in a professional environment
  • Preparation of ICAAP, ILAAP & RRP financials

Title: Senior Regulatory Accountant - Permanent role - Up to £65,000 + Bonus + Benefits
Description:
Our client is a successful and established financial services PLC who have been going through an impressive period of growth over the last 5 years. Their London operations are now looking to hire a Senior Regulatory Accountant on a permanent basis to join their finance function. The role is based in their City offices. Important: This position requires a candidate with hands-on experience of COREP reporting, specifically being able to do the COREP calculations themselves (rather than just providing information for others to do the calculations).

Job Duties

The Regulatory Reporting team is part of the EMEA Financial Reporting Group within the EMEA Finance team. The Regulatory Accountant will be part of the team responsible for ensuring timely and accurate reporting to the FCA, NFA, DFSA and CFTC and will work closely with Compliance, Risk and Treasury. The role is part of a team of 3, reporting into the Regulatory Reporting Manager

Specifically, the individual will:

  • Work with the other regulatory accountants to produce quarterly COREP returns for the various regulated entities, ensuring disclosure is timely, current and high quality
  • Work with the other regulatory accountants to ensure all other UK reporting deadlines are met e.g. monthly Client Money and Assets return, quarterly balance sheet and income statements, High Earners returns
  • Work with the other regulatory accountants to ensure all reporting deadlines for various international and regulated entities are met
  • Prepare monthly liquidity calculations, working with the Treasury team
  • Prepare the daily client money reconciliation and ensure client money procedures are up to date
  • Responsible for daily monitoring of structured trades and capital adequacy for NFA reporting
  • Assist with integration work, harmonising reporting and ensuring all new and amended processes are fully documented
  • Assist with various audit queries with regards to NFA and CASS audits
  • Help to build, maintain and develop relationship with external advisors, the business, and other Group functions on regulatory capital issues

Technical Skills:

  • Preferably would have general knowledge of capital requirements as they relate to IFPRU limited activity and limited licence investment firms
  • Skilled in Microsoft applications software (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook etc)

Qualifications and Experience:

  • Fully-Qualified accountant with relevant experience covering COREP reporting, specifically being able to do the COREP calculations themselves (rather than just providing information for others to do the calculations)
  • Work experience from the financial services industry
  • Regulatory reporting/accounting experience

Title: Accounts Assistant - Private Equity Company - Up to £25,000 + Bonus + Benefits - City/London
Description:
We are recruiting for an Accounts Assistant for a successful private equity company with offices based in Central London (although currently the office is working remotely/from home). Our client is looking bring on board an individual who brings a min. of 12-24 months of experience to assist with day-to-day finance tasks such as accounts payable and management of suppliers and customers. Candidates can be an AAT studier or AAT qualified (or not be studying towards a qualification). Note: Candidates who are interested in studying towards an ACCA or CIMA qualification will not be considered.

Profile criteria:

  1. A candidate who is happy to continue their career in an accounts payable and receivable role and who isn't studying towards an ACCA or CIMA. A reliable and steady pair of hands with the ability to work with pace, confidence and accuracy in an busy environment (they need a  capable profile as they see the AP function as being a vital part of the finance function)
  2. Ideally financial services experience but this is not essential
  3. Someone who has the communication skills and personality to fit into a professional, friendly and team-oriented environment.
  4. Well-rounded accounting skill set to be able to work on the Accounts Receivable side and also get involved in a variety of accounting and administration related tasks 

Job Details: 

  • Operational support to the Finance team.
  • Responsibility for management of Accounts Payable and Accounts Receivable function across the organisation.
  • Obtain authorisation, and present for payment, supplier invoices and employee expenses.
  • Assist in the review and implementation of new technology for invoice processing.
  • Principal point of contact for customers and suppliers and other internal and external stakeholders.
  • Monitoring and managing bank platform, performing bank reconciliations.
  • Ensure compliance with AIFMD through liaising with and providing information to External Depositary.
  • Preparation of monthly invoices and management of these from preparation to settlement of balances
  • Management of employee expense system.
  • Providing ad hoc accounting support including filing of all back-up documentation.

Suitable candidates will have:

  1. A min. of 12-24 months of accounts payable experience

  2. Proficiency with Sage and Excel, as well as Office packages.

  3. Good understanding of banking platforms

Title: Technical Project Manager (Digital Marketing Focused)
Description:
The Zeal Group (https://www.zfx.com) is a global financial corporation (Seychelles FSA License: SD027 & UK FCA License (FRN):768451) with a diversified portfolio of businesses spanning across Europe and Asia, with over 300+ employees globally. Headquartered in London, with international affiliates in Hong Kong, Greater China, Taipei, Bangkok, Vietnam, Indonesia, Moscow, Cairo. ZFX provides a wide range of financial products & services (FX, Commodities, Indices, Cryptocurrencies) to investors, professional traders, and financial institutions worldwide, with monthly trading volume USD 30 billion.

Job Summary

As a Project Manager, your job will be to coordinate people and processes to ensure that our projects are delivered on time and produce the desired results. You will be the go-to person for everything involving a project’s organization and timeline. Project manager’s responsibilities include developing detailed project plans, ensuring resource availability and allocation and delivering every project on time within budget and scope. Project managers should have a background in business and management skills, analysis and technology. You should be an excellent communicator and comfortable managing multiple tasks. You also need to be a team player and have a problem-solving aptitude.

Responsibilities

  • Ensure that projects are delivered on-time, within scope and within budget
  • Develop project scopes and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility  
  • Develop a detailed project plan to track progress 
  • Use appropriate systems, tools and techniques to control project performance, manage changes in project scope, schedule and costs 
  • Manage relationships with the stakeholders, define roles and responsibilities  
  • Develop communication plans, manage project communications 
  • Perform risk management to minimize project risks 
  • Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation 
  • Establish and maintain relationships with third parties/vendors 
  • Use and continually develop leadership skills 

Requirements

  • Great educational background, preferably in the fields of computer science or engineering
  • Proven 3+ years of working experience in optimisation and reengineering 
  • Strong analytical skills (data analysis skills as an advantage) 
  • Financial Markets and trading operations understanding as an advantage 
  • Project Management certification is a plus (PMP / PRINCE II) 
  • Understanding of the Agile methodology (Scrum framework) 
  • Strategic mindset and ability to foresee upcoming opportunities and threats

Title: Head of Development, Data Management Technology
Description:
Job Reference #226583BR
Your team
You'll be working in the Data Management Technology Team in Finance, Risk and Analytics Services Technology. Our role is to support the Group, Divisional and Functional Data Management Offices in implementing the Data Management Framework and provide the necessary Toolset for the firm to be successful. The ultimate goal is to improve the quality of data at the firm and extend its use to increase our revenue, reduce our cost base and minimize the risk.

• experience with agile development methodologies, test driven development and continuous integration

Expert advice. Wealth management. Investment banking. Asset management. Retail banking in Switzerland. And all the support functions. That's what we do. And we do it for private and institutional clients as well as corporations around the world.

Title: Fund Financial Controller - Real Estate IM
Description:
Posted by:
Tim Green
Director
View profile & contact
Are you looking for a varied & commercial role? Keen to work closely with bright, intelligent people who will help you advance your career? Then this high quality, award winning Investment Management business can offer you an exceptional opportunity. The culture of this business is exceptional, and we are looking to speak with exceptional talent who really want to advance their career. Demonstrable evidence of people being promoted and advanced within the business. This is a retained assignment. No other recruiters are involved.

THE COMPANY

One of the largest investors in their asset class, they invest and manage a well-diversified portfolio of European real estate assets, and have provided attractive long-term returns for their investors. 

THE ROLE

Reporting to the Finance Director, and managing two members of the finance team, the role briefly comprises of:

-Board and Committee Reporting:

* Responsibility for the drafting of Board papers including dividend declarations, budget/forecasting/scenario planning, strategic matters

* Ad hoc Board and Audit Committee attendance

-Deal Execution

* Responsibility for all financial aspects of property acquisitions, including:

*Engage and oversee advisors with financial and tax due diligence

* Tax/Corporate structuring

* Providing deal support

* Responsibility for all financial aspects of property disposals

-Financial & Management Reporting:

* Leading the interim and annual reporting process

* Assisting the Finance Director on all financial reporting aspects , taking the lead on technical accounting and disclosure matters

* Review and sign off on Group monthly management accounts prepared by external service providers

-Treasury & Debt:

* Assisting the Finance Director and supporting with execution on new loan facilities/refinancing events 

*Input into Green finance reporting

*Oversee debt facility activity - drawdowns, repayments, extensions

-Tax:

*Responsibility for Group tax provisioning alongside tax advisors

*Knowledge of REIT rules would be desirable

YOU

-Bright and interesting person to have around! 

-Qualified accountant with 6-10 years PQE

-Currently working in a Real Estate IM business, Real Estate Investment business, or the Real Estate team of an Audit firm

-Ability to ask intelligent questions/curious mindset

-Proactive with exceptional communication skills

-Commercially astute with strong technical skills

-Excellent planning and organisational skills

Title: Content Manager - CMS
Description:
Content Manager - CMS
Fitch Group is a global leader in financial information services with operations in more than 30 countries. Fitch Group is comprised of: Fitch Ratings, a global leader in credit ratings and research; Fitch Solutions, an industry-leading provider of credit risk products and services; and Fitch Learning, a preeminent training and professional development firm. With dual headquarters in London and New York, Fitch Group is owned by Hearst.

Fitch complies with all laws governing employment in each jurisdiction in which it operates, and provides equal opportunity to all applicants and employees. All applications will be considered without regard to race, colour, creed, religion, gender, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, disability, marital or veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity and other status protected by applicable laws.

Content Manager - CMS

London

Company Brief

Fitch Learning is a leader in financial services training. With unrivaled breadth and depth of training, the company delivers learning solutions for apprentices and graduates, to those with 10+ years' experience in Financial Services. A truly global company we have offices in New York, Chicago, London, Singapore, Hong Kong and Dubai, providing services to many of the worlds to banks and financial institutions.

Fitch Learning is part of the wider Fitch Group which includes; Fitch Ratings and Fitch Solutions. Agile and fast-paced we are able to tailor our solutions to a wide range of Financial Services clients with operations in more than 30 countries.

We're looking for individuals with drive, flexibility and passion to help us deliver a world-class service to our clients. In return, Fitch Learning offers a fast-paced, start-up like environment with considerable financial backing and stability that you associate with a larger corporate. It's a place where you can really make a difference and progress in your career.

Role purpose and description

As a leading training company in the financial services sector, our content for our learning programmes is at the heart of our success. We recognize the need to continually improve the way we develop, manage and deliver our content so we can continue our leadership in our field. For 2021, content is a key pillar of our strategy, and as a result, we are looking for a hands-on Content Manager, specializing in Content Management Systems and Processes, to join our team and help transform and enhance our content production and management capabilities. Our content comes in many different forms - e-learning, instructor materials, videos, study notes, and assessments. Regardless of the type of content, our objective is to create high quality, and highly reusable, pieces of learning content that act as the bedrock of the solutions we provide to our clients.

The Content Management Specialist will have help us achieve this objective by focusing on the following.
  • Managing, hands-on, the implementation of a content management system.
  • Content management, categorisation and centralisation.
  • General client and product content project support.


Role Responsibilities
  • Content management system implementation and ownership:
    • Project manage the implementation plan for the new content management system, alongside our in-house project management office where required.
    • Working with stakeholders to understand the challenges and opportunities as the implementation plan is rolled out.
    • Provide training and support to the wider business for use of the content management system.
    • Post-release, act as the system owner for the content management system, co-ordinating and executing all changes, updates and modifications as required.
  • Content management, categorisation and centralisation.
    • Alongside existing Content Managers oversee the management of certain parts of our content pool, across multiple types of content - e-learning, slides, manuscripts, videos, questions.
    • Own the version control and document management of different types of in-scope content.
    • Create necessary calendars, schedules and budgets to co-ordinate new content work.
  • General client and product content project support.
    • For our larger client projects act as a content specialist, helping co-ordinate and manage the workflows of the content between clients, stakeholders, our authoring team, and external partners.
    • Help develop and progress our content processes relating to larger client projects.


Role Requirements

Essential
  • 5-10 years' experience in content management roles, mainly focusing on learning content.
  • Detailed, hands-on experience implementing and managing a content management system.
  • Good understanding of the development process for learning content within an assessment-based content management environment including content workflows, content management and version control.
  • In-role project management experience.


Desirable
  • Experience of assessment software
  • Understanding of the development process for digital and e-learning content
  • Indesign and HTML knowledge
  • Sector experience is not essential but financial services experience or the ability to demonstrate high-level understanding of financial service topics would be an advantage.


Fitch is committed to providing global securities markets with objective, timely, independent and forward-looking credit opinions. To protect Fitch's credibility and reputation, our employees must take every precaution to avoid conflicts of interests or any appearance of a conflict of interest. Should you be successful in the recruitment process at Fitch Ratings you will asked to declare any securities holdings and other potential conflicts for you and your Family Members prior to commencing employment. If you, or your Family Members, have any holdings that may conflict with your work responsibilities, they must be sold before beginning work. In certain roles, employees and their Family Members may be limited to investments in diversified mutual funds only.

For more information about this policy, please visit the Code of Ethics and Conduct page .

#LI-AC2

Title: Financial Insight Analyst
Description:
Financial Insight Analyst
At Fitch, we have an open culture where employees are able to exchange ideas and perspectives, throughout the organization, irrespective of their seniority. Your voice will be heard allowing you to have a real impact. We embrace diversity and appreciate authenticity, employees work in an environment where they can be their true selves. Our inclusive and progressive approach helps us to keep a balanced perspective.

With our expertise, we are not only creating data and information but also producing timely insights from every angle to influence decision-making in this ever-changing and highly competitive market. We have a relentless hunger to innovate and unlock the power of human insights and to drive value for our customers. There has never been a better time to make an impact and we invite you to join us on this journey.

Department overview:

The Finance Department consists of approximately 40 staff working in an open plan environment.

Responsibilities:

The successful candidate for this role will support and report to the Director of Finance, Fitch Ratings. The main focus of this team is to provide insight to the Ratings business and the shareholders with insightful and timely information to facilitate informed decision making, including:

  • Being a trusted advisor to the business, working to provide support and analysis
  • Adding value to assist in decision making
  • Developing and improving financial reports and the financial reporting process
  • Working with the Group FP and A team to produce the annual budget and regular forecasts
  • Providing analysis and understanding around performance improvement projects
  • Constructively challenging business decisions and spending
  • Working closely with the Group Finance function including the CFO and CAO to provide data, analysis, exchange ideas and share knowledge
  • Variance analysis
  • Ad-hoc tasks and projects


Qualifications and experience:
  • Prior experience of working in a similar environment (strategy, business intelligence, analytics, finance)
  • Clear and concise communication skills with experience of using PowerPoint
  • Ability to collaborate with stakeholders at all levels of seniority
  • Advanced Excel skills, report design, and creating complex spreadsheets
  • Knowledge of accounting concepts an advantage
  • Experience with SAP an advantage
  • Accounting qualification (ACA, ACCA, CIMA or similar) preferred


Fitch Group is a global leader in financial information services with operations in more than 30 countries. Wholly owned by the Hearst Corporation, we are comprised of three main businesses: Fitch Ratings | Fitch Solutions | Fitch Learning.

For more information please visit our websites: www.fitchratings.com | www.fitchsolutions.com | www.fitchlearning.com

Fitch is committed to providing global securities markets with objective, timely, independent and forward-looking credit opinions. To protect Fitch's credibility and reputation, our employees must take every precaution to avoid conflicts of interests or any appearance of a conflict of interest. Should you be successful in the recruitment process at Fitch Ratings you will be asked to declare any securities holdings and other potential conflicts prior to commencing employment. If you, or your immediate family, have any holdings that may conflict with your work responsibilities, you may be asked to divest yourself of them before beginning work.

Fitch is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law.

#li-ac1

Title: Global Planning Manager
Description:
Global Planning Manager
At Fitch, we have an open culture where employees are able to exchange ideas and perspectives, throughout the organization, irrespective of their seniority. Your voice will be heard allowing you to have a real impact. We embrace diversity and appreciate authenticity, employees work in an environment where they can be their true selves. Our inclusive and progressive approach helps us to keep a balanced perspective.

With our expertise, we are not only creating data and information, but also producing timely insights from every angle to influence decision making in this ever changing and highly competitive market. We have a relentless hunger to innovate and unlock the power of human insights and to drive value for our customers. There has never been a better time to make an impact and we invite you to join us on this journey.

F itch Learning partners with clients to deepen knowledge, develop skills and enhance conduct, delivering positive business outcomes. We have centers in established financial hubs including London, New York, Singapore, Dubai and Hong Kong. We are committed to understanding complex client needs across fast paced financial markets, globally. Our learning solutions encompass expert faculty, e-learning, coaching and blended candidate assessments, improving individual contribution and collective business performance.

Global Planning Manager

London

Company Brief

Fitch Learning is a leader in financial services training. With unrivalled breadth and depth of training, the company delivers learning solutions for apprentices and graduates, to those with 10+ years' experience in Financial Services. A truly global company we have offices in New York, Chicago, London, Singapore, Hong Kong and Dubai, providing services to many of the worlds to banks and financial institutions.

Fitch Learning is part of the wider Fitch Group which includes; Fitch Ratings and Fitch Solutions. Agile and fast-paced we are able to tailor our solutions to a wide range of Financial Services clients with operations in more than 30 countries.

We're looking for individuals with drive, flexibility and passion to help us deliver a world-class service to our clients. In return, Fitch Learning offers a fast-paced, start-up like environment with considerable financial backing and stability that you associate with a larger corporate. It's a place where you can really make a difference and progress in your career.

Role Purpose

As a valued member of our management team, you will take ownership of the strategy, development and long-term success of the Global Planning team.

The tasks of the Global Planning Manager include: the effective utilisation of both our full-time faculty and associate trainers, Strategic Human Resource Planning, Scheduling and responsibility for the production and delivery of MI (Management Information).

Fitch Learning is embarking on an update to our systems and processes integral to these tasks and the Global Planning manager will assist in developing and implementing these.

Role Responsibilities
  • Support the implementation and ongoing development of systems and processes within the team
  • Build a Strategic Human Resource plan for our trainers to ensure the future demands of our industry are proactively met
  • Maintain a positive working relationship with all trainers, both full-time faculty and associates
  • Keep up to speed with the pipeline of work coming into the Global Planning team with regard to upcoming resource requirements
  • Drive quality assurance processes to ensure the right resource is allocated to each training assignment
  • Attend Resource Planning meetings to help identify and resolve any resource conflicts
  • Produce and monitor day-to-day and periodic MI / reports and resolve resourcing issues
  • Monitor trainer evaluations to ensure the highest level of delivery is sustained across our programmes
  • Manage the associate trainer PO / invoicing process
  • Help manage holiday requests to ensure there are no clashes that will affect business requirements and maintain and update holiday records
  • Become an advocate for the Global Planning team, becoming knowledgeable about the work the trainers are asked to do, and each individual's strengths and weaknesses


Role Requirements
  • Broad working knowledge of workforce management systems, tools, and processes.
  • Experience in a similar Supply and Demand Planning role
  • Superior analytical skills with the ability to assess data and trends using both quantitative and qualitative analysis techniques
  • Must be hands-on, proactive in approach and calm under pressure
  • Excellent relationship-building skills
  • The ability to stand your ground and be firm when required
  • Strong business acumen, the ability to relate workforce management processes and objectives to broader business at all levels

  • Excellent communication skills, previous exposure to senior leadership, professional demeanour and able to adapt your approach to fit the audience
  • Should be comfortable with multi-tasking, high-energy environment. Should be a creative and analytical problem solver

Description:
Learning Consultant CRM Dubai
At Fitch, we have an open culture where employees are able to exchange ideas and perspectives, throughout the organization, irrespective of their seniority. Learning Consultant

Dubai

Company Brief

Fitch Learning is a leader in financial services training. With unrivalled breadth and depth of training, the company delivers learning solutions for apprentices and graduates, to those with 10+ years' experience in Financial Services. A truly global company we have offices in New York, Chicago, London, Singapore, Hong Kong and Dubai, providing services to many of the worlds to banks and financial institutions.

Fitch Learning is part of the wider Fitch Group which includes; Fitch Ratings and Fitch Solutions. Agile and fast-paced we are able to tailor our solutions to a wide range of Financial Services clients with operations in more than 30 countries.

We're looking for individuals with drive, flexibility and passion to help us deliver a world-class service to our clients. In return, Fitch Learning offers a fast-paced, start-up like environment with considerable financial backing and stability that you associate with a larger corporate. It's a place where you can really make a difference and progress in your career.

Role purpose and description

To collaborate closely with corporate clients to understand their organizational learning needs, and internally liaise with subject matter experts to design, develop, and deliver learning solutions tailored to meet client objectives. To represent Fitch Learning in a professional, ethical and consultative manner with a view to maximize revenue and provide best class advice in the effective use of our products and services. The Learning Consultant will also be responsible for projecting annual sales, tracking sales performance and interacting with other areas of the organisation to ensure that client transactions are executed properly and profitably.

Role Responsibilities:

  • Development of learning solutions, proposals and advisory relationships
  • Business development to identify opportunities
  • Position Fitch Learning solutions and services to clients in the Middle East region
  • Identify individual client needs and industry trends to assist in product and service development priorities
  • Meet or exceed all assigned revenue and non-revenue targets
  • Qualify and convert opportunities that provide incremental revenues
  • Manage the complete sales lifecycle from the initial meeting to project roll out


Role Requirements

Technical Skills:
  • Understand Learning and Development (L&D) and the various activities undertaken by an L&D function
  • Skilled instructional design approach demonstrated through creative and commercial solution design
  • Good Microsoft PowerPoint, Word and Excel skills
  • Interest in coaching and training delivery
  • Solid planning skills to drive performance
  • Communicates effectively


Relationship Capability:
  • Strong advisory, sales and consulting activity
  • Dedicates time to developing business with existing customers
  • Manages pipeline for speedy progression of prospects to customers
  • Manages the sales process, nurturing from prospect to delivery
  • Manages the post-sale follow-up to build a strong customer relationship
  • Can build a trusted advisor relationship with all levels of clients in FS


Market Knowledge & Professional Skills:
  • Understanding of Financial Services and a keen interest in financial markets
  • Demonstrates flexibility, professionalism and is a strong advocate of Fitch Learning
  • Conveys enthusiasm, confidence and an entrepreneurial attitude


Education and Experience :
  • Requires a Bachelor's degree with Master's preferred
  • 5+ years' experience in Learning and Development and /or Financial Services

Title: New Business Sales
Description:
New Business Sales
Fitch Solutions provides data, research and analytics that help clients excel at managing their credit risk, offer deep insight into the debt investment market, and provide comprehensive intelligence about the macroeconomic environment. All available on our platform, Fitch Connect, designed and built using our credit, macro and industry expertise to help you make more informed decisions.

Role: New Business Sales

Location: London

Role

Fitch Solutions' Capital Structure, Leveraged Finance Intelligence group is a leading provider of breaking news and legal analysis on the leveraged finance and distressed debt markets. We are seeking ambitious, hungry and extremely results driven sales professionals to join our team. The successful candidate will be required to develop a business strategy and execute on sales plans to grow Fitch Solutions' footprint across Europe's leveraged finance space. This role is based in London and offers a base salary and commission.

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a company that is a leader in its space and at a very exciting stage in its growth and evolution.

Key responsibilities will include:

  • Hitting new business sales targets, whilst developing and maintaining a continuous pipeline of new business sales leads.
  • Managing full sales cycle, from identifying target customers and presenting product demonstrations, through to liaising, negotiating and closing deals with internal stakeholders.
  • Ensure all opportunities and activities are logged and updated in Salesforce.
  • Working closely with other Sales specialists and CRM teams across the group to help maximize revenue and cross -selling opportunities.
  • Act as subject matter expert in the leveraged finance space.
  • Working closely with the Product team to ensure our value proposition is well crafted for new products and is well connected to our sales opportunity landscape.


Key Skills and attributes required:

  • New business sales experience selling to one of our primary target markets of hedge funds, asset managers, investment banks and financial/legal advisory firms.
  • Proven track record of hitting / exceeding new business sales targets.
  • Comfortable managing the full sales cycle, from lead generation to closing multiple deals simultaneously.
  • Candidates with a strong network of contacts across high yield, distressed debt, leveraged loans is highly desirable.
  • Candidates with experience selling similar subscription-based services will have an advantage

Description:
Programme Manager - CWMA Certification
At Fitch, we have an open culture where employees are able to exchange ideas and perspectives, throughout the organization, irrespective of their seniority. Programme Manager - CWMA Certification

London, UK

Company Brief

Fitch Learning is a leader in financial services training. With unrivalled breadth and depth of training, the company delivers learning solutions for apprentices and graduates, to those with 10+ years' experience in Financial Services. A truly global company we have offices in New York, Chicago, London, Singapore, Hong Kong and Dubai, providing services to many of the worlds to banks and financial institutions.

Fitch Learning is part of the wider Fitch Group which includes; Fitch Ratings and Fitch Solutions. Agile and fast-paced we are able to tailor our solutions to a wide range of Financial Services clients with operations in more than 30 countries.

We're looking for individuals with drive, flexibility and passion to help us deliver a world-class service to our clients. In return, Fitch Learning offers a fast-paced, start-up like environment with considerable financial backing and stability that you associate with a larger corporate. It's a place where you can really make a difference and progress in your career.

Role Purpose

As the Certification Programme Manager working on our wealth management certification programmes (of which there are multiple variations), you will be responsible for overseeing and managing the day to day operations involved in delivering the technical written exams. You will form part of the Certification Team working closely with the Account Delivery Manager, Oral Exam Programme Manager and Candidate support function.

You'll be responsible for the technical written exam element of the CWMA programme, managing supplier relationships, monitoring and forecasting capacity, and ensuring a smooth transition onto the Oral element of this programme.

You'll work closely with our product team on implementing and maintaining remotely invigilated exams further enhancing the offering, escalating any product-related issues raised by candidates and have input into new certification products which the team will also support.

The position is based in London, England with some occasional travel to Europe required.

Role Responsibilities

  • Supplier Relationship Management with exam delivery partner, Pearson Vue
  • Capacity management and forecasting for both remote and 'in centre' exams
  • Administering exams using ExamStudio
  • Oversee candidate transition from Technical Written Exams to Oral Assessment
  • Manage the Objection and Appeal Process with the exam committee and the Swiss Association for Quality
  • Oversee the implementation and embedding of remote written exams
  • Coordinate communications to candidates and clients in relation to Technical Written Exams, including syllabus updates and process changes
  • Optimize booking process and exam allocation in the internal booking tool
  • Documentation of processes and procedures
  • Deliver client reporting
  • Provide support with annual programme audit administered by SAQ
  • Provide consultative support to Account Delivery Manager and CRM's as part of the sales and onboarding process for new clients
  • Escalate any technical issues affecting the exam booking process


Role Requirements

  • Experience in professional training and qualifications would be beneficial, but not essential
  • Experience of working with a global client base
  • Prior involvement in system implementation or changes
  • Must be hands-on, proactive in approach and calm under pressure
  • Excellent relationship-building skills
  • Confident in managing multiple stakeholders
  • Excellent collaboration and communication skills
  • German or French speaking would be an advantage

Title: Service Desk Analyst
Description:
Service Desk Analyst
Company Overview:

Dual-headquartered in New York and London, Fitch Ratings is a leading provider of credit ratings, commentary and research. Dedicated to providing value beyond the rating through independent and prospective credit opinions, Fitch Ratings offers global perspectives shaped by strong local market experience and credit market expertise. The additional context, perspective and insights we provide help investors to make important credit judgments with confidence.

Fitch Solutions delivers credit market data, analytical tools and risk services to the global financial community. In addition to offering proprietary market-based content, Fitch Solutions distributes the ratings, research and financial data of Fitch Ratings through a variety of flexible platforms. With innovation and experience behind every solution, Fitch Solutions helps financial professionals meet the diverse and evolving needs of today's global markets.

Fitch Ratings and Fitch Solutions, along with Fitch Learning and BMI Research, are part of the Fitch Group, a global leader in financial information services with operations in more than 30 countries. Fitch Group is majority-owned by Hearst .

Fitch complies with all laws governing employment in each jurisdiction in which it operates, and provides equal opportunity to all applicants and employees. All applications will be considered without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital or veteran status, sexual orientation, and other status protected by applicable laws.

Department overview:

The Global Service Desk is responsible for providing a high level of computing and telecommunications support, as well as implementing projects and technical initiatives for Fitch staff internationally. There are approximately 1,000 users in London and the UK, as well as approximately 4,500 users in sites across: America, Europe, the Middle East, Africa, Asia, Australia and Latin America. Support and project work encompasses all sites as well as frequent interaction with IT staff in our offices globally.

Service Desk technicians are primarily responsible for resolving queries that are picked up by themselves from the telephone, ticketing system or have been assigned or escalated to them from one analyst to another. They are also responsible for completing various project related tasks as may be assigned to them. The London Service Desk reports to the Service Desk Team Leader in London.

This is a support role requiring working a shift rota (covering the operating hours of 8am - 6pm) with other technology and support staff, although work outside these hours will be occasionally be required.

Responsibilities:

  • Take and resolve requests over the telephone, face to face and via the ticketing system.
  • Respond to and resolve requests within the specified time frame as logged in the ticketing system.
  • Keep requests updated in system with progress on a daily basis including requests for escalation.
  • Ensure users are kept sufficiently informed of progress throughout the lifetime of their calls through regular emails / phone calls.
  • Interpret and reiterate company policies to users and technicians and enforce policy when appropriate.
  • Prepare written communications and documentation.
  • Undertake research, document results and present to colleagues and Managers.
  • Develop own technical knowledge to improve ability to resolve requests.
  • Work with co-workers to increase knowledge across the Global Service Desk team.
  • Work with other team members and small project groups to develop tools to improve the Global Service Desks efficiency and effectiveness.
  • Recommend new methods or improvements based on own research, knowledge and possibly testing.
  • Organise, implement and action project tasks as required within agreed timeframe.
  • Expert knowledge on the local office setup.
  • Enforces best practice in the office.
  • Develop relationships with key members of the business, engages with business stakeholders and reinforces role of site expert.
  • Co-ordinate Asset Management and stock taking tasks for the office.
  • Manage third party providers for the office
  • Occasional Major Incident Management.
  • Supports Manager in recruitment.


Skills and experience:

  • Positive can-do attitude with a mature and professional approach.
  • Excellent troubleshooting and diagnosis skills.
  • Excellent verbal communication and customer service skills. Must have the ability to listen carefully, express ideas clearly and converse comfortably with a stranger, particularly under pressurised situations either in person or on the telephone.
  • Proven, excellent written communication skills - to write professional emails, communicate a range of information to staff across all levels of seniority, create documentation and write up research and analyse data.
  • Enthusiasm for and genuine interest in IT and technical support.
  • Must also have excellent decision-making and problem-solving skills to manage multiple priorities.
  • Excellent team working skills, ability to communicate well with others and share ideas as well as knowledge for the benefit of the team.
  • Strong eye for detail and an ability to follow procedures and implement them with users.
  • Must also be patient and empathetic to the issues and concerns of others.
  • Strong planning and organisational skills to enable proactive management of calls.
  • Methodical approach with lateral thinking ability.
  • Ability to cope with demanding situations.
  • Willingness to be involved all aspects of IT

Title: Top International Bank, Project Finance VP, London
Description:
A top International Bank' Natural Resources & Infrastructure Financing Group is seeking a VP to join its Energy/Power Financing Group in London. This team provides full coverage of finance/advisory services and help their clients to develop energy projects through lending as well as capital advisory services globally. This team is refocusing into the rapidly growing Power and Renewables sector in line with the energy transition and would be a great opportunity to gain global exposure.

A top International Bank' Natural Resources & Infrastructure Financing Group is seeking a VP to join its Energy/Power Financing Group in London. This team provides full coverage of finance/advisory services and help their clients to develop energy projects through lending as well as capital advisory services globally. This team is particularly in tune with recent developments and has been refocusing into the rapidly growing Power and Renewables sector with close collaboration between the Paris office for mandates across Europe, Africa and the Middle-East.

  • Preparation and presentation of marketing materials for origination purposes, while supporting all related activities
  • Preparation of credit analysis and other documents for the bank's credit teams and management's review
  • Preparation of term sheets and negotiation of loan documentation
  • Promote the firm within the Natural Resources industry and support its continued Energy transition focus

Requirements

  • Strong track record for leading Project Finance transactions
  • Extensive credit and financial analysis skills
  • Capability to supervise complex financial modelling
  • High levels of attention to detail, and numeracy
  • Strong communication skills
  • Client orientation and capability to maintain existent or build new relationships
  • Ability to work autonomously or within a wider group

Please apply if you are seeking a new challenge within a highly established group that has a particularly contemporary growth strategy.

Title: UK Senior Tax Manager - 12 Month Fixed Term Contract
Description:
Posted by:
Joshua Mazzeo
Recruiter
View profile & contact
Merhcant Bank

UK Senior Tax Manager

Responsibilities

Corporate Tax (CT) compliance and accounting participation and oversight

  • Oversight of UK CT compliance and submission of returns in accordance with internal and external deadlines;
  • Oversight of SAO notification and attestation process;
  • Oversight of UK and Danish CbCR process;
  • Oversight of UK Jointed Amended Return (JAR)/Group Payment Arrangement submission process;
  • Management of process for UK CT quarterly instalment payments;
  • Main point of contact with finance and auditors on preparation and finalisation of year-end and half-year end tax provisions, and presentation to finance stakeholders;
  • Oversight of CT input on HMRC Business Risk Review;
  • Main day-to-day point of contact for HMRC in correspondence, telephone calls, and meetings on CT matters;
  • Lead process improvement and efficiency drives in CT processes;
  • Attendance and participation at UK CT tax industry groups;
  • Preparation of NMR’s quarterly tax provision calculation, and presentation to finance stakeholders;
  • Preparation of schedules on deferred remuneration and share-based payments CT tax deductions for main UK subsidiaries;
  • Management of the publication of the UK and Group Tax Strategy; and
  • Management of the strike off/liquidation formalities for UK entities.

Business advice

  • Participation in/lead tax input on projects requiring tax involvement;
  • Assist UK Head of Tax/Global Head of Tax on tax input into projects; and

Overseas tax matters

  • Oversight and responsibility for overseas tax compliance eg Indian CT, WHT and transfer pricing (TP) compliance concerning non-Indian entities and individuals for the THE CLIENT ;
  • PE risk monitoring in relation to HR;
  • Oversight of all CT, VAT and Danish Business Authority obligations for Danish branch;
  • Oversight of all CT, VAT and TP obligations for Austrian tax PE;
  • Management of the ATED tax return filing process for two Group entities; and
  • Management and monitoring of US Treaty Protective Return filings for Group entities.

General Tax Matters

  • Build skills and knowledge to be in position to prepare provisional VAT returns for Business Continuity Planning purposes.

Title: Senior Quant (M/F) - NIMI UK
Description:
Senior Quant (M/F) - NIMI UK

Avec plus de 910 milliards d'euros d'actifs sous gestion au 30 septembre 2020, Natixis Investment Managers est une organisation multi-affiliés qui offre un accès unique à 22 sociétés de gestion spécialisées aux Etats-Unis, en Europe et en Asie. Elle se situe parmi les plus grandes sociétés de gestion d'actifs au niveau mondial.

Dans ce contexte, Natixis Investment Managers International est la principale société de gestion de tête des fonds ouverts du groupe en Europe et rassemble en son sein 3 activités :

  • Les activités de distribution en France de l'offre en gestion d'actifs de Natixis Investements Managers ;
  • Le pôle de gestion « Solutions » qui a vocation à proposer des offres innovantes et à forte valeur ajoutée construites principalement à partir des expertises de gestion des différents affiliés du groupe ;
  • Une plateforme de service dénommée « International Business Operations » centre d'expertise au service des activités de distribution et des affiliés


Natixis Investment Managers International ambitionne, grâce à cette nouvelle plateforme opérationnelle centralisée, de développer encore davantage sa présence en France et à l'international, d'optimiser le fonctionnement de son modèle multi-affiliés et de renforcer son efficacité commerciale en apportant davantage de valeur ajoutée à ses clients et distributeurs.

Relevant à la fois du Head of Global Market Strategy et du Head of Portfolio Construction, le Senior Quant permettra de développer des outils économétriques pour la construction de portefeuille, pour les hypothèses de rendement à long terme et pour la SAA. Il contribuera également à élargir les vues sur l'allocation d'actifs et à partager leur expérience des actifs privés.

  • Élaborer et maintenir des modèles et des processus robustes en vue de la réalisation des rendements attendus et des hypothèses de rendement à long terme,
  • Développer des modèles sur les classes d'actifs alternatives et les actifs privés,
  • Contribuer aux opinions en matière d'investissement et contribuer à la rédaction de documents de recherche,
  • Participer à la modélisation de l'allocation stratégique d'actifs et à la production de portefeuilles modèles,
  • Participer aux débats d'investissement,
  • Aider les clients internes et externes à modéliser/gérer le risque via la construction de portefeuille,
  • Contribuer à la conception de solutions sur mesure et innovantes et à la mise à disposition de portefeuilles modélisés du risque pour de nouveaux clients potentiels,
  • Mise en œuvre d'outils quant, notamment spécification, examen des codes, essais et documentation,
  • Réaliser des projets de recherche sur les nouvelles techniques de construction de portefeuille et les sujets pertinents du secteur.

* De solides qualifications universitaires et une expérience dans les disciplines multi-actifs et autres disciplines financières,
* Une connaissance approfondie de la construction de portefeuille, allocation d'actifs et modélisation,
* Une compréhension solide de nos clients, à partir d'un large engagement auprès d'une équipe de solutions et plus particulièrement de la valeur ajoutée de solutions multi-assets et cross-assets,
* Une connaissance approfondie des marchés financiers, des outils et des méthodologies quantitatives dans la gestion et l'exécution de la gestion de portefeuille,
* Une connaissance approfondie des actifs privés (au travers de multiples classes d'actifs),
* De solides compétences en matière d'analyse et de modélisation,
* Capacité à communiquer des idées complexes de manière claire, structurée et concise, tant oralement que par écrit, à un éventail de collègues et de clients,
* Des compétences de programmation fortes en Python, R ou Matlab,
* CFA un plus.

Title: DCM Associate - High Yield/LevFin
