Title: Software Development Engineer
Description:
Software Development Engineer
DESCRIPTION Come build the future of entertainment with us.
Are you interested in shaping the future of movies and television? Do you want to define the next generation of how and what Amazon customers are watching?

Prime Video is a premium streaming service that offers customers a vast collection of TV shows and movies - all with the ease of finding what they love to watch in one place. We offer customers thousands of popular movies and TV shows from Originals and Exclusive content to exciting live sports events. We also offer our members the opportunity to subscribe to add-on channels which they can cancel at anytime and to rent or buy new release movies and TV box sets on the Prime Video Store. Prime Video is a fast-paced, growth business - available in over 240 countries and territories worldwide. The team works in a dynamic environment where innovating on behalf of our customers is at the heart of everything we do. If this sounds exciting to you, please read on."

We are looking for Software Development Engineers to join the Living Room Client team. Within Prime Video, we are transforming the face of device application technology to provide the most performant, immersive, and fully-featured online video experience to the millions of customers worldwide who love watching Prime Video on their smart TVs, games consoles, DVD players, set-top boxes, and streaming media devices. Delivering a best-in-class experience on these devices is hard because they represent a wide range of performance and hardware capabilities. Addressing this challenge means creating new and innovative solutions and utilising a lightweight client codebase utilising TypeScript and React - allowing us to scale our experience to the thousands of devices that we support and provide updates on-demand. Our main focus is building the next generation UI experience on living room. We are engaged in breaking new ground in terms of what is possible on the 3P Living Room CX. We will be blending a full suite of existing and exciting new bleeding edge features with an unparalleled ability to measure and improve our own software using detailed and insightful metrics. We build software that allows other teams to add and extend functionality with minimum effort. This requires a keen eye for detail, an ability to design and architect scalable and maintainable software with an absolute focus on the customer experience. If you love building software that is used directly for the enjoyment of millions of Amazon customers, then this is the team for you.

Candidates will have an understanding of stable, scalable systems that have been successfully deployed in a business setting. You will be passionate about technology with a focus on the customer experience and great teamwork.

You will work as part of one of our small Agile teams, launching and growing new initiatives for Amazon's global business. As an engineer, you can be involved in every aspect of the process - from idea generation, business analysis and technical design through to development and deployment across a variety of technologies - giving you a real sense of ownership. Together we build systems which meet high standards of performance and reliability and operate at massive scale.

Amazon is a place where builders can build. We're looking for engineers who can delight customers by continually learning and inventing. From day one, you'll be working with experienced engineers, designers and applied scientists who love what they do.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS • Non-internship professional software development experience
• Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design
• Experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS • Experience operating and maintaining production software.
• Experience mentoring and coaching others.
• Demonstrated best-practice software engineering including some aspects of agile methodologies, unit testing, refactoring, code reviews, continuous build and deployment processes.
• Advanced coding skills (concurrency, profiling and performance optimization).
• Designed and built complex systems (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling).
• Basic familiarity with web technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React).
• Linux/UNIX (command-line tools, shell scripts, operations).
• Experience in data manipulation and analysis.

We offer a strong benefits package including healthcare. This is your opportunity to develop a rewarding career, work in a unique environment, and be part of a passionate and international team to work hard, have fun and make history!

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills.

Please let us know if you have any special requirements in relation to this recruitment process.

Title: EMEA Market Strategy Analyst
Description:
EMEA Market Strategy Analyst
This is an exciting opportunity for you to join a dynamic, diverse team within J.P Morgan's EMEA Private Banking business. We are actively looking for exceptionally talented individuals who are collaborative, confident and motivated to provide a first-class experience to clients. If you have an entrepreneurial mind-set and are looking to constantly challenge yourself, J.P. Morgan is the place for you. You will be working alongside a team of talented colleagues from other markets, businesses and functions to provide you with the opportunity to take your career to the next level.

Our Private Bank is a global wealth management leader that delivers the highest quality advice, service, capabilities and solutions to Ultra High Net Worth individuals and families around the world. Through our integrated and diverse platform, we deliver highly customized and comprehensive market leading solutions to help clients with the many challenges and complexities they face in the ever-evolving financial services space.

About the Market Strategy Team:

The Market Strategy team is responsible for communicating the thematic market and investment insights across J.P. Morgan Wealth Management businesses, which manage over billion of client assets worldwide. The team has a unique and broad mandate to synthesize Wealth Management views across all asset classes, sectors, and geographies, and to share these insights via internal sales force education, external client presentations, and internal and external publications. Channels for content distribution include the daily Morning Meeting, Key Investment Themes, and Top Market Takeaways. The team leverages resources and relationships across the entire J.P. Morgan Private Bank Solutions franchise to synthesize our views into actionable, relatable, and repeatable messages for our advisors and clients.

The Market Strategy Analyst Position Summary:

Global analysts on the Market Strategy team support David Stubbs (Global Head of Market Strategy) and his team. Analysts are responsible for driving ideas, planning, and coordination of the global Morning Meetings; interfacing with solutions partners across Wealth Management to craft and develop messaging of investment themes; assisting with global business strategy and contributing analysis and materials for Market Strategy content. Analysts receive significant exposure to Wealth Management leadership and will grow to be well-versed in a substantial variety of financial market, macroeconomic, and investment strategy concepts.

This Analyst will help support the team's functions in EMEA, led by Grace Peters (EMEA Head of Investment Strategy). Focus will be on the team's offering in EMEA, particularly the Morning Meeting, but will also include the opportunity to develop content and strategy across the IPB, including LatAm and Asia.

Required Skills and Qualifications:
  • Fast learner; strong initiative; desire and ability to synthesize a variety of global macroeconomic trends, complex financial concepts, and investment themes.
  • Demonstrated ability to outperform in demanding and fast-paced work environment.
  • Broad understanding of JPMorgan Private Wealth Management, including internal processes, products, and platform.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Advanced proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint.
  • Acumen and familiarity with all asset classes, macroeconomics, and investment disciplines across the firm.
  • Robust attention to detail and commitment to unsupervised follow-up.
  • Executive presence, exceptional aptitude, positive energy, and confident demeanor.
  • Identified as a top performer within analyst class.
JP Morgan Chase offers an exceptional benefits program and a highly competitive compensation package. JP Morgan Chase is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, M/F/D/V.

Title: Credit Portfolio Group - XVA Pricing & Capital Solutions EMEA - Analyst
Description:
Credit Portfolio Group - XVA Pricing & Capital Solutions EMEA - Analyst
Credit Portfolio Group (CPG) is a fully integrated public-side function with global presence in London, New York and Singapore.

The group manages both the credit and funding risks around derivative counterparty transactions; and ensures the efficient utilization of assets in collateral agreements with derivative counterparties. CPG also works with key stakeholders to facilitate the efficient use of capital, particularly those components of total capital most related to CPG activities.

XVA Pricing & Capital Solutions (XPCS) forms part of CPG. The group acts as a general centre of expertise around derivatives and securities; and has a broad solutions and advisory mandate working closely with: Sales, XVA Trading (XVAT), LOB Trading, Credit Risk, Market Risk, Quantitative Research (QR) and Reg Policy assisting with exposure and capital models, and pricing the appropriate XVA.

The XPCS group's responsibilities include:

1. Analysing, modelling and pricing material deals as part of trade execution;

2. Helping determine the XVA (credit, funding and capital implications/pricing) for credit intensive, or complex, bilateral derivative transactions. This ensures proper handoff to XVAT or to the various self-insured trading desks for ongoing management of these risks;

3. Supporting the structuring of transactions to enable a sensible risk/reward evaluation;

4. Covering exposure analysis on traditional credit products (repos, loans etc), including more exotic structures around these;

5. Development of new risk measurement tools in partnership with Quantitative Research, and improving the bank's derivatives infrastructure.

Description of the role

The open position is for an Analyst or Associate who will cover markets and products within the region, developing close relationships with Sales and Trading.

The role includes building a strong understanding of the bank's derivative exposure methodology and full proficiency in the various modelling tools.

In addition to raw metrics, helping to shape the more qualitative risk considerations are an essential part of the role.

Skills Required

Strong partnership and communication skills: Must be able to explain technical concepts to non-specialists and be able to articulate a view, both clearly and logically.

Credibility, influencing skills and leadership: Must be confident, have a commercial acumen weighing up risk/return, and be able to make a sound risk judgment. Within a reasonable period of time the candidate must have the potential to become relatively self-sufficient.

Derivatives knowledge: A strong all-round knowledge of products traded, ideally spanning derivatives on all the major asset classes and repos. Knowledge of ISDA/CSA documentation including the mechanics of collateral arrangements is desirable.

In addition to knowledge of the products themselves, we are looking for an appreciation of their main risk drivers, including an understanding of the counterparty credit exposure of derivatives.

Strong quantitative skill-set and good breadth of experience: Must be highly numerate, very good with excel, and have around 2 years prior experience of working in a quantitative or analytical role that covered complex structures and their risks. Relevant experience may have been gained in a derivatives pricing area or market/credit risk management for example. Experience of counterparty credit risk, and XVA modelling can be very useful, but is not essential if the candidate demonstrates a well rounded appreciation for risk issues.

Title: CIB - Investment Banking - EMEA Diversified Industries - Analyst - London
Description:
CIB - Investment Banking - EMEA Diversified Industries - Analyst - London
Departmental description:

J.P. Morgan advises clients globally on a wide range of strategic transactions, including mergers, acquisitions, divestitures, spin-offs, asset purchases and dispositions, joint ventures, corporate defense assignments, restructurings and reorganizations.

The J.P. Morgan EMEA Diversified Industries team is responsible for the origination and execution of public and private M&A and capital markets transactions involving corporate and financial sponsor clients in the broad industrial sector. The team has a network of relationships with some of the most prominent industrial companies in the EMEA region and across all subsectors, i.e. automotive, aerospace & defence, building materials, business services, capital goods, chemicals, infrastructure, paper & packaging, transportation, infrastructure.

Job Summary:

As an Analyst in the EMEA Diversified Industries coverage team, the candidate will play a vital and accountable role in executing M&A and capital market transactions and maintaining a strategic dialogue with key clients. The candidate will work closely with colleagues from other countries and product teams (M&A, ECM, DCM, etc.).

Core Responsibilities:
  • Detailed valuation analysis, including DCF, trading comparables, transaction comparables and LBO analysis
  • Detailed combination and other financial analysis
  • Transaction structuring analysis
  • Daily deal execution and project management of clients
  • Preparation of presentation books, management presentations, Board materials, Memorandums, and other presentation materials for use in corporate finance transactions or strategic client dialogue
  • Interaction with senior team members and client management teams on a daily basis to execute transactions and discuss strategic alternatives
Qualifications

The successful candidate will possess or demonstrate the following personal and professional attributes:
  • Relevant equivalent experience ideally in a bulge bracket Investment Bank or leading Corporate Finance Boutique, and ideally within the industrials sector
  • Outstanding ethics, integrity and judgment
  • Very strong financial modeling/valuation and analytical skills
  • Ability to comfortably interact with clients in a professional and mature manner
  • Strong intellectual curiosity
  • Industry knowledge/interest
  • Comfort in and commitment to strong teamwork environment
  • Highly organized, detail oriented and proactive
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills with specific ability to communicate concepts and ideas concisely and defend their validity
  • Foreign language skills, while not required, is desirable
  • Excellent academic track-record

Title: CIB Global Infrastructure - Credit Risk - Infrastructure & Project Finance - Vice President
Description:
CIB Global Infrastructure - Credit Risk - Infrastructure & Project Finance - Vice President
The Credit Risk Infrastructure & Project Finance team is responsible for lending activities and related credit exposures. The team manages project specific credit risks and engages with credit officers, capital markets and relationship partners throughout the Bank globally covering a wide variety of industries. The team provides input and approval on financing structure, documentation, and market convention as it relates to project finance and infrastructure transactions. It covers developed and emerging markets and works on transactions for both greenfield and brownfield projects in the transportation, energy, power, telecom and social infrastructure sectors. As a member of the team, Vice Presidents are exposed to a wide variety of client types spanning multiple industries and exercise analytical skills to assess the risks in highly structured transactions.

Job Responsibilities:
• Use strong analytical and problem-solving skills to understand risks and recommend structure which sufficiently protects JPM's interests in various structured transactions.
• Interface extensively with the Infrastructure Finance and Structuring team to conduct due diligence. Perform financial statement analysis and modelling, technical and markets analysis in order to assess the creditworthiness of counterparties and make recommendations as to appropriate structure, exposure levels and risk grading.
• Actively involved in the negotiation of credit terms and in analyzing and synthesizing third party consultant reports and engineering construction and procurement development plans and progress.
• Perform ongoing due diligence and financial analysis for a portfolio of counterparties including credit approval memos and reviews, ongoing counterparty and industry credit analysis, monitoring of trading limits and appropriate credit ratings, and negotiating documentation revisions.
• Prepare and present to senior management a quarterly risk review that details exposure metrics analyzing key trends, drivers, and concentrations.
• Provide oversight on work efforts of junior team members, providing guidance where needed to ensure quality of various credit processes.

Requirements:
• Bachelor's Degree from an accredited university/college required, preferably in accounting, finance, economics or related field
• 7-9 years of professional work experience in financial services preferred. Prior experience in infrastructure, credit/counterparty risk, and derivative products strongly preferred.
• Strong sector experience across energy and infrastructure assets and with negotiating highly structured credit documents
• Strong financial modeling ability and familiarity with financial statements (including ability to analyze capital structure, profitability, project build costs and cash flow).
• Knowledge of technical aspects and analysis on credit standards, contracts, cash flows, budgets, construction reports, operating reports, etc.
• Supporting portfolio management, including analyzing amendment and waiver requests, assisting with monitoring periodic credit approval renewals.
• Exceptional analytical aptitude and ability to think abstractly. Strong organizational skills, ability to learn quickly, and a high level of attention to detail.
• Understanding of front office processes and ability to balance necessities of credit risk management with commercial requirements. Ability to build rapport and influence change.
• Excellent communication (written, oral, and listening) and interpersonal skills; the ability to convey thoughts clearly and succinctly and to communicate pertinent complex information in a clear and organized manner.
• Self-motivated with the ability to work independently while also being able to work effectively in a team environment. Desire and willingness to take ownership of various credit risk responsibilities.
• Candidates must be highly proficient in Excel (including analysis/control of large datasets), PowerPoint, and Word.

Title: Software Development Engineer Intern - 2022 UK
Description:
Software Development Engineer Intern - 2022 UK
DESCRIPTION Do you want to solve business challenges through innovative technology?

Do you enjoy working on cutting-edge, scalable services technology in a team environment?

Do you like working on industry-defining projects that move the needle?

At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate and build on behalf of our customers. The intense focus we have on our customers is why we are one of the world's most beloved brands - customer obsession is part of our company DNA.

Our interns write real software and collaborate with a selected group of experienced software development engineers who help interns on projects that matter to our customers.

As an intern, you will be matched to a manager and a mentor. You will have the opportunity to impact the evolution of Amazon technology as well as lead mission critical projects early in your career. Your design, code, and raw smarts will contribute to solving some of the most complex technical challenges in the areas of distributed systems, data mining, automation, optimization, scalability, and security - just to name a few.

In addition to working on an impactful project, you will have the opportunity to engage with Amazonians for both personal and professional development, expand your network, and participate in fun activities with other interns throughout internship.

No matter the location of your internship, we give you the tools to own your project and learn in a real world setting. Many of our technologies overlap-you would be hard pressed to find a team that is not using Amazon Web Services (AWS), touching the catalogue, or iterating services to better personalize for customers.
If this sounds interesting, come chart your own path at Amazon!

Amazon internships are full-time (40 hours/week) and vary in length to fit in with your university's program starting from 5 months up to 11 months duration. Start dates can vary throughout the year. Applicants should have at a minimum one quarter/semester remaining after their internship concludes.

KEY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
• Collaborate with experienced cross-disciplinary Amazonians to conceive, design, and bring to market innovative products and services.
• Design and build innovative technologies in a large distributed computing environment and help lead fundamental changes in the industry.
• Create solutions to run predictions on distributed systems with exposure to innovative technologies at incredible scale and speed. Build distributed storage, index, and query systems that are scalable, fault-tolerant, low cost, and easy to manage/use.
• Ability to design and code the right solutions starting with broadly defined problems.
• Work in an agile environment to deliver high quality software.

Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. For an update on your status, or to confirm your application was submitted successfully, please login to your candidate portal. Please note that Amazon works with a high volume of applicants. We appreciate your patience as we review applications for future Amazonians

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS • Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design
• Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related fields at time of application
• Although no specific programming language is required - you should be familiar with the syntax of languages such as Java, C/C++ or Python
• Knowledge of Computer Science fundamentals such as object-oriented design, algorithm design, data structures, problem solving and complexity analysis

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

• Previous technical internship(s) if applicable
• Experience with distributed, multi-tiered systems, algorithms, and relational databases
• Experience in optimization mathematics such as linear programming and nonlinear optimization
• Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions
• Adept at handling ambiguous or undefined problems as well as ability to think abstractly

Due to the volume of applicants, Student Programs will provide an update on your application within 4 weeks.

Want to know more about our opportunities? Visit our Student Events page to register for one of our upcoming virtual events: https://amazonstudentevents.splashthat.com/careers

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build.

Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Title: Senior Partner Solutions Architect, Database - Flexible Location
Description:
Senior Partner Solutions Architect, Database - Flexible Location
DESCRIPTION We are looking for a Partner Solutions Architect to work with top ISVs to integrate AWS database services into their solutions. This is a hands-on, highly technical position for someone who can dive deep, build complex, AWS-optimized architectures, and develop a long-term strategy with AWS business development and service teams.

As a great candidate, you will have:

• Deep technical experience working with relational database solutions. (Your experience should not be limited to systems administration, as some depth of DBA knowledge will be required.)
• Years of hands-on experience with one or more of Amazon Aurora, RDS Oracle DB, MS SQL Server, MySQL, or PostgreSQL.
• Additional experience with non-relational databases, such as columnar data stores, NoSQL, and graph databases would be even better.
• Previous experience with AWS is desired but not required, provided you have experience building solutions that run in virtualized environments.

Roles and Responsibilities

• As a key member of the business development and sales team, ensure success in building and migrating applications, software and services on the AWS platform.
• Educate customers/partners of all sizes on the value proposition of AWS and participate in deep architectural discussions to ensure solutions are designed for successful deployment in the cloud.
• Conduct one-to-few and one-to-many training sessions to transfer knowledge to customers considering or already using AWS.
• Capture and share best-practice knowledge amongst the AWS solutions architect community.
• Author or otherwise contribute to AWS customer-facing publications such as whitepapers, blogs.
• Build deep relationships with senior technical individuals within customers/partners to enable them to be cloud advocates.
• Act as a technical liaison between customers/partners, service engineering teams and support.

This position can be based in London or Manchester area.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS Basic qualifications
• 5+ years building solutions with or for databases.
• 5+ years of highly technical, hands-on job experience.
• Consultative skills: 3+ years of customer-facing experience.
• Experience with database cross platform and cross engine migration.
• Experience with platform and infrastructure bench-marking
• Language: Fluent written and verbal communication skills in English required.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Preferred qualifications

• Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges.
• Ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations.
• Strong knowledge of information security best practices.
• Experience with data center network technologies.
• Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort speaking with executives, IT management, and developers.
• Expert software architecture skills and experience building complex software systems.

Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy/eu ) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify, and build.

Title: Enterprise Solutions Architect - AWS
Description:
Enterprise Solutions Architect - AWS
DESCRIPTION Amazon Web Services (AWS) is seeking a technical leader for our solution architecture team who will be responsible for the technology strategy and senior level relationships with global enterprise customers. The Global Communications and Media Solutions Architect will be responsible for creating and driving the technical strategy with sales in the management of accounts with a complex and multi-faceted relationship with AWS. You will partner with customers and several AWS teams to craft highly scalable, flexible and resilient cloud architectures that provide solutions to solve customer business problems and accelerate the adoption of AWS services. In collaboration with sales, you will drive revenue growth across a defined set of customers. As a trusted customer advocate, you will have the opportunity to help shape and execute a strategy to build mind-share and broad use of AWS with enterprise customers. You will also need to be adept at interacting, communicating and partnering with other teams within AWS such as services teams, marketing, and professional services, as well as representing your team to executive management. Must be open to travel up to 40% including international.

ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
* Support AWS Account teams to help formulate a strategy for the adoption of Streaming Media tools within the Communications and Media business unit.
* Work with existing and potential customers to deeply understand their business and technical needs. Develop solutions that make the best use of the AWS Cloud platform.
* Collaborate with AWS field sales, training, and support teams to ensure customer success.
* Exhibit Thought Leadership. Evangelize AWS Services and Streaming Media solutions that benefit customers. Share best practices through forums such as AWS blogs, whitepapers, reference architectures and public speaking events such as AWS Summit and AWS re:Invent.
* Act as technical liaison between customers and the service engineering teams, providing product improvement feedback to AWS developers and accelerating the adoption of new features in customer deployments.
* Provide one-to-few and one-to-many training sessions to transfer knowledge to builder considering or already using AWS.
* Capture and share best-practice knowledge pertaining to Streaming Media technologies among the AWS solutions architecture community.
* Build deep relationships with senior technical individuals within customers to enable them to be cloud advocates.
* Act as a technical liaison between customers, service engineering teams, and support.
* Be able to develop proof-of-concepts for Streaming Media applications

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
• 7+ years of design/implementation/consulting experience of large-scale, enterprise applications
• 3+ years of experience working with multi-national customers in support of technology sales
• 3+ years of experience with cloud solutions, virtual platforms, software development experience, and operational management practices and frameworks
• Technical degree required

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
• Master's degree preferred
• Understanding/experience with Media Archive/Libraries and asset management architectures and ISVs
• Understanding/experience with Media Supply Chains architectures and ISVs
• Professional experience architecting/operating solutions built on AWS• Experience communicating across internal and external organizations
• Demonstrated experience developing enterprise application architectures to meet business requirements in complex environments
• Understanding of security, risk and compliance frameworks, disaster recovery, high availability architectures, hardware, operating systems and networking connectivity
• Large-scale systems integration involving on-premises technology and public cloud platforms
• Meets/exceeds Amazon's leadership principles requirements for this role
• Meets/exceeds Amazon's functional/technical depth and complexity

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us

Title: Finance Manager, Amazon Advertising
Description:
Finance Manager, Amazon Advertising
DESCRIPTION Amazon Advertising is dedicated to driving measurable outcomes for brand advertisers, agencies, authors, and entrepreneurs. Our ad solutions - including sponsored search, display, OTT/video, audio, and custom ads - leverage Amazon's innovations and insights to find, attract, and engage intended audiences throughout their daily journeys. With a range of flexible pricing and buying models, including self-service, managed service, and programmatic ad buying, these solutions help businesses build brand awareness, increase product sales, and more.

Amazon seeks an experienced Finance Manager to join the worldwide Advertising Team. The successful candidate will own end-to-end business support and effectively be the CFO for the EU Emerging Ad Sales Business. This individual will be responsible for leading the business reviews including measuring and driving focus on our key input metrics and health of the business. As part of the holistic support, the role will also be directly involved in setting targets, headcount planning, initiative sizing, free cash flow analysis and being a trusted advisor to the Sales managers across all of EU5. The role also includes partnering with managers to highlight blockers, risks and opportunities that impact our ability to meet our quarterly/annual goals. The successful candidate will have the ability to tackle multiple projects and efficiently execute deliverables. The right individual will have strong communication skills and solid business acumen capable of driving results and improving processes. The successful candidate must be able to think and act both strategically and tactically. Strong oral and written communication skills are crucial, as well as ability to think clearly, analyze quantitatively, problem-solve and prioritize.

Key Responsibilities include:
• Serve as a trusted Advisor to Country Leaders in making optimal long term decisions on the business
• Finance leader in the preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual Business reviews.
• Work directly with Business and finance leaders to highlight Opportunities and Risks.
• Serve as the Single point of contact for production of the metrics deck
• Own the end-to-end goals process: Build actionable goals and mechanisms to measure progress on the goals.
• Build high degree of governance (accuracy) and controls in the reporting process.

• The successful candidate will also have demonstrated ability to meet deadlines while managing multiple projects in a fast paced environment.

• Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, business or a related field

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Preferred Qualifications:
• Advanced analytical skills
• Advanced knowledge of Excel
• Able to work well with cross functional teams.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills
•MBA or advanced business degree preferred
Knowledge of multiple financial reporting and data mining tools (Cognos, Oracle, SQL, Business Intelligence reporting tool)

Title: Senior Manager, Solutions Architecture, AWS Game Tech - EMEA
Description:
Senior Manager, Solutions Architecture, AWS Game Tech - EMEA
DESCRIPTION Behind great games, there's game tech.
Games live at the intersection of technology and the arts, and with more than 2.5 billion people playing games every day, there's never been a more exciting time to make games. At AWS Game Tech, our mission is to help developers build amazing, fun, and successful games, and we strive to power every game with AWS.
Would you like to build a team focused on helping game developers, studios, and publishers in EMEA build the best games possible? As a Senior Manager with AWS Game Tech, you will build and lead our technical go-to-market strategy in partnership with sales, marketing, and business development. Your team will drive AWS adoption within the most creative, impactful, and innovative games makers on the planet, and your team will address some of the most compelling technical challenges for games touching billions of players globally.
Your responsibilities will include hiring and developing a team of exceptional technologists focused on the games industry throughout EMEA. You will attract the best talent to AWS Game Tech, building and coaching a direct-line team of Solutions Architects to help customers build with AWS. You will collaborate with leaders focused on early stage customer engagement, sales, and field marketing resources to ensure Game Tech functions are aligned with the commercial team's strategy to power every game with AWS.
You will also establish relationships with key executive stakeholders in the most strategic publishers, studios, and companies in EMEA. You will represent the business to AWS and customer executive leadership, collaborate with international AWS Game Tech senior and executive leadership, and become a trusted senior leader to your team and AWS customers. You will set a vision, build a team, and establish a customer-obsessed culture of experimentation and technical excellence that is instrumental to helping game devs use the cloud to make fun, successful games powered by AWS. Your leadership will ensure AWS Game Tech customers have the technical and architectural support they need to be successful.
The ideal candidate will possess a technical leadership background that enables them to interact impactfully at the CTO/CIO/SVP level. They will also have strong, demonstrated technical skills that allows them to effectively engage with other technical customer stakeholders and convey technical concepts in detail. They will be able to think strategically and analytically, communicating compelling value propositions for customers and partners. They will have a passion for new and emerging technologies, and the ambition to shape the future to benefit customers. They will have familiarity with core games industry vernacular and business processes and, perhaps most importantly, they will love games.
Roles & Responsibilities:
• Hire, develop, and lead a team of exceptional technologists in the field
• Operate at an executive level with diligence, focus, and maintain a strong operational rigour
• Establish strategic relationships with Amazon and AWS technical and business oriented executive stakeholders globally
• Establish strategic, technical, and business relationships as an executive sponsor to game developers, studios, publishers, and other key stakeholders in EMEA in order to drive cloud adoption
• Prepare and deliver data-driven business reviews to senior management and executive leadership about progress, achievements, and roadblocks in the games business
• Develop and Execute strategic initiatives for AWS Game Tech, while collaborating with key internal stakeholders internationally

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS A passion for games
Experience building and leading technical customer-facing teams
Experience working in technology or games industry engineering, solutions architecture, infrastructure management, Production, or Game Development
Strong analytical and quantitative skills
Strong, demonstrated technical skills
Bachelor's degree or significant relevant work experience
Moderate travel may be required
Fluent spoken and written English
Strong opinions about whether or not to Invert the Y Axis

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Experience working in a pre-sales technical or engineering capacity within a hypergrowth technology company
Experience working with game publishers, developers, retailers, distributors, and studios
Experience working with enterprises, innovation centers and digital initiatives of organizations
Proven leadership, problem solving, and strong attention to detail
Strong project management skills and experience working with cross-functional, international teams
Experience and familiarity with cloud technologies
Experience and familiarity with key games software, middleware, and platform tooling
Experience with common games industry funding mechanisms, regional trade associations, regional institutions, and regional communities for game devs

Title: Quality Assurance Engineer
Description:
Quality Assurance Engineer
DESCRIPTION Come build the future of entertainment with us.
Are you interested in shaping the future of movies and television? Do you want to define the next generation of how and what Amazon customers are watching?
Prime Video is a premium streaming service that offers customers a vast collection of TV shows and movies - all with the ease of finding what they love to watch in one place. We offer customers thousands of popular movies and TV shows from Originals and Exclusive content to exciting live sports events. We also offer our members the opportunity to subscribe to add-on channels which they can cancel at anytime and to rent or buy new release movies and TV box sets on the Prime Video Store. Prime Video is a fast-paced, growth business - available in over 240 countries and territories worldwide. The team works in a dynamic environment where innovating on behalf of our customers is at the heart of everything we do. If this sounds exciting to you, please read on.

The Living Room Client is chartered to design large scale applications to power the Prime Video viewed by a massive audience daily, and you will help bring customers streaming video view experience to a new level. You will work on the latest customer features and have opportunities to interact with teams inside and outside the organization, plus to work on a variety of video devices such as the game consoles, Internet-connected TVs, BD Players, set-top-boxes, and mobile devices.

As QAE you will be responsible for the contributing to the design and development of automated tools and other test investments that help maintain the quality of the Prime Video client. A successful candidate will have an established track record in launching highly available customer-facing services and experiences, deep technical ability, excellent project management skills, solid communication skills, an ability and desire to achieve results in a fast-paced environment, high creativity and, of course, a passion for bringing a world class entertainment experience to Amazon customers.

The primary goals of this team are to develop, deploy and maintain the Prime Video living room client, increase delivery efficiency, eliminate performance issues, UX regressions, and reduce manual operations and efforts.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS • Experience in automation testing
• Experience in manual testing
• Experience working as a Quality Assurance Engineer
• Bachelor's Degree
• Solid understanding of software development fundamentals
• Proven technical experience in Quality Assurance and software testing
• A proven track record of software delivery through all phases of development
• A proven track record of hiring and developing engineers to become high performance teams

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS • Experience taking a leading role in building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers
• Demonstrated track record for code quality, automation, and continuous deployment are just the way things get done
• Hands-on expertise in many disparate technologies, typically ranging from front-end user interfaces through to back-end systems and all points in between
• Experience driving quality for highly available and large scale customer facing systems

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Job Reference #227034BR
Your team
The UBS Knowledge Graph team is a very dynamic, fast-paced and creative team taking advantage of the latest technology and data processing techniques. We are part of the Group Chief Technology Office organization and are working on a unique endeavor to connect the bank's data and knowledge to a semantic knowledge graph.

Your expertise
• university degree, preferably in a technical/quantitative field such as statistics, computer science or math
• strong command of Python. Other languages are desirable (C++, Java, etc.)
• strong understanding of data, databases (SQL, NoSQL, TripleStores, Hadoop, etc.)
• Hands-on experience with RDF and the query language SPARQL (SHACL exposure is a plus)
• working with efficient processing of large datasets in an production system
• understanding of data structures and data manipulation techniques including classification, parsing, pattern matching
• strong English language skills essential
• experience with Java Script and Svelte would be an asset
• experience working with knowledge of decentralized architecture would be an asset

About us
Expert advice. Wealth management. Investment banking. Asset management. Retail banking in Switzerland. And all the support functions. That's what we do. And we do it for private and institutional clients as well as corporations around the world.

We are about 60,000 employees in all major financial centers, in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?

Join us
We're a truly global, collaborative and friendly group of people. Having a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace is important to us. And we support your career development, internal mobility and work-life balance. If this sounds interesting, apply now.

Disclaimer / Policy Statements
UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

Title: Credit Analyst - Banking
Description:
Michael Page are currently looking for a Credit Analyst for a new role in a London Bank

My client are a well known company within Financial Services

Description

Overall function and main purpose of the position

Assembling and submitting written credit proposals/recommendations to the London HUB's Head of Credit in favour of new and/or existing counterparts belonging to the London Hub's credit perimeter, according to the Bank's policies and procedures, as per the request prompted by the London Hub's Head of Credit.

  • Assigning/updating internal ratings to any relevant counterpart belonging to the London Hub's credit perimeter, according to the Bank's internal rating model methodology and procedure, as per the request prompted by the London Hub's Head of Credit.Collecting full sets of information (i.e. annual and interim financial statements, industry data, industry analysis / researches / reports / articles from, among others, Moody's, S&P's, Bloomberg, Credit Edge KMV and Brokers) for each relevant counterpart under examination (i.e. parent, borrower, guarantor, sponsor) ;
  • Analysing each relevant counterpart's business model / profile;
  • Spreading each relevant counterpart's last two (at least) financial statements and latest interim report (if available), as well as any Business Plan / Forecast / Projections (if available, and so required) into the Bank's standard forms and formats;
  • Performing the analysis of each relevant counterpart's position vs. competitors / peers, highlighting key features of the industry(s) it operates into (i.e. growth drivers / industry's specific credit factors, regulatory framework / issues, macro / microeconomic trends / cycles) and its Strengths / Weaknesses / Opportunities / Threats within such context.
  • Performing written reviews of each relevant counterpart's operating performance and financial position through fundamental and ratio analysis of P&L, Balance Sheet and Cash Flow statements, according to the Bank's standards and procedures;
  • Analysing each relevant counterpart's Business Plans / Forecasts / Projections under different sensitivity scenarios (base case vs. worst case(s), if available, and so required), according to the Bank's standards and procedures.
  • Communicating and interacting effectively with all the players / functions involved in the credit granting process (i.e. Relationship Manager(s), London Hub Legal Department, Product Desks and HO Credit Analyst(s)).
  • Condensing the Relationship Manager's request (i.e. new credit line(s), review(s), amendments and/or waivers of existing credit lines) into an effective summary, including a thorough description of the collateral package, if any, and other relevant T&Cs safeguarding the risks under examination.
  • Double checking and validating the input to/from London Hub's Monitoring & Administration Desk relating to credit lines booked / to be booked in favour of each counterpart under her examination.
  • Attending (when asked) to visits, presentations events and bank meetings of existing counterparts and/or prospects belonging to the London Hub's credit perimeter.

Profile


Required qualifications, skills and knowledge

  • Degree or equivalent in Economics
  • CFA (Level 1-2) certification a plus
  • Excellent Communication skills in English, fluency in Italian preferred
  • Strong team player
  • Minimum 2-3 seniority years in Credit Analysis at major financial institutions
  • Permission to work in UK

Competencies required


Candidates mustpossess strong communication abilities, especially with regard to writing skills in English; be thoroughly analytical and organised, with the ability to meet tight deadlines and work under pressure during peak periods


Job Offer

350 a day

temp to perm role

Title: Syndicate Reporting Manager
Description:
Syndicate Reporting Manager
A large London Market Insurance Group have a great opportunity for a Reporting Manager to join a very efficient and dynamic team. Working with the Head of Syndicate Reporting, you will manage the production of the external Lloyd's reporting for the syndicates, and the role includes the management of a high performing team of accountants and account assistants. You will work closely with different areas of the business such as actuarial, underwriting, claims, MI, group finance, treasury and investments, as well as all business units using syndicate capacity.

  • Manage all aspects of the production of Lloyd's regulatory returns (QMA, QMB, US and CAD Trust reporting, TPD, GQD, F&P, TRIA, BEAT, SIS), ensuring all external deadlines are met in a timely manner.
  • Manage the production of the annual syndicate accounts, both on an annual basis and the underwriting year accounts.
  • Work closely with the Head of Reporting in managing the quarterly and yearly close process ensuing all external deadlines to Lloyd's are met.
  • Working closely with the Finance Operations Manager, ensure sign-off of all key Balance sheet financial reconciliations is completed, prior to using the syndicate Trial Balances for external reporting.
  • Alongside the Head of Reporting, become a subject matter expert for any projects relating to syndicate reporting such as the Finance Transformation Project and other group wide projects.
  • Working closely with the Head of Reporting, build a controlled and sustainable reporting framework post the implementation of Oracle, which meets the syndicates & reporting needs in an accurate and efficient manner.
  • Work closely with the Director of Syndicate Finance and the Head of Reporting in developing and enhancing the syndicate financial control framework.
  • Manage, coach and develop the team whilst maintaining high manager effectiveness.
  • Manage the relationship with the auditors ensuing audit queries are answered and closed off in a timely manner.

To be considered for this role, you be a qualified accountant and/or have relevant demonstrable experience in a senior accounting role. Lloyd's experience is a must as you will need a strong grounding in syndicate accounting and Lloyd's regulatory returns.

Title: Senior Expense Business Partner
Description:
Senior Expense Business Partner
A global (re)Insurance Group are looking for a talented individual to bolster their Business Partnering function within the Expenses Team. The role will have responsibility for expense reporting, planning and analysis across the business globally, managing Expense team in effective and efficient delivery of activities and partnering with client groups to positively influence on expense management.

You will support and take oversee aspects of the global expense business planning process relating to several business areas and work collaboratively with cost centre managers, Executive members and other senior colleagues. Key areas of responsibility and oversight will be:
  • Leading the production and review of the detailed annual budget and quarterly forecasts with around 50 budget holders
  • Challenging the budget setting and producing suitable analytics to support it
  • Presentations to senior executive of the budget, with suitable analysis to understand composition, review challenges made and understand variances. The presentations should also highlight key risk areas or relevant trending of expenses
  • Quarterly review with budget holders to ensure YTD expenditure, accrual/prepayment decisions, and updated forecasts are appropriate.
  • Continually develop current suite of reports to provide senior management with improved insight into expense variances so that they can be proactively manage expenses
  • Lead the legal entity charge process and continuously review and improve as appropriate
  • Continually review and improve budget holder expense reporting
  • Embed ultimate expense reporting into the BAU quarterly reporting
  • Develop business plans and improve the reporting of actuals relating to expenses, highlight trends and risks in expenses against budget and ensure that appropriate controls are in place.

The ideal candidate will have proven business partnering experience gained in an Insurance/FS environment and will have post-qualified (ACA/ACCA/CIMA) experience gained in an internal reporting function. You will need to have excellent communication skills and the ability to lead and mentor a small team.

Title: Lead Platform Engineer - Remote
Description:
Fully remote platform engineering opportunity - strong azure and microsoft background needed. salaries up to £80,000 + 15% bonus!

Lead Platform Engineer - Remote

I am currently working with a renowned UK based Financial Services company They are growing a team of highly skilled and passionate engineers to help build, develop, and operate large-scale public cloud environments. They're responsible for creating and maintaining the cloud platform and related services that allows the company to leverage Public Cloud resources in a standard, supportable framework. The Cloud Platform Engineering team help to deliver and enable internal product engineering teams to leverage the cloud in a secure, scalable, and consistent manner.

There is now a chance for a Lead Platform Engineer to join a team of agile, technically strong, diverse, and creative engineers to help deliver multiple complex projects. This is a fantastic opportunity to secure a fully remote leadership position with a household UK name in financial services, working some of the most large scale and complex projects available!

Day-to-Day Responsibilities

  • Take the lead with architects and other team members to develop and build complex cloud services and capabilities
  • Ongoing development of cloud services including working with product development groups to build cloud aware applications
  • Develop automated processes to prevent, identify, and fix problems that impact service availability
  • Maintain an understanding of industry trends and how new technologies can be leveraged to meet business objectives
  • Identify and deliver improvements across a broad range of areas such as cost savings, security, ease of use, & reliability. Take ownership of these and drive to completion.
  • Work with and help lead a virtual team to deliver business unit priority work
  • Participate and help run SCRUM sessions with local team and participate in wider team direction setting
  • Collaborate with cloud architecture and product engineering teams to translate high level technical requirements and in turn define infrastructure changes
  • Innovate new and improved uses of technology to meet business objectives
  • Understand the impact of new technologies and their technical impacts to supported systems
  • Collaborate with peers, architects and managers to understand strategy and how best to operationalise it across the cloud environments

Required Skills

  • Substantial related technology experience
  • Experienced in leading multi-functional teams
  • Consistent track record of delivering goals
  • Experienced in writing clean code (.net framework, etc)
  • Experienced with IaC / Terraform
  • Excellent Azure experience
  • Experienced in automating software build, deployment, and server configuration management using tools such as Git, & Terraform
  • Knowledge & Experience of modern agile development methodologies
  • Exposure to DevOps practices and automation of software testing, delivery and infrastructure changes
  • Strong passion for technology, a willingness to learn new skills and the ability to evangelize the uses of cloud services
  • Self-motivated and self-directed, ability to translate technical direction into functional solutions
  • Ability to work effectively in a globally distributed team, handling multiple priorities while collaborating with multi-functional teams
  • Proven ability to investigate complex issues spanning multiple technologies and drive to completion

Desired Skills

  • Experienced in writing clean code in other Object Orientated languages: C++, .NET, other
  • Experience in developing IaaS development toolkits
  • Experience in working as part of an existing Site Reliability Engineering team
  • Experience with any public or private cloud technologies/services, particularly federation and STS services, ExpressRoute and connectivity services, and Azure Functions
  • Expertise in Windows and Linux system administration, databases (relational and NoSQL), and networking infrastructure and services (routing, switching, DNS, NTP)

Packages on offer include:

  • Base salary up to £80,000
  • fully remote working
  • up to 15% bonus
  • generous pension contributions and annual leave
  • private medical
  • flexible benefits

If you're fitting the bill and want to find out more, apply now using the link on the page!

Lead Platform Engineer - Remote

YOUR PROFILE:
  • Associate level experience in either investment banking or possibly a junior role in a credit fund
  • Northern European language skills are a must with a preference for German, Dutch or Nordic languages
  • Excellent technical, commercial and financial modelling skills
  • A good understanding of, and transaction experience within, the mid-market
  • Strong interpersonal and team working skills and an ability to thrive in a small team environment. Able to learn quickly and engage with external parties confidently

Title: Investor Relations Manager, Leading Global Secondaries Fund, London, UK
Description:
Investor Relations Manager, Leading Global Secondaries Fund, London, UK

REFERENCE:
9637 /22H

Our client is a leading, global investor in the secondary private equity market. They provide liquidity to various LPs from buyout to venture capital funds as well as exit opportunities for GPs. They are keen to bring on board a top calibre Investor Relations Manager to join their established London IR team.
As an integral member of the IR team, you will share responsibility in servicing the existing and prospective investor base and project managing the end-to-end fundraising process.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Work closely with internal teams (legal, investment, operations) to deliver effective investor relations services for the fund's global investor base
  • Manage the due diligence process and the production of DD materials plus any other fundraising materials
  • Plan, prepare and deliver internal and external presentations and information for key events: AGMs, Advisory Board meetings etc
  • Work closely with senior internal stakeholders including Principals and Partners to assist in the production of quarterly reports, webcasts, LP meeting materials and other ad hoc materials
  • Manage the IR inbox ensuring all general and technical queries are responded to in a timely manner
YOUR PROFILE:
  • Accountants keen to transition into investor relations or individuals with experience in investor relations from within private markets or private placement
  • Excellent communication skills able to build strong working relationships with senior stakeholders
  • Technically minded and comfortable understanding financial / performance terminology
  • Detail-oriented, structured thinker with strong project management skills
  • Proficient command of English and demonstrable ability to transform financial performance details into investor-friendly messages
  • Accounting or other financial qualification would be a beneficial but not a requirement

Title: VP/Principal, Private Equity Fund and Direct Investments, London, UK
Description:
VP/Principal, Private Equity Fund and Direct Investments, London, UK

REFERENCE:
9600 /16F

We are working with a leading family office which is looking for an established investor to join its team in London focused on primaries, co-investments and secondaries. The current team is lean and of an extremely high calibre, with a strong track record and an excellent market reputation. They have a substantial existing primary portfolio and are looking to grow their exposure to co-investments, so this would be a significant focus of the role.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• You will take a leading role in all aspects of the investment process from origination through to execution
• You will be responsible for managing the junior members of the team in the production of financial models and the due diligence process

YOUR PROFILE:
• You will have prior private equity exposure with significant co-investment and/or secondary experience
• You will have previous experience of working investment banking or corporate finance
• You should have strong technical skills as well as some relationship management experience - ideally from a primary fund investment environment

Title: Associate, Fund Investing, Top-Tier Global Investment Manager, London, UK
Description:
Associate, Fund Investing, Top-Tier Global Investment Manager, London, UK

REFERENCE:
9633 /32F

We are working with a reputable international investment manager. It is looking for an Associate to join its team in London to focus on primary fund commitments.

The investment team is small and constitutes reputable and high-calibre investment professionals with whom you'll work closely. You'll support them on all aspects of the fund investment process whilst developing your ability to use and interpret quantitative and qualitative data for investing.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Support the senior team on all aspects of the investment process including sourcing and screening new investments, executing deals and monitoring assets in the portfolio
  • Quantitative and qualitative analysis of prospective private equity fund investments
  • In-depth review of GP performance post-investment, including GP portfolio company analysis
  • Ad hoc due diligence projects, research and reports

YOUR PROFILE:
  • Background in private equity fund investing, big four professional services or other relevant corporate finance background
  • Excellent technical skills - advanced knowledge of Excel, able to understand and manipulate large data sets
  • Strong verbal and written English language skills
  • Able to converse confidently with senior professionals - both internally and externally

Title: Manager, Data & Analytics Delivery, Analytics & Cognitive, Consulting, London
Description:
Manager, Data & Analytics Delivery, Analytics & Cognitive, Consulting, London
Your opportunity
Take your career to the next level by joining one of the world's best and most recognised professional services firms. Develop a portfolio of skills and experiences in a high-growth, cutting-edge analytics consulting practice working across a fantastic range of transformational client projects.
In Data & Analytics Delivery, we help our clients implement large scale data programmes that deliver on the promise of technology. We specialise in data and information - how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.
You will be part of the following wider group within our Consulting portfolio offerings:
Strategy, Analytics and M&A
How do you make intelligent, future-proof decisions in a world where change is the one constant? That's exactly what you'll help our clients to do. You'll build trusted relationships with business stakeholders - and use the most exciting new technologies available - to create data-driven programmes that transform their organisations. Your advice will help clients position their organisations to succeed in an ever-evolving marketplace.
We encourage consideration of flexible ways of working, both formal and informal arrangements that allow for the best outcomes for our people and our clients. If this opportunity is of interest to you with some flexibility, please do discuss with us.
Your role
The Data & Analytics Delivery team sits within our Analytics and Cognitive consulting group. Our practitioners work on challenging projects with leading FTSE 100 clients across strategy, advisory and implementation.
Our projects vary greatly and your responsibility as a Manager will differ based on the focus of the client engagement and your skillset but could include and may require you to:
• Lead a team to design and deliver a data solution such as an ETL components, data lake, data warehouse, and reporting solutions, data migration or data virtualisation solutions
• Advise clients on appropriate tooling for a particular solution based on your expertise in specific technologies
• Manage relationships with key client stakeholders and lead client workshops to capture business or technical requirements for a data solution
• Provide specialist industry knowledge in the data & analytics domain to our clients and further our offering in new and innovative technologies or applications of technologies
• Perform the role of Scrum master in an agile delivery or manage large-scale project implementations
• Take responsibility for all aspects of project management, and quality of client deliverables
• Lead content development for client bids and contribute to presentations of proposals
• Manage diverse teams within an inclusive team culture where people are recognised for their contribution, bring your own perspective, skills and experience to develop your team
• Mentor and lead junior resources within an inclusive team culture where people are recognised for their contribution helping them grow their career in Deloitte.
• Develop and grow the Delivery practice by contributing to recruitment, talent development, managing relationships with vendors, shaping and leading learning offerings and industry / technology propositions, contributing to the general running of the practice and actively participating in community events to share knowledge and nurture positive and collaborative relationships within the practice.
Your work, your choice
At Deloitte we believe the best impact is the value we add, not the hours we sit at our desk. We carefully consider agile ways of working, both formal and informal, that allow for the best impact for our people and our clients. Please speak to your recruiter about the working pattern that works best for you.
Location:
You will be based in the Deloitte London office, however travel may be required for client based projects. Whilst some clients are London based, we do spend time on site with regional and international clients. We specify full mobility for our consulting roles but we make arrangements respectfully; there may be some opportunity for working from home depending on client and project demands.
Work pattern:
This is a permanent full-time role.
Our team members work a variety of agile working patterns. Tell us what arrangement works for you and we'll try to accommodate.

Your professional experience
Candidates will have hands on experience with one or more technologies relevant to these areas:
• Data Integration (including ETL / ELT)
• Data Migration
• Master Data Management
• Data Warehousing
• Data Virtualisation
• Big Data Engineering
• Business and Data Analysis
• Data Programme Delivery
• Data Governance
• Data Cataloguing
• Data Quality
We are specifically looking for candidates with both technical and business focused skills, who can articulate the outcomes and value of their work, and have 6+ years of relevant working experience across some of the following:
• Demonstrable experience of managing / leading different data projects, using variety of tools and technologies: e.g.
o ETL tools such as Informatica, SSIS, Talend or Pentaho
o Data governance and data management tools such as Informatica MDM, Informatica AXON, Informatica EDC, and Collibra
o Databases such as MySQL, SQL Server, Oracle, Snowflake, PostgreSQL and NoSQL databases
o Languages such as Spark or Python
• Knowledge of popular cloud platforms for such as Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure or Google Cloud and distributed processing technologies such as Hadoop
• Strong experience in Agile and/or DevOps for software development & IT operations and knowledge of SDLC
• Experience of Data Platform Modernisation (e.g. transitioning data workflows from legacy to next generation data platforms)
• Experience in release management and implementation into production
• Proven experience managing teams across multiple locations both within the UK and overseas, and in an onshore/offshore delivery model, taking responsibility for the team and project deliverables
• Experience of stakeholder management and ability to collaborate effectively within multidisciplinary teams
• Competent use of Microsoft packages, particularly Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel
• Strong written, communication and presentation skills
Your service line: Consulting
Our people and the way we work are the two things that set us apart in the consulting universe. For us, collaboration is fundamental to success, along with an unrivalled depth and breadth of expertise. We work closely with our clients and each other, at every stage of every project, solving our clients' trickiest problems with a mix of knowledge, creativity and intellectual rigour. A hugely diverse range of clients rely on us to deliver the kind of change that adds genuine, lasting value to their business.
Personal independence
Regulation and controls are standard practice in our industry and Deloitte is no exception. These controls provide important legal protection for both you and the firm. We are subject to a number of audit regulations, one of which requires that certain colleagues abide by specific personal independence constraints. This can mean that you and your "Immediate Family Members" are not permitted to hold certain financial interests (shares, funds, bonds etc.) with audit clients of the firm. The recruitment team will provide further detail as you progress through the recruitment process.
About Deloitte
Our Purpose & Strategy
To make an impact that matters for our clients, our people and society - defines who we are and what we stand for. Our purpose provides the foundation for our strategy and our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services: this is not about size, it's about being the first choice. The first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.
What do we do?
Deloitte offers global integrated professional services that include Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Legal, Risk Advisory and Tax Consulting. Our approach combines intellectual leadership, industrial expertise, insight, consulting & problem solving capabilities whatever the role, technology revolutions and innovation from multiple disciplines to help our clients excel anywhere in the world.
Beyond the UK: Deloitte North and South Europe
The UK is part of Deloitte North and South Europe (NSE), the second largest member firm in the Deloitte network. Deloitte NSE combines operations in Belgium, Central Mediterranean (Italy, Greece, Malta), Ireland, the Middle East (Bahrain, Cyprus, Egypt, Iraq, Jordan, Kuwait, Lebanon, Libya, Oman, Palestinian Ruled Territories, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, United Arab Emirates, Yemen), the Netherlands, the Nordics (Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway and Sweden), Switzerland and the UK. Deloitte NSE brings together 2,700 partners and over 50,000 people, combining our unmatched breadth and depth of capabilities in audit and assurance, consulting, financial advisory, risk advisory, and tax and legal across the region. Being part of Deloitte NSE supports our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services and will create more opportunity and growth for our people.
What do we value?
What brings us all together at Deloitte? It's how we approach the thousands of decisions we make every day. How we behave, our beliefs and our attitudes. In other words: our values. Whatever we do, wherever we are in the world, we lead the way, serve with integrity, take care of each other, foster inclusion, and collaborate for maximum impact. These five shared values lead every decision we make and action we take, guiding us to deliver impact how and where it matters most.
Being a Leader at Deloitte
Cultural fit and purpose-led leadership is crucial for Deloitte. Our leaders always set the example and inspire their colleagues. They make quality time for people and take an interest in them. They know what matters to people - both inside and outside work - and value them as individuals; always finding opportunities to develop them while showing respect and appreciation.
We expect colleagues at all levels to embrace and live our purpose and our leadership culture by challenging themselves to identify issues that are most important for our clients, our people, and for society and make an impact that matters. We know leadership comes in all shapes and sizes, but our Leadership Charter helps all of our people understand what we're looking for:
• We live our purpose: we act as a role model, embracing and living our purpose and values, and recognising others for the impact they make
• We develop talent: we develop high-performing people and teams through challenging and meaningful opportunities
• We drive performance: we deliver exceptional client service; maximise results and drive high performance from people while fostering collaboration across businesses and borders
• We believe positive influence can make an impact that matters: we influence clients, teams, and individuals positively, leading by example and establishing confident relationships with increasingly senior people
• We move, together, towards a strategic direction: we understand key objectives for clients and Deloitte, aligning people to objectives and setting priorities and direction.
WPFULL, SLCONS, BASAMA, CFTECH

Deloitte LLP is a limited liability partnership registered in England and Wales with registered number OC303675 and its registered office at 1 New Street Square, London EC4A 3HQ, United Kingdom.
Deloitte LLP is the United Kingdom affiliate of Deloitte NSE LLP, a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee ("DTTL"). DTTL and each of its member firms are legally separate and independent entities. DTTL and Deloitte NSE LLP do not provide services to clients. Please see www.deloitte.com/about to learn more about our global network of member firms.
