Title: Senior Consultant - Manager, Multi Solution Architect, Deloitte Digital, Consulting, London
Description:
Senior Consultant - Manager, Multi Solution Architect, Deloitte Digital, Consulting, London
Your opportunity
Part Business. Part Creative. Part Technology. One hundred per cent digital. At Deloitte Digital, we connect creativity with technology for business. Bringing empathy, ideas, and experience into digital transformation. Together with all of Deloitte, we create connections across the breadth of our people, organisation, and ecosystems to make an impact that matters to our clients and to society. We're a new type of creative digital consultancy that fuses strategy, tech and design to identify where businesses need to be, then get them there. Fast. Want to help us shape the future? We're looking for experienced practitioners from a consulting, design, tech or business background who can show our clients what's next, then work with our mixed-discipline team to make it happen.

As part of our Consultancy practice, your career with Deloitte Digital can take multiple paths. Including: customer and channel strategy, customer experience design, designing new service capabilities and operations, mobile, online and contact centre technology solutions, and related technology and operational change programmes.

We embrace the strengths of diverse talent within our team. You may have a brilliant mind, be a confident communicator or a nerd for all things digital, or you may have an impeccable business instinct, a collaborative outlook and a flair for big ideas
We encourage consideration of flexible ways of working, both formal and informal arrangements that allow for the best outcomes for our people and our clients. If this opportunity is of interest to you with some flexibility, please do discuss with us.

Are you looking to return to the workplace after an extended career break?
For this role we can offer coaching and support designed for returners to refresh your knowledge and skills, and help your transition back into the workplace after a career break of 2 years or more. If this is relevant for you, just let your recruiter know when you make your application.

Your role
We're expanding fast, so we're looking for people who are, by which we mean natural initiative-takers who bring out the best in others, are brilliant listeners and can grow our business without compromising standards, integrity or culture.
You will work with outstanding digital talent across disciplines to innovate and create great solutions for iconic brands.
• You will need to hold a room with senior client stakeholders and provide Digital Architecture advisory and build direction to our clients and teams of consultants that would be working under you
• Partner and vendor management
• Architectural development
• Conduct vendor evaluations
• Management of architectures for clients
• Ensure technologies are aligned to achieve business objectives on behalf of our clients.
• Manage diverse teams within an inclusive team culture where people are recognised for their contribution

Your work, your choice
At Deloitte we believe the best impact is the value we add, not the hours we sit at our desk. We carefully consider agile ways of working, both formal and informal, that allow for the best impact for our people and our clients. Please speak to your recruiter about the working pattern that works best for you.

Location:
Through our studios spread across the globe, we help our clients imagine, deliver and run the future, through from customer research right through to implementation. And we love doing it.
This role is based in our airy and bustling offices in Clerkenwell, London, with its legendary coffee machine and model train track, you'll also have a chance to work with clients throughout Europe and beyond.

Work pattern:
This is a permanent opportunity, to be worked on a full time basis. However, our team members work a variety of agile working patterns. Tell us what arrangement works for you and we'll try to accommodate.

Your professional experience
Overall, you're an ideas person and problem solver as well as a hands-on doer - that's important. You know it takes a mix of people to do amazing work, so you love collaborating with and learning from people with different skills, backgrounds and perspectives. If you have an interesting or unusual mix of skills yourself, even better.

Essential
• Previous experience in a digital architect role or similar and an understanding of the vendor technologies deployed in those landscapes
• Experience in Commerce technologies, Content Management and Engagement or Digital Agency, Management Consultancy, System Integrator and/ or client side background
• Good knowledge of all Digital Vendors in Content, Commerce, CRM and Digital Optimisation
• Good Communication Skills with the ability to hold a room in client and internal engagements
• Organised
• Ability to manage a programme and people to provide clear direction to large multiple client teams
• Clear view on innovation in our sector
• Proven experience with suitable client engagements
• Self motivated and driven

Your service line: Consulting
Our people and the way we work are the two things that set us apart in the consulting universe. For us, collaboration is fundamental to success, along with an unrivalled depth and breadth of expertise. We work closely with our clients and each other, at every stage of every project, solving our clients' trickiest problems with a mix of knowledge, creativity and intellectual rigour. A hugely diverse range of clients rely on us to deliver the kind of change that adds genuine, lasting value to their business.

Personal independence

We are subject to a number of audit regulations, one of which requires that certain colleagues abide by specific personal independence constraints. Requisition code: 178535

Title: Senior Consultant, Data Scientist, Data Risk & Analytics, TMT, Risk Advisory, London
Description:
Senior Consultant, Data Scientist, Data Risk & Analytics, TMT, Risk Advisory, London
Your opportunity
Building a secure and trusted data foundation
Our mission is to deliver meaningful work for priority clients and society. As part of the largest Risk Analytics practice in the UK, our practitioners understand exactly how data underpins a business and how improving the management, use and insight from this data improves performance and reduces risk.
As a team we combine our people's skills and experience, with Deloitte tools and solutions, across four focus capability areas:
  • Data & software engineering - we design and deliver the data architectures, pipelines and solutions which underpin our clients' businesses.
  • Information management - we implement governance and compliance around enterprise data as a secure and trusted foundation.
  • Data science - we conduct data-driven problem solving and analysis through modelling and visualisation to shed light on root-cause issues and identify the optimum solutions and options.
  • AI & automation - we harness machine learning and cognitive capabilities to derive new insight from a myriad of unstructured and structured data sources and removing manual effort.

Furthermore, Technology and Data Risk is an integral part of Deloitte's advisory capabilities, and our One Deloitte strategy enables individuals to work with our specialists in different areas across the business.

We encourage consideration of flexible ways of working, both formal and informal arrangements that allow for the best outcomes for our people and our clients. If this opportunity is of interest to you with some flexibility, please do discuss with us.

Your role
As a Data Science Senior Consultant in our Tech and Data Risk team, you will:
  • Provide our clients with the information and insight they need to take the best decisions, improve their performance and minimise risk in projects ranging from advisory missions to technical assignments.
  • Engage with clients to get a detailed understanding of their specific needs and ensure that data and information meets our client's business requirements.
  • Solve the puzzle of integrating disparate sources of enterprise data and information to model and visualise our clients' businesses.
  • Develop solutions and processes to implement governance and compliance around enterprise data as a secure and trusted foundation.
  • Design and develop solutions that span Data Science techniques through to AI and automation capability.
  • Work effectively in diverse teams within an inclusive team culture where people are recognised for their contribution.

Your work, your choice
At Deloitte we believe the best impact is the value we add, not the hours we sit at our desk. We carefully consider agile ways of working, both formal and informal, that allow for the best impact for our people and our clients. Please speak to your recruiter about the working pattern that works best for you.

Location:
London with occassional domestic travel

Work pat tern:
This is a permanent contract opportunity

Your professional experience
We are looking for experienced professionals to align to our Data Science capability area, focusing on areas such as predictive modelling, advanced data analytics, scenario analysis, and outcome optimisation.
Experience in the following:
  • Working with clients to determine most appropriate statistical models to solve business problems
  • Developing and fitting complex statistical and machine learning models (e.g., generalised linear models, regularised regressions, neural networks, NLP)
  • Summarising model outputs for non-technical audience through reports and visualisation tools (e.g., Tableau/RShiny dashboard)
  • Reviewing complex models to assess risks and potential biases
Working with or knowledge on a range of tools such as:
  • Visualisation, dashboard and reporting tools e.g. Qlikview, Tableau, Power BI, R Shiny.
  • Open source visualisation solutions e.g. Plotly, D3.js.
  • Data Science / Big Data languages e.g. R, Python.
  • Database management tools e.g. SQL.
  • Big Data technologies e.g. Hadoop, Kafka, Spark.
Additional Desirable Experience
  • Experience with training and deploying models using cloud technologies (e.g., Amazon Sagemaker, GCP Datalab).
  • Experience working in the Technology, Media, and Telecommunications sector
  • Postgraduate degree in a scientific subject (Mathematics, Natural Sciences, Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Robotics, Data Science, Engineering, etc.) or equivalent and/or relevant professional qualification and/or significant relevant consulting/industry expertise.
  • Cloud Certifications.
  • A relevant professional qualification and/or relevant consulting expertise.
  • Experience managing key client relationships and/or managing multiple engagements.
  • Strong delivery skills and the ability to work on your own initiative and in many different and challenging environments.
  • Strong planning, organisation and management skills.
  • Exceptional communication, presentation, business writing and professional skills, including being able to liaise with both technical and business contacts at our clients.

Your service line: Risk Advisory
In Risk Advisory, our thinking and actions give clients, our people and society the confidence to succeed responsibly in a rapidly changing world. We don't just work with our clients to manage risk, we help them understand and grab the opportunities it presents too, helping them gain a competitive advantage. Our expertise and industry knowledge run deep here. At Deloitte, you'll find yourself working with some of the most inspiring and experienced colleagues and with clients who trust you to lead the way to smart choices, better control frameworks, and new systems, including bespoke solutions that have a direct impact on their bottom line.

Personal Independence
Regulation and controls are standard practice in our industry and Deloitte is no exception. These controls provide important legal protection for both you and the firm. We are subject to a number of audit regulations, one of which requires that certain colleagues abide by specific personal independence constraints. This can mean that you and your "Immediate Family Members" are not permitted to hold certain financial interests (shares, funds, bonds etc.) with audit clients of the firm. The recruitment team will provide further detail as you progress through the recruitment process.

About Deloitte
Our Purpose & Strategy
To make an impact that matters for our clients, our people and society - defines who we are and what we stand for. Our purpose provides the foundation for our strategy and our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services: this is not about size, it's about being the first choice. The first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.

What do we do?
Deloitte offers global integrated professional services that include Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Legal, Risk Advisory and Tax Consulting. Our approach combines intellectual leadership, industrial expertise, insight, consulting & problem solving capabilities whatever the role, technology revolutions and innovation from multiple disciplines to help our clients excel anywhere in the world.

Beyond the UK: Deloitte North and South Europe
The UK is part of Deloitte North and South Europe (NSE), the second largest member firm in the Deloitte network. Deloitte NSE combines operations in Belgium, Greece, Ireland, Italy, Malta, the Netherlands, the Nordics (Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway and Sweden), Switzerland and the UK. Deloitte NSE brings together 2,500 partners and over 40,000 people, combining our unmatched breadth and depth of capabilities in audit and assurance, consulting, financial advisory, risk advisory, and tax and legal across the region. Being part of Deloitte NSE supports our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services and will create more opportunity and growth for our people.
What do we value?
At Deloitte we foster a collaborative culture where talented individuals can produce their best work. We value innovative thinking, diverse insights and a genuinely distinctive level of customer service. We value difference, with respect at the heart of our inclusive culture, and we support agile working arrangements. Hear from some of our people already working at Deloitte in agile ways . We are proud to have earnt a Top 10 place on the 2018 list of Top 30 Employers for Working Families for the eighth consecutive year, and to have been listed in The Times Top 50 Employers for Women for each of the last four years.

Being a Leader at Deloitte
Cultural fit and purpose-led leadership is crucial for Deloitte. Our leaders always set the example and inspire their colleagues. They make quality time for people and take an interest in them. They know what matters to people - both inside and outside work - and value them as individuals; always finding opportunities to develop them while showing respect and appreciation.
We expect colleagues at all levels to embrace and live our purpose and our leadership culture by challenging themselves to identify issues that are most important for our clients, our people, and for society and make an impact that matters. We know leadership comes in all shapes and sizes, but our Leadership Charter helps all of our people understand what we're looking for:

× We live our purpose: we act as a role model, embracing and living our purpose and values, and recognising others for the impact they make
× We develop talent: we develop high-performing people and teams through challenging and meaningful opportunities
× We drive performance: we deliver exceptional client service; maximise results and drive high performance from people while fostering collaboration across businesses and borders
× We believe positive influence can make an impact that matters: we influence clients, teams, and individuals positively, leading by example and establishing confident relationships with increasingly senior people
× We move, together, towards a strategic direction: we understand key objectives for clients and Deloitte, aligning people to objectives and setting priorities and direction.

Title: Manager Planning, Budgeting & Forecasting, Digital Finance Technology, Finance & Performance, Consulting, London
Description:
Manager Planning, Budgeting & Forecasting, Digital Finance Technology, Finance & Performance, Consulting, London
Your opportunity
Develop your technical and advisory skills delivering end-to-end client solutions, from design to implementation, to an outstanding client base.

Enterprise Technology & Performance
Want to work with business leaders, and alongside some of the most creative thinkers in industry? Can you develop and deliver innovative and core technology solutions that transform the digital enterprise and maximise ROI? From strategy articulation and process design to technology enablement, we work together to simplify the complex; creating tangible value for our clients.
We encourage consideration of flexible ways of working, both formal and informal arrangements that allow for the best outcomes for our people and our clients. If this opportunity is of interest to you with some flexibility, please do discuss with us.

Are you looking to return to the workplace after an extended career break?
For this role we can offer coaching and support designed for returners to refresh your knowledge and skills, and help your transition back into the workplace after a career break of 2 years or more. If this is relevant for you, just let your recruiter know when you make your application.

Your role
You will consult with and advise at all levels of a client's business â€" from the junior analyst to the CFO and CIO and be comfortable working alongside the Finance and IT departments. You will be responsible your project team and for the full life cycle of an Enterprise Performance Management (EPM) project, starting with the initial design of the performance framework through to the implementation of the supporting technology and future roadmap design.

You will be responsible for:
  • Managing the successful design and delivery of Planning, Budgeting & Forecasting solutions in strategic accounts
  • Leading on identifying client requirements, processes and business drivers through meetings and workshops, and advising on best practices
  • Leading on advising clients on the various solutions available to meet their needs and the relative advantages and disadvantages of those solutions
  • Establishing effective working relationships with clients as part of the project delivery role and advising them using your knowledge of the industry that they operate in
  • Performing practice development including contributing to client bids, thought leadership pieces, industry events, supporting the delivery of training or managing team communications
  • Managing diverse teams within an inclusive team culture where people are recognised for their contribution

Your professional experience
You will demonstrate:
  • Experience managing diverse teams and coaching/mentoring junior talent
  • Experience in a planning, budgeting and forecasting discipline within management consulting or relevant experience working in industry
  • Experience of implementing EPM technologies on premise and/or in the cloud in Anaplan, Adaptive Insights, OneStream and/or Oracle
  • Ability to translate and present technical information to a non-technical audience in a clear, concise, appropriate manner
  • Ability to translate business requirements into technology solutions
  • Effective cross-functional project management skills, with experience of working with geographically dispersed teams and clients
  • Qualified/Part-Qualified ACA/CIMA/ACCA is advantageous

Title: SAP Transformation Consultant, SAP Delivery Services, Consulting, Nationwide
Description:
SAP Transformation Consultant, SAP Delivery Services, Consulting, Nationwide
Your opportunity
Deloitte's strategy is to be the market leader in SAP enabled Transformations globally. We are recruiting exceptional individuals who can produce work of the highest quality in support of a superior client experience as part of our ground-breaking, digital SAP Transformation Programmes. Deloitte has a long-standing relationship with SAP. We are the global number one SAP delivery partner with over 200 S/4HANA implementations delivered to date.
By joining Deloitte, you will:
• Work with some of the most prestigious national and global private sector clients to address their greatest challenges and provide innovative and creative solutions to overcome these
• Have access to our broad range of market-leading services, propositions, assets, and our extensive knowledge base accumulated over hundreds of successful projects to develop your career
• Work alongside excellence colleagues from around the firm and across the globe
• Continue to grow and develop your core skills, hone your expertise and truly reach your potential accessing the wealth of learning and development available.
Enterprise Technology & Performance
Want to work with business leaders, and alongside some of the most creative thinkers in industry? Can you develop and deliver innovative and core technology solutions that transform the digital enterprise and maximise ROI? From strategy articulation and process design to technology enablement, we work together to simplify the complex; creating tangible value for our clients.
We encourage consideration of flexible ways of working, both formal and informal arrangements that allow for the best outcomes for our people and our clients. If this opportunity is of interest to you with some flexibility, please do discuss with us.
Your role
• We are looking for talented Consultants who have a strong consulting or a combination of change management/ business analysis and/ or training background
• You will be working in the Transformation Services team within SAP+ Delivery Services and will have day-to-day responsibility for the completion of high quality client deliverables
• You may not have specialised in a single change discipline to date, but you must be strong in business analysis, change management or training and willing to broaden to encapsulate the full services that we offer our clients
• You will be expected to lead on the production of key elements or artefacts of SAP Transformation Programmes, such as leading a workstream or being accountable for the delivery of key client deliverables, such as a training needs analysis or the change management plan
• You will be expected to build strong, productive relationships and communicate effectively in order to positively influence peers and other stakeholders
• You are motivated by supporting and enabling the people side of change, although an interest in technical, and specifically SAP projects, is important
• A working knowledge of the project lifecycle is essential
Your work, your choice
At Deloitte we believe the best impact is the value we add, not the hours we sit at our desk. We carefully consider agile ways of working, both formal and informal, that allow for the best impact for our people and our clients. Please speak to your recruiter about the working pattern that works best for you.
Location:
Based in various locations in the UK, this role also requires flexibility to work onsite at clients across multiple locations.
Work pattern:
This is a permanent contract opportunity. The role can be worked on a full-time basis.
Our team members work a variety of agile working patterns. Tell us what arrangement works for you and we'll try to accommodate.

Your professional experience
Essential
• Ability to lead on the production of key elements or artefacts of a SAP Transformation Programme, such as successfully leading a workstream or being accountable for the delivery of a key client deliverable
• Experience in producing and implementing high quality artefacts relating to the people side of change, such as a change strategy, communications and engagement plan, training needs analysis, change readiness assessment, change design and impact assessment, change management plan
• Ability to follow and adapt, where necessary, industry-recognised change management, business analysis and training methodologies
• Ability to assimilate and align work to client and Deloitte objectives, develop insights through effective data gathering and engagement with clients
• A self-starter mindset; you seek opportunities to develop and challenge yourself
• A team player who is able to build trust and collaborate with others, developing effective relationships and deliver key messages with clarity, confidence and poise to instil confidence in others
• Adaptive and innovative; you can work both with our valued ways of working and continually apply new ways of looking at problems and practices to help us strive for excellence
• Ability to embrace our Deloitte purpose and values and put these into practice in your professional life
• Ability to actively seek out opportunities to grow, share knowledge and experiences with others, and act as a strong brand ambassador
Desirable
• Relevant professional qualification, awarded by BCS, APMG, IIBA, PMI, Prosci, such as BCS International Diploma in Business Analysis, SAP Enable Now Certification, and/or a professional Change Management qualification, would be highly advantageous
• A sound and active knowledge of the Prosci® approach to change including the ADKAR® model would be advantageous
• Considered a strong collaborator or high performer by your peers and able to provide references in support of this
• The willingness to take risks and be wrong in the pursuit of being your best, authentic self

Requisition code: 181246

Title: Consultant, Data Strategy & Governance, Consulting, London
Description:
Consultant, Data Strategy & Governance, Consulting, London
Your opportunity
Data currently presents the world with great opportunities, but also significant risk if not managed effectively. Within our Data Strategy & Governance practice you will be helping market leading clients across all industries to develop their long term data strategy, the processes and operating model to govern data as a valuable asset and to build the foundation to exploit the exciting new opportunities that advanced analytics, AI, Big Data and automation present. Our fast-paced, stimulating, team-based and fun environment will allow you to take your career to the next step by developing new skills and honing existing ones, through the best training and exposure to leading-edge technology-enabled programmes.
You will be part of the following wider group within our Consulting portfolio offerings:
Strategy, Analytics and M&A
How do you make intelligent, future-proof decisions in a world where change is the one constant? That's exactly what you'll help our clients to do. You'll build trusted relationships with business stakeholders - and use the most exciting new technologies available - to create data-driven programmes that transform their organisations. Your advice will help clients position their organisations to succeed in an ever-evolving marketplace.
Your role
Our consultants work in a variety of projects to solve clients' toughest data problems by combining industry experience, consulting and analytical skills with data management capabilities to create a lasting impact. Whether it is devising a Data Strategy, implementing new ways of working to govern and manage data more efficiently or delivering technology-based solutions to do so more effectively, we need the very best people to join us and strengthen our team even further. That is where you come in.
Our projects and clients vary greatly and your responsibility will differ slightly based on the focus of the client engagement and your skillsets, but within our Data Strategy & Governance practice, your role will involve:
• Helping market leading clients define their long term Data Strategy to ensure that data is managed and used as a valuable asset
• Interview client stakeholders, analyse metamodels and data sets and evaluate existing documentation in order to assess a client's current Data Governance capabilities in order to identify gaps to be addressed
• Defining a client's 'to-be' state, which will involve the design of Data Governance Target Operating Models (TOM) through which data is efficiently managed within the organization, securing its trust and accountability
• Supporting the client in the creation of a business case to deliver Data Strategy & Governance ('to-be') improvements
• Working on projects to embed TOMs, Data Governance frameworks and data capabilities in the client organisation in a sustainable way
• Assessing and improving client's Data Quality
• Understanding the importance of stakeholder and change management and incorporating it into the implementation of Data Governance frameworks
• Working effectively in diverse teams within an inclusive team culture where people are recognised for their contribution
• Assisting in the further development of our market leading solution and delivery offerings and help produce proposal documents to showcase our capabilities to clients
• Contributing to the development of our thriving Data Strategy & Governance community, working effectively in diverse teams within an inclusive team culture where people are recognised for their contribution
Your work, your choice
At Deloitte we believe the best impact is the value we add, not the hours we sit at our desk. We carefully consider agile ways of working, both formal and informal, that allow for the best impact for our people and our clients. Please speak to your recruiter about the working pattern that works best for you.
Location:
Your home office will be London, but this client-facing role provides lots of opportunity for travel in the UK and overseas. We specify full mobility for our consulting roles but we make arrangements respectfully.
Work pattern:
This is a permanent full-time role.
However, we encourage consideration of flexible ways of working, both formal and informal arrangements that allow for the best outcomes for our people and our clients.

Your professional experience
We are looking for candidates who are able to demonstrate skills and experience in some of the following.
Essential
• Have a keen interest in data and experience of operating in a client or business facing role
• Business Analysis skills and experience such as process improvement, process and Operating Model design and requirements / information gathering techniques
• Work effectively within an inclusive team to achieve common goals
• Be able to assimilate and apply new techniques and knowledge to achieve business outcomes
• Possess good problem solving and analytical skills
• Manage stakeholders using clear communications and be able to form strong client relationships
• Demonstrate an ability to think and address challenges in a creative manner
• Experience of working in project teams
Desirable
• Demonstrate an understanding of Data Strategy and Governance principles and familiarity with processes, policies and any of the key technology vendor platforms
• Demonstrate knowledge of Data Quality Management, Metadata and Master Data Management principles
• Have experience with Data Governance Target Operating Model design
• Consulting experience, including;
o Working on client facing projects
o Experience of contributing to proposal writing, presentations and pre-sales activities
• Project Management experience of both waterfall and agile delivery approaches
Your service line: Consulting
Our people and the way we work are the two things that set us apart in the consulting universe. For us, collaboration is fundamental to success, along with an unrivalled depth and breadth of expertise. We work closely with our clients and each other, at every stage of every project, solving our clients' trickiest problems with a mix of knowledge, creativity and intellectual rigour. A hugely diverse range of clients rely on us to deliver the kind of change that adds genuine, lasting value to their business.
Personal independence
Regulation and controls are standard practice in our industry and Deloitte is no exception. These controls provide important legal protection for both you and the firm. We are subject to a number of audit regulations, one of which requires that certain colleagues abide by specific personal independence constraints. This can mean that you and your "Immediate Family Members" are not permitted to hold certain financial interests (shares, funds, bonds etc.) with audit clients of the firm. The recruitment team will provide further detail as you progress through the recruitment process.
About Deloitte
Our Purpose & Strategy
To make an impact that matters for our clients, our people and society - defines who we are and what we stand for. Our purpose provides the foundation for our strategy and our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services: this is not about size, it's about being the first choice. The first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.
What do we do?
Deloitte offers global integrated professional services that include Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Legal, Risk Advisory and Tax Consulting. Our approach combines intellectual leadership, industrial expertise, insight, consulting & problem solving capabilities whatever the role, technology revolutions and innovation from multiple disciplines to help our clients excel anywhere in the world.
Beyond the UK: Deloitte North and South Europe
The UK is part of Deloitte North and South Europe (NSE), the second largest member firm in the Deloitte network. Deloitte NSE combines operations in Belgium, Central Mediterranean (Italy, Greece, Malta), Ireland, the Middle East (Bahrain, Cyprus, Egypt, Iraq, Jordan, Kuwait, Lebanon, Libya, Oman, Palestinian Ruled Territories, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, United Arab Emirates, Yemen), the Netherlands, the Nordics (Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway and Sweden), Switzerland and the UK. Deloitte NSE brings together 2,700 partners and over 50,000 people, combining our unmatched breadth and depth of capabilities in audit and assurance, consulting, financial advisory, risk advisory, and tax and legal across the region. Being part of Deloitte NSE supports our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services and will create more opportunity and growth for our people.
What do we value?
What brings us all together at Deloitte? It's how we approach the thousands of decisions we make every day. How we behave, our beliefs and our attitudes. In other words: our values. Whatever we do, wherever we are in the world, we lead the way, serve with integrity, take care of each other, foster inclusion, and collaborate for maximum impact. These five shared values lead every decision we make and action we take, guiding us to deliver impact how and where it matters most.
Being a Leader at Deloitte
Cultural fit and purpose-led leadership is crucial for Deloitte. Our leaders always set the example and inspire their colleagues. They make quality time for people and take an interest in them. They know what matters to people - both inside and outside work - and value them as individuals; always finding opportunities to develop them while showing respect and appreciation.
We expect colleagues at all levels to embrace and live our purpose and our leadership culture by challenging themselves to identify issues that are most important for our clients, our people, and for society and make an impact that matters. We know leadership comes in all shapes and sizes, but our Leadership Charter helps all of our people understand what we're looking for:
• We live our purpose: we act as a role model, embracing and living our purpose and values, and recognising others for the impact they make
• We develop talent: we develop high-performing people and teams through challenging and meaningful opportunities
• We drive performance: we deliver exceptional client service; maximise results and drive high performance from people while fostering collaboration across businesses and borders
• We believe positive influence can make an impact that matters: we influence clients, teams, and individuals positively, leading by example and establishing confident relationships with increasingly senior people
• We move, together, towards a strategic direction: we understand key objectives for clients and Deloitte, aligning people to objectives and setting priorities and direction.

Title: Consultant, Front End Developer (Deloitte Digital), Defence and Security, Consulting, C&M, London
Description:
Consultant, Front End Developer (Deloitte Digital), Defence and Security, Consulting, C&M, London
Your opportunity
We love to code, and especially to create, so weâ€™re hoping youâ€™re going to join us and do just that. For us, developers are not people who are just fed specifications and sit quietly churning out code. As a senior member of our team, we need you to lead, guide, plan, explain, working alongside clients and other agency disciplines, cracking problems with a mix of technical expertise and innovative thinking. It's how we outclass the competition and create the best digital experiences.

We are proud of the impact we have with our Defence and Security clients, the strength of our relationships, and the depth and breadth of our skills that we bring to help them achieve their mission â€" we are privileged to be asked to work with them at the heart of their biggest and most ambitious technology programmes.

Our Defence and Security customers care deeply about user experience, accessibility and of course security; good software engineering is at the heart of what we do. As part of our team youâ€™ll be responsible for developing cutting-edge digital solutions. You'll work with some of the best developers, UX designers and strategists in the business, using digital to shape the future of how we live, work and play.

Deloitte Digital, Consulting
Part Business. Part Creative. Part Technology. One hundred per cent digital.

Weâ€™re a new type of creative digital consultancy that fuses strategy, tech and design to identify where businesses need to be, then get them there. Fast.

Through our studios spread across the globe, we help our clients imagine, deliver and run the future, through from customer research right through to implementation. And we love doing it.

As part of our team, youâ€™ll work side by side with strategists, designers, researchers, engineers, writers, architects and product specialists â€" using your unique skills and perspective to help drive transformation from operational level to the C-suite, across a complete range of digital channels.

We believe in our people, which means giving them the support they need to get the best balance of work and life. Individuality, flexibility, diversity are things weâ€™re passionate about. We wouldnâ€™t be Deloitte Digital without it.

As part of our Consulting practice, your career with Deloitte Digital can take multiple paths. We will work closely with you on a career plan that fits your skills, talents and aspirations, and provide an open environment to discuss your development and progression with Deloitte.

Your Role
  • Work with outstanding talent across front-developers, API developers, creatives and UX experts, integration teams and the client themselves.
  • Help deliver features end to end. We don't throw our work "over the wall," everyone is expected to pull together to design new features and figure out bugs.
  • Deliver mobile-first, responsive sites using a combination of HTML5 and CSS.
  • Build webapps capable of doing anything a native mobile or desktop app can do. This is the heart and soul of the modern web developer role. The possibilities in the browser should excite you to build the best experience possible for users.
  • Ensure your site works for users with accessibility needs, and use progressive enhancement to improve the experience for those on slow connections and weaker devices.
  • Help the client and end users to understand trade-offs when making product decisions, and explain why you would do things a certain way.
  • Keep learning! We have a great community of front-end developers who run weekly workshops together, share the best articles they find on Slack, and meet up twice a year for a full-day internal conference.
  • Going beyond standard duties and responsibilities to champion small details, spot opportunities and add extra value for our clients.
Your work, your choice
At Deloitte we believe the best impact is the value we add, not the hours we sit at our desk. We carefully consider agile ways of working, both formal and informal, that allow for the best impact for our people and our clients. Please speak to your recruiter about the working pattern that works best for you.

Location
Based in our airy and bustling offices in Clerkenwell, London, with its legendary coffee machine and model train track, youâ€™ll also have a chance to work with clients throughout Europe and beyond.
â€
Work pattern
This is a permanent contract opportunity. The role can be worked on a full-time / part-time / term-time (or other annualised days) basis.
Our team members work a variety of agile working patterns. Tell us what arrangement works for you and weâ€™ll try to accommodate.

Your professional experience
Overall, youâ€™re an ideas person and problem solver as well as a hands-on doer â€" thatâ€™s important. And you know it takes a mix of people to do amazing work, so you love collaborating with and learning from people with different skills, backgrounds and perspectives. If you have an interesting or unusual mix of skills yourself, even better.
Weâ€™re expanding fast, so weâ€™re looking for people who are, by which we mean natural initiative-takers who bring out the best in others, are brilliant listeners and can grow our business without compromising standards, integrity or culture.

Youâ€™ll also have
  • Experience in web development
  • A clear understanding of the fundamentals of JavaScript development, along with good overall engineering patterns and practises. Be able to explain these clearly.
  • Solid working experience of at least one major framework (React, Angular, etc).
  • Demonstrable experience and understanding of working in teams, particularly in agile methodologies such as Scrum & Kanban.

Requisition code: 178378

Title: Consultant â€" ServiceNow, Quality & Testing, Systems Engineering, Consulting, London
Description:
Consultant â€" ServiceNow, Quality & Testing, Systems Engineering, Consulting, London
Your opportunity
Deloitte provide premium testing services to a wide range of global clients, solving the most complex testing challenges on their most significant and highest profile IT change programmes. Our team has grown rapidly over recent years, and continues to do so, combining a wealth of deep industry knowledge with both business advisory experience and technical expertise.
Our proposition differs from our competitors as we are not purely delivery focused, we pride ourselves on providing a more consultative and strategic approach to testing which results in our clients experiencing a higher touch service.
Business Operations
Want to work with the latest technologies, as part of a team helping international organisations transform their core business capabilities? Whether you're working with on-premise systems, Cloud technology, or custom-developed solutions (to name just a few), your expertise will help clients deliver continuous improvement and innovation, from initial design right through to implementation and optimization.
Your role
As part of this role you will be responsible for helping our clients to identify and implement the most appropriate and efficient ServiceNow testing solutions for their needs, drawing upon our wide range of expertise and experience. You will get the chance to work with top tier clients across a range of sectors, providing high quality test advisory and delivery services. This an excellent opportunity to join a rapidly growing team that has a unique position in the test consultancy market.
Responsibilities will include:
• Executing testing for large, complex client test delivery focused on ServiceNow technologies
• Providing advice on ServiceNow testing tools and leveraging them effectively to deliver a successful outcome
• Working with key stakeholders at the client, building strong trusted relationships
• Reviewing test processes and practices
• Supporting our industry and proposition Testing leads to develop & implement existing & new go-to-market propositions
Your work, your choice
At Deloitte we believe the best impact is the value we add, not the hours we sit at our desk. We carefully consider agile ways of working, both formal and informal, that allow for the best impact for our people and our clients. Your home office will be London, but this client-facing role provides lots of opportunity for travel in the UK and overseas.
Work pattern:
This is a permanent opportunity. Although, our team members work a variety of agile working patterns. Tell us what arrangement works for you and we will try to accommodate.

Your professional experience
To qualify for the role Consultants must have:
• Experience of testing ServiceNow
• Experience of testing within an agile delivery environment
• Experience of ServiceNow test automations and tools, e.g. Automated Testing Framework (ATF)
• Understanding across multiple disciplines of test, e.g. functional, integration, performance, compatibility
• A good awareness of the role that ServiceNow testing tools play in the software development lifecycle, the types of tools available and where it is appropriate and useful to apply them
• Client-facing experience
• ISTQB Foundation Level certificate (or equivalent experience)
• Test management tool expertise (such as Atlassian Jira, HP ALM etc.)
• Strong written, verbal and presentation skills
• Proven technical ability - combined with strong business acumen
• Acute attention to detail
Additional desirable experience includes:
• A proven track record in a top tier consultancy
• ISTQB Certified Agile Tester qualification
• ServiceNow certifications

Requisition code: 181493

Title: Manager, Analytics, Financial Crime Technology Advisory, Financial Advisory, London
Description:
Manager, Analytics, Financial Crime Technology Advisory, Financial Advisory, London
Your opportunity
Investigating fraud, bribery and corruption, financial crime - it's just another day at the office for our Forensic Technology experts.
This is your opportunity to join Deloitte's growing Financial Crime Tech Advisory practice. We work with both UK and global Deloitte partners to undertake a wide range of fraud, corruption and regulatory investigations. We also help our clients harness technology to identify and address related challenges in a variety of industries.
As the leading company for global forensic and dispute advisory services, we're constantly sought out by high-profile organisations who need to perform extensive, complex and often urgent investigations into their business operations and data. Our rapidly growing analytics team comprises a group of specialists drawn from a wide range of different professional and technical backgrounds. We apply our combined skills and experience to find new ways of solving our clients' most complex data and analysis challenges.
The scope of our work, which ranges from developing technical solutions to advising clients and helping them to proactively manage their own risks, means that you will find numerous opportunities to grow your own portfolio of skills and excel at what you do best. Away from project work, we offer both formal and informal support for continuous professional development, to accelerate your career progression within a rapidly growing team.
You can expect to manage challenging, client-facing projects and be actively involved in growing our business from day one. You will work directly with our clients to understand the challenges they face and design, propose and deliver solutions that address them. In between projects you will use your constantly growing experience to identify and secure new business opportunities for our team. Join us and you'll be joining a growing team of multi-disciplinary, technically excellent and highly motivated people.
We encourage consideration of flexible ways of working, both formal and informal arrangements that allow for the best outcomes for our people and our clients. If this opportunity is of interest to you with some flexibility, please do discuss with us.
Are you looking to return to the workplace after an extended career break?
For this role we can offer coaching and support designed for returners to refresh your knowledge and skills, and help your transition back into the workplace after a career break of 2 years or more. If this is relevant for you, just let your recruiter know when you make your application.
Your role
Using cutting edge technology you'll work alongside specialists, often in multi-disciplinary teams, to deliver technology platforms and analytics tools that collate, analyse and solve our clients' most data intensive challenges. Leading project teams you will help to find solutions for clients on projects arising from high-profile legal or commercial disputes or driven by compliance and risk issues, particularly in the financial crime and regulatory fields.
Specific responsibilities will include:
• Scoping the delivery of analytical projects, working closely with clients and other project stakeholders to understand their requirements;
• Leading the delivery of analytical work and leading team/(s) of colleagues;
• Guiding the review and analysis of large and disparate data sets and reporting back to clients and stakeholders on identified issues and anomalies;
• Managing the quality and accuracy of your team's work and addressing risks as they arise;
• Leveraging your skills and experience to identify, propose and lead the development of new solutions to client problems;
• Contributing to the overall business management and leadership of the forensic analytics team;
• Contributing to the firm's talent agenda, managing and working effectively in diverse teams and helping to foster an inclusive culture where people are recognised for their contribution;
• Supporting the ambition of the team to be the leading forensic analytics experts in the UK and beyond, through growing the team to enable development of a broad range of quality client relationships across all industries and through the adoption of both cutting-edge and well-established technologies;
Your work, your choice
At Deloitte we believe the best impact is the value we add, not the hours we sit at our desk. We carefully consider agile ways of working, both formal and informal, that allow for the best impact for our people and our clients. Please speak to your recruiter about the working pattern that works best for you.
Location: London or St. Albans with a requirement for national and international travel for specific client projects. We work across various industries - our clients are wide-ranging, and associated projects will vary in both location and duration.
Work pattern: This is a permanent role with options for flexible working. At times work may be required outside standard office hours in order to meet the needs of our clients.

Your professional experience
Essential:
• Experience of leading and managing project-based work;
• Significant professional experience gained in roles of increasing responsibility;
• Ability to work with and lead project teams, helping to motivate team members;
• A desire to understand business problems and to evaluate the results of your work in a business context;
• Supporting the development of colleagues through mentoring and knowledge sharing;
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills that you can adapt to technical and non-technical audiences;
• Contribution to or development of proposals and propositions for internal or external clients;
• Recent experience in SQL to at least intermediate level and significant experience in at least one of the following technical areas:
o Data analysis, including the use of relevant software (e.g. R, VBA, Hadoop, Hive, Neo4J, i2);
o Database design and development (Microsoft SQL server preferred);
o Data loading and BI/ETL solutions (Microsoft SQL server preferred);
o Reporting and data visualisation using specialist tools (e.g. Microsoft SSRS, Tableau, Qlikview/sense);
o Text analytics through the use of taxonomies, concept searching, machine learning or clustering.
Preferred:
• Relevant postgraduate or professional qualifications;
• Experience of working on projects for external clients;
• Experience of working in or working on projects in regulated industries, particularly financial services.
Your service line: Financial Advisory
Advising clients in the moments that define their business takes multiple layers of expertise. Much more than due-diligence, this is about diverse teams of specialists coming together, crossing service lines and international borders to tackle the many, complex issues involved in major transactions. And we have one of the broadest networks in the business. Here, you'll find fascinating, career-building projects, market leading approaches, cutting-edge resources, huge clients and inspirational colleagues. As well as opportunities to develop a deep industry or product specialism.
Personal independence
Regulation and controls are standard practice in our industry and Deloitte is no exception. These controls provide important legal protection for both you and the firm. We are subject to a number of audit regulations, one of which requires that certain colleagues abide by specific personal independence constraints. This can mean that you and your "Immediate Family Members" are not permitted to hold certain financial interests (shares, funds, bonds etc.) with audit clients of the firm. The recruitment team will provide further detail as you progress through the recruitment process.

Deloitte NSE combines operations in Belgium, Central Mediterranean (Italy, Greece, Malta), Ireland, the Middle East (Bahrain, Cyprus, Egypt, Iraq, Jordan, Kuwait, Lebanon, Libya, Oman, Palestinian Ruled Territories, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, United Arab Emirates, Yemen), the Netherlands, the Nordics (Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway and Sweden), Switzerland and the UK. Deloitte NSE brings together 2,700 partners and over 50,000 people, combining our unmatched breadth and depth of capabilities in audit and assurance, consulting, financial advisory, risk advisory, and tax and legal across the region. Being part of Deloitte NSE supports our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services and will create more opportunity and growth for our people.
What do we value?
What brings us all together at Deloitte? It's how we approach the thousands of decisions we make every day. How we behave, our beliefs and our attitudes. In other words: our values. Whatever we do, wherever we are in the world, we lead the way, serve with integrity, take care of each other, foster inclusion, and collaborate for maximum impact. These five shared values lead every decision we make and action we take, guiding us to deliver impact how and where it matters most.
Being a Leader at Deloitte
Cultural fit and purpose-led leadership is crucial for Deloitte. Our leaders always set the example and inspire their colleagues. They make quality time for people and take an interest in them. They know what matters to people - both inside and outside work - and value them as individuals; always finding opportunities to develop them while showing respect and appreciation.
We expect colleagues at all levels to embrace and live our purpose and our leadership culture by challenging themselves to identify issues that are most important for our clients, our people, and for society and make an impact that matters. Requisition code: 181423

Title: Senior Consultant - Site Reliability Tester, Systems Engineering, Consulting, London
Description:
Senior Consultant - Site Reliability Tester, Systems Engineering, Consulting, London
Your opportunity
Site Reliability Testing is an evolving practice focused on applying Quality Engineering to the rollout of SRE tools, processes and changes. For example, adoption of monitoring services in all test environments as well as production, to gain early sight of reliability issues and service level objective breaches before any impact to users.
Business Operations
Want to work with the latest technologies, as part of a team helping international organisations transform their core business capabilities? Whether you're working with on-premise systems, Cloud technology, or custom-developed solutions (to name just a few), your expertise will help clients deliver continuous improvement and innovation, from initial design right through to implementation and optimization.
Your role
Site Reliability Engineering focusses on areas such as automation, efficiency and reliability to deliver quality. As a site reliability tester within our Quality and Test Engineering team some of the key questions you will help to answer for our clients would be:
• How reliable is the system?
• How can we measure and quantify this reliability?
• What automated responses can be put in place to proactively handle known exceptions and incidents and adopt a self-healing approach?
• How confident are we that the reliability is not compromised by a change being delivered?
• How can we test and assure that the SRE requirements will be met before a production change is implemented?

Site reliability testers are naturally inquisitive and test the full stack of the application under test, from infrastructure through to the front end, protecting the user's digital experience from outages and ensuring large-scale, distributed systems are observable, manageable and fault-tolerant.
SRTs should think creatively and apply the latest tools and techniques including chaos engineering and digital experience monitoring. Working collaboratively with our clients and engineering teams you will help promote and embed reliability engineering throughout our programmes.

Your work, your choice
At Deloitte we believe the best impact is the value we add, not the hours we sit at our desk. We carefully consider agile ways of working, both formal and informal, that allow for the best impact for our people and our clients. Please speak to your recruiter about the working pattern that works best for you.
Location:
Your home office will be London, but this client-facing role provides lots of opportunity for travel in the UK and overseas.
Work pattern:
This is a permanent opportunity. Although, our team members work a variety of agile working patterns. Tell us what arrangement works for you and we will try to accommodate.

Your professional experience
To qualify for the role you must have:
• Experience of non-functional testing in the cloud
• Demonstrable hands on experience working with Azure, Amazon Web Services or Google Cloud Platform
• Experience with Unix/Linux systems with scripting experience in Shell, Perl or Python
• Experience with monitoring tools such as Dynatrace, Datadog, Splunk, Rapidspike or similar
• Excellent interpersonal skills
• Acute attention to detail
• Comfortable working in a fast-paced and often changeable client environment
• Test management tool expertise (such as HP ALM or Jira)
• Excellent interpersonal skills
• Acute attention to detail
• Comfortable working in a fast-paced and often changeable client environment
• Strong academic record
Additional desirable experience includes:
• Experience in one or more of C, C++, Java, Go or Python
• Experience in problem solving and analyzing global scale distributed systems
• One or more certification in any of Azure, Amazon Web Services or Google Cloud Platform
• Experience of testing Infrastructure as code solutions such as Terraform
• Proven technical ability - combined with strong business acumen
• Demonstrable rapid career progression to-date
• Test management tool expertise (such as HP ALM or Jira)
• Strong academic record
• A proven track record in a top tier consultancy
• Strong Agile experience, Scrum/Kanban knowledge

Your service line: Consulting
Our people and the way we work are the two things that set us apart in the consulting universe. For us, collaboration is fundamental to success, along with an unrivalled depth and breadth of expertise. We work closely with our clients and each other, at every stage of every project, solving our clients' trickiest problems with a mix of knowledge, creativity and intellectual rigour. A hugely diverse range of clients rely on us to deliver the kind of change that adds genuine, lasting value to their business.
Personal independence
Regulation and controls are standard practice in our industry and Deloitte is no exception. These controls provide important legal protection for both you and the firm. We are subject to a number of audit regulations, one of which requires that certain colleagues abide by specific personal independence constraints. This can mean that you and your "Immediate Family Members" are not permitted to hold certain financial interests (shares, funds, bonds etc.) with audit clients of the firm. The recruitment team will provide further detail as you progress through the recruitment process.

Requisition code: 180829

Title: Senior Manager, Transaction Monitoring, Financial Crime Technology Advisory, Financial Advisory, London
Description:
Senior Manager, Transaction Monitoring, Financial Crime Technology Advisory, Financial Advisory, London
Your opportunity
Investigating fraud, bribery and corruption, financial crime - it's just another day at the office for our Forensic Technology experts.
This is your opportunity to join Deloitte's growing Financial Crime Tech advisory practice. We work with both UK and global Deloitte partners to undertake a wide range of fraud, corruption and regulatory investigations. We also help our clients harness technology to identify and address related challenges in a variety of industries.
As the leading company for global forensic and dispute advisory services, we're constantly sought out by high-profile organisations who need to perform extensive, complex and often urgent investigations into their business operations and data. Our rapidly growing analytics team comprises a group of specialists drawn from a wide range of different professional and technical backgrounds. We apply our combined skills and experience to find new ways of solving our clients' most complex data and analysis challenges.
The scope of our work, which ranges from developing technical solutions to advising clients and helping them to proactively manage their own risks, means that you will find numerous opportunities to grow your own portfolio of skills and excel at what you do best. Away from project work, we offer both formal and informal support for continuous professional development, to accelerate your career progression within a rapidly growing team.
You can expect to manage challenging, client-facing projects and be actively involved in growing our business from day one. You will work directly with our clients to understand the challenges they face and design, propose and deliver solutions that address them. In between projects you will use your constantly growing experience to identify and secure new business opportunities for our team. Join us and you'll be joining a growing team of multi-disciplinary, technically excellent and highly motivated people.
We encourage consideration of flexible ways of working, both formal and informal arrangements that allow for the best outcomes for our people and our clients. If this opportunity is of interest to you with some flexibility, please do discuss with us.
Are you looking to return to the workplace after an extended career break?
For this role we can offer coaching and support designed for returners to refresh your knowledge and skills, and help your transition back into the workplace after a career break of 2 years or more. If this is relevant for you, just let your recruiter know when you make your application.
Your role
Using cutting edge technology you'll work alongside colleagues, often in multi-disciplinary teams, helping to solve our clients' most significant challenges. In particular, as a Transaction Monitoring Specialist you will work on a wide range of Financial Crime projects, helping our clients to use analytics and technology to meet their obligations under national and international regulations.
Leading a small project team you will help to find solutions for clients on projects typically driven by compliance and risk problems, mainly in the financial crime and regulatory fields. You will work directly with our clients to understand the challenges they face and design, propose and deliver solutions that address them.
Specific responsibilities will include:
• Scoping the delivery of projects, working closely with clients and other project stakeholders to understand their requirements;
• Leading the delivery of analytical work leading a team/(s) of colleagues;
• Providing subject matter expertise (SME) to our Financial Crime team including in the area of Transaction Monitoring solutions;
• Managing the quality and accuracy of your team's work and addressing risks as they arise;
• Evaluating new technologies to expand the scope of the team's work and improve its efficiency;
• Contributing to the overall business management and leadership of the forensic analytics team;
• Contributing to the firm's talent agenda, managing and working effectively in diverse teams and helping to foster an inclusive culture where people are recognised for their contribution;
• Supporting the ambition of the team to be the leading forensic analytics experts in the UK and beyond, through growing the team to enable development of a broad range of quality client relationships across all industries and through the adoption of both cutting-edge and well-established technologies;
Your work, your choice
At Deloitte we believe the best impact is the value we add, not the hours we sit at our desk. We carefully consider agile ways of working, both formal and informal, that allow for the best impact for our people and our clients. Please speak to your recruiter about the working pattern that works best for you.
Location: London or St. Albans with a requirement for national and international travel for specific client projects. We work across various industries - our clients are wide-ranging, and associated projects will vary in both location and duration.
Work pattern: This is a permanent role with options for flexible working. At times work may be required outside standard office hours in order to meet the needs of our clients.

Your professional experience
Essential:
• Transaction Monitoring and Financial Crime domain expertise and/or technical knowledge acquired from a Compliance, Business or IT perspective;
• Experience of leading and managing project-based work;
• Ability to work with and lead project teams, helping to motivate team members;
• A desire to understand business problems and to evaluate the results of your work in a business context;
• Supporting the development of colleagues through mentoring and knowledge sharing;
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills that you can adapt to technical and non-technical audiences;
• Contribution to or development of proposals and propositions for internal or external clients.
Preferred:
• Relevant postgraduate or professional qualifications (including compliance experience as a practitioner and/or Financial Crime compliance qualifications (e.g. ICA or ACAMS or equivalent));
• Experience of working on projects for external clients;
• Experience of working in or working on projects in regulated industries, particularly financial services;
• Knowledge of a market leading rules engine based solution for Financial Crime compliance (e.g. Actimize, Norcom, Mantas, BAe Detica, SAS etc.)
• Use of 'traditional' data analytics tools and techniques (e.g. MSSQL, Oracle, MySQL) and ETL software (e.g. SSIS, Informatica, CloverETL) to address Financial Crime problems;
• Scripting or programming (e.g. Java, Python, C#).
Your service line: Financial Advisory
Advising clients in the moments that define their business takes multiple layers of expertise. Much more than due-diligence, this is about diverse teams of specialists coming together, crossing service lines and international borders to tackle the many, complex issues involved in major transactions. And we have one of the broadest networks in the business. Here, you'll find fascinating, career-building projects, market leading approaches, cutting-edge resources, huge clients and inspirational colleagues. As well as opportunities to develop a deep industry or product specialism.
Personal independence
Regulation and controls are standard practice in our industry and Deloitte is no exception. These controls provide important legal protection for both you and the firm. We are subject to a number of audit regulations, one of which requires that certain colleagues abide by specific personal independence constraints. This can mean that you and your "Immediate Family Members" are not permitted to hold certain financial interests (shares, funds, bonds etc.) with audit clients of the firm. The recruitment team will provide further detail as you progress through the recruitment process.

Requisition code: 181426

Title: Senior Consultant, Cloud Architect, Data Risk & Analytics, TMT, Risk Advisory, London
Description:
Senior Consultant, Cloud Architect, Data Risk & Analytics, TMT, Risk Advisory, London
Your opportunity
Building a secure and trusted data foundation
Our mission is to deliver meaningful work for priority clients and society. As part of the largest Risk Analytics practice in the UK, our practitioners understand exactly how data underpins a business and how improving the management, use and insight from this data improves performance and reduces risk.
As a team we combine our people's skills and experience, with Deloitte tools and solutions, across four focus capability areas:
  • Data & software engineering - we design and deliver the data architectures, pipelines and solutions which underpin our clients' businesses.
  • Information management - we implement governance and compliance around enterprise data as a secure and trusted foundation.
  • Data science - we conduct data-driven problem solving and analysis through modelling and visualisation to shed light on root-cause issues and identify the optimum solutions and options.
  • AI & automation - we harness machine learning and cognitive capabilities to derive new insight from a myriad of unstructured and structured data sources and removing manual effort.

This opportunity is for an AWS Cloud-DevOps engineer to join the Data & Software Engineering Team. You will be responsible for building AWS cloud-based solutions with intuitive web-based user interfaces that utilises cutting edge data analysis and machine learning algorithms in order to provide our clients with insight and to improve the efficiency and efficacy of their business.

Your role
As a Senior Consultant level AWS Cloud-DevOps engineer in our Data Risk Analytics team, you will:
  • Be a part of a team of developers working together to design and build cloud-based solutions that benefit our clients.
  • Use Terraform to design complex AWS infrastructures that support our solutions, including ECS Workloads and Lambda/Batch Job definitions.
  • Implement continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) practices for our solutions using Jenkins.
  • Support junior developers on projects, helping manage their tasks and develop their coding skills.
  • Work effectively in diverse teams within an inclusive team culture where people are recognised for their contribution.

Your work, your choice
At Deloitte we believe the best impact is the value we add, not the hours we sit at our desk. We carefully consider agile ways of working, both formal and informal, that allow for the best impact for our people and our clients. Please speak to your recruiter about the working pattern that works best for you.

Location:
London with occassional domestic travel

Work pat tern:
This is a permanent contract opportunity

Your professional experience
We are looking for experienced AWS Cloud-DevOps engineers that can also contribute to the wider team. Specifically, you must have:

  • Experience using Terraform to build cloud infrastructures
  • Experience implementing CI/CD practices with Jenkins (or similar tools)
  • Expertise in AWS (preferably with AWS certification)
  • Expertise in bash shell scripts
  • Strong delivery skills and the ability to work on your own initiative and in many different and challenging environments
  • Exceptional communication, presentation, business writing and professional skills, including being able to liaise with both technical and business contacts at our clients.
  • Strong planning and organisation skills.
Additional desirable experience includes:
  • Experience with other cloud platforms like GCP and Azure
  • Experience with Python
  • Experience working in the Technology, Media, and Telecommunications sector
  • Postgraduate degree in a scientific subject (Mathematics, Natural Sciences, Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Robotics, Data Science, Engineering, etc.) or equivalent and/or relevant professional qualification and/or significant relevant consulting/industry expertise.
  • A relevant professional qualification and/or relevant consulting expertise

Your service line: Risk Advisory
In Risk Advisory, our thinking and actions give clients, our people and society the confidence to succeed responsibly in a rapidly changing world. We don't just work with our clients to manage risk, we help them understand and grab the opportunities it presents too, helping them gain a competitive advantage. Our expertise and industry knowledge run deep here. At Deloitte, you'll find yourself working with some of the most inspiring and experienced colleagues and with clients who trust you to lead the way to smart choices, better control frameworks, and new systems, including bespoke solutions that have a direct impact on their bottom line.

Personal Independence
Regulation and controls are standard practice in our industry and Deloitte is no exception. These controls provide important legal protection for both you and the firm. We are subject to a number of audit regulations, one of which requires that certain colleagues abide by specific personal independence constraints. This can mean that you and your "Immediate Family Members" are not permitted to hold certain financial interests (shares, funds, bonds etc.) with audit clients of the firm. The recruitment team will provide further detail as you progress through the recruitment process.
