Title: Head of Crop Science
Description:
Head of Crop Science
Head of Crop Science - IHS Markit

About Us

IHS Markit Agribusiness Intelligence is recruiting a Head of Crop Science to lead our team of crop protection and seed market analysts and reporters and develop our commercial proposition in this vibrant space. The successful candidate will bring industry experience to the role and will be working with our analyst team, which provides essential business intelligence on agrochemicals, GM seeds, biologicals and technologies for the global crop protection and seeds industry. Our Crop Science services (previously under the Phillips McDougall and Agrow brands) deliver authoritative, high quality market insight, analysis, data and forecasts, which are used by our clients to gain critical competitive advantage in a fast-changing market where they play a key role in sustainable agriculture.

Agribusiness | IHS Markit
Agribusiness is part of IHS Markit's Energy and Natural Resources division and provides specialist data, intelligence and insight to businesses and professionals, helping the world's largest and most influential food, agribusiness and financial organisations gain advantage by delivering actionable intelligence across the food and commodities value chain. Our customers rely on our authoritative services to provide the precise, forward focused information they need to quickly capitalise on opportunities in today's complex, fast-evolving marketplace.

The key areas of expertise of our 260+ person team are:
  • Crop Protection and Seed
  • Fertilizers
  • Animal Health
  • Commodities: Crops, Livestock and Energy
  • Food Processing and Distribution
  • Agri Food Policy & Regulation


Your Role

You will be based in one of our global office locations and will be responsible for the planning and coordination of the group's publishing activities, contributing to the market analysis and playing a lead role in developing the group's longer-term business strategy, including new product development, to meet the evolving requirements of our client base.

This is a leadership role for the Crop Science team which has 13 staff located in the Europe, US and India. You will be responsible for contributing informed, unique insight and analysis, delivery of the group's analysis to schedules, the training and development of the team, the effective integration of the group within the broader Agribusiness portfolio and identifying and implementing opportunities, synergies and efficiencies from collaborating with colleagues in Agribusiness and more widely across IHS Markit. Within this varied role you can expect to be supporting both experience and more junior staff in developing their understanding of the market and how their analysis can support our clients, working with customers and internal product teams to ensure we have the most up-to-date understanding of client needs and develop our products to that and working with supporting sales and marketing staff to ensure we commercialize our portfolio.

You will be working closely with the Agribusiness senior management team and colleagues in the consulting group to support business planning. As this role will have frequent, direct exposure to our clients, involving international travel, you will be expected to act as an ambassador for the crop science group and wider business; building strong partnerships and networks across the industry.

About You

Key Qualifications and Skills:
  • Master's or Bachelor's Degree
  • At least 10 years of experience in the crop protection/seeds industry, preferably within a commercial or business/market intelligence role
  • Strong leadership and team management skills (including virtually) and the ability to work autonomously
  • Established network within the sector and the ability to expand continue to expand this as an ambassador for IHS Markit
  • Excellent written and spoken English with proven ability to produce insightful written analysis.
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively in an international team-oriented environment and to navigate and excel in a complex, matrix organization
  • Strong data, analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Ambitious view on how data and content can solve our customers' biggest problems
  • A commercial acumen to ensure we capture value through a consultative, customer-centric approach
  • Strong presenting skills
  • Excellent organizational, time management and prioritization skills.


What we offer
  • Competitive salary
  • Cash incentive plan and equity award
  • Options to work from an office or home location
  • Opportunity to work with experts in the field
  • Strong career path and training structure supporting continuous professional development

Title: Frontend Software Engineer - Enterprise Knowledge Graph
Description:
Frontend Software Engineer - Enterprise Knowledge Graph
About Us
The office of the CTO focuses on the corporate technical strategy to deliver the companies objectives. This includes practical engagement with all business units on product design, architecture, technology selection and governance. The office strives for horizontal alignments across all business units to benefit from economies of scale. In certain cases, the office will utilize capital investment on key initiatives to deliver immediate value or remediate high risk areas through structured programs. Maintains a focus on innovation to keep ahead of market trends in an effort to create new business value.

Your Role

The candidate would be working in dynamic development culture as part of OCTO, driving success through software design, delivery of reference implementations and general knowledge sharing. Accountable for the successful execution of technology projects including support and maintenance releases, minor functional releases and major products. Further, candidate would be expert at adapting easily to rapidly changing environments to ensure bottom-line success with leadership capabilities that enable them to work well independently or as part of a team.
  • Front end (UI) design and development required to implement the Enterprise Knowledge Graph
  • Clearly understands data visualization and UI workflow principles
  • Can develop both frontend visualization capabilities and backend presentation layers
  • Recommends software solutions and/or new technologies based upon business value drivers, proven architecture principles, patterns and return on investment
  • Influencing common data modeling, design, coding and documentation practices
  • Defines reference documentation in support of developed solutions
  • Experience of working with development methodologies like Agile, Kanban.
  • Presenting demos to a business audience


About You

This highly motivated individual will have responsibility for front end development of quality software related the Enterprise Knowledge Graph platform which intends to connect all data within IHS Markit. The successful candidate will need to be capable of working with staff in all centres remotely.
  • 3+ years of experience in software development/design in relevant technology disciplines
  • Bachelor's Degree or equivalent in a Business, Financial or Technical field.
  • Experienced with hands on development in progressive frontend stacks, such as Angular and Node.js
  • Experience with Angular, Typescript, RxJS, state management libraries such as NGXS, HTML and CSS is a must while familiarity with Apollo GraphQL and D3 would be a benefit.
  • Familiarity with building on and deploying services to 3rd party platforms such as AWS and interfacing using infrastructure as code tools such as terraform.
  • Knowledge applying a test-driven CI/CD framework and culture at a team level


What we offer
  • Fully remote working environment
  • Flexible working hours to allow you to attend your family
  • Cash incentive plan and equity award
  • Opportunity to work with world experts in the field

Title: Quantitative Analyst Director
Description:
Quantitative Analyst Director
Your Role:

The successful candidate will work with other experienced quantitative analysts, developers and product specialists to support and develop models to be used across the business lines mentioned above. In particular, current projects include the development of new pricing models and expanding the functionality
of existing models for pricing derivatives, the creation and improvement of market data products for several business lines within the Financial Services division, in particular the Portfolio Valuations team, and the application of advanced analytics to the calculation of Initial Margin (particular ISDA SIMM). The methods used involve both financial modelling and statistical techniques.

Key responsibilities:
  • Contribute to improvements on existing models and processes used daily in derivative pricing and/or market data product creation and dissemination.
  • Work with other quantitative analysts, product specialists and developers to develop new models as required by various businesses within the Financial Services division.
  • Exposure to different derivative asset class (fixed income, equity, credit, commodity) in pricing or in risk calculations, or in non-derivative areas (bond pricing and analytics, indices).


Your Team:

The Quantitative Analytics Group (QAG) supports the entire Financial Services division in IHS Markit and offers expertise on all quantitative issues within the company. Using a broad range of mathematical and statistical techniques in conjunction with technology, we develop many types of models for various businesses such
as Portfolio Valuations, CDS Data, Indices, Structured Finance, OTC Derived Data and others. Applications include derivatives valuation, risk calculations, data cleaning algorithms, fair value, scenario analysis, etc.

Your expertise:
  • MSc/PhD in a quantitative subject e.g. Math, physics, computer science
  • Knowledge of mathematical finance, stochastic calculus, probability theory, PDEs
  • Familiarity with object oriented programming (eg. Java / C++)
  • Strong problem solving skills
  • High level of attention to detail

It's a bonus if you also have:
  • Experience with numerical methods such as Monte Carlo, Finite Differences
  • Knowledge of Python
  • Experience with derivatives pricing models and/or risk models.
  • Familiarity with statistical programming (e.g. R)

Title: Quant Analyst
Description:
Quant Analyst
Job Title: Quant Analyst

Location: London

Your Role

Are you an experienced quant with aspirations to develop into a data scientist whilst innovating new solutions in the financial services space? You will contribute and make an impact towards the global investment portfolio analytics industry.
  • Reporting to Product Management, you will execute strategy to build and deliver our product offering
  • Develop and validate statistical / machine learning models and algorithms.
  • Work within an Agile SCRUM team to contribute to the development of the product
  • Run POCs with clients and clearly present the results
  • Articulate solutions and models to clients in a clear and concise way
  • Carry out testing of analytics and drill down to understand the impact of underlying data sources


Your Team

This is a newly formed team within the IHS Markit financial services division tasked to build analytics in the portfolio management space.

The team is characterised by a strong entrepreneurial culture. You will thrive on innovation of new products and analytics. With a practical entrepreneurial mindset, critical thinking skills and attention to detail you will have a quantitative background, an aptitude and curiosity to explore and exploit the unique data sets available with IHS Markit.

You will have had exposure and knowledge of portfolio analytics techniques including regression. You must have a proven ability for using creative problem-solving to drive business results and should have strong communication skills and be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders.

Your expertise
  • A minimum 7 to 10-year experience in quant analytics ideally multi-asset
  • Strong knowledge of python and other programming languages
  • Strong knowledge of investment products, both fixed income and equity
  • Strong oral and written communication skills
  • Excellent attention to detail and a meticulous eye for identifying inconsistencies or inaccuracies in data entry or data outputs
  • Knowledge of Machine Learning techniques


It's a bonus if you also have (Optional)
  • Language Skills are desirable
  • Experience in scrum and agile software development
  • Practical, with a can-do, entrepreneurial attitude and problem-solving skills
  • Adaptable and cultural aware
  • Comfortable with change and ambiguity

Title: Java Developer
Description:
Java Developer
Java Developer, London

Department overview:

Data Services for Valuations team is in charge of providing services to the DDVS (Valuations) division in IHSMarkit. Work will be primarily on developing and extending the current services in Java and other JVM languages as well as working on the AWS resources and infrastructure. Good opportunity to work on an interesting mix of business critical financial data services (modeling financial data transformations and streaming processes to create optimal services) as well as working on the scalable and cloud based technology platform to support the micro-services framework in place.

The DSV development team is in growth phase and currently consists of developers, product and testers located in the London, New York and Noida offices

Position summary

DSV is looking for a strong hands-on Java developer to develop the group's development effort in Noida developing software for financial applications, including:

• Services to on-board new data sets

• Develop AWS infrastructure as a service

• Client-facing and internal web applications

• Model financial data

The candidate will work closely with global cross-functional teams across Development, QA, Technology, Infrastructure Business Analysis and Project Management., to ensure project deliveries. The candidate would be required to work closely with the key stakeholders and technical teams to ensure smooth and timely delivery.

Duties & accountabilities:

Work closely with the DSV development team in London & Noida, take ownership of various components in the platform, and gain a solid understanding of how these components fit within the overall platform;
Implement and maintain various aspects of IHS Markit's Java-based cloud hosted platform.

Develop new software, and enhance existing software, to high-standards. Adhere to best practices that enhance user experience, usability, scalability, performance and security. Drive technology initiatives
Ensuring clear communication on status to all stakeholders including regular progress and updates to your manager, peers and leads.
Establish a productive working relationship with main product stakeholders for these components;

Work closely with the QA teams in London and Noida through testing cycles
Maintain and support the applications, investigating and fixing issues.
Contribute to discussions and decisions regarding the DSV system architecture

Education and experience:
  • Degree in Computer Science or related field from a top-tier institution.
  • 4+ years of experience working on distributed Java platforms and Web Platforms
  • Strong core Java 8 skills (with good understanding of
  • multi threading and performance tuning)
  • Comfortable working with both UNIX/Linux and Windows environments
  • Strong technical and platform knowledge, including some or all of:
  • Restful Web services
  • JMS, Message Queues
  • JSON, XML serialization
  • Spring
  • Knowledge of AWS, Spark and NoSQL technologies is a plus

Title: Quantitative Analyst, iBoxx Indices
Description:
Quantitative Analyst, iBoxx Indices
Company & Team - "About Us"

IHS Markit provides global pricing and reference data, indices and information services across multiple asset classes. Customers throughout the financial services industry leverage our Information products and services for independent valuations and to support research and analysis, risk management, regulatory reporting and trading.

Markit Indices sits within the Information division of Markit, one of three divisions of the global parent. Markit Indices is a leading independent provider of financial indices across all major asset classes. Our span of products cover global equity and fixed income markets and include globally recognized benchmarks such as our branded index families including iBoxx and iTraxx , and our Markit PMITM economic indices. Indices also offers related services which provide Index and ETP constituent aggregation and analysis to manage risk, attribute performance and inform investment decisions. In Asia our indices include the award-winning Markit iBoxx ABF Pan-Asia, Markit iBoxx Singapore Dollar and Markit iTraxx index and the HSBC PMI indices. We are market leader for bond indices used i n exchange traded funds .

Duties and Responsibilities - "Your Role"

IHS Markit is looking for an experienced hire, up to Senior Associate, with quantitative/investment background. Location will be London. The focus of the role is to support the development of new IHS Markit and bespoke indices for clients, focusing on leveraging assets available to IHS Markit and creating innovative products.

The role encompasses the full lifecycle of index product development, from market research, prototyping, client validation, product development, and coordination with other internal teams to ensure successful product launch. The individual will be part of a team that creates intellectual capital for IHS Markit and have ownership and responsibility of the index design process.

Responsibilities
  • Support the development of new benchmark and tradable bond indices in conjunction with key index stakeholders
  • Undertake analysis of markets and data collection and conduct scenario analysis for the research and development of new index methodologies
  • Extensive modelling of index methodologies in order to produce index constituent list and weights, and to back-test results
  • Attend client meetings and conference calls with salespeople to present the current thoughts and ideas of Markit Indices and to understand and manage client requirements
  • Writing of index specification guides
  • Index setup and calculation: develop calculation prototypes and test cases for new indices; perform test calculations and reconciliation of the results with clients
  • Quality control: daily checks and testing of index calculation and output files around the release of new indices


Job Requirements - "About You"

Essential Skills
  • Ability to think through a problem and break it into steps
  • Understanding of fixed income securities
  • Python , SQL, Excel
  • Ability to summarise complex algorithms without getting lost in details


Beneficial Skills:
  • Experience with ESG data or building ESG indices a plus


Education and experience
  • Solid quantitative background
  • Programming skills in Python and SQL or Java or C++
  • Knowledge of the fixed income, especially bond market
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities and modelling
  • Understanding of other asset classes including equities, FX and derivatives is an advantage


Commercial awareness
  • A high degree of awareness of the financial/resource implications of index design decisions is required
  • A keen interest in the developments and trends within financial markets in areas such as fixed income, asset management and ETFs


Job Benefits - "What we offer"
  • Cash incentive plan and equity award
  • Options to work remotely
  • Development and growth plan into higher level management
  • Training support towards further financial market qualifications
  • Opportunity to work with world experts in ETFs & indices
  • A strong client base and broad product line from the industry leader in the segment

Title: Trade Compliance Sales Exec
Description:
Trade Compliance Sales Exec
About Us

From identifying growth opportunities, reducing global supply chain risk, and improving efficiency, Maritime and Trade solutions from IHS Markit provide the information, analytics and insight you need to sail ahead of the competition. We have over 300 years industry experience and are the sole appointed authority for assigning and validating the IMO. We are also able to provide 100% of US seaborne imports and export data along with global trade information for 86 countries.

The sales and account management team work closely with our product, subject matter experts and marketing team to drive the growth of the Maritime & Trade data and analytics suite and deliver outstanding customer service across a wide range of customer verticals.

Your Role

You will be a key member of the EMEA Maritime & Trade Sales team. Reporting into the Head of EMEA sales you will be responsible for driving new business growth of our exciting suite of trade compliance tools across the banking and trade spectrum of customers.

Key responsibilities:
  • Primary responsibility to drive new business sales of all trade compliance-related solutions
  • Research and prospect accounts to identify key contacts
  • Develop targeted multi-channel campaigns to generate new business opportunities
  • Engage in C level conversations designed to discover sales opportunities and drive from a senior level
  • Manage and maintain accurate Salesforce.com notes and data to illustrate work activities and sales pipeline data

About You

You are a focused and high energy individual who thrives on driving new business growth. You are fully able to understand a customer's workflow challenges, the key responsibilities of their role and have a superior ability to map out the priority deliverables to help them achieve their aims. You are familiar with the challenger sale approach and can teach, tailor, and take control of the sales process. Your curiosity to understand your customers world and deep work ethic to deliver solutions is key to your success.

Key Qualifications and Skills:
  • 5+ years' experience with software or data vendor specializing in sanctions, compliance, trade based money laundering (TBML), AML, KYC PEP
  • Proven ability of closing large value sales across multiple stakeholders at various seniority levels
  • Deep network of contacts across sanctions and compliance and within trade finance and export control is an advantage
  • Knowledge and experience of export compliance, trade finance regulation, economic sanctions are an advantage
  • Knowledge and experience of regulatory sanctions frameworks such as OFAC, EU, OFSI, HMT is an advantage
  • Proven track record of operating in the sanctions screening, trade finance or export compliance markets in EMEA is an advantage


What we offer
  • Competitive Base Salary and On Target Commission Plan
  • Equity award
  • Opportunity to work with world experts in the field

Title: Senior Sales Director
Description:
Senior Sales Director
Company & Team - "About Us"

Our industry-leading solutions, data services and investment management capabilities enhance the end-to-end lifecycle for traded and illiquid markets, with a range of offerings, including:
  • Portfolio Monitoring
  • CRM & Pipeline Management
  • Compliance
  • Valuation Software & Services
  • Multi-Currency Cash & FX Management


Duties and Responsibilities - "Your Role"

This is a Sales Director appointment with the solution sales specialist team in EMEA. The position will have responsibility for prospecting and selling to new accounts within a geographic region or named account list across EMEA.

The successful candidate will have experience in financial markets, direct selling experience of related software applications and/or relevant background in asset management, trading, capital markets or hedge fund focused software application.

An ideal candidate must have a proven sales track record within enterprise software sales and have the ability to sell fintech enterprise software solutions and/or buy side trade order management software with the ability to have contact at the C-level and across front/middle business and technology functions at sell-side banks, asset managers, hedge funds and insurance companies. This is a hunter style sales role requiring a solution/complex sales approach, ability to be a self-starter, and able to own full responsibility for developing sales opportunities.

Knowledge of institutional portfolio management workflows with loans, equity, fixed income and derivative trading and overall workflow is ideal. Understanding of portfolio modeling, compliance and trade operations is preferred.

Duties & Accountabilities:
  • Generation of new business pipeline in assigned territory
  • Prospecting and networking activities to drive new opportunities
  • Work closely with thinkFolio pre-sales and development team
  • Ability to give product presentations with high level product demos
  • Work with the US Account management team as a thinkFolio sales
  • Specialist
  • Maintain opportunities, pipeline and management reports from
  • Salesforce.
  • Take responsibility for IHSM solutions product knowledge, support and
  • implementation processes on an ongoing basis
  • Act as a point person for solutions sales providing understanding of technical information, product characteristics, and attending client meetings with assigned account managers
  • Understand competitive systems strengths & weaknesses, including ability to articulate Markit thinkFolio key advantages to prospects and internal staff. Strong domain knowledge of managed service solutions and deployment models
  • Active participation in sales conferences, marketing events, sales collateral production, client entertainment and other marketing functions


Job Requirements - "About You"
  • 8+ years complex software sales experience
  • Broad based experience with another buy side technology vendor with exposure to managing complex relationships and/or process's
  • Knowledge and experience in buy side or capital markets
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong inter-personal and influencing skills
  • Specific experience in covering this client base will be a big advantage


Job Benefits - "What we offer"
  • Cash incentive plan and equity award
  • Options to work from home
  • Flexible working hours to allow you to attend your family
  • Opportunity to work with world experts in the field

Title: Operations Analyst - Client Onboarding
Description:
Operations Analyst - Client Onboarding
Company & Team - "About Us"

The IHS Markit Transaction Cost Analysis team provides independent research, trade analysis, and consulting services for multiple asset classes to the financial services community comprised of institutional asset managers and sell side broker dealers.

The group provides trading analysis including actionable insights to the most challenging trade implementation questions: algorithmic trading performance, venue toxicity, and the impact of high frequency trading front-running to the client base.

Duties and Responsibilities - "Your Role"

The TCA team is looking for an Operations Analyst with 1-4 years of experience in onboarding and implementations/operations to support our clients. Candidate should possess intermediate SQL skills, be highly organized, comfortable talking to clients and developers.

Knowledge of financial markets and scripting. This role involves daily interactions with customers, and the ability to understand, document, and communicate technical requirements. The analyst will be responsible for managing projects to onboard clients to the IHS Markit TCA suite of products; organizing and leading meetings with clients; analyzing client files for TCA suitability; writing specifications for the development team; QA'ing results; and serving as the primary client point of contact throughout the onboarding process.

Duties & accountabilities
  • Lead projects to ensure clients are successfully onboarded to the IHS Markit TCA platform in a smooth and timely manner
  • Serve as client point of contact during initial onboarding phase, including answering questions regarding data and file structure, reports and analysis, client trade performance reviews and general technology inquiries
  • Work with product specialists for proof of concept presentations
  • Other projects as assigned


Job Requirements - "About You"
  • Minimum of a BA/BS degree in Finance, Computer Science, Financial Engineering, Economics, or other analytically oriented field
  • 1-4 years of relevant experience
  • Strong analytical background
  • Prior experience with SQL or another database knowledge is preferred
  • Experience with complex Excel functions (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUP, INDEX/MATCH) a plus
  • Commercial awareness
  • Ability to effectively interface with clients and promote the IHS Markit brand
  • Understanding of the investment landscape
  • Knowledge of institutional trading is a plus


Job Benefits - "What we offer"
  • Cash incentive plan and equity award
  • Options to work from home
  • Flexible working hours to allow you to attend your family
  • Opportunity to work with world experts in the field

Title: Equities Business Analyst - Corporate Actions
Description:
Equities Business Analyst - Corporate Actions
Equities Business Analyst - Corporate Actions

As a Business analyst you will be reporting directly to the Product Manager for the Custom Baskets Integrated Solution. CBIS. You will work within the scrum team.

You will have deep experience of Corporate Actions handling from a fund accounting/administration or Index Provider background

In addition to the operational responsibilities you will also play a key role in supporting projects, developments and testing of features affecting CBIS and the wider Eclipse solution.

Your key accountabilities
  • Good practical knowledge of fund corporate actions types and how they affect the value of a Portfolio or Fund
  • Deep and proven experience in corporate action handling
  • Work with clients to gather their requirements
  • 5+ years experience as a business analyst from an Index provider background
  • Write business documentation including training material
  • Additionally, the successful applicant will train clients in the use of the custom baskets product
  • Review sign-off processes and implement procedural improvements to reduce risk and improve efficiency
  • Follow up any issues arising with other areas such as Asset Valuation, Corporate Actions, within Product Management and see through to resolution
  • Timely escalation of any issues or exceptions found during processing to Product Manager
  • Provide support for issue resolution and various business developments and initiatives
  • Participation in projects
  • Participation in daily product development scrum
  • Work with the scrum team to write product development jiras and create process flow diagrams for new idea
  • Use SQL to query product databases ad support data analysis
  • User UI prototyping tools such as Balsamiq to visualize product ideas
  • Knowledge of the Sell side investment banks operations is an advantage but not essential
  • Effective presentational and communication skills at all levels (from individual user to executive)
  • Client focused with the ability to reason logically and provide innovative solutions


Desirable skills
  • Knowledge of Custom Baskets an advantage
  • Experience with index creation and administration.
  • Feature and story writing
  • Previous NAV Sign-off/ NAV Oversight/ Fund Accounting/Fund Administration experience
  • NAV calculation experience
  • Previous experience with an index provider
  • Ability to work with complex Excel spread sheets
  • Fund Accounting qualification, or Investment Management Certificate (IMC) would be a distinct advantage but not mandatory.


Key Competencies for the role
  • Corporate actions handling
  • Delivers results: Takes ownership for delivery
  • Problem Analysis
  • Initiating and adapting to change: Process improvements
  • Stakeholder/Client Management

Title: Technical Product Owner
Description:
Technical Product Owner
Technical Product Owner

Location: London

Your Role

Are you a self-starter and organised individual? You enjoy developing innovative products and solutions in the financial services space. You will contribute and make an impact towards the global investment portfolio analytics industry.
  • Reporting to Product Management, you will execute strategy to build and deliver our product offering
  • Manage a team of quantitative product specialists responsible for assisting customers, answer technical queries, and showcasing our capabilities
  • Identify customer requirements and translate them in user stories
  • Liaise with Product, Data Science and Software Development leadership team to prioritise customer requirements
  • Act as point of contact for Data Science and Software Development team on any query on the product
  • Manage software releases and go-to-market strategies, in partnership with key stakeholders (Sales, Marketing, etc)


Your Team

This is a newly formed team within the IHS Markit financial services division tasked to build analytics in the portfolio management space.

The team is characterised by a strong entrepreneurial culture. You will thrive on innovation of new products and analytics. With a practical entrepreneurial mindset, critical thinking skills and attention to detail you will have a quantitative background, an aptitude and curiosity to explore and exploit the unique data sets available with IHS Markit.

You will have had exposure and knowledge of portfolio analytics techniques including regression. You must have a proven ability for using creative problem-solving to drive business results and should have strong communication skills and be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders.

Your expertise
  • A minimum 7 to 10-year experience in multi-asset portfolio analytics in the buyside space
  • Strong knowledge of investment products, both fixed income and equity
  • Strong knowledge of python and other programming languages
  • Strong oral and written communication skills
  • Experience in scrum and agile software development
  • Excellent attention to detail and a meticulous eye for identifying inconsistencies or inaccuracies in data entry or data outputs


It's a bonus if you also have (Optional)
  • Practical, with a can-do, entrepreneurial attitude and problem-solving skills
  • Adaptable and cultural aware
  • Comfortable with change and ambiguity

Title: Power Consultant
Description:
Power Consultant
Your role

Are you a highly quantitative individual with a deep interest in the future evolution of African, Middle Eastern, and European power markets? Do you enjoy analysing complex problems and delivering well-structured solutions?

We're looking for an Energy Consultant, within the Power and Renewables Consulting team of the Climate and Sustainability business vertical to:
  • Participate in consulting project development and delivery, leading power supply, demand, and prices forecasts.
  • Apply energy industry knowledge into a variety of market designs and realities as required by different consulting projects need. Tasks would include supply-demand power modelling, legal and regulatory framework analysis, market screening, entry strategies, scenario energy planning, gas-to-power monetisation assessments, power generation economics analysis, and asset due diligence and valuation. The main geographical focus will be African and Middle Eastern markets.
  • Travel for consulting assignments.
  • Support, on a needs basis, IHS Markit's European power, gas, and renewables analysis in terms of market projections; regulation tracking; economic assessments; economic competitiveness of various power sector supply resources; tracking power market design evolution; and supply and demand fundamentals.
  • Deliver insights through written reports, presentations, and client interactions.


Your team

You will be working in the Gas, Power, and Energy Futures Consulting Team in London. The team is part of a global gas and power group that allows IHS Markit to deliver unrivalled insights into the future direction of energy markets, informing investment decisions, scenario planning, and asset due diligence and valuation .

Your expertise

You have
  • An Electrical Engineering bachelor's degree or another highly quantitative subject.
  • At least three years' experience of maintaining and developing large models of complex power systems and an understanding of power dispatch and demand modelling.
  • Fluent in English, with French, German, and/or Arabic reading skills desirable.
  • Knowledge and experience of third-party power dispatch software, such as Plexos and Aurora and advanced proficiency with MS Office applications (Excel, Word and PowerPoint) and VBA.


You are or have
  • Strong analytical skills and demonstratable experience in using structured methods and data analysis to derive research insights and messages.
  • An effective verbal and written communicator.
  • Effective interpersonal skills to enable communication and collaboration with colleagues and clients.
  • Able to work effectively in a team-oriented environment and to navigate in a matrix organization.


Your Benefits
  • Become part of a small, dynamic and knowledgeable team.
  • Develop and learn from industry experts.
  • Broaden your knowledge of international oil, gas and power markets.


Flexible Working

We pride ourselves on our agility and diversity, and we welcome requests to work flexibly. For most roles, flexible hours and/or an element of remote working are usually possible. Please talk to us at interview about the type of arrangement that is best for you. We will always try to be adaptable wherever we can.

Return to Work

Have you taken time out for caring responsibilities and are now looking to return to work? As part of our Return to Work initiative (link to career site page when available), we are encouraging enthusiastic and talented returners to apply, and will actively support your return to the workplace.

Your colleagues

About us

We are over 14,000 analysts, data scientists and specialists armed with real-time technology and data, working together to uncover deeper sources of information. The unique insights we provide help the industries and markets that drive our economies operate more efficiently, outpace competition and secure long-term success. Our global insights impact nearly every major sector - from aerospace to automotive. We empower our customers by isolating cause and effect, risk and opportunity in new ways so they can make well-informed decisions with greater confidence. This is a force we call The New Intelligence.

Join us

Boundaries belong on maps, not in your work. Start every day at IHS Markit with the excitement of what's next, by working with people from across the globe on interesting, cutting-edge projects and gaining once-in-a-lifetime learning experiences. It is easy to be passionate and invested in your work here, knowing you are causing an effect for some of the world's most influential companies. You'll get to be hands-on with, and see the direct impact, of your work. Career satisfaction just comes with the territory here. Title: Technology Lead - thinkFolio
Description:
Technology Lead - thinkFolio
Are you a passionate technologist? You enjoy driving large-scale software delivery projects and helping technology teams deliver their full potential. You will contribute and make an impact towards the build out of our platform supporting the fast-growing Private Markets sector.

Your Role

  • Build and grow multiple teams of engineers globally to support and grow the thinkFolio platform
  • Oversee the engineering and execution for a large-scale transformation project to modernize the platform
  • Accountability for delivery from the teams, ensuring best levels of velocity and quality
  • Liaise with senior technology partners, architects and global business stakeholders across the team to establish and evolve the technical direction for the platform


Your Team

You will be working as part of the global Solutions front office technology team, which operates across London, Manchester, North America, Eastern Europe and India. The team supports multiple front-office facing businesses in the Solutions segment and is expanding rapidly, demanding strong leadership to ensure coordination across streams and to constantly improve levels of quality.

Your Expertise

You have
  • Experience managing large high performing software development teams
  • Deep understanding and proven track record of delivering modern, scalable portfolio management solutions


The below skills are a strong plus:
  • Experience working in a global environment with stakeholders distributed around the globe
  • Experience working in a fast-paced Agile environment with mature CI/CD infrastructure
  • Good understanding of testing best practices and testing automation tools
  • Good understanding of cloud technology, preferably AWS

You are
  • A problem solver
  • A good communicator
  • A team player

Title: Senior Finance Manager (Operations)
Description:
Senior Finance Manager (Operations)
Job Summary
  • North West London
  • Permanent
  • BBBH778185
  • Apr 07, 2021
  • £40k - £60k

Job Description
Senior Financial Operations Manager with previous SAP and outsourcing experience. Vendor management and team management is also a must

Morgan McKinley are excited to be working with an FMCG business looking for a new role to support the Commercial Financial Controller in all management of a small team and outsourcing processes. We are looking for a highly motivated self starter to take ownership and assist in the leading of and SAP implementation.

The day to day duties include:
  • Financial Accounting
  • Governance and compliance
  • Daily management and review of all accounting processes
  • Process review and improvement
  • Advise and review of off shore modelling
  • External and internal audits
  • SAP implementation

The successful individual MUST have previous outsource model experience, ideally with an SAP implementation/ up grade under their belt,be a strong Financial Accountant with a strength in governance and compliance and have managed a team of people as well as taking the finance lead in projects.

Morgan McKinley is acting as an Employment Agency and references to pay rates are indicative.

BY APPLYING FOR THIS ROLE YOU ARE AGREEING TO OUR TERMS OF SERVICE WHICH TOGETHER WITH OUR PRIVACY STATEMENT GOVERN YOUR USE OF MORGAN MCKINLEY SERVICES.

Title: Dev Lead for .NET application suite
Description:
Job Reference #226128BR
Your team
Risk IT team supports the Financing business which is part of the Global Markets division within the Investment Bank.

Risk IT has about 30 people split between London and Krakow, Poland. We are responsible for 10 applications that specifically manage the counterparty credit risk of UBS's clients.

Your expertise
.NET senior developer, with experience of leading a team.

Financial services experience is an advantage.

Will need to work with senior business stakeholders, so strong communication skill will be required.

Scripting and experience with databases is also required.

Understanding of how to deliver enterprise grade software.

Have a passion for setting, and following, standards for the purpose of simplifying applications.

Experience of working with monitoring software is an advantage.

About us
Expert advice. Wealth management. Investment banking. Asset management. Retail banking in Switzerland. And all the support functions. That's what we do. And we do it for private and institutional clients as well as corporations around the world.

We are about 60,000 employees in all major financial centers, in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?

Join us
We're a truly global, collaborative and friendly group of people. Having a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace is important to us. And we support your career development, internal mobility and work-life balance. If this sounds interesting, apply now.

Disclaimer / Policy Statements
UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

Title: Rates Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Our client is a top tier Investment Bank that is looking to expand their Rates Quant team. This role is primarily focussed on Rates Exotics Modelling and Equity Hybrids

Rates Quant Analyst

London based

Responsibilities:

  • Develop analytics libraries used for pricing and risk-management
  • Create, implement, and support quantitative models for the trading business leveraging a wide variety of mathematical and computer science methods and tools including hardware acceleration, advanced calculus, C++ including STL, C#, .NET, Java, object oriented software design, Python, kdb, Structured Query Language (SQL), mathematical finance/ programming and statistics and probability
  • Develop pricing models using numerical techniques for valuation including Monte Carlo Methods and partial differential equation solvers
  • Collaborate closely with Traders, Structurers, and technology professionals.
  • Work in close partnership with control functions such as Legal, Compliance, Market and Credit Risk, Audit, Finance in order to ensure appropriate governance and control infrastructure
  • Build a culture of responsible finance, good governance and supervision, expense discipline and ethics


Qualifications:

  • 6-10 years of experience in a comparable quantitative modeling or analytics role, ideally in the financial sector
  • Must have technical/programming skills; Python, C++ .Net, SQL and C#; Statistics and Probability based calculations; Using probability theory to evaluate the risks of complex financial instruments, solve analytical equations and design numerical schemes to analyze complex contracts; and Software design and principles
  • Must also possess any level of product knowledge, Investments and Quantitative Methods
  • Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication skills


Education:

  • Bachelor's/University degree, Master's degree preferred

Title: Front Office Tooling Strat/Quant
Description:
Exotic strats are responsible for implementing and supporting the models used in exotic trading. They also look after automation of the Exotics product flow, including pricing methodology, control of the pricing platform and automated booking. They also assist with tooling for exotics trading, to improve the risk management and hedging infrastructure.

Java/Python Tooling Front Office Dev/Strat - Assoc/VP level

London based

Our client is looking for a strong Java/Python tooling developer to sit as part of their Exotic Derivative Strat team. Strats sit together with traders and sales people, in the revenue-generating activities of the Sales & Trading Division. They sit on the trading desk, are the primary modellers for new products, and team with the traders to deliver innovative ideas using models to analyse risks and opportunities in trading books for complex derivatives.

Exotic strats are responsible for implementing and supporting the models used in exotic trading. They also look after automation of the Exotics product flow, including pricing methodology, control of the pricing platform and automated booking. They also assist with tooling for exotics trading, to improve the risk management and hedging infrastructure.

Responsibilities:

  • Build cutting edge tools for trading and risk managing equity derivatives products.
  • Automating the Exotics product flow, automatize the auto-quoting of.
  • Analyse and manage the risk of the positions currently in the book.
  • Create tools to assist decision making & increase efficiency in trading.

Requirements:

  • A degree in a quantitative subject such as Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Physics, Software Engineering.
  • Very strong programming skills (Java/Python).
  • Ideally with exposure to Exo products.
  • Drive and desire to work in an intense team-oriented environment.
  • Ability to communicate effectively in both written and verbal English.

Title: Gasoil Operator
Description:
A large company is looking for someone to join their team.

- Must have experience in the Oil industry

- Must be eligible to work in the UK

- Team working and Team player preferable.

- Experience working in a trading environment

Title: EQUITIES TRADING BEHAVIOURAL SCIENTIST
Description:
Exciting role with one of London's top hedge funds

Do you have an equities-focused background and a highly numerical skillset?

Do you have an appreciation for the relationship between data-driven and fundamental approaches to investing?

Are you ready to step into an advisory role and become an integral part of the investment process of multiple PMs?

Is connecting the dots and drawing insightful conclusions your strength?

Do you consider yourself a great communicator who can spot trading patterns and communicate them with clarity and ease?

This is an exciting role with one of London's top hedge funds.

The successful candidate will focus on liaising with various stakeholders:

PMs - focus on surfacing recommendations backed by data. If the individual is credible and is adding insight and value, they will become an integral part of the PM's investment process

The founder - the role will involve presenting a well thought out monthly/ quarterly Trading Analytics report full of observations and recommendations

Proprietary development team - the candidate will be expected to conceptually understand the ins and outs of what goes into the complex analytics, and be able to communicate stakeholders' needs and ideas to the analytics team for them to put into production.

If the above sounds like you, feel free to apply.

Title: Trading Assistant
Description:
Posted by:
Vijay Sanghvi
Recruiter
View profile & contact
A brand new hire within a growing fund platform to provide desk based support to a team of traders covering a wide ranging set of strategies. If you have 2 - 3 years experience (buy or sell-side), this role would be perfect for you to take a step up in pace and experience.

​Superb opportunity to join the TA team at a rapidly growing multi-strategy fund platform. We're keen to hear from candidates with broad asset class exposure to give real time trading support to a team of traders. The business covers everything from L/S Equity, Credit, Fixed Income, and ETD investments but we aren't focussed on one specific asset class, just good all round middle office/TA experience. Duties will cover trade bookings, lifecycle event management, static data management, and process improvements/projects.

This seat is the focal point for much of the business hence, the successful candidate will be afforded business wide exposure, as well as, the chance to learn from some of the most highly regarded professionals in the investment space.

Title: Fund Controller
Description:
Posted by:
Mush Ali
Recruiter
View profile & contact
A leading fund manager is looking to identify a key new hire for its growing platform - we are looking to identify talent that has experience in the fund control function but are looking for an environment where they can make a difference and impact.

A great opportunity has arisen in a well known platform that is growing it fund control function.

We are looking for talent that understand how the fund accounting operates or are looking for that first move into the function. Our client is growing its team so would be interested in the following backgrounds :

- Experience of working in an existing fund accounting function

- Good experience at administrator and has a good understanding of how the NAV process works.

- Product Controller in a bank looking to make that first transition - our client recognies the value of the product knowledge and then training gained in a control function of a bank which they see as transferable skills.

- Audit Firm but ideally audited FS or hedge funds so have an appreciation of the function but also recognise the controls mindset that has been trained which is transferable to this function.

A great role, genuinely a really good team and culture where opinions are listened too and just seen as just a production line.

If are looking for an environment which will embrace and develop your existing knowledge then a great time to explore this sort of option.

Title: VP / Director - European Credit Sales - French or German
Description:
A Investment Bank is looking to add to their Fixed Income Business Unit and is seeking to hire an experienced Fixed Income Sales professional in Europe. The role offers a huge opportunity for an ambitious person looking grow within a successful team.

Associate / VP - European Fixed Income Sales - Investment Bank, Europe

A Investment Bank is looking to add to their Fixed Income Business Unit and is seeking to hire an experienced Bond Sales professional in Europe. The role offers a huge opportunity for an ambitious person looking grow within a successful team.

Key responsibilities of the Sales role include:

  • Responsible for sales of flow credit products including, corporates, financials and covered bonds
  • Focus on sales to French, Iberian and Nordic Institutional Sales
  • Work with the wider trading team to design and implement long term trading strategies and grow the bank's institutional client presence
  • Liaising and building long term-relationships with clients by providing investment advice to clients, including market information

Key requirements of the Credit Sales role include:

  • Proven experience in an credit sales role within a leading financial institution, at least to an Associate level
  • Extensive and in depth knowledge of European Fixed Income markets
  • Existing client across European Institutional Clients, preference would be across either Iberian, Nordic or French institutional client bases

If you are interested in the Fixed Income Sales role, apply online today or contact the Sales & Trading Team for more information. Please note, this advert is for one specific vacancies, but there are alternative vacancies available across Credit Sales space covering flow products based in alternative locations, please reach out for more information on all roles.

Title: Managing Director - UK Institutional Sales
Description:
Managing Director - UK Institutional Sales
Whether you're an investment professional, an expert in sales or a technology specialist, you'll find a culture at MFS that supports you in doing what you do best. Our employees work together to reach better outcomes, always favoring the strongest idea over the strongest individual. We put people first and show care and compassion for our community and each other. Because what we do matters - to us as valued professionals and to the millions of people and institutions who rely on us to help them build more secure and prosperous futures.


Job Description The Managing Director - UK Sales works alongside the UK team and the other European sales people in developing, implementing, communicating and monitoring the UK and Ireland market sales strategies. This role also works closely with the Global Consultant Relations team to coordinate, support and maintain relationships with specific research and field consultants within certain global and local consulting firms, as well as in-house teams of major banks and insurance companies. This role reports to the Global Head of Consultant Relations.


RESPONSIBILITIES :

  • Works collaboratively to develop and implement the UK and Ireland sales strategies, and ensure this aligns with the EMEA business plan and with MFS company strategy. Monitors industry trends, advises on company product development and develops a long-term strategy for marketing MFS' investment management to institutions to achieve sales goals. Works closely with the Relationship Management Team to encourage cross-selling opportunities.
  • Works collaboratively with the GCR team to build and coordinate the strategy for consultant coverage both at the research and field level in the UK and Ireland. Teams with the GCR team to build and maintain close working relationships with existing list of consultants.
  • Works collaboratively with on long-term brand building initiatives that help anchor the name awareness of MFS in its core distribution channels in the UK and Ireland. Participates in industry forums and in targeted press events as required. Is comfortable sharing MFS approved content on social media in an engaging way. Works with the UK marketing team to manage relationship with PR agency focused on UK institutional marketing.
  • Partners with the MFS portfolio managers, associate portfolio managers and research analysts when delivering presentations to pension sponsors, consultants or sub-advisor distributors.
  • Provides guidance and direction to junior members of sales team, and coordinates and monitors their efforts to ensure goals are met, or exceeded.
  • Arranges sales presentations, demonstrations and site visits for consultants and plan sponsor prospects. Participate in conducting these with colleagues and hosts independently as necessary.
  • Works collaboratively with the RFP team to ensure quality control of all consultant RFP responses.
  • Uses excellent communication skills and attention to detail to undertake the admin tasks that support the UK business development activities. These include, but are not limited to entering all meeting details in the CRM system, including pre and post meeting notes, and sharing information on internal messaging systems.
  • Leads activities for region across multiple lines of business. Monitors and measures for desired results and continuous improvement.
  • Work closely with the Legal and Compliance teams to ensure sale practices are compliant with internal MFS regulations as well external rules, policies, procedures and regulatory requirements.
  • Demonstrate expertise in local regulatory framework and changes and country specific items that impact the region. Partner with Legal and Compliance to ensure new regulatory requirements are embedded into the sales practices.
  • MFS' job descriptions reflect management's assignment of essential functions, which may be subject to change at any time due to constantly changing business needs.


JOB REQUIREMENTS :

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent. CFA and/or MBA desirable.
  • Experience in sales or consultant facing role with good technical knowledge.
  • Good investment knowledge to include significant expertise and experience in Fixed Income.
  • Thorough understanding of retirement industry.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills as well as presentation experience.
  • Excellent analytical, communication, management and influencing skills.
  • Strong organizational skills with an ability to effectively prioritize resources and manage multiple agendas
  • Global mindset and ability (and experience) of working in a global organization, leveraging and working in partnership/collaboration with internal stakeholders.
  • Demonstrated expertise with database software, all components of Microsoft Office. Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks simultaneously. Travel within country will be required. Position requires FCA certification and compliance with Individual Conduct Rules
  • Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
  • Travel within country will be required
  • Position requires FCA certification and compliance with Individual Conduct Rules
  • This role falls into the category of being an 'advise giving' role as per the requirements under MIFID II regulation.


#LI-CP1



If any applicant is unable to complete an application or respond to a job opening because of a disability, please contact MFS at 617-954-5000 or email talent_acquisition@mfs.com for assistance.

Title: Fixed Income Pricing Specialist
Description:
Fixed Income Pricing Specialist
About Us

The evaluated bond pricing team provides independent pricing, transparency and liquidity metrics on government, sovereign, agency and corporate bonds. Using a proprietary tool along with a variety of market data sources we are able to evaluate over 150,000 bond prices intraday.

Your Role

This position will be for someone with a good understanding of how fixed income instruments are priced with special focus on corporate and government bonds. The successful candidate will be expected to monitor market movements and become a sector specialist in the designated area. Operational tasks such as data delivery, customer support, and client relationships will also be part of this role.

About You

The successful candidate will be responsible for accurately pricing various sectors of the EMEA fixed income market using proprietary models. Responsibilities will include credit spread analysis, dealers quote research, analysis of primary and secondary markets, maintaining existing pricing models as well as increase sector coverage, monitoring and controlling price file distribution, manage client challenges and general customer support.

The pricing team is a small unit operating in a time sensitive environment. As such, all members must participate in all activities necessary to keep the product competitive and moving forward.
A sense of willingness to do whatever needs to be done is key to the team operating effectively.
Flexible working hours to cover London shift when required.

Specific Requirements:
  • University degree in Finance, Economics, Mathematics are all suitable.
  • Experience should be in a hands-on capital markets role (e.g. Trading assistant, market analyst, or a pricing analyst from another vendor).
  • A strong working knowledge of SQL is vital in order to extract and analyse live data. VBA and/or Python is also desirable
  • Knowledge of the fixed income markets, particularly the cash bond markets. Keen awareness of the credit space.
  • The candidate must have a natural attraction to the market and the issuers that compose it.
  • The candidate must be highly detail oriented.
  • Constant communication between teammates is critical in daily model maintenance. Ability to articulate situations clearly and quickly is a key characteristic for the candidate.
Inclusion and diversity are critical to the success of IHS Markit, and we actively encourage applications from people of all backgrounds. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected category. For more information on the many ways in which we enthusiastically support inclusion and diversity efforts for both candidates and employees, please access our Inclusion & Diversity Statement here .

We are proud to provide reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with IHS Markit and need special assistance or an accommodation to use our website or to apply for a position, please contact or call +1 212 849 0399. Determination on requests for reasonable accommodation are considered on a case-by-case basis. This contact information (email and phone) is intended for application assistance and accommodation requests only. We are unable to accept resumes or provide information about application status through the phone number or email address above. Resumes are only accepted through the online application process, and only qualified candidates will receive consideration and follow-up.

IHS Markit maintains a substance-free workplace; employees may be asked to submit to a drug test (where permitted by law). In addition, as a federal contractor in the United States, the company participates in the E-Verify Program to confirm eligibility to work.

Title: Client Solutions Associate - Nordic (Stockholm October 2021)
Description:
Client Solutions Associate - Nordic (Stockholm October 2021)
FactSet's world-class service is built on our employees' ability to engage our clients through proactive consultation on the financial industry and FactSet's sophisticated software and product offerings. The Client Solutions Development Programme provides new employees with the foundational knowledge they need to successfully build careers within FactSet. Through this programme, employees quickly gain exposure to FactSet's solutions, clients, industry and various teams within our client-facing organisation.
Client Solutions Associates begin their careers with comprehensive training, followed by working with clients first over the phone and then through a series of career rotations to best match each individual's passions and strengths with their career destination. Throughout the program, Client Solutions Associates will develop a wide array of skills and provide value to our clients by:
  • Developing a deep knowledge base across our business, products, and clients
  • Communicating with impact in person and over the phone while mastering presentation and public speaking skills both internally and externally
  • Asking effective questions in various situations to gather information, uncover needs, and create solutions to foster a truly collaborative and consultative partnerships
  • Defining key industry terms and concepts important to FactSet's clients to be seen as an industry expert
  • Using advanced product knowledge and understanding of FactSet's product suite to identify and implement solutions specific to client and user workflows including Excel modelling, company research, and portfolio analysis

A rapidly growing company like FactSet is committed to attracting the best and the brightest talent to propel its expansion. Client Solutions Development Programme, while challenging and rewarding, can lay the foundation for a long-term career at FactSet.

Position Requirements:
The ideal Nordic Client Solutions Associate possesses the following qualifications:
  • Background or strong interest in a Finance or FinTech industry
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Experience or desire to be client facing
  • Desire to grow and learn in an ever-changing environment
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and a proven ability to work on teams
  • A strong knowledge of PC applications, in particular Microsoft Excel
  • A commercial attitude
  • Fluency in English plus one Nordic Language (Finnish, Danish, Swedish, Norwegian or Icelandic)
  • Willingness to travel to your assigned clients in Scandinavia (approx. 1 week in 3)

Particularly advantageous although not essential:
  • Previous experience working in the finance industry
  • Academic or commercial experience working with large datasets
  • Previous experience with numerical programming languages or statistical Software packages
  • Previous experience in a client facing role

While we consider candidates from any major, we encourage applicants with backgrounds in Finance, Economics and Maths.

If you seek a challenging opportunity with a long-term career potential at a growing company with unique corporate culture, please apply now.

Start date: 11th October 2021. Location: Stockholm

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Description:
Senior Software Engineer
The Content Engineering (CE) - Fundamentals Integration group is responsible for the integration and development of FactSet's global company financials dataset, FactSet Fundamentals. This team is primarily responsible for the design and development of the Publisher Service, FactSet's premiere cloud-based reporting platform.
We are focused on expanding into the "Digital Strategy" market with portals, components, and interactive data, and the Publisher Service is the heartbeat of that functionality. One of the best parts of this team is that its code base is very stable. Stability is the key to a balanced work life, and while this team is on-call, the curator rarely gets a page. You will be joining a team that is growing functionality.

Responsibilities:
  • Design, implement, and test software for FactSet Fundamentals products.
  • Communicate with teammates, product developers, and stakeholders on project statuses.
  • Collaborate with engineering peers to improve the reliability and performance of data delivery.
  • Execute on Digital Transformation initiatives of the CE department.
  • Explore additional technologies and tools that could enhance our existing process or infrastructure.
  • Analyze, troubleshoot, and resolve production issues

Essential Requirements
  • Solid knowledge and experience of Object Oriented development
  • Relational database management experience
  • Team Leadership experience
  • Strong technical, analytical, troubleshooting, organizational, and communication skills
  • Self-driven and able to work/learn independently

Desired Skills
  • C# development experience
  • Python development experience
  • T-SQL development experience
  • Job scheduling and management experience
  • Understanding of Agile principles
  • A desire to learn and work with modern cloud technologies

Title: Digital – Pitch Portal – Junior Scrum Master
Description:
Digital – Pitch Portal – Junior Scrum Master
The Junior Scrum Master acts as the servant leader and coach for one team within the organization. An effective Junior Scrum Master promotes attributes of a highly functioning dedicated agile team, including perpetuating team dynamics of support and value driven delivery, protecting the team from outside interference, removing impediments, facilitating Scrum rituals, driving continuous improvement and promoting healthy Agile practices within the team. As part of a larger community of agile practitioners, they are motivated to learn to become an advocate of Agile values and principles within the team and across the organization.

Responsibilities & Expectations Agile-Lean Knowledge
  • Displays understanding of the scrum values and framework, agile values and principles
  • Can implement the practical application of Agile practices
  • Understands how to answer questions and make observations about how the team is implementing scrum or agile practices from a place of intuition drawing on their understanding of agile values and principles
  • Is starting to be able to identify when decisions, processes, or actions that are impacting the team, but they may not yet be able to articulate how these are out of alignment with Agile values or principles.

Teaching
  • Is developing their teaching skills in relation to Agile values and principles.
  • Is able to co-teach with experienced Scrum Masters to deliver high-level training sessions on Agile and Scrum to new team members and refresher sessions to team when needed.

Mentoring
  • Has developed the required skills to mentor the development team in industry practices that will help them become higher performing
  • Influences the team in ways that help them to embed working agreements, retrospective improvement plans, definition of ready, definition of done and other concepts into the culture of the team.

Facilitating
  • Uses time management techniques during meetings and Scrum events.
  • Leverages scope management techniques to make sure that the meetings are valuable.
  • Facilitates from the "front of the room" where much of the conversation is directed towards the Scrum master rather than the team talking to each other.
  • Facilitates the daily Scrum rather than teaching the team to collaborate and create a daily plan in a self-organizing manner

System Thinking
  • Can identify impediments that limit team productivity and quality, and has a basic understanding of which are team-based and which are organizational impediments
  • Use observation to help the individuals on the team work better together and start to form as a single unit

Leadership
  • Servant leadership - Is an empathetic leader that builds trust and focuses on the needs of the team.
  • Courage - Can defend certain Agile values and principles. Does what is right for the team and takes responsibility for protecting the team
  • Self-Awareness - Can express his/her own leadership style and identify improvement opportunities

Qualifications
  • 1year experience supporting a team as a Scrum Master or relatable experience
  • Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university
  • At least 3 years' experience working in a software development organization, preferably in an agile environment
  • Experience working in an iterative Development environment, utilizing Scrum practices.
  • Scrum Master Certification preferred but not essential
  • Exceptional communication/interpersonal skills and organizational skills
  • Willingness to provide direct and honest feedback to team members
  • Excellent facilitation skills
  • Ability to work effectively in a team setting
  • High level of motivation
