Title: Web UI Developer - Data Technologies
Description:
Web UI Developer - Data Technologies
Who are we?
Bloomberg is foremost a data company. Data is at the heart of everything we do; we collect it, cleanse it, enrich it, validate it, and make it available to our clients. This data is vast and varied and critical not only to our success but to that of our diverse global client base, and we continuously challenge ourselves to do this better and faster.
 
Our department is responsible for providing the tools and infrastructure to help get data from the outside world into Bloomberg. As an engineer in the Data Technologies Non Securitised Data (DT NSD) team, you will be responsible for the platform that on-boards Time Series data which drives Bloomberg's applications and enterprise systems. As our clients are shifting more and more to rely on machines to interpret data and drive insights, we are utilizing state of the art technologies to deliver unparalleled data quality. By joining Data Technologies, you will help us improve the accuracy, coverage, timeliness, and accessibility of our data to service our clients across all of Bloomberg's products.
 
What's in it for you?
You will be at the forefront of a change in the way Bloomberg is ingesting Big Data and making it available to its clients. In this particular role, you will focus on developing and maintaining our new user facing platform for the ingestion of Economic, Commodity, and Third Party datasets and ensure they are on boarded in a prompt and accurate fashion. We are aiming to increase the volume of data we have for those markets by orders of magnitude and need talented engineers to understand the full scope of what we, as a business, are trying to achieve, and come up with creative solutions. At present, this pipeline is highly automated and our first challenge is to scale it to meet our ambition. It is a greenfield project, with plenty of opportunity to design and build out new exciting functionality and drive the direction of the platform.
 
The London based DT NSD team is a technically diverse group solving a number of very different problems in very different ways. We pride ourselves on our intellectual curiosity and the quality of our systems, as well as our "do what it takes" attitude. Our new platform consists of an intuitive web based UI which allows users to easily setup ingestion pipelines, and leverages leading web technologies such as React. This is complimented by our scalable, distributed, ingestion pipeline running on industry leading technologies including Kubernetes, Docker, Kafka and HBase.
 
We are looking for an experienced Web UI developer to join the team and help develop the platform and take it to the next level.
 
We'll trust you to:
  • Be able to excel in a collaborative agile environment
  • Be part of full development life cycle, from back end services to front end development and automated testing
  • Develop strong working relationships with Engineering peers and main stakeholders
  • Own and understand the business challenges Bloomberg faces in terms of large scale data ingestion, enrichment, and dissemination and drive solutions to address those
    •  
    You'll need to have:
  • An expert understanding of web technologies and frameworks including React, React based components (e.g. Prime React, Material-UI, etc.), Redux, Node.js, HTML, CSS etc.
  • Professional hands-on experience with Javascript, and building intuitive, secure, scalable and responsive web applications
  • Understanding of web browsers including Chrome, Edge, Safari, Firefox, and their various idiosyncrasies, including browser performance and compatibility
  • Ability to design user interfaces taking them from mock ups for UX approval all the way to deployment
  • A firm grasp of networking concepts including services, protocols, proxies, and firewalls
  • Good system design and architecture skills
  • Experience working with large distributed systems
  • An understanding of continuous integration principles and writing testable code
  • Good communication and strong problem-solving skills
  • Experience using Linux/Unix
  • Good knowledge of Python
    •  
    We'd love to see:
  • Experience working in an agile environment
    •  
    Interview process:
    We believe interviewing is a two way street. It's a way for us to get to know you and your skills, and also a way for you to learn more about the team, our technical challenges, and what you'd be working on. The content of each interview round will be tailored to the role and your background, but the general framework can be found here: https://www.bloomberg.com/careers/technology/engineering/software-engineering-experienced-hire/
     
    We want to ensure you can put your best foot forward throughout the process, so if you have any questions or need any accommodations to be successful, please let us know!
     
    If this sounds like you, apply!
    And do check out our blog, TechAtBloomberg.com/ to learn more.
    Bloomberg is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: 2021 London Summer Internship: Analytics and Sales - Japanese Speakers
Description:
2021 London Summer Internship: Analytics and Sales - Japanese Speakers
You have an understanding of the drivers behind market moving stories and events. You're a solution-finder, with a real passion for providing exceptional customer service in a fast-paced environment. With a desire to build a career in a client-facing role, you understand the importance of credibility and building relationships!

Join our comprehensive Analytics & Sales summer internship program, where you will rotate between both departments over the course of ten weeks, gaining an insight into what our graduate role has to offer!

What is the role?
You will start with a week of classroom based financial product and functionality training, to broaden your knowledge of the global financial markets and our market leading Bloomberg solutions. After your training, you'll join a team where you'll immediately begin collaborating with interns on Analytics and Sales projects.

You'll have the opportunity to interact with clients, making valuable contributions by taking part in sales campaigns, promoting product features and prospecting for new business. Hands-on individual and group projects will allow you to experience how your full-time career could evolve.

To round out your experience, you'll attend lunch and learn sessions, designed to teach you about our diversified group, and there will be plenty of opportunities to meet Bloomberg leaders at a variety of networking events. Of course we also want to give you the chance to get to know your peers, so you'll also take part in volunteering activities and social events with interns from other departments.

Analytics
We provide 24/7 support for Bloomberg Professional Service users all over the world and across multiple industries. Reaching us via our 'Instant Bloomberg' chat system, clients access unparalleled customer service where we answer their questions and help them maximise the value of Bloomberg's products.

On any given day we respond to over 12,000 queries in more than 15 languages. From educating a portfolio manager on Bloomberg's risk management solutions to helping a trader use our functionality to discover new sources of market liquidity - the variety of problems we solve is immense.

Bloomberg is constantly innovating and Analytics plays a key role in ensuring clients are educated on new products and enhancements by proactively working closely to upskill them through technology, and delivering on-site training and seminars. We also work in conjunction with Enterprise Sales to deliver on strategic initiatives, supporting product roll-out and onboarding clients. We want to ensure our clients are making the most of our service and using tools and features that allow them to work smarter.

Sales
In Sales, we're the face of Bloomberg for our clients. Consultative and entrepreneurial, we manage client relationships, whilst striving to continually grow our revenue by identifying new business opportunities.

We spend our time with our clients, understanding their business goals and outpacing their expectations. Guided by curiosity and purpose, we work to understand their workflows and present them with the most appropriate solutions across our range of enterprise offerings.

We're discovering new business leads by making prospecting calls and networking. We demonstrate how Bloomberg's product offering will help our clients make the best investment/trading/business decisions, making their day to day business smoother and more profitable.

You need to have:
  • Business fluency in English as well as Japanese
  • Strong critical-thinking and problem-solving skills
  • A demonstrated interest in the financial markets and the aspiration to work in the financial services industry
  • The resilience to learn and adapt quickly in a dynamic environment
  • Real ambition to pursue a client-facing career, with a strong interest in relationship management and sales
  • Outstanding communication skills (both written and verbal)
  • Availability for the full 10-week duration of the internship from July - September 2021
  • The ability to start in a full-time role in 2021 or 2022

We'd love to see:
  • Work experience in a client facing role
  • An interest in programming and an aptitude for technical skills
Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are! Please note this is a two stage application process, following the submission of your candidate details you will receive an email with directions to complete an online assessment. Your application will not be complete until you have submitted the assessment.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
Bloomberg is a disability inclusive employer. Please let us know if you require any reasonable adjustments to be made for the recruitment process.

Title: Global Data - Contributions Technical Account Manager
Description:
Global Data - Contributions Technical Account Manager
Bloomberg runs on data. In our Global Data business, we're responsible for supplying it. The Content Acquisition & Business Management (CABM) department is responsible for managing, acquiring and integrating content and data from Exchanges, Brokers, Sell-side and other types of providers to drive the value of the Bloomberg Terminal and downstream products.

Our Client Service team is responsible for acquiring and managing content which is then made available to our client base. For clients, who use Bloomberg daily, having the ability to access this content in one place makes their workflow more efficient and helps them make more informed decisions. For the contributors of the data, being able to deliver their content in a place that their clients actively operate ensures greater market presence and returns on their distribution efforts.

What's the role?
We have an exciting opportunity for a highly motivated individual to join our team as a Contributions Account Manager, based in our London office. Your role will be vital in supporting new and existing content providers to the Bloomberg terminal. You will be proactively working with content providers daily to ensure content is delivered in a timely and effective manner. In order to do this, you will need to build strong and lasting relationships with these institutions, have a deep understanding of the technology they use, their goals and challenges and offer outstanding support to them. You will work closely with other business areas to set company strategy around contributed content and ensure your account strategy is aligned with it.

You'll need to have:
  • Ability to manage and support key accounts, helping them maintain and improve custom systems related to content dissemination
  • Confidence to manage relationships on a technical and business level
  • Autonomy to develop your own ideas and strategies for your accounts
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and a desire to work directly with customers
  • Excellent customer service while supporting a wide range of client queries via Bloomberg Help desk
  • Effective prioritisation skills and ability to work on multiple projects in parallel
  • Ability to identify problems in a process and apply technical knowledge to address inefficiencies
  • Capability to find technical solutions to help automate our clients' workflows and make our internal processes more efficient
  • Experience in utilising business intelligence to help spot trends, identify gaps and areas for product and content improvements
  • A proactive attitude with the confidence to challenge the status quo and a real desire to improve practices and processes
  • Collaborative attitude and ability to work with the global team of motivated Product managers, Technical Account Managers, Content Specialists and Engineering teams to improve our products and exceed our customers' expectations
  • Keen interest in the financial markets
  • Fluent knowledge of English and another European language

We'd love to see:
  • Experience in data analytics tools; SQL, Python, business intelligence tools or similar

If this sounds like you:

Apply today! We're eager to speak with you.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Software Engineer - 2021 Level 4 Apprenticeship
Description:
Software Engineer - 2021 Level 4 Apprenticeship
Bloomberg's global community of engineers take on some of the world's most interesting and important technical challenges. We develop impactful solutions to complex, real-world problems. With new systems being rolled out daily, we make an immediate impact on global markets and we look for the best software engineers to build them. This is no different for our Apprentices.

Our Level 4 Apprenticeship Program is a two-year Software Engineering work placement for talented school leavers and career switchers who are passionate about technology, looking to pursue a Foundation degree and eager to learn in our fast-paced environment.

Gain invaluable work experience at Bloomberg and earn a salary whilst studying part time at Ada National College for Digital Skills, England's first new Further Education College since 1993.

You will collaborate with your team and be trusted to take ownership of your projects under the guidance of full time Software Engineers. Our training will educate you on the ins and outs of our technology stack and you will learn how to be a successful software engineer. Mentors will support you with your day-to-day project work as you put into practice what you learn at University.

In addition you will participate in coding challenges, attend tech talks, volunteer and network with other apprentices, interns and placement students across the business.

You'll need to have:
A background in STEM subjects
A minimum B Grade in GCSE Mathematics
Three A-Levels with grades BBB and above (grades 5-9), or 31 International Baccalaureate points and above, or BTEC DDD
Not studied Computer Science or a related subject at Degree or Masters level
Good communication and teamworking skills
Good problem solving skills

Kick-start your career at Bloomberg and learn about technology and finance. Complete the program successfully and achieve a Level 4 standard and Foundation Degree in Digital Innovation which is validated by the Open University, plus you'll get the potential opportunity of a full time position at Bloomberg.

Bringing clarity to a complex world is our purpose. Come find yours.
We are deeply proud of our diverse and open culture, and value diversity of thought and perspective in every form. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other classification protected by applicable law. Disruptive innovation and breakthrough performance only happen when we are able to channel the diverse ideas and experiences of our employees to solve the needs of our clients.

Bloomberg is a disability inclusive employer. Please let us know if you require any adjustments to be made for the recruitment process by emailing access2@bloomberg.net.
 
Alternatively, you can get support from our disability partner EmployAbility, please contact +44 7852 764 684 or info@employ-ability.org.uk.

Title: Risk and Valuation Data Sales Specialist - EMEA
Description:
Risk and Valuation Data Sales Specialist - EMEA
We're Bloomberg Enterprise Data - fast paced, innovative and expanding. We have worked hard and smart to become the $1bn business we are today. We partner closely with our clients, taking time to understand their unique businesses and individual data and technology needs. Our endless selection of datasets, covering all asset types, with multiple delivery technologies and flexible scheduling mean our clients are able to get exactly the data they need, when they need it, in the format they prefer. Without us, they simply can't operate!

What's the role?
 
As a key member of our growing EMEA team, you'll be responsible for selling the suite of solutions under the Enterprise Data Valuation and Risk Products: Pricing data such as BVAL, Liquidity solutions, Derivatives valuations and Risk Data.

Our clients face an increasingly complex challenge to remain competitive in risk and valuation business functions, presenting a phenomenal opportunity to position our market leading products and technology in this space. As a business we have been able to innovate and adapt dynamically to the market changes and trends, whilst partnering our clients to solve their business needs.

As we continue these focus areas, we will look to you to develop these themes with your accounts and opportunities, to uncover new and diverse use cases with our risk and valuations solutions, keeping current with new approaches to valuations and risk management technologies is also vital for success.

This is an opportunity to be part of Bloomberg's fastest growing and rapidly innovating business, where our clients are evolving just as fast as we are. Our exceptional product development group look to us for guidance and input to create our award winning suite of solutions, enabling us to sell with the highest level of credibility, confidence and reliability. As a sales specialist, the potential to add your own unique value and insight to this exciting business will contribute to our ongoing growth and success!
 
We will trust you to:

  • Utilize your strong product knowledge, technical skills, and market knowledge to generate revenue for Enterprise Businesses & all of Bloomberg's solutions.
  • Lead enterprise sales engagements with multiple stakeholders, and long term requirements.
  • Articulate the features and benefits of Bloomberg enterprise level products in great detail, so that you can act as a partner for your customers. 
  • Develop an in-depth knowledge of what your customers do so that you can position our products to them at multiple phases of an engagement to multiple stakeholders.
  • Contribute innovative ideas that anticipate and address client needs
  • Collaborate internally to implement and execute value-added solution
  • Participate actively in new projects that drive departmental and firm-wide initiatives and goals
  • Seek out additional ways to make an impact, such as mentoring, involvement in training, running campaigns, and active involvement in product enhancement

You'll need to have:
  • Strong fixed income background, with an understanding of valuation and liquidity
  • Knowledge of data workflow and data management technology within buy and sell side institutions
  • Insight into market trends and where our clients are focusing next
  • Ability to lease with all levels and seniority across our clients business
  • Proven track record in building, managing and closing sales opportunities
  • A great organizational, time management and prioritization skill set
    • -- Excellent communication skills
    -- Exemplary presentation, training and communication skills in English
  • The ability for regular travel

If this sounds like you;
Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this:

http://www.bloomberg.com/enterprise/

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Senior Manager - Fund Accounting - Credit / Debt Funds
Description:
Posted by:
Glen Roberts
Director
View profile & contact
A high-growth start up fund services business with a supportive and entrepreneurial working culture and impressive client base is seeking to appoint a Senior Manager to head up their credit and private debt funds team.

This is a superb newly created opportunity to join this firm as they start to build out their operations in the UK, with an office of roughly 15 people at the moment and growing. This is a rare chance to get in early and support their UK Head of Office with building out their operations, as you take day to day management for a small team of fund accountants who are dedicated to a key credit and debt fund management client, managing all their fund and SPV level accounting work.

 

The role will primarily focus on being the final review on accounts and technical trouble shooter, leading and co-ordinating all accounting and reporting deliverables, client relationship management and supporting a broader agenda of systems and process enhancements. In addition to being responsible for a small team of PQ and Qualified accountants including responsibility for all training and on-boarding, coaching and mentoring.

 

We’re keen to speak to people with experience in fund accounting or funds services for ideally credit or private debt funds or private equity. Ideally you’ll be coming from either an in-house or fund administration background or from audit if you’ve had some exposure to auditing closed end fund structures and alike. Candidates based in the Channel Islands, Ireland, Malta, Isle of Man or Luxembourg with relevant experiences are strongly encouraged to get in touch if you’re seeking a role in London although visa sponsorship is not available.

Title: Financial Controller
Description:
Posted by:
Glen Roberts
Director
View profile & contact
A broad, commercial and business-facing Financial Controller opportunity at a diversified financial services boutique with interests across private equity, property and tech.

Owing to growth they’re seeking to appoint a financial controller to oversee the corporate side of their business, which is a complex and eclectic mix of business interests in the above sectors. The company are going through a period of change and this role would suit someone comfortable in a hands-on role with far reaching responsibilities, with longer term potential to evolve into a more senior position.

 

Day to day you’ll be responsible for all accounting, reporting and analysis for a large collection of businesses that the fund invests into or owns outright, from start-ups through to more established SME companies operating in a myriad of sectors. There are a couple of junior accountants in the team who cover all transactional work, book keeping, month end etc with this role focused on the review, consolidation and oversight for all deliverables; you’re the face of the business so to speak and would be the main point of contact for the business and front office, as well as external parties. We need someone smart, switched on, keen to shake things up and with a positive mindset. They key thing to mention is that this portfolio consists of lots of moving parts and strong attention to detail is absolutely crucial. On top of the reporting, there would inevitably involvement in lots of ad hoc analysis and supporting the FD on project work.

 

This role would probably suit someone around the 3 to 5 years post qualified mark or similar, looking to move into their first Financial Controller position. A strong academic background is essential in addition to formal accounting qualifications – ACA, ACCA, ACMA, CPA or equivalent. Industry experience is not important although the preference would be for someone who’s worked in a SME organisation in commerce and industry, professional services or financial services. Culture wise the company is incredibly down to earth, sociable and pro-flexible working, with a supportive, collaborative and inclusive environment.

 

Please apply ASAP for immediate consideration with interviews looking to commerce in early April. Salary on offer is £75-85,000 base plus benefits and a healthy discretionary bonus.

Title: Quant Developer - Macro Hedge Fund/Buy Side - (Python/C++)
Description:
A market leading global Hedge Fund are looking to hire a Python/C++ Quant Developer to bolster their buy side operations and redevelop and modernize the full technology stack, encompassing pricing and other analytics, risk management, market data and trade capture and reporting. You will work closely with Traders and Quants to develop a bespoke application suite for Pricing and Risk using modern Python technology and some C++ for the core libraries.

Responsibilities:

  • Working closely with Quants to implement changes in the existing codebase
  • Prototype and explore ideas for new tools and analytics
  • Be part of the team responsible for the major build-out of functionality on the new platform, including but not limited to:
    • Trade modelling and pricing
    • Market data processing
    • Risk reporting (EOD and potentially intraday)
    • Scenario analytics tools

In general, they are looking for smart, commercial, problem-solving-oriented, "get-things-done" candidates with a proven track record of delivering robust, high performance software and quantitative analyses and with either experience in financial markets or a keen interest to learn about them.

Skills and Experience:

Required:

  • Advanced analytical skills (typically evidenced by a degree in maths, physics, computer science, engineering, etc.).
  • A deep passion for technology and software development.
  • Excellence in applied programming skills - Python, C, C++ or other major languages.
  • A team player with excellent communication skills.

Preferred:

  • Demonstrable, applied expertise in creating and validating pricing and/or risk models for use in a financial services organisation.
  • Deep understanding of Fixed Income products and derivatives.
  • A broad understanding of model risk, bringing new approaches and processes.

Title: Finance Director
Description:
High calibre senior finance professional required to head up finance and operations in an exciting, innovative and growing FinTech. Must be independent and hands on in nature to help in the scaling of the business and to contribute to the company's overall strategy and direction.

Our client is an exciting FinTech which aims to transform how we use, spend, save, send and view money in the future. The concept has been proven and the product is now live on a commercially scaleable banking platform with exciting plans for expansion and to grow a world class team.

Accordingly, we are now looking for positive people with integrity, intelligence and a strong work ethic to join and help to deliver this extraordinary vision.

Description

The role requires a strong, independent finance professional who is both good with numbers and understands how to present these into a compelling narrative. We will be looking for this individual to build best practice rigours and to help the business to scale and contribute to the company's overall strategy and direction. Responsibilities will include:

  • Preparing, modelling and presenting financial projections
  • Mapping vision to business plan strategy
  • Establishing plans and metrics to help shape the revenue and pricing strategy
  • Effectively manage cash runway whilst enabling revenue growth
  • Support with various ad hoc reporting and financial analysis
  • Develop effective processes, systems and controls
  • Implement best practice and manage reporting obligations
  • Oversee day to day running of the accounting processes
  • manage key financial reporting (P&L and cash flow)
  • Create, review and finalise monthly MI
  • Ownership of the budgeting and forecasting process and provide actual vs forecast analysis
  • Preparation of KPI's and financial information
  • Point of contact for audit, statutory and regulatory queries
  • Manage supplier relationships and payments management
  • Manage day to day risk and controls and tax schemes
  • Build out and implement business operational processes, systems and functions

The individual will also be responsible for business operational management (IT, facilities, admin) and for managing HR operational processes (recruitment, on/off boarding staff, policies, staff benefits etc)

This is a rapidly growing but small company in which individuals and teams are required to be hands on and to contribute across the wider business.

Profile

Applicants must be highly driven, entrepreneurial and dynamic with a proven track record of helping organisations grow and increase revenue.

Other requirements for this role include:

  • Qualified accountant (ACA, ACCA, CIMA, CPA) with significant post qualification experience
  • Experience in high growth organisations
  • Strong experience of establishing systems and processes to enhance and increase company value and growth
  • Excellent analytical skills and experience of scaling start ups
  • Strong modelling experience
  • Extensive core financial reporting and controls experience
  • Banking or operational risk experience
  • Experience of working in another technology led financial services start up (FinTech) especially in the finance and payments industry

You will be a goal orientated, self motivated, forward thinking finance professional who is ambitious and resourceful with a can-do attitude. You will also be a strong leader and communicator with a credible network and a keen understanding of cutting edge start-ups and investing trends.

Job Offer

In return for all this you can expect an inspiring, collaborative and driven work environment and the following:

  • Competitive salary
  • Opportunity for equity in the company
  • 25 days annual leave
  • Flexible working and a fun, vibrant office environment
  • An increasing list of staff benefits as the company grows and scales
  • Workplace pension scheme
  • Regular socials (subject to Covid guidelines)
  • Opportunities for personal growth, professional development and training

Title: HR Coordinator
Description:
HR Coordinator
Fitch Group is a global leader in financial information services with operations in more than 30 countries. Fitch Group is comprised of: Fitch Ratings, a global leader in credit ratings and research; Fitch Solutions, an industry-leading provider of credit risk products and services; and Fitch Learning, a preeminent training and professional development firm. With dual headquarters in London and New York, Fitch Group is owned by Hearst.

Fitch complies with all laws governing employment in each jurisdiction in which it operates, and provides equal opportunity to all applicants and employees. All applications will be considered without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital or veteran status, sexual orientation, and other status protected by applicable laws.

Department:

The Fitch Group HR Service Centre team provides centralised transactional support across the three Fitch business lines, Fitch Ratings, Fitch Solutions and Fitch Learning and across EMEA, North America and APAC. The key processes managed by the team span the employment life-cycle:
  • Onboarding new hires
  • Probation
  • Transfers
  • Leave of absence
  • Contract changes
  • Monitoring overdue mandatory training
  • Processing leavers

The HR Service Centre comprises eight HR Coordinators situated in three of our key locations: the United Kingdom, the United States and Singapore, reporting to the Global HR Services Manager.

HR Coordinators are part of a global team and have exposure to international processes and clients and, in many cases, are the first HR point of contact for employees. HR Coordinators also work closely with HR Advisors, HR Business Partners and HR COESs e.g. Recruitment and HR Systems.

Through the HR Service Centre, our aim is to provide our HR Coordinators with the structure to develop a career in HR, whether as an HR COE Specialist or HR Advisor. Whilst some HR experience is preferable, we will also consider candidates with a strong customer service background who have a demonstrable interest in a career in HR.

Key responsibilities:

Onboarding
  • Production of new hire offer letters/contracts and tracking return of documents
  • Checking right to work documentation and flagging any concerns or anomalies
  • Creation of new hire records in our HR system Employee Central (Success Factors)
  • Oversight of new hire screening including liaising with our external vendor and investigation and escalation of any red flags
  • Acting as point of contact for new hire queries
  • Ensuring managers and HR Advisors/HR Business Partners are updated in a timely manner about any onboarding delays
  • Tracking of probation completion including advising managers and escalation of issues to the HR Advisor


Contractual changes
  • Includes transfers (international and local), off-cycle salary changes, working pattern changes, fixed-term contract extensions
  • Production of paperwork where required
  • Updating employee records in Employee Central
  • Guiding managers through Employee Central self-service where applicable


Leave of absence
  • Including sick leave, holiday, sabbaticals, family leave and all other adhoc types of leave
  • Production of paperwork where required
  • Advising managers and employees on leave of absence policies and processes


Offboarding
  • Guiding managers through the resignation process and flagging any concerns or exceptions to the HR Advisor
  • Production of leaver paperwork
  • Management of online exit survey and results
  • Updating Employee Central with termination details


Other key responsibilities include but are not limited to:
  • Support HR transformation activities e.g. process redesign, system testing
  • Act as the face of HR
  • Handling employee and manager policy and process queries
  • Creation of and maintenance of electronic employee files
  • Ad hoc project/HR support e.g. for large seasonal HR projects or employee relations issues
  • Post transformation act as SME in one particular process or area of the HR Service Centre work
  • Post transformation management of work in a case management system
  • Adhering to strict data privacy and confidentiality requirements
  • Other responsibilities to be defined through the HR transformation review
  • Liaison and collaboration with HR Advisors and HR COEs (HRIS, HR MIS, Payroll, Recruitment, L&D)


Skills and experience
  • Prior HR administrative or customer service experience in a busy and diverse environment including managing contact with clients (internal or external) in potentially challenging situations
  • Experience of working to deadlines and managing a complex workload, including managing expectations of stakeholders
  • Experience of communicating and working with clients (internal or external) at all levels of seniority
  • Experience of managing data using HR or other data management systems and being responsible for data accuracy
  • Experience of using a case management or CRM system (desirable but not essential)
  • Experience or an appreciation of handling sensitive data and situations
  • Experience of working as part of a team
  • Highly proficient in MS Office
  • Fluency in English
  • Excellent verbal and written communication
  • The ability to read and converse in a second European language would be beneficial, although not a requirement


#LI-DS1

Title: Digital Marketing (Frankfurt)
Description:
Posted by:
Liam McHale
Recruiter
View profile & contact
Our client is a Global Asset Manager who are looking to recruit a Digital Marketing Specialist in their Frankfurt office. This role is a core part of the intent to build a local digital marketing model that complements the existing global model.

Primary Responsbilities

  • Manage digital content and campaigns, and improve digital experiences for the local websites:
  • Prepare content for digital delivery – liaise with stakeholders to understand what content is to be published or optimized for digital delivery
  • Create thinking and campaign pages, integrating data capture forms to support Lead Generation and Inbound Marketing campaigns Development of event landing pages and e-books
  • Post-publish of content – generate, communicate and present informed decisions based on analytics,to improve web presence, traffic and experience. Deliver metrics to measure the success factors and impacts
  • Support and deliver local email marketing campaigns via Adobe Campaign, reporting on the effectiveness and identifying opportunities to drive efficiency
  • Provide consultation on social media strategy, including platforms that are appropriate for country and target audience type
  • Set up social media platform accounts on behalf of the market, develop and post content and monitor engagement, sharing with Marketing, discussing and executing optimization ideas
  • Assist with paid media, including sponsored content on social and paid search
  • Leverage local best practice for MidEurope (Germany, Austria, Switzerland, BeFraLux)

Required Experience

  • Experience in digital marketing 
  • Familiar with CMS systems, preferably AEM
  • Understanding of optimizing website content for SEO
  • Hands-on experience of creating campaigns within marketing automation systems such as Adobe Campaign, Pardot, Marketo, or Eloqua
  • Experience running social media channels
  • Native German Speaker

Title: FI Sales Strat - VP/ED level
Description:
Great opportunity for an experienced an strat/tech (Python/qKDB) profile to lead a growing team and drive the focus and efficiency in Sales across Rates, Credit and FX. This role will be 60% technical/analytical / 40% user facing - lots of stakeholder management / project managing the team. The key is to know market dynamics (risk and pricing) so that you can come up with ideas or build the models to conduct the intelligence work.

FI Sales Strat - VP/ED level

London based

This Fixed Income Strats team is searching for an ED-level project manager who can also be hands on coding in Python and q/KDB to help coordinate various sales technology initiatives. You will be responsible for executing a portfolio of projects that are both strategic and tactical, aiming to increase efficiency and effectiveness of sales teams and their related support functions.

Project areas include (but not limited to):

  • Voice Trading - Analyze and identify opportunities to improve voice trading workflows across all product areas, from pricing, execution, trade booking, axe recycling and post execution processes. Tailor solutions to specific teams/product areas when necessary, while ensuring overall cohesiveness and consistency across all regions.
  • Client Intelligence - Understand how they can improve quality of interaction sales people can have with their clients by providing more value added information to differentiate them from other banks. Thus they design/implement solutions that can help facilitate and improve effectiveness of their client engagements e.g. more efficient communication tools, automated client activity tracking and opportunity alerts, a centralized dashboard showing what clients are doing.
  • Data Quality - Ensure integrity of key business information for sales e.g. revenue, interactions, profitability, execution efficiency, market share, etc. Help design tools that allow efficient data entry and enrichment, coupled with appropriate controls and processes that can certify their accuracy.

Requirements:

You must be able to develop and govern the central book of work for global sales technology that includes detailed business analysis, requirements/specifications, and delivery plan, which must be updated regularly with stakeholders across various sales teams and trading desks. Establish effective relationships with Technology partners, Strats and Ops/support functions to facilitate prioritization and implementation of deliverables. Identify and measure their success criteria via quantifiable metrics such as cost, benefit/opportunity, time-to-market and usage. In addition to these, you must be able to code in Python and q/KDB to facilitate client intelligence initiative more effectively e.g. building necessary data series for the analysis, conducting research and development to build POC or hands on help for add-hock requests by desk.

  • Bachelors or higher university degree, preferably in economics, finance, or related discipline
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Excellent organizational skills
  • Experience running a large scale project as well as coordinating multiple smaller projects simultaneously
  • Working understanding of fixed income products (rates, credit and foreign exchange)
  • Deep understanding on Interest Rates products and business a plus
  • Thorough understanding of front to back business workflow
  • Experience in data science projects a plus
  • Experience in Technology (Python, q/KDB, Angular JS) a plus

Salary: GBP50000 - GBP65000 per annum + Benefits listed in ad
Title: Software Developer - Python - React
Description:
* Be a part of our revolutionary HealthTech Start-up working on a product that is positively impacting lives globally! We are dedicated to transforming the way traditional healthcare is viewed and championing the use of AI and machine learning. * You will have the opportunity to continue to grow, develop and jump up the career ladder as we expand. * This role is FULLY REMOTE, we can pay for shared workspace if you want to get out of the house.

Software Developer - FULLY REMOTE

Software Developer (Python, JavaScript, Dart, React, HealthTech)

Quick Summary:

  • Be a part of our revolutionary HealthTech Start-up (recently recognised as a Global 100 HealthTech business) working on a product that is positively impacting lives globally! We are dedicated to transforming the way traditional healthcare is viewed and championing the use of AI and machine learning.
  • It is an interesting role for someone passionate about technology (we use Python, React, Dart to name a few) and making a difference! You will have the opportunity to continue to grow, develop and jump up the career ladder as we expand.
  • This role is FULLY REMOTE (UK based as cannot offer sponsorship), we can pay for shared workspace if you want to get out of the house, we will also (post-COVID) be organising social meets and see each other on daily standups!

More about us:

  • We are a bleeding-edge HealthTech start-up, recently recognised as a Global 100 HealthTech business, that wants to bring the power of technology into traditional healthcare. Our goal is to provide solutions for our customers that are affordable, accessible and easy to use.
  • Our debut product is revolutionising a key area of the healthcare industry, using AI to mould the product to every user and their needs in a way that they can handle their recovery.
  • Thanks to some significant early business successes, we are seeking to expand our dynamic, proactive workforce with a similarly-minded mission-driven Junior UI Designer who is keen to change the world and make a difference

The Role:

As a Full-Stack Developer (Python, JavaScript, Dart, React, HealthTech) you will be playing a pivotal role in ensuring we deliver on our mission, building user-centric, life-changing applications.

  • We are looking for a seasoned full-stack engineer to build out and manage our entire web infrastructure
  • Implementing pre-approved UI
  • Ensuring the entire stack is designed and built for speed and scalability
  • Design and implementation of continuous integration and deployment
  • Integrating our front-end UI with the constructed API
  • Lead and mentor junior members on the team

Your background:

You will have at least 3 years' experience in the majority of the below:

  • Writing HTML, CSS, JavaScript (up to date - HTML5, CSS3, ECMAScript6)
  • Familiarity with both front and back-end frameworks, ideally React on the front end
  • Experience with a back-end technology, ideally Python but if not, C#, C++ or Dart would be beneficial
  • An appreciation for clean and well-documented code
  • Proficiency with Git or another version control system as required
  • Exposure to GCP (Google Cloud Platform)
  • Database design and management

If you want to be a part of something revolutionary - on your road to a very successful interesting career, please get in touch with me (Emily) on: 0207 780 6700 or click to apply.

Software Developer (Python, JavaScript, Dart, React, HealthTech)

Reference: AMC*EWA*SOF/EQ01

Location: London

Duration: Permanent

Salary: £50,000 - £65,000 + package

Agency: Anson McCade

Contact: Emily Watkins

Software Developer (Python, JavaScript, Dart, React, HealthTech)

Title: Assurance Partner
Description:
Due to a period of continued growth, our client is looking for a partner to join their Assurance Practice and to permanently take up post in Jamaica. A proven senior leader, with strong management skills, this new hire will be duly tasked with leading on audit engagements, and focusing on developing new business for both Jamaica and the wider Caribbean firm.
  • Unique international role for proven assurance senior leader
  • Favourable tax regime, island jurisdiction, enviable work/life balance

About Our Client

Global Professional Services Firm

Responsibilities will include -

  • Management of a portfolio of clients along with a focus on building new client relationships to grow client base of firm
  • Leading the direction, supervision and performance of audits in compliance with professional standards
  • Planning and execution of audits within a determined time frame and with a high level of audit quality and focus on key firm metrics

The Successful Applicant

Based in the Jamaica, the successful Assurance Partner will be a dynamic individual and leader at the apex of the business. The location affords both a one of a kind career opportunity and an enviable work/life balance. More information on housing and relocation is available through our specialist Offshore team. Expertise in a global matrixed environment will be essential to success.

The Assurance Partner will possess:

  • Relevant Professional Qualification and Degree or equivalent track record
  • Clear interest in relocating or continuing residence in Jamaica for the foreseeable.
  • Proven track record in Business Development in an assurance business
  • Excellent planning, time management and organizational skills
  • Strong executive presence and ability to build and sustain client relationships at the highest levels of the firm and with C-suite clients.
  • Proven track record in effective management of a wide range of employees and stakeholders
  • Exceptional communication skills, both verbally and written
  • Ability to think laterally and creatively.

What's on Offer

Competitive Salary + Benefits + Bonus + Equity Buy-In + Relocation

Where specific UK qualifications are required we will take into account overseas equivalents. All third party applications will be forwarded to Michael Page.

Title: Financial Controller
Description:
My client is a specialist investment group, with deep industry expertise and hands-on operating experience, helping mid-sized companies grow to become clear industry leaders.
  • Financial Controller required to join a passionate team in London
  • Expanding specialist investment business with deep industry expertise

About Our Client

  • My client is a specialist investment group, with deep industry expertise and hands-on operating experience, helping mid-sized companies grow to become clear industry leaders.
  • Headquartered in London the team has decades of experience of investing, development and operating expertise across the globe with an enviable track record.
  • The firm focuses on investing and partnering with leading sector management teams to develop and grow unique businesses across North America and Europe.

Job Description

The Financial Controller based in London will have the following duties and responsibilities:

  • With the help of advisers and in collaboration with deal teams, lead finance operations of subsidiaries and portfolio companies - accounting, budgeting, tax affairs, statutory compliance, relevant and cost-effective technology deployment and treasury
  • Analyse financial performance of portfolio companies against key business metrics; monitor on-going deal development; identify and analyse potential improvements and, where relevant, suggest operational improvements (policy, procedures, processes, technology, etc.);
  • Lead on all reporting (monthly KPIs, financial statements, audit, investor reports, etc.) for portfolio companies (in collaboration with CFO of subsidiaries) and for holdings and group subsidiaries
  • Establish, maintain, and implement standardisation in financial reporting, procedures, and policies to ensure robust financial and internal controls exist across the Group
  • Participate in continuous improvement efforts to standardise and automate financial procedures to enhance the operational efficiency of the Group
  • Preparation and analysis of asset valuations
  • Manage extensive list of corporate and indirect tax compliance for variety of jurisdictions as well as maintaining relationships with several service providers to ensure all compliance filings at group level are completed timely
  • Tax structuring of new investments
  • In collaboration with the lead finance partner, for both the existing group companies and for new portfolio companies, set-up of the finance organisation by developing relevant financial processes (month-end closing, budgeting, treasury management, etc.)
  • Ad-hoc analysis as required at portfolio company level

The Successful Applicant

The Financial Controller based in London will have had the following education and experience:

  • Excellent academic records with a degree from a top university, preferably in business / finance / engineering;
  • 3 - 10 years of financial management experience gained in a relevant corporate function or with a Big 4 firm
  • Broad knowledge of finance and accounting and, in particular, IFRS standards
  • Commitment to learning in a changing technology environment
  • Strong problem solving and analytical capabilities with ability to work in multi-currency environment
  • Strong financial modelling skills in Excel and ability to work with BI tools and various accounting systems
  • Excellent project management skills and ability to multi-tasks;
  • Strong interpersonal skills / the ability to work effectively in a multi-cultural environment with other team members, senior management, external advisors, investors, partners, and others;
  • Compelling written and oral communication skills.

What's on Offer

A unique opportunity for a finance professional to join a passionate and high performing team.

Where specific UK qualifications are required we will take into account overseas equivalents. All third party applications will be forwarded to Michael Page.

Title: Investment Director
Description:
Posted by:
Khuram Bajwa
Recruiter
View profile & contact
A fantastic opportunity to join a boutique Private Equity firm as they embark on a period of growth. We are keen to identify an Investment Director to join the firm and take on responsibilities across the entire deal cycle. This is an incredible opportunity to join a progressive and forward-thinking firm with a strong cultural ethos of embracing different cultures and truly vauing its people.

Our client seeks an experienced investment professional to work within a small, dynamic team in Central London. The successful candidate will have proven Director-level qualifications and be a self-starter, have excellent quantitative, modelling, communication and organisational skills, and be presentable and able to effectively liaise with market intermediaries, institutional investors, management teams and sponsors. This senior executive will be responsible for building on the Firm’s existing capabilities, including general market research, deal sourcing and execution, and portfolio management. Reporting to the Managing Partners, the successful candidate will have strong technical capabilities, knowledge and must possess the ability to grow the firm's investing capabilities and capacity in a proactive and comprehensive manner. The successful candidate must be able to demonstrate an understanding of and an ability to adhere to the company's stated principles of responsible investing.

Candidate profile:

• Self-motivated, analytical and enthusiastic team player with the ability to work on multiple tasks within tight deadlines

• Strong desire and ability to manage all stages of the investment process and to craft creative, workable solutions for various types of opportunities

• A minimum of ten years’ experience in a transaction-orientated capacity

• Demonstrable experience living and/or working in multicultural environments, including language skills

Role:

• Investment:

o Originate relevant secondary investment opportunities, with a particular focus on direct and structured transactions

o Lead due diligence processes, working in conjunction with the investment team

o Monitor investments in our portfolios, including holding board and or observer board seats when appropriate

o Take responsibility for the exit process

• Marketing / Investor Relations:

o Represent the firm at conferences and other industry events

o Contribute to the production of quarterly and annual reports to investors, and other investor related material

• Research:

o Proactively manage the Firm’s analysis and research of various geographies and sectors, together with other members of the investment team

o Participate in the production of the firm’s regular research reports

Candidates should have at least ten years’ relevant experience in the financial services sector, ideally in a Private Equity, corporate finance or M&A environment. MBA qualifications are not essential but highly desirable. Fluency in at least one European language other than English is a must.

Title: Financial Accountant - 12 Month FTC - Insurance
Description:
Posted by:
Dominic Mabbs
Recruiter
View profile & contact
A leading Insurance firm, based in the City of London, requires a Group Financial Accountant to join their them on an initial 12 Month Fixed Term Contract. This is a great opportunity to gain a broad range of experience across Finance, working closely with the Financial Controller. You will also get the opportunity to be involved with high profile projects.

 

Key Duties:

 

  • Preparation of monthly management accounts and reports to senior stakeholders
  • Review of balance sheet accounts, accruals and prepayments as part of the month end close process
  • Support preparation of quarterly board report
  • Preparation of statutory accounts under IFRS
  • Responsible for preparation of monthly MI packs
  • Support to the Head of Finance as necessary
  • Ad hoc projects and requests from Directors
  • Preparation of statutory accounts under IFRS

 

Qualifications & Expertise:

 

  • Qualified Accountant, or Part Qualified Finalist (ACA, ACCA or CiMA)
  • Ability to produce high quality work within agreed deadlines
  • Communicates in a clear and practical manner, both verbally and in writing
  • Experience within the Insurance industry and IFRS essential

Title: Data Engineer - Quantitative Finance
Description:
Data Engineer - Quantitative Finance
At Bloomberg, our products are fueled by powerful information. We combine data and context to paint the whole picture for our clients, around the clock - from around the world. In Global Data, we're responsible for delivering this data, news and analytics through innovative technology - quickly and accurately.

Our goal is to innovate, redefine, and break boundaries in expanding our modern data business. In Global Data's Technical Operations, our focus is how data is acquired, processed, validated and stored. Working across industries and asset classes, we draw on expertise from all backgrounds to identify the most impactful insights. Our work leads directly to client satisfaction, which contributes to Bloomberg's profitability and ability to keep innovating.

Our Team:
The Bloomberg Intelligence (BI) Data Engineering team is responsible for building the systems that support the creation of critical research to support client investment decision making.  Our team works closely with the BI team to execute on BI strategy that supports client and business needs. Our team builds scalable and configurable solutions to meet these needs across multiple product areas. We see the impact of our work every day, whether it's pipelining unique and primary data sets that translate to market-moving insights, or finding signals in market data and applying quantitative methods in models that will drive financial research. 

We'll trust you to:
  • Apply your coding skills: automate the influx of data and build flexible solutions for ETL and machine learning pipelines, and data visualization to support product needs
  • Inspire and impact our business: act as an internal consultant to influence and implement more efficient products through analysis, dashboards, web apps, and user documentation
  • Collaborate across teams: gather requirements across teams, synthesize into generic solutions, and serve in project management capacities to drive initiative to the finish line
  • Champion improvements: identify strategic technical gaps in our ecosystem and advocate for solutions over workarounds
  • Grow our business: approach each day knowing this role is critical to the success of the firm. We will rely on your expertise, and our flat structure allows for you to make measurable impact

You'll need to have:
  • 2+ years of professional work experience in software development, data engineering, data science or information technology
  • Strong financial market knowledge, including knowledge of accounting principles, interpreting financial statements, and exposure to quantitative financial analysis
  • 2+ years of Python programming and scripting in a production environment
  • Demonstrated proficiency using data and statistical modeling and machine learning methods to solve real world problems
  • Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills

Does this sound like you?
Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are.

Bloomberg is committed to diversity. It drives our innovation. At Bloomberg, you'll have the opportunity to go above and beyond and to take risks. You'll be a part of an organization that is entering new markets, launching new ventures, and pushing boundaries. Our ever-expanding array of technology, data, news, and media services champions innovation and empowers clients -- and offers nearly limitless opportunities for career growth.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We bring out the best in each other.

Title: EMEA PORT Enterprise Operations and Managed Services Team Leader
Description:
EMEA PORT Enterprise Operations and Managed Services Team Leader
The Team
The Buy-Side Enterprise Support Group within Analytics is a global team of experienced subject matter experts focused on delivering a premium level of service to Bloomberg largest, most strategic, Buyside Customers that rely on AIM and PORT Enterprise to run their investment decision making and execution workflows.

The Role
The PORT Enterprise Operations and Managed Services Team Leader will report directly into the Global Buyside Enterprise Support Manager. The role involves leading the team in the region to deliver an excellent level of service to Bloomberg customers that subscribe to PORT Enterprise, our enterprise portfolio risk and analytics product.

This is a client-facing role that requires experience in engaging with senior stakeholders at Buyside clients including c-suite, heads of operations, risk management, performance reporting and associated technology and business managers. The TL in this role will work closely with our Sales and Implementation division to support the growth in our PORT Enterprise franchise.

Additionally, the role involves working together with the Buyside Product and Engineering teams to design, build and launching of Bloomberg Data Validation managed services product. The team leader working in this role must think strategically and exhibit strong problem solving, complimented with exceptional communication to collaborate effectively with our Product and Engineering teams and ensure the success of this initiative.

Finally, The TL will be a subject matter expert in PORT Enterprise functionality in order to take ownership and manage critical operational changes, roll outs, and incident management as part of ensuring the effective running of our PORT Enterprise production environment.

Key Activities
  • Attract and develop a diverse and specialized team and maintain a high performance culture.
  • Manage the day-to-day operations and service delivery to strategic clients.
  • Provide product and industry expertise to team member, internal stakeholders and clients.
  • Work closely with broader global team to ensure unified processes exists across all regions.
  • Identify systemic issues, escalate appropriately by representing client impact internally.
  • Communicate effectively and in a timely manner to both clients and key internal stakeholders.
  • Collaborate extensively with Product, Sales and Engineering teams to improve our client's experience and develop new product offerings and services.
  • Be a decision maker for all data-quality check breaks and make a go/no-go decision regarding whether the nightly batch process can begin.

Requirements for the role:
  • Strong understanding of Fixed Income or Equity Markets with expertise in Portfolio Attribution and Risk analysis.
  • Ability to manage an experienced group of client facing subject matter experts.
  • Deep understanding of the enterprise workflows of Buyside Financial Institutions used by portfolio managers, risk and attribution specialists.
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.
  • Exceptional analytics and problem-solving skills; strong relationship management skills; results driven.
  • Demonstrated track record of managing key client relationships, particularly Tier 1 asset managers.
  • The ambition to take ownership and responsibility of issues and handle them effectively through to resolution.
  • The ability to effectively communicate technical/complex issues in a concise and simple manner to various audiences.
  • Proven experience working in a flexible, fast-paced environment. Ability to manage multiple priorities and multiple small projects simultaneously.

Title: Senior Full Stack Engineer - Instant Bloomberg
Description:
Senior Full Stack Engineer - Instant Bloomberg
Bloomberg data moves global financial markets - but only when people can converse about it. The Communication Channels Applications team is responsible for building and maintaining the tools that connect Bloomberg's network of 350,000 financial professionals. Our applications seamlessly link the myriad of financial and data applications on the Bloomberg Professional Service, making us crucial to the company's success.

Instant Bloomberg (IB) is Bloomberg's instant messaging system, which is used by the Bloomberg community for real-time communication including exchanging quotes, trade confirmations, breaking news alerts and help desk inquiries. On a daily basis, we're tasked with selecting and implementing the best solutions to support our clients' workflows across geographic location and asset classes. We have a user-base unlike any other in the company and deliver billions of post events per day.

As a full-stack engineer on our IB Application team, we'll trust you to:
  • Develop, own and maintain client facing features to cater for the growing demands of our clients, using both Javascript and C++
  • Learn new technologies while mentoring and being mentored by colleagues with different experience and seniority.
  • Collaborate closely with our UX and business stakeholders to seek requirements and implement extensible solutions 

You'll need to have:
  • Extensive experience with software development, object-oriented design, data structures and algorithms
  • Strong knowledge of either JavaScript and desire to learn new technologies
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills
  • A passion for testing, rapid delivery and continuous integration

We'd love to see:
  • Enthusiasm for full-stack debugging and analytical problem solving
  • Experience designing real-time distributed systems
  • Experience with C++
  • Contributions to OSS
  • Experience with Agile software development

You will use:
  • Javascript, TypeScript, C++
  • Git, Jenkins, Github, JIRA
  • Agile methodologies, Scrum

Interview process:
We believe interviewing is a two way street. It's a way for us to get to know you and your skills, and also a way for you to learn more about the team, our technical challenges, and what you'd be working on. The content of each interview round will be tailored to the role and your background, but the general framework can be found here: https://www.bloomberg.com/careers/technology/engineering/software-engineering-experienced-hire/
We want to ensure you can put your best foot forward throughout the process, so if you have any questions or need any accommodations to be successful, please let us know.

If this sounds like you, apply!
And do check out our blog, TechAtBloomberg.com/ to learn more.

Bloomberg is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We have a lot of opportunities to choose from in Engineering, and it is important to us that your skills and experience align best with the team you are interviewing with. To help ensure you are placed on the right team, your application will be considered for all of our current vacancies in Engineering at the first stage of the interview process.

Title: Portfolio Analytics Sales Representative
Description:
Portfolio Analytics Sales Representative
Portfolio Sales team members sell and implement state-of-the-art enterprise level Portfolio and Risk Analytics Solutions to the world's top institutional buyside firms.

Our Portfolio & Risk Analytics solutions help financial professionals achieve their objectives by providing unmatched transparency into their portfolio's performance, characteristics and risk. From one location, a series of powerful, integrated multi-asset tools deliver consistent insight, enabling our clients to create and execute differentiating investment strategies.

What's the role?
Portfolio Analytics sales representatives are experts in advanced portfolio management theory and buyside client workflow. They have a strong financial background and deep understanding of fundamental portfolio management concepts such as performance attribution, multi factor risk models and portfolio optimization. With a consultative approach, you will identify our clients' needs and demonstrate how Bloomberg's portfolio analytics and indices will help them make the best investment and trading decisions.

We'll trust you to:
  • Build senior level relationships with many of the top institutional investment firms in Northern Europe
  • Increase client usage and adoption of our Portfolio and Risk Analytics Solution and Bloomberg Barclays Indices
  • Collaborate extensively with different internal teams to cross-sell our suite of solutions
  • Upsell our desktop Portfolio and Risk Analytics at the Enterprise level
  • Provide detailed product feedback from clients to internal business managers in an effort to continually improve our products
  • Take a lead role in conducting internal and external training sessions and sales pitches
  • Travel extensively to meet with clients and prospects

You'll need to have:
  • An astute commercial mind-set, working to exceed sales revenue target and other sales metrics
  • Demonstrable ability to identify new prospects and build and maintain solid client relationships
  • Solid experience working in, or selling to the buy-side i.e. pension funds, investment advisors or mutual funds, or alternatively, experience in financial engineering/structuring
  • Fixed Income market experience and knowledge
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Aptitude to excel in a dynamic, rapidly growing environment
  • Ability to creatively market our product to a vast demographic of potential clients
  • A self-starter and dedicated collaborator with strong multi-tasking skills

If this sounds like you:
Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch with you to let you know the next steps but in the meantime feel free to browse this: https://www.bloomberg.com/professional/portfolio-risk-analytics/

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Corporate Systems Security Analyst
Description:
Corporate Systems Security Analyst
About Bloomberg Corporate Technology:
The Global Corporate Technology Group is responsible for designing, deploying, and supporting Bloomberg's internal IT systems. This includes our global corporate network plus all hardware, software and the enterprise applications used by nearly 21,000 employees in more than 170 state of the art offices around the world. Corporate Technology is a world-class global team of Engineers, Architects, and Administrators.  We focus on developing enterprise on premise and cloud based solutions, productivity tools, and IT systems integration.  Corporate Technology helps evolve the employee experience and keeps Bloomberg's business moving forward.

The Role:
Corporate Systems Security Analysts are responsible for securing our corporate desktops, servers, storage systems and enterprise and SaaS based applications. We are an agile team, which focuses solely on improving and maintaining the security posture of our organization. We work closely with other Security teams within the organization to accomplish these goals. Daily responsibilities can include reviewing and responding to security related events and requests, evaluating processes, and determining appropriate end-users access controls. Our main objective is to be a strategic business partner enabling employees to seamlessly perform their roles effectively while still maintaining and adhering to Bloomberg's rigorous security standards.
 
You will need to have:

  • 3+ years* of experience in comparable role
  • Proficiency with Windows Operating System and Active Directory
  • Proficiency creating and deploying Microsoft Group Policy Objects
  • Proficiency in at least one scripting language such as Powershell or Python
  • Experience providing technical guidance for the operation of endpoint protection tools, i.e. McAfee, MS Defender
  • Proven initiative in further growing knowledge in security space
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills and the ability to take initiative
  • Dedication and ability to collaborate with team members
  • Experience providing superb customer service
    • *Please note we use years of experience as a guide but we certainly will consider applications from all candidates who are able to demonstrate the skills necessary for the role.

We would love to see:
 
  • Experience implementing security controls for server and desktop tools in an enterprise environment
  • Experience with log aggregation tools like Splunk and Humio
  • Experience working within an Agile framework
  • Working knowledge of security controls for SaaS offerings such as M365 and GSuite and IaaS offerings such as AWS, GCP, and Azure.
  • Working knowledge of utilizing and applying controls with Active Directory Group Policies, MS Intune and JAMF

If this sounds like you:
Apply if you think we're a good match! We'll get in touch with you to let you know what the next steps are.
Bloomberg is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Senior Market Strategist
Description:
Senior Market Strategist
Bloomberg runs on data. In our Global Data business, we're responsible for supplying it. The Content Acquisition & Business Management (CABM) department is responsible for managing, acquiring and integrating content and data from Exchanges, Brokers, Sell-side and other types of providers to drive the value of the Bloomberg Terminal and downstream products!

What's the role:
We have an exciting opportunity for a highly motivated individual to join our team as a Senior Market Strategist! You are an experienced market professional who has an extensive network of contacts across the financial community. We are dedicated to building C-suite relationships with the pillars of the financial community, namely exchanges, clearing houses and regulators. In addition, we are responsible for building relationships, both internally and externally, to seek out and devise solutions to meet clients' needs. This requires a comprehensive understanding of all asset classes, to discover new opportunities for Bloomberg's wide range of products. Lastly, Senior Market Strategists collaborate with global counterparts and Exchange Business Managers to inform Bloomberg's overall business strategy that drives commercial results, as well as technical and operational excellence.

We'll trust you to:
  • Build and maintain strategic relationships with Exchanges, Regulators and Market Structure teams within the investment arena
  • Drive product strategy and development while ensuring the delivery of data, technology and governance for clients
  • Drive overall business strategy as it relates to local market structure including regulatory, technological and competitive trends
  • Build trusted and collaborative relationships with key partners across Bloomberg including but not limited to Enterprise, Product and Trading systems
  • Use broad industry knowledge and network to act as an escalation point and face off to key stakeholders and C-Suite at the Exchanges
  • Understand the full Bloomberg enterprise, as well as front to back office client landscape, and use this knowledge to build scalable solutions
  • Have a deep understanding of financial market structure and competitive landscape to help drive strategic vision

You'll need to have:
  • Extensive knowledge of Financial Markets Structure across all asset classes
  • 10+ years of experience* in client and market facing roles in the trading and market data industry
  • Solid understanding of market macro and micro structure and relevant regulations affecting capital markets
  • Knowledge of the asset class workflows across market participants and trading platforms
  • Experience dealing with senior executives across Exchanges and regulatory agencies
  • Deep expertise in financial data and in the associated technology which is crafting the future of our business
  • Excellent understanding of the commercial landscape in which Bloomberg operates, along with extensive knowledge of financial products and the ways in which our clients consume data
  • A proven ability to establish strong credibility and build influential relationships with multiple internal and external clients and stakeholders
    • *Please note we use years of experience as a guide but we certainly will consider applications from all candidates who are able to demonstrate the skills necessary for the role.

Does this sound like you?
Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are.
Bloomberg is committed to diversity. It drives our innovation. At Bloomberg, you'll have the opportunity to go above and beyond and to take risks. You'll be a part of an organization that is entering new markets, launching new ventures, and pushing boundaries. Our ever-expanding array of technology, data, news, and media services champions innovation and empowers clients -- and offers nearly limitless opportunities for career growth.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We bring out the best in each other.
