Title: 2021 Equity Fundamentals Data Analyst - Danish, Hebrew, Polish, Portuguese or Turkish Speaker
Description:
2021 Equity Fundamentals Data Analyst - Danish, Hebrew, Polish, Portuguese or Turkish Speaker
Bloomberg runs on data, and data drives the market. Our Global Data team acquires and supplies this data to our clients. Teams work collaboratively to collect, analyse, process and publish the data which is the backbone of our iconic Bloomberg Terminal - the data ultimately feeding and moving the financial markets.      

In Global Data, you will apply your problem-solving skills to identify innovative workflow efficiencies, implement technical solutions to enhance our systems, products and processes, establish links with key players in the financial market by providing exceptional client support, and manage the financial data that feeds the Bloomberg Terminal.

The Role:
Data Analysts possess a unique combination of technical skills and business insight, as well as strong communication and ability to build relationships. They use these skills to collaborate with a variety of stakeholders to provide timely, accurate, and comprehensive data to our clients. They also play a key role in evolving our products and processes, which makes the role challenging and entrepreneurial. The Equity Fundamentals Data Analyst will sit specifically within our Equity teams.

We'll trust you to:
  • Utilise a variety of software solutions to extract and rationalise data to Bloomberg taxonomies
  • Analyse internal processes to identify opportunities for improvement, as well as devise and implement innovative solutions
  • Implement business rules for programmatic data validation by codifying market conventions and/or data relationships
  • Design and manage workflow configurations for critical functions such as acquisition, worklist management, and quality control
  • Contribute to continuous improvement by generating ideas to improve our data products and/or associated processes and building prototypes to validate and illustrate requirements
  • Lead ad hoc projects to optimize processes and/or improve the quality of the data set         
  • Utilise statistics and data visualization skills to report on results of on-going operations and projects, as required           
  • Build subject matter expertise and technical skills to generate premium content, including data-driven news stories
  • Partner with a wide variety of stakeholders from Engineering to Sales on product development
  • Provide in-depth customer support for users of Bloomberg products such as the Professional Service, News, Enterprise Solutions, and Bloomberg - Law by resolving inquiries in a timely manner

You'll need to have:
  • A degree background in Accounting or Finance or a STEM degree background with a passion for finance
  • Strong passion for data, technology and finance
  • Demonstrated project or work experience using one more programming language such as Python, SQL and R
  • Fluency in English and either Danish, Hebrew, Polish, Portuguese or Turkish
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Understanding and experience of statistics and data modeling
  • Solid attention to detail and strong evidence of decision-making and problem solving skills
  • Eagerness to learn and collaborate
  • Stakeholder-focused mind-set
  • Ability to remain calm under pressure in a frequently changing environment
  • Availability to start by June 2021

We'd love to see:
  • Prior work experience in information technology, engineering, finance, data analysis or research
  • Exposure to Bloomberg products such as the Professional Service
  • Established presence in virtual development communities such as GitHub, Stack Overflow and HackerRank
  • Familiarity with Data Science and/or Machine Learning
  • Experience using data visualization tools such as Tableau or QlikSense

Does this sound like you?
Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are! Please note this is a two stage application process, following the submission of your candidate details you will receive an email with directions to complete an online assessment. Your application will not be complete until you have submitted the assessment.

In the meantime feel free to have a look at this: https://www.bloomberg.com/careers/global-data/

Title: Index Data Quality Analyst
Description:
Index Data Quality Analyst
Bloomberg is a leading provider of financial benchmarks and custom index services.  This includes investment and market analysis of both alpha and beta sources, portfolio benchmarking and performance measurement, asset allocation, and the creation of index tracking funds and index-based structured products.
Our beta/benchmark platform, Bloomberg Index Services Ltd (BISL) is the leading provider of fixed income, inflation-linked, and swaps indices offering unmatched market coverage and a full suite of customized client solutions for benchmarking and informational needs! The BISL platform also includes a diverse family of alpha generating strategy indices that offer quick and easy access to outperformance sources and a quantitative way to express investment strategies, in markets that would otherwise be difficult to access. Index products are available across multiple asset classes including equities, fixed income, FX, commodities, derivatives, and alternative investments.

What is the role?
You will be responsible for managing all aspects of the daily production processes of the various BISL index families within the EMEA region. Reporting to the EMEA/APAC Index Production TL, you will ensure that index data is calculated and published accurately and on time every day. You will work with the Client Index Services teams to ensure client needs are met in an efficient and timely manner. You will work with the Change Management and Engineering teams to design and build the tools and technology required for the aforesaid tasks. 

We'll trust you to:
 
  • Run daily production tasks, responding to events raised in the index monitoring console
  • Become a subject matter expert in multiple asset classes, related data and indices (global equities, commodities, currencies, etc.)
  • Perform index rebalance evaluations, including analysis of membership inclusions and omissions
  • Work with both our clients and internal partners in response to index data related queries
  • Work closely with the Index Production Change Management and Client Services teams, and the Engineering team, to develop work flows, quality assurance processes and product improvements

You will be expected to:
  • Have strong data and quantitative analysis skills
  • Have Strong operational and process management skills
  • Be able to analyze a problem on the fly, in real time, with limited information, and determine a valid and helpful course of action
  • Be able to identify and communicate the key points of information to partners and stakeholders-clearly, completely, and concisely-under pressure
  • Be able to quickly understand and learn the Benchmark and Strategy Index businesses, and their role within the capital markets
  • Be enthusiastic about learning complex business and technology processes and actively contributing to their evolution
  • Be self-motivated, with the ability to work independently as well as part of a team
  • Be able to interact and communicate effectively with our clients
  • Have excellent attention to detail
  • Be dedicated to quality

You'll need to have:
  • Excellent problem solving and communications skills
  • Knowledge of financial markets and products

We'd love to see:
  • Technology skills (Python & SQL)
  • Eagerness to learn and work in a challenging, complex, dynamic, high pressure environment

If this sounds like you:
Apply if you think we're a good match! We'll get in touch with you to let you know what the next steps are.

Title: Senior Product Manager - Enterprise Quant Platform
Description:
Senior Product Manager - Enterprise Quant Platform
The Business and Team
BQuant is Bloomberg's brand new cloud-hosted, multi-asset class quantitative investment research platform designed specifically for financial markets. We are looking for an experienced professional from a quantitative investment research background to come and join our team and help us create the industry best solution.

This is a unique opportunity to join a cross-functional team with Product, Engineering, Quant, CTO, and Client teams on a high profile project. The team is global, located in London, NY and San Francisco. We are expanding the team, along with similar hiring in our Engineering department, to accelerate the range of products and use cases we support.

Your Role
You will be responsible for identifying target markets, challenges worth solving, and how to solve them, as well as executing upon that strategy. Examples of areas you could be working on include:

  • > Alpha research. This could involve working with Eng and Quants to drive the data requirements and create the API-based products to help our customers identify trading signals by leveraging feature engineering, signal combination and time series models at scale.
  • > Risk and Post-Trade analysis. This could involve working with our enterprise product teams (OMS, PMS) on integration of services and creating models and workflows that are geared to improving efficiencies and execution.
  • > Platform. This could involve working with Eng, ML teams to define and build workflows for enterprise integration and features such as ML, data pipelines and governance.

 
We'll trust you to

  • Help formulate the vision for advanced analytics workflows in our quant platform
  • Act as a thought leader within the company
  • Collaborate with machine learning scientists, engineers and architects to translate business problems into quantitative and machine learning based solutions
  • Own the roadmap and backlog, taking into account customer input, product strategy, value propositions, competitor analysis and internal operational requirements
  • Work with Marketing and Sales to help explain and promote our product to clients
  • Come up with metrics to measure business impact and success
  • Perform market analysis of trends that could impact strategy, roadmap, or positioning
  • Lead the design of models to help our customers solve challenges in alpha research, risk or trading
  • Play an active role in the delivery of analytics products from hypothesis to experiment design and results analysis to help inform the platform features and products you develop

 
You'll need to have:

  • Extensive experience (5 yrs+) leading successful strategies to create data pipelines, analytics and models within a leading financial institution or service provider.
  • The ability to effectively coordinate and work with Engineers, UX, Data Scientists, Product Managers and Executive level
  • Deep practical knowledge of customer challenges, use cases and systems-thinking spanning the workflow from research, portfolio construction to implementation, including security and governance.
  • Extensive experience working with others to apply big data processing, advanced analytics and ML concepts to solve problems in research, risk, or trading.
  • The ability to gather and prioritise business requirements and translate these into user stories and an actionable backlog
  • Technical fluency and experience evaluating trade-offs in design with Engineering
  • Problem solving mindset, doing what it takes to solve the problem for the customer
  • Excellent communication skills (documents, presentations, verbal) to both technical and executive audiences

We would love to see:
  • An advanced degree Masters/PhD in a STEM subject or Economics/Finance
  • Prior experience building quantitative products at a Tier 1 buy or sell side firm
  • Strong technical understanding of the tech stack (cloud/enterprise infrastructure, Ops, ML, open source)
  • Experience with the management and usage of multi-asset, alternative and proprietary data in finance
  • Demonstrable knowledge of use cases across buy and sell side, asset classes, and different trading strategies

 
Bloomberg is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status

Title: Senior Financial Data Quality Specialist
Description:
Senior Financial Data Quality Specialist
We're Bloomberg Enterprise Data - fast paced, innovative and expanding. We have worked hard and smart to become the $1bn business we are today. We partner closely with our clients, taking time to understand their unique businesses and individual data and technology needs. Our endless selection of datasets, covering all asset types, with multiple delivery technologies and flexible scheduling mean our clients are able to get exactly the data they need, when they need it, in the format they prefer. Without us, they simply can't operate.

In this role you, will be working with the Bloomberg Enterprise Data - Data Quality team. We perform an essential function at Bloomberg, by making sure that Bloomberg has the highest quality, fit for purpose, financial data in the world. This role requires a passion for financial data and financial instruments. Our approach to data quality involves writing accurate definitions for securities in different asset classes, and applying those definitions across massive amounts of data on a daily basis. We are constantly writing new definitions, revising definitions, and working with our Global Data teams to correct any inaccurate data. We check data both for correct values and for machine readability.
Ideally, you are familiar with Linked Data, RDF data, SHACL, and SPARQL.  You have experience using technology to help you solve problems and create working prototypes, such as jupyter notebooks.  You are familiar with ISO 20022. You have your own worldview of financial instruments across asset classes and are comfortable writing exact definitions in a constraint language like SHACL, which can be applied to data.

We'll trust you to:
  • Operate in an influential business role
  • Write financial definitions that can be used for data quality
  • Apply data quality definitions to vast amounts of data
  • Work in jupyter notebooks (python) and test new data quality rules
  • Analyze data quality test results
  • Grow your business and technology skills
  • Evaluate what is possible and viable
  • Work with Engineering and other global teams

You should have:
  • Extensive experience with financial data
  • Familiar with using large structured data models and datasets to solve problems
  • Experience with and/or a desire to work with: Linked Data, Semantic Web, RDF, RDFS, OWL, SHACL, RDFa, Graph Data, Knowledge Graph, and Knowledge representation and reasoning
  • Experience with tools to handle large diverse data sets
  • Knowledge of large structured data models
  • The ability to address multiple priorities in an extremely fast-paced environment

If this sounds like you:
Apply if you think we're a good match! We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this:
https://www.bloomberg.com/professional/solution/data-and-content

Title: Product Manager - Company Financials
Description:
Product Manager - Company Financials
The Company Financials product team at Bloomberg designs and builds company analysis tools for the Bloomberg Terminal, API and Enterprise. This includes marquee applications on Bloomberg such as: Financial Analysis (FA) Analyst Recommendations (ANR) Estimates (EEO) and Models (MODL), and all company financials data which feeds downstream into other applications. We are expanding the team, along with similar hiring in our Engineering and Data Operations departments, to ensure we provide best of breed solutions to clients.

The team structure itself around solving client problems. Most of which require tracking the evolution of a data point from data processing, to database and data taxonomy, to API syntax design, to front-end applications as we bring a product to market. Given the range of skills needed a willingness to learn and work as a team player is essential, as are excellent communication skills.

You would be responsible for understanding our target clients and under served needs, and then designing, prioritising and executing a strategy all the way to taking it to market and measuring efficacy. Examples of areas you could be working on include:

  • Providing clients with a robust company financial estimates. This could involve liaising with brokers for contributions, consolidation of technology stacks for estimates processing, modelling support for point-in-time consensus, and looking at strategies to increase precision and recall of data extraction from models.
  • Allowing clients to easily discover relevant content for company analysis. This could involve: improving our company financials taxonomy and field search tools, alerting, and building a knowledge graph linking company financial data to relevant alt data sets.
  • Providing clients with comprehensive company financial data. This could involve: as-reported data integration, expanding our guidance offering, and building rules for derivation/standardisation of company financials data.

We'll trust you to:
  • Maintain and evolve a business plan for the Company Financials products
  • Partner with Engineering and Data operations to ensure deliverables are well understood, and align with the overall business goals
  • Work with Marketing and Sales to promote our product to clients
  • Come up with metrics to measure business impact and success
  • Keep abreast of the competitive environment and client trends

You'll need to have:
  • Demonstrable skills in designing systems for data processing, data modelling or APIs.
  • Technical fluency- being comfortable discussing technical concepts and experience evaluating trade-offs in design with Engineering
  • Knowledge of how company financials data is used by different financial market players (especially Portfolio Managers and Analysts)

We would love to see:
  • Extensive Product Manager experience bringing complex products to market
  • Experience using a Scrum Agile process
  • A degree/masters/PhD in a STEM subject or Economics/Finance
  • Experience working with Software as a Service (SAAS)

If this sounds like you:
Apply if you think we're a good match and we'll get in touch with you to let you know next steps. In the meantime, check out http://www.bloomberg.com/professional .

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Specialist Risk Sales Representative - Sell Side
Description:
Specialist Risk Sales Representative - Sell Side
Bloomberg's Multi-Asset Risk System (MARS) and derivatives data and valuation services (BVAL OTC) offers a comprehensive suite of risk management tools that delivers consistent, consolidated results across our clients entire firm. MARS is powered by Bloomberg's world-class pricing library, market data and mortgage cash flow engine, and together with BVAL OTC enables front office, risk, middle office, collateral managers and other financial professionals to analyze their trading and investment portfolios, manage and mitigate their exposure and ready themselves for any turn of events.

What's the role?
The Risk Sales Executive is responsible for managing the sales process for Bloomberg's MARS and derivatives data and valuation (BVAL OTC) solutions to sell-side clients ranging from small regional organisations to large global banks.
As a key member of the team, you will be responsible for generating and converting a pipeline of these products to sellside clients in the region, marketing the products internally within Bloomberg, building key relationships with decision makers and providing actionable feedback to management.

We will trust you to:
  • Utilize your strong product knowledge, technical skills, and market knowledge to generate revenue for Enterprise Businesses & all of Bloomberg's solutions.
  • Manage an enterprise sales engagements with multiple stakeholders, and long term requirements.
  • Articulate the features and benefits of Bloomberg enterprise level products in great detail, so that you can act as a partner for your customers.
  • Develop an in-depth knowledge of what your customers do so that you can position our products to them at multiple phases of an engagement to multiple stakeholders.
  • Contribute innovative ideas that anticipate and address client needs
  • Collaborate internally to implement and execute value-added solution
  • Participate actively in new projects that drive departmental and firm-wide initiatives and goals
  • Seek out additional ways to make an impact, such as mentoring, involvement in training, running campaigns, and active involvement in product enhancement

You'll need to have:
  • You should have excellent sales skills to uncover issues, position solutions and manage a diverse pipeline of opportunities
  • Recent experience of selling derivative risk solutions, either with a vendor or as a market practitioner
    • -- Excellent communication skills
  • -Exemplary presentation, training and communication skills in English
  • The ability for regular travel

We'd love to see:
  • Fluency in one or more other relevant regional language

If this sounds like you;
Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this: https://www.bloomberg.com/professional/product/multi-asset-risk-system/
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Data Analyst - Fundamentals Taxonomy
Description:
Data Analyst - Fundamentals Taxonomy
Bloomberg runs on data, and data drives the market. Our Global Data team acquires and supplies this data to our clients. Teams work collaboratively to collect, analyse, process and publish the data which is the backbone of our iconic Bloomberg Terminal - that ultimately feeds and moves global financial markets.

The Role:
As a Bloomberg Data Analyst, your focus will be on fundamental data taxonomy and you will play a critical role in extracting and rationalising company financial metadata into Bloomberg taxonomies.  A key objective will be supporting taxonomy policy implementation and delivering on key business as a data steward within the broader fundamentals team.
In your role you will be responsible for governance of critical data elements and their associated meta-data, as well as setting, maintaining and optimising the operational procedures governing this metadata. This input will include standards, guidelines and policies for critical data elements as well as the responsibility for supporting the global taxonomy team on key initiatives and identifying trends in financial reporting globally.
You will be expected to identify, implement and socialise improvements in operational procedures and workflows globally, using your subject matter expertise to support the team.
As a data steward within the taxonomy team, we will look to you to provide support for internal and external clients as well as to collaborate with multiple business partners, making the role diverse and providing an opportunity for continuous learning.

We'll trust you to:
  • Develop, maintain and support meta-data management policies and procedures such as field relationships, and apply these policies retrospectively within the Bloomberg taxonomy environment;
  • Extract and rationalise data to Bloomberg taxonomies in accordance with established methodologies;
  • Maintain and enhance existing elements of the Bloomberg Taxonomy including hierarchies, field relationships, formulas and grids, operational workflows and enhance formulaic approaches;
  • Codify market conventions and/or data relationships into business rules for data validation;
  • Support key global business initiatives through the development of new fields, from testing to production, and promote new taxonomy functionality, and to optimise processes and/or improve the quality and discoverability of the taxonomy;
  • Perform incident management, from troubleshooting and root cause analysis to overall problem management;
  • Identify trends in financial reporting globally, taxonomy developments and digitisation of data;
  • Collaborate with multiple internal partners (business, engineering, sales, tech-ops) and project owners to establish consensus on best practices; and
  • Utilise subject-matter-expertise to set and maintain methodologies and identify process and product improvements
  • Train new hires and offer input and expertise into training materials
    •  
    You'll need to have:

  • A bachelor's degree, preferably in Accounting and/or Mathematics/Statistics and/or Computer Science; or relevant experience;
  • Familiarity with Agile project management methodologies and with data processing paradigms;
  • Solid understanding of Python;
  • Knowledge of financial markets and familiar with international financial reporting standards;
  • An aptitude for data modelling and systems thinking;
  • High attention to detail and strong evidence of decision-making and problem solving skills:
  • Ability to remain calm under pressure in a frequently changing environment
    •  
    We'd love to see:

  • Exposure to Bloomberg products such as the Professional Service;
  • 3 -5 years professional experience in similar taxonomy/data steward capacity;
  • Foreign Language Skills
  • Familiarity with project management methodologies, for example Agile, and with data processing paradigms;

If this sounds like you:
Apply if you think we're a good match! We'll get in touch with you to let you know what the next steps are.

We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Title: EMEA Support Team Lead
Description:
EMEA Support Team Lead
We're Bloomberg Enterprise Data - fast paced, innovative and expanding. We have worked hard and smart to become the successful business we are today. We partner closely with our clients, taking time to understand their unique businesses and individual data and technology needs. Our endless selection of datasets, covering all asset types, with multiple delivery technologies and flexible scheduling mean our clients are able to get exactly the data they need, when they need it, in the format they prefer.
Without us, they simply can't operate.

The role:
Due to business growth, there is an opportunity to join the Service Delivery leadership team within Enterprise Data, covering the Europe, the Middle East and Africa (EMEA) region.

One of Bloomberg's key differentiators is our level of customer service. It's something we are proud to be known for in the industry. In this leadership role, you will lead from the front a dynamic, multi-lingual support team. You will ensure you and your team provide a premier level of service whether answering questions on our data content and technology, investigating and troubleshooting a reported service delivery issue and when needed attending a client meeting with a colleague from our Sales or Technical Account Management teams. You'll also interact with multiple internal business areas in order to ensure a seamless level of outstanding customer service. So be prepared to demonstrate your strong communication skills, technical knowhow and can-do attitude.

Reporting to the EMEA Head of Service Delivery, you'll bring with you a strong background in leading client facing teams within the financial services space. You're great at keeping your cool in pressured situations, skilled at flexing your style to suit your audience and excellent at troubleshooting enterprise infrastructure and data. Importantly, you take pride in developing your team, managing them through the changing business environment associated with one of the fastest growing businesses in Bloomberg.

We'll trust you to:
  • Provide effective and inspiring day-to-day leadership presence. Guiding your team in communication and troubleshooting best practices.
  • Be truly Global, collaborating with the AMER and APAC Service Delivery teams in order to drive global projects to completion.
  • Has the ability manage high impacting incidents, working with internal teams to drive an incident resolution, whilst maintaining good client communications.
  • Focus time and energy to learn and adapt to the Bloomberg Technology suite of products you will be supporting. You will need a keen interest in data products and a variety of delivery methodologies.
  • Understand or be able to quickly grasp public cloud services and their best practices on usage. E.g. AWS, AZURE or GCP.
  • Work smarter not harder to, re-engineer business processes when there are efficiencies to be had and introduce automation for easily repeatable processes.
  • Set clear objectives, evaluate progress and develop a high performance culture with focus on collaboration, service excellence and ownership for resolving customer issues
  • Ensure working practices are well defined and operational with minimal disruption using technology to improve efficiency as appropriate
  • Encourage open communication between team members, suggesting and driving forward ideas about how the team can work more effectively together
  • Collaborate with the internal functions including sales, product management, Engineering and Network Operations to develop and implement appropriate technical solutions for our clients
  • Develop and implement training programs to drive individual performance, technical and skills development
  • Develop a culture of continuous improvement and manage change both at an individual and team level.
  • Effectively collaborate with colleagues to bridge regional operations into cohesive global support model

You'll need to have:
  • Experience leading, coaching or mentoring of colleagues in a technical support environment with an emphasis on data and supporting clients subscribed to a managed service.
  • Technical troubleshooting skills and the ability to trace issues to their source through collaboration with incident and engineering teams.
  • Proven management of production service teams, strategy development and execution, delegation, supervision and associated human resource skills.
  • Incident, problem, release and change management experience.
  • Real passion for troubleshooting, critical thinking, and teamwork especially in the fast paced financial services industry.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong multi-tasking skills and the ability to maintain a professional demeanour when handling complex time sensitive issues.
  • Good time and task management - as an individual and for the team

We'd love to see:
  • Knowledge of network infrastructure and experience in Market Data Distribution platforms
  • An understanding of Linux system maintenance, technical networking topologies, network distribution technologies & concepts, network distribution protocols, and/or hands on experience of industry leading Market Data enterprise distribution systems and data feeds.
  • An understanding of either Bloomberg or a similar vendor's Enterprise data offerings, including real time, reference, pricing or regulatory content.
  • Experience of industry standard Market Data Real-Time Enterprise Technologies.

If this sounds like you:
Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this:
https://www.bloomberg.com/professional/solution/data-and-content/

Title: Senior Software Engineer - Fixed Income Trading (C++)
Description:
Senior Software Engineer - Fixed Income Trading (C++)
Senior Software Engineer - Fixed Income Trading 
Our team is part of the Fixed Income Shared Services group. We provide the systems and critical interfaces for determining trading enablements, buy-side and sell-side compliance and client on-boarding. We own a number of client facing applications that are used by our clients to manage and maintain their enablements set-up. Our services receive in excess of 150m hits a day as part of the trade ticketing and RFQ activity. At the other end of the trading workflow, we are also responsible for the functionality that ensures Bloomberg is meeting its regulatory trading obligations imposed by the various regulatory bodies around the world. 

How do we work? 
We are a full stack development team. We work very closely with product managers and trade ticketing teams to ensure we are providing the APIs and behaviour to allow trading to perform smoothly. We also collaborate with Risk and Compliance teams across London and New York to specify, develop and deliver the appropriate control functionality. We are also responsible for the integration and deployment of a third party Surveillance tool that is used by Compliance globally to monitor trading activity. 

What we are looking for: 
An experienced C++ developer who enjoys improving and maintaining critical functions and APIs. You are eager to understand the Fixed Income trading workflow and how our systems influence and integrate within the overall trade process. You are passionate about accuracy and correctness of how Bloomberg operates as a trading function. You will look at how data flows through our systems and layers within Fixed Income and understand how we can provide appropriate control processes to identify failures during that flow.

You understand how to design reliable and large-scale systems. You care about the quality of the code base and demonstrate the experience to know how to apply unit testing, integration testing and stress testing to produce reliable production software. You are also pragmatic and able to balance technology demands with business requirements! 

We will trust you to: 
-    Work closely with wider Electronic Trading Team to ensure that our services are correct, accurate, performant and fit for purpose
-    Liaise with business managers to understand requirements and customer expectations and deliver the product features within realistic timelines
-    Plan, manage and provide ownership of production releases

We'd love to see:
-    Experience with multithreading 
-    Familiarity with SQL, Python and JavaScript
-    Experience with high volume, high availability distributed systems
-    An interest in the financial markets

Interview process:
We believe interviewing is a two way street. It's a way for us to get to know you and your skills, and also a way for you to learn more about the team, our technical challenges, and what you'd be working on. The content of each interview round will be tailored to the role and your background, but the general framework can be found here: https://www.bloomberg.com/careers/technology/engineering/software-engineering-experienced-hire

We want to ensure you can put your best foot forward throughout the process, so if you have any questions or need any accommodations to be successful, please let us know!

We have a lot of opportunities to choose from in Engineering, and it is important to us that your skills and experience align best with the team you are interviewing with. To help ensure you are placed on the right team, your application will be considered for all of our current vacancies in Engineering at the first stage of the interview process.

Title: Senior Software Engineer - Feeds
Description:
Senior Software Engineer - Feeds
Real-time market data is at the core of Bloomberg's business and we are responsible for the software that provides it. Our feed handlers consume data from hundreds of exchanges and financial institutions around the world and translate it into normalized streams. The data we provide is flowing into applications across Bloomberg and ultimately is used by clients driving financial markets. Performance and reliability are key features of our software, and our mission is to provide the best quality financial data in the world.

What's in it for you:
As a member of our team, you will immediately begin delivering software that has an impact on the whole company. You will collaborate with business units, development teams, and external exchanges to drive projects dealing with high volume data across all asset classes. You will work on a variety of business projects as well as strategic initiatives to continually improve our infrastructure. At the moment, we are refactoring major feed handlers to use standard components, modern frameworks, and C++14 to ensure our software is stable and maintainable. It is a great chance to try your design and coding skills in practice.

Our tech stack: 
Most of our software is written in C++ and runs on Linux. We also partner with dedicated SRE and SDLC teams that help us manage and support our CI and production environment. An ideal match would be an engineer with commercial C++ experience. However, if you have worked with other object-oriented languages and you are keen to learn C++, we want to talk to you all the same! 

You'll need to have:
  • Excellent problem-solving skills
  • Expertise in your chosen object-oriented programming language, and a willingness to learn C++
  • A mindset for high quality and continuous improvement, delivering performant and resilient solutions and challenging others
  • Strong computer science fundamentals including data structures and algorithms
  • Excellent communication skills, comfortable interacting with business teams

We'd love to see:
  • Experience developing on Linux-based platforms
  • Experience with network protocols such as TCP, UDP and Multicast
  • Knowledge of market data
Bloomberg is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Institutional Client Relations - ESG
Description:
Posted by:
Liam McHale
Recruiter
View profile & contact
Our client is Global Asset Manager based in London who is looking to add a new member to their Institutional Client Relationship team. This newly created position will be responsible for pro-actively managing relationships with an allocated number of global institutional clients.

Responsibilities

  • Ensuring that client relationship directors and other relevant stakeholders are fully briefed and supported, client requirements and all agreed client deliveries are met as well as responding to ad hoc requests for information and maintaining records on the CRM database.
  • The role will include responsibility for managing the take on process for new clients and working with the in house reporting and voting and engagement support team to ensure that accurate client reporting is delivered to deadline
  • Pro-actively identify market / regional trends and needs and drive relevant initiatives to respond to those needs, appropriately balanced with the requirements of the global client base and the shared service model. To fulfil the functions of the role the job holder will be required to build strong positive relationships with both internal and external clients. 
  • To support those responsible for sales and business development in furthering the efforts of the sales process.  
  • To create and/or update on a six-monthly basis the client relationship plans for all assigned clients.
  • Day to day management of relationships with allocated clients and prospects, ensuring the highest level of service e.g. query management, contract fulfilment. 
  • Proactively schedule regular prospect and client contact including calls, meetings and presentations, preparing supporting documents and briefing directors in advance. Collate, prepare and deliver quality bespoke client materials in a timely fashion. 

Required Experience

  • Must have experience of managing Institutional clients within Asset Management 
  • Is able to demonsrate a passion/interest in Sustainable Investing 
  • Minimum of 2 years experience in the Asset Management Industry

Title: Lead C# Software Engineer
Description:
Lead C# Software Engineer
Description
CME Group is the world's leading and most diverse derivatives marketplace. But who we are goes deeper than that. Here, you can impact markets worldwide. Transform industries. And build a career shaping tomorrow. We invest in your success and you own it, all while working alongside a team of leading experts who inspire you in ways big and small. Joining our company gives you the opportunity to make a difference in global financial markets every day, whether you work on our industry-leading technology and risk management services, our benchmark products or in a corporate services area that helps us serve our customers better. We're small enough for you and your contributions to be known. But big enough for your ideas to make an impact. The pace is dynamic, the work is unlike any other firm in the business, and the possibilities are endless. Problem solvers, difference makers, trailblazers. Those are our people. And we're looking for more.

To learn more about what a career at CME Group can offer you, visit us at www.wherefuturesaremade.com .

Department: Elysian Systems

The Elysian application is a real-time trading and matching platform used to match orders in physical and over-the-counter (OTC) markets, including fixed income/repo and commodities. It supports multiple execution styles including central limit order book, auctions and RFQs.

We are a small, dedicated and focused team of open-minded, experienced developers, all based in the London office. We directly shape the future of the product and are trusted to make all the technical decisions. We are developing a leading-edge trading platform where we have the flexibility to make our own decisions about the development process, architecture and technology. We are an innovative and reactive team offering quick answers to technological challenges and business opportunities, both for external and internal customers.

Principal Accountabilities

  • Hands on technical lead, building consensus on detailed design and architecture plans for complex, large scale efforts.
  • Oversees development for all aspects of the application their team is responsible for delivering.
  • Mentors development staff
  • Applies expert knowledge of C# language, DBMS and middle-ware technologies in independently designing and developing key services.
  • Develop solutions for deployment in the Cloud.
  • Leads code reviews, proactively identifying and mitigating potential issues and defects.
  • Defines key metrics driving code optimization and re-factoring.
  • Plays a lead role in preliminary story review, providing constructive feedback and input on both work effort estimation as well as architecture/design improvements.
  • Plays a lead role in working with analysts to interpret high level requirements for complex, large scale initiatives and decomposing them into independent stories and sub-tasks for the team.
  • Expected to develop network of relationships within the organization in order to achieve results and to effectively communicate vision and status both within/across teams as well as to management.
  • Drives continuous improvement efforts by identifying and championing practical means of reducing time to market while maintaining high quality products (i.e. - process improvements/automation opportunities).
  • Embraces and enforces CME Group SDLC and information security standards.

Essential Criteria
  • Bachelor's degree (with honors) or equivalent/better strongly preferred, but substantial relevant experience could substitute.
  • A solid background in maths and computer science, a good knowledge of basic data-structures, algorithms and algorithmic complexity.
  • Excellent problem solving skills with significant experience of development in C# or similar
  • Excellent understanding of the platforms and language you're familiar with, including .NET/C#, a good understanding of how things work underneath, in the runtime and the operating system
  • Be interested and enthusiastic about technology and finance, have the desire to learn
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Desirable Criteria
  • Experience in developing performance-critical, low-latency, high-throughput .NET applications
  • Deep knowledge of multi-threading and parallel programming in general
  • Experience in modern web-technologies (Angular, React)
  • Good C++ knowledge
Why would you want to join our team?
  • You will not be told how to do things, we expect you to work autonomously, prioritize your own work and think about the customers' needs.
  • We're redesigning the system to be a modern, scalable, high performance architecture. Creative new ideas are welcome, everybody who is interested can be involved in the decision making process.
  • You get to learn about a broad range of financial products.
  • Everything you do directly affects the customers and is in use by thousands of people every day.

For EU Residents, the Candidate Privacy Policy can be found here.

Title: Field Service Engineer Supervisor
Description:
Field Service Engineer Supervisor
Description
CME Group is the world's leading and most diverse derivatives marketplace. But who we are goes deeper than that. Here, you can impact markets worldwide. Transform industries. And build a career shaping tomorrow. We invest in your success and you own it, all while working alongside a team of leading experts who inspire you in ways big and small. Joining our company gives you the opportunity to make a difference in global financial markets every day, whether you work on our industry-leading technology and risk management services, our benchmark products or in a corporate services area that helps us serve our customers better. We're small enough for you and your contributions to be known. But big enough for your ideas to make an impact. The pace is dynamic, the work is unlike any other firm in the business, and the possibilities are endless. Problem solvers, difference makers, trailblazers. Those are our people. And we're looking for more.

To learn more about what a career at CME Group can offer you, visit us at www.wherefuturesaremade.com .

We are looking for a Supervisor to take responsibility for the day to day running of the London workshop and to provide support to the team of Data Centre Field Engineers. Your role will be to oversee the day to day operational needs of the engineers and to ensure that the EBS Global Field Services Manager is updated on any issues or needs of the team. The successful candidate will work closely with other stakeholder teams, act as the focal point and
coordinator for Data Centre deployment activities.

Accountabilities
  • To provide support for all service calls at UK customer sites and third-party Data Centres
  • Field Service Technical lead for UK based data centre activities
  • Participate in planning meetings representing the DCE UK team
  • Assist with planning of all MAC activities working with Operations and Network teams
  • Oversight of UK data centres ensuring the required data centre build qualities are being maintained by the FS teams for UK based locations
  • Carry out duties adhering to all aspects relating to Field Service, Logistics, Installations and customer care
  • Ensure all tasks are completed to the highest standard and all relevant scheduling, calendar, rota and Data Centre diagrams are up to date
  • Responsible for keeping the workplace clear of redundant equipment and safe to work in
  • Liaise with customers as necessary when scheduling on-site activity ensuring they are aware of all actions and intended actions relating to their service call thereby ensuring customer satisfaction
  • Report customer feedback to your line manager
  • Comply with all instructions and procedures
  • Adhere to all health and safety standards
  • Provide a point of escalation for Field Service Engineers to raise any concerns related to the workplace and action or escalate accordingly on a rota based out of hours support structure

Skills and qualifications

  • Strong personal organisational skills
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Service oriented, adaptable and resilient
  • Results oriented with personal accountability
  • Excellent attention to detail, quality and control
  • Ability to analyse and troubleshoot logically and act decisively
  • Flexible team player
  • Customer/stakeholder focused
  • Ability to develop new skills and understand new technology as required
  • Skilled in Microsoft applications software (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook etc.)
  • A reasonable knowledge of PC's, servers and network components
  • Experience of project management beneficial
  • Demonstrate proven experience in the area of Field Service Management
  • Educated to GCSE or A level equivalent
  • Any industry specific certification would be an advantage
  • Candidates must be in possession of a valid UK driving license. A company car will be supplied with the role.

Title: Salesforce Administrator
Description:
Salesforce Administrator
Description
CME Group is the world's leading and most diverse derivatives marketplace. But who we are goes deeper than that. Here, you can impact markets worldwide. Transform industries. And build a career shaping tomorrow. We invest in your success and you own it, all while working alongside a team of leading experts who inspire you in ways big and small. Joining our company gives you the opportunity to make a difference in global financial markets every day, whether you work on our industry-leading technology and risk management services, our benchmark products or in a corporate services area that helps us serve our customers better. We're small enough for you and your contributions to be known. But big enough for your ideas to make an impact. The pace is dynamic, the work is unlike any other firm in the business, and the possibilities are endless. Problem solvers, difference makers, trailblazers. Those are our people. And we're looking for more.

To learn more about what a career at CME Group can offer you, visit us at www.wherefuturesaremade.com .

As a source of innovative derivatives products and as a global financial marketplace, CME Group helps companies and institutions manage a vast array of risks, such as currency fluctuations for global manufacturers, unpredictable fuel costs for airlines and ever-changing commodity prices for farmers and are an essential part of the global economy.

The mission of the CRM team at CME Group is to be build out our Salesforce.com platform to be the central location to capture, manage, access and share customer intelligence across the organization so that we main gain a single view, or 360 degree view, of customer profiles, activities, campaigns, and opportunity pipeline.

The Salesforce Administrator will support this mission as part of the Customer Marketing/CRM team and be responsible for provid ing w orld c lass support to all CME Salesforce users around the world. We are looking for a customer focused individual with excellent oral and written communication skills to assist internal users with day-to-day Salesforce requests. World c lass support means friendly and prompt response, thorough analysis and follow-up, and quick resolution to requests. This multi-skilled position speaks to an individual who knows how to combine their technical Salesforce expertise with customer service to ensure users can get timely support and resolution to their requests.

Responsibilities

Monitor the Case queue and accept or assign cases as needed

Adhere to Service Level Agreements ( SLA ) for response and resolution times of cases

Assist with ongoing system administration including security, profiles, workflow rules, custom objects, custom fields, etc.

Assist with release evaluations including updating user guides

Ensur e all modifications follow the change control processes including changes in sandbox environments, testing and signoff

Train end users on new updates, features and functionality and provide guidance in accordance to processes and best practices

Regularly perform database de-duping and clean-up procedures. Ensure data quality through clean- up efforts (monthly reporting, lead clean up, etc.)

Develop ad-hoc reports as requested by user groups or stakeholders, performs analysis on data as required
The opportunity to design and build some features and enhancements using Salesforce declarative tools

EXPERIENCE/ SKILLS
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, a persuasive and passionate communicator
  • Certified Salesforce Administrator
  • Experience in administration of a Salesforce instance
  • Strong ability to effectively prioritise competing requests, while managing user expectations
  • Strong logical reasoning and problem-solving skills across multi-disciplinary skill sets
  • Ability to engage with a wide range of stakeholders and build relationships
  • Experience working within SLA guidelines and tracking key performance indicators


For EU Residents, the Candidate Privacy Policy can be found here.

Title: Client Portfolio Manager, Responsible Investment
Description:
Client Portfolio Manager, Responsible Investment
Job Description

Where you'll fit in & what our team goals are...

You will be a critical component of our Responsible Investment (RI) strategy success and commitment to excellence and client focus.

You will be embedded within an investment team and act as its ambassador. You will be the source of specialised RI knowledge of investment products and markets and operate as a bridge between their investment team and its internal and external clients.

You will facilitate the flow of information between all parties to maximise the firm's credentials in the marketplace while ensuring the Portfolio Manager's time is optimised.

Responsibilities

How you'll spend your time...
  • Maintain an up-to-date knowledge of the team's investment decisions, strategy and market outlook;
  • Proactively maintain an in-depth knowledge of the team's investment decisions
  • Understand the underlying assumptions used
  • Maintain an up-to-date knowledge of the risks assumed by the desk's strategies
  • Understand the drivers of financial markets
  • Manage the team's book of business
  • Work with the team to maintain and develop the book of business;
  • Ensure that key clients are regularly updated and engaged with the team;
  • Take a proactive approach to solving client's issues, whether investment, business or operation-related, by serving as a facilitator.
  • Communicate on the team's behalf internally and externally
  • Act as 'gatekeeper' for the team in respect of the requirements of clients, consultants and Distribution to ensure that the most appropriate resource is used;
  • Work with Distribution as a substitute for fund managers in communicating and building relationships with clients, consultants and the media, including delivering presentations to win business, update clients and retain assets;
  • Educate Distribution on the team's products, processes and decisions.
  • Promote high quality, well articulated client communications (Monthly commentaries, Performance commentaries, Clients reviews, Market outlook, Quarterly commentaries, Press articles and viewpoints)
  • Maintain oversight for all the materials produced on behalf of the team (including editing, checking and finalising): Presentation, Press articles, RFPs/RFIs
  • Work with the team to improve its perception and efficacy in the marketplace:


Required Qualifications

To be successful in this role you will have...
  • Knowledge of Asset Management, specifically in Responsible Investments
  • Understanding of institutional and retail distribution channels
  • Impeccable oral, written and presentation skills
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Ability to work under tight deadlines


Preferred Qualifications

If you also had this, it would be great...
  • IMC and/or CFA
  • European Language Skills

Title: HR Business Partner
Description:
HR Business Partner
Job Description

Where you'll fit in & what our team goals are...

In this role you will be partnering with specific EMEA based business areas of approximately 200 employees, mainly based in London to deliver an end to end HR service at a strategic and operational level.

Your designated client groups will be made up of the regional Investments functions, which have global matrix structures and require close collaboration with the North American part of the business to ensure global strategies, processes and initiatives are rolled-out consistently whilst safeguarding regional requirements.

You will also support other designated client groups, specifically the EMEA Risk function and the group of Non-Exec Directors engaged with Columbia Threadneedle.

Responsibilities

How you'll spend your time...

Act as first point of contact for leaders whilst building and maintaining strong relationships, attaining "trusted advisor" status; geared to deliver solutions which are commercial, pragmatic and risk managed.
  • Facilitate management of headcount, hiring approval process and hire-plan to agreed budgets working with Hiring Leaders and the Talent Acquisition Team.
  • Manage process for identifying talent/high potential employees and supporting Leaders in implementing solutions to develop, engage and retain talent. Facilitate identification of training and development needs, partnering with the Talent Development team.
  • Provide advice and support to leaders to resolve employee relations issues, engaging and educating leaders to ensure active management of all performance issues through informal and formal processes.
  • Support leaders through the annual performance management cycle; coaching on delivering feedback and ensuring the successful delivery of the Performance Appraisal process; including managing Consistency Meetings and following up on outcomes.
  • Collaborate with the Reward team to ensure integrity of compensation data, facilitate job matching and ensure general understanding by Leaders of the Total Reward philosophy and methodology.
  • Active management of HR information; maintaining approvals of changes in the leader self-service HRIS. Provide management information to Leaders to facilitate discussions on employment matters.
  • Ensure familiarity with SMCR implications working with the SMCR Manager and relevant Senior Manager, to identify and facilitate changes to SMF/ Certified Person designations, registrations in addition to changes to Management Responsibility Maps, Statements of Responsibility and Reasonable Steps.
  • Support Leaders through periods of transformation and organisation change and deliver and embed change across client group(s)
  • Act as HR lead on projects in support of wider HR agenda, collaborating across teams as required.


Required Qualifications

To be successful in this role you will have...
  • Advanced client facing HRBP experience and process quality standards
  • Experience from within the Financial Services Industry and of UK regulation and compliance concepts
  • Significant Employee Relations experience
  • Strong commercial acumen with a risk and controls mindset
  • Team-working and collaboration with experience working in a matrix organisation / regional and functional business operating model with the ability to build effective working relationships with global partners.
  • Experience working with Workday HRIS

Title: Head of Alliances and Channels
Description:
My client is looking for a Head Alliances & Channel to join their successful business The business has a broad experience in shaping and leading innovation in the payment space. The world of payments is dynamic and so are they. In this leading position you will report to the Chief Commercials Officer and will be responsible for generation of leads and business via technical vendors and acquiring partners

The team has a broad experience in shaping and leading innovation in the payment space.

The world of payments is dynamic and so are we. We are all about ambitious objectives, promoted by an open team and communication culture. Today we have 200 employees from 25 nationalities working across 6 office locations: UK, Austria, Bulgaria, India, the Netherlands and the US.

Description


Develop, implement, manage and grow a professional and global alliance and channel strategy for the company;


Sign up and drive revenue across alliances and channel partnerships to grow our online and off-line business and constantly grow our external value proposition by working closely with our alliances and partners to aim for an integrated end-to-end offering to merchants;


Be a contact point for all 3rd party technical vendors & acquiring alliances who give leads and opportunities to the business;


Represent our client externally and be a spokesperson on events and public gatherings.


Proactively work closely with all senior leadership by aligning, designing Partner Development plans for successful execution across business;


Conduct regular partner reviews and performance screening by using a "Partner Business Review" process;


Help train partners and their sales teams to provide well qualified opportunities and fast on-boarding;


Work closely with the COO to align a joint roadmap with partners and alliances to promote a joint value proposition;


Work closely with the account development team and new sales hunters to align with partners and look at joint commercial opportunities;


Work closely with the Head of Risk and compliance to monitor partner performance, risk ratios, on-boarding quality and overall monitoring;


Constantly monitor partner performance and align with the finance team on constant improvement on commercials and bottom-line revenue.

Profile


Have knowledge of payment services and ideally experience of card-present and card-not-present;


Technically apt in the payments eco-systems and understand payment models such as:

- Fully integrated solutions

- Stand-alone

- Semi-integrated

- E-Commerce (Direct; Re-direct / iFrame);


Ideally experienced or having worked across a broad range of industries such as (but not limited):

- Hospitality

- T&E

- Retail

- Financial Services

- Gaming and online sports betting

- Dating

- Event organisation and ticketing;

Job Offer

Starting salary of up to £100,000
Leading Bonus package

Title: Business Analyst - Investment Operations - Fixed Income - Asset Management
Description:
Posted by:
jonathan kearlsey
Recruiter
View profile & contact
Investment Management client requires an experienced Business Analyst with Fixed Income projects, ideally with experience of working closely with the Fixed income investment teams

Business Analyst - Investment Operations - Fixed Income - Asset Management

Our client, a London based Asset Management company, is currently recruiting for a Business Analyst with Investment Operations projects experience and Fixed Income product knowledge to join their team on a 12 month Fixed Term contract.

You will be responsible for working on a variety of projects to cover strategic, regulatory or discretionary across the business but with an emphasis on supporting the Fixed income and FX investment process. This will include liaising with the technology change teams across the front and middle office.

The ideal candidate will have:

  • Extensive Business Analysis experience gained within an Asset Management/Fund Management business
  • Fixed Income product knowledge
  • Experience of working closely with fixed income and FX investment teams and systems (highly desirable)

Business Analyst - Investment Operations - Fixed Income - Asset Management

Title: Solutions Architect, Buyside Product - Enterprise Products
Description:
Solutions Architect, Buyside Product - Enterprise Products
The Bloomberg Buy-Side Solutions Group partners with our most sophisticated clients to ensure we anticipate and meet their evolving needs during periods of transformation. As a Solutions Architect you will be expected to develop an intimate knowledge of the client's business and technology priorities-and to conceive, design and oversee delivery of scalable solutions so our clients can reach their objectives. To do this, you will need to drive a common understanding of needs between internal and external stakeholders and you will need to combine knowledge of systems functionality with exceptional and pragmatic problem-solving skills.

We'll trust you to:
  • Represent Bloomberg's buy-side solutions with a wide range of client stakeholders
  • Engage with clients to understand their needs, strategic priorities, and technical parameters, to not just deliver what they are asking for but what they truly need
  • Relay these needs back to Bloomberg stakeholders in the form of a proposed solution and  client's objectives, working with Implementation, Product, and Engineering teams to ensure approach is in line with best practices and vision
  • Exercise sound judgment in leading discussions on trade-offs between client-specific needs and broader business priorities
  • Develop client-aligned roadmaps and collateral including tutorials, sample code, reference implementations, and presentations that will be used by practitioners as well as executive client decision makers  
  • Leverage deep client knowledge when coordinating with Program Management, Product, and Engineering to develop and deliver an execution plan
  • Ensure budgets and timelines accurately reflect the nuances and complexities of the client and Bloomberg

You'll need to have:
  • 10+ years of experience in a technical project management or a technical sales role
  • Deep familiarity with asset management, global and multi-asset experience a plus
  • Familiar with full investment lifecycle as well as investment operations
  • Prior experience with change management and business transformation initiatives
  • Track record of client engagement and communication, with the ability to craft and deliver both technical documentation and conceptual presentations (white-board, small team, broad audience)
  • Understand and articulate implications of various technology architectures
    •  - Structured thinker who is process-oriented and systematic in approach
  • Extremely pragmatic with good commercial sense, comfortable making principles-based recommendations, tradeoffs, and decisions
  • High standards and strong sense of personal ownership, comfortable setting and holding a high bar with internal and external stakeholders
  • Leadership skills to effect change via influence and without authority
  • Versatile communicator who is able to coordinate and create alignment across varied groups including sales, product, engineering and client
  • Entrepreneurial and passionate learner who can quickly become an expert in various domains and conceptualize the impact of new information

If this sounds like you:
Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this:  https://www.bloomberg.com/professional/expertise/buy-side/

Title: Global Data - Earnings Estimates Data Specialist
Description:
Global Data - Earnings Estimates Data Specialist
Bloomberg runs on data and Data drives the markets. The Global Data team is responsible for acquiring it and providing it to our clients. We collect, analyse, process and publish the data which is the backbone of our iconic Bloomberg Terminal- the facts and figures which ultimately move the financial markets. We apply problem-solving skills to identify innovative workflow efficiencies and we implement technology solutions to enhance our systems, products and processes- and all this while providing platinum customer support to our clients.
You have the proven ability to identify business needs and transform these into actionable, impactful projects that you lead through to success. You're professional and personable, intelligent and analytical. You have a demonstrated knowledge of the financial industry coupled with an interest in process engineering and data analysis.
Our Global Data Earnings Estimates team is looking for a highly motivated and driven individual to support and enhance the Earnings Estimates product, providing clients with consensus estimates that reliably represent the markets expectation of a listed stocks performance. In addition to providing timely, accurate, and comprehensive estimates data for our clients to make business decisions, analysts are able to showcase their subject matter expertise through superior customer service internally and externally.
The successful candidate will have a get it done attitude, embrace hard work, act with urgency and collaborate with those around you to deliver results. A strong passion for pursuing a career at Bloomberg is essential.

What you'll do:
 
  • Maintain clean and structured broker data on the Bloomberg terminal to ensure our clients have access to the best product possible.
  • Manage projects to optimize processes and/or improve the quality of our data products.
  • Function as a subject-matter-expert internally and externally by consulting others on the product.
  • Provide exceptional customer support in a timely manner.
  • Identify opportunities/gaps in the product, run and transition proof of concepts and ad hoc work into long term capabilities.
  • Perform incident management, from troubleshooting and root cause analysis to overall problem management.
  • Train and mentor Data Specialists and Data Analysts.
  • Manage vendor operations by handling escalations, conducting training, and managing other ad hoc projects.
  • Perform quality control to ensure data accuracy.

What you'll need:
  • Bachelor's degree (preferably in Finance)
  • 2 years of relevant experience in either Finance or Data Analysis
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
  • Demonstrated interest in financial market and the aspiration to work in the financial services industry
  • Strong critical-thinking and problem-solving ability
  • The aptitude to learn and adapt quickly in a rapidly changing environment
  • Effective research and analysis skills with attention to detail
  • Intimate understanding of how industry players utilize data to drive business decisions
  • Expert-level knowledge of data processing paradigms and associated tools and technologies
  • Proven ability to innovate data products and processes
  • Ability to influence others and lead change
  • Demonstrated project management skills, CAPM, PMP and/or CSM preferred
  • Eagerness to learn and collaborate with others

We'd love to see:
 
  • Some programming knowledge (Python, SQL)
  • Experience using data visualization tools such as Tableau or QlikSense

Does this sound like you?
Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are. In the meantime, feel free to have a look at this: https://www.bloomberg.com/careers/global-data/
