Title: Investment Specialist
Description:
Investment Specialist
WELLINGTON MANAGEMENT

Wellington Management offers comprehensive investment management capabilities that span nearly all segments of the global capital markets. Our investment solutions, tailored to the unique return and risk objectives of institutional clients in more than 55 countries, draw on a robust body of proprietary research and a collaborative culture that encourages independent thought and healthy debate. As a private partnership, we believe our ownership structure fosters a long-term view that aligns our perspectives with those of our clients.

POSITION

INVESTMENT PRODUCTS & FUND STRATEGIES - FIXED INCOME
The fixed income team within Investment Products and Strategies ("IPFS") at Wellington works closely with our fixed income investment teams, our global relationship group and business colleagues around the firm. Our fixed income investors span a wide range of disciplines, geographies, sectors, and styles. The IPS function has three main responsibilities:

Product Development And Marketing
IPFS contributes to client growth and retention by assessing business opportunities and leading business planning, developing new products and investment solutions, creating the communication strategy for the book of business, including materials that differentiate the product relative to competitors and acting as a subject matter expert and portfolio representative for colleagues, clients and consultants.

Investment Integrity and Risk Management
IPFS acts as an independent advisor to ensure the integrity of the investment and risk management processes, as well as consistency with client expectations and guidelines, conducts regular portfolio risk and performance attributions reviews and contributes to formal oversight processes.

Business Management
IPFS contributes to managing the business, including managing risk, capacity, pricing and guidelines, leading resolution of internal business issues and sharing investment integrity, marketing and product development best practices.

Role and Responsibilities
Investment Specialists are members of product teams, which are led by an Investment Director. He/she works closely with the Investment Director(s), investment teams, and business professionals on the areas described above. Responsibilities include performing analyses that ensure portfolio integrity by providing oversight of portfolio positioning, performance, and risk exposures. The individual will also contribute to the development of new investment strategies and client solutions, conduct market and competitor analysis, evaluate product overlap and capacity trends and prepare white papers and presentation materials that serve to differentiate our portfolios. Over time the individual will participate in meetings with clients, prospects and consultants to communicate our investment philosophy, strategy, positioning, and performance.

The ideal candidate is a flexible problem solver with a can-do attitude, who takes ownership of issues. The individual will work closely with members of the investment team, the Client Group and other functional areas. The position will be based in London.

QUALIFICATIONS
The Investment Specialist role requires demonstrated knowledge of portfolio and market analysis and a passion for fixed income investing. Advanced analytical skill including the ability to frame issues, identify important points and draw conclusions, combined with strong communication skills and intellectual curiosity. He/she must be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment in a multi-faceted role, where priorities can change rapidly.

Further qualifications include:

• 5-7 years industry experience, preferably in a relevant capacity

• Excellent organisational and project management skills, attention to detail

• Excellent written, oral and interpersonal communication skills

• Creative problem-solving skills, solutions-oriented mindset

• Strong business judgment, curiosity, comfort with ambiguity

• Ability to work independently and with a team

• Leadership skills, grace under pressure, flexibility, ability to get things done

• MBA and/or CFA are preferred

• German and French language skills are preferred

• Experience and/or interest in sustainable investing is preferred

SKILLS

JOB TITLE
Investment Specialist

LOCATION
London

As an equal opportunity employer, Wellington Management ensures that all qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, religion, creed, national origin, age, ancestry, disability (physical or mental), medical condition, citizenship, marital status, pregnancy, veteran or military status, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by applicable law . If you are a candidate with a disability, or are assisting a candidate with a disability, and require an accommodation to apply for one of our jobs, please email us at GMCANINQ@wellington.com .

Salary: GBP100000 - GBP120000 per annum + plus bonus
Title: Head of Finance - Wealth Management
Description:
This is a Head of Finance role that gives you the opportunity to help shape the direction of the business as you will sit on the Management Committee along with the Founding Partners.

Role Title: Head of Finance || Salary: £100,000 plus

This is a finance role that gives you the opportunity to really help shape the direction of the business as you will sit on the Management Committee along with the Founding Partners.

The business are a very reputable wealth management firm who have achieved consistent growth over a number of years and place a real importance on the moral and social responsibility of the firm. Therefore, this is a fairly rare opportunity where you can work in a challenging role that allows you to drive the business forward while also making a positive impact on society.

There is a small finance team that you will lead as the bookkeeping, payroll etc. is outsourced. Therefore you will need to be someone who is happy to be hands on and understand the detail as well as see the bigger picture and drive the business forward.

You will have ownership of all areas of finance, including:

  • Production of management and statutory accounts
  • Create and manage the business' budget and forecasting
  • All regulatory reporting, ICAAP production and Capital planning
  • Production and presentation of MI and quarterly packs along with performance monitoring
  • Ad hoc financial analysis and project work
  • Managing the audit process
  • Team management
  • Member of various committees including the Management Committee
  • A lot of other responsibilities involved in the running of the Finance function

For this role significant wealth management sector experience is essential and they are looking for 10 years plus relevant finance experience.

Title: Investment Strategy Analyst
Description:
Investment Strategy Analyst
WELLINGTON MANAGEMENT

Wellington Management offers comprehensive investment management capabilities that span nearly all segments of the global capital markets. Our investment solutions, tailored to the unique return and risk objectives of institutional clients in more than 55 countries, draw on a robust body of proprietary research and a collaborative culture that encourages independent thought and healthy debate. As a private partnership, we believe our ownership structure fosters a long-term view that aligns our perspectives with those of our clients.

POSITION

Company

Tracing our roots to 1928, Wellington Management Company, LLP is one of the world's largest independent investment management firms. With over US$1.2 trillion in assets under management as of 31 December 2020, we serve as a trusted adviser to institutional clients and mutual fund sponsors in over 60 countries. Our innovative investment solutions are built on the strength of proprietary, independent research and span the global capital markets, including equity, fixed income, multi-asset, and alternative strategies. As a private partnership whose sole business is investment management, our long-term views and interests are aligned with those of our clients. We are committed to attracting a talented and diverse workforce, and to fostering an open, collaborative, and inclusive culture because we believe multiple perspectives lead to more informed investment and business decisions. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we welcome people with diverse life experiences, fresh ideas, and specialized subject-matter expertise.

Position

The Investment Strategy team is part of Wellington's Investment Platform, and is responsible for multi-asset, multi-manager and custom solutions research and portfolio management, and manages a range of outcome-oriented, factor and thematic portfolios on behalf of clients. The team also provides bespoke research and advice across various topics such as asset allocation, fundamental factors, thematic investing and manager research.

As part of continued growth, we are seeking an Analyst to support our multi-asset activities, and to help the team to deliver best-in-class investment advice, research, and investment outcomes to institutional clients across the globe. The role will be based in either London or Singapore, with opportunities for flexible working, and will report into a Director of Investment Strategy locally. Wellington is firmly committed to growing and developing internal talent, and this role will provide the successful candidate with ample opportunities over time to broaden and deepen their skills in investment research, asset allocation and portfolio strategy.

Primary responsibilities will include:

* Developing investment advice, and undertaking bespoke research projects on behalf of large, strategic clients of the firm;

* Supporting the team's efforts in sharing insights, and engaging with clients across the globe (e.g. helping to produce published and/or widely distributed investment content);

* Leveraging coding platforms (e.g. Python) to undertake data analysis in the pursuit of research objectives;

* Developing an understanding of capital markets, and contributing to the team's asset allocation process;

* Developing a deep understanding of internal investment capabilities, and how they address client needs;

* Collaborating with investors and analysts across Investment Strategy and the broader investment platform (e.g. Macro, Fixed Income, Equity, Industry Research, Commodities, Quantitative and Risk) on investment-led projects;

* Developing and sharing expertise on investment challenges shared by clients in different channels.

Qualifications

The successful candidate is likely to have many of the following attributes / qualifications:

* Strong academic background;

* 3-5 years of relevant professional experience, gained in a research-driven role, e.g. investment/capital market strategy, asset allocation, macro or fixed income research, quantitative investing;

* Ability to work with different types of data, and experience in building analytical frameworks would be advantageous;

* Experience of coding in support of research (Python strongly preferred);

* Creative and intellectually curious mindset, strong problem-solving skills, and comfort with using and developing analytical frameworks;

* Effective team contributor in a highly collaborative research setting;

* Ability to work independently in pursuit of team goals, demonstrating initiative and entrepreneurialism;

* Track record of completing multiple competing projects, and demonstrated success working in a fast-paced environment;

* Demonstrated interest in investment challenges faced by clients, and how the asset management industry will respond to those challenges:

* Growth mindset - the flexibility and openness to continue learning, evolving and growing as an analyst.

SKILLS

JOB TITLE
Investment Strategy Analyst

LOCATION
London

As an equal opportunity employer, Wellington Management ensures that all qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, religion, creed, national origin, age, ancestry, disability (physical or mental), medical condition, citizenship, marital status, pregnancy, veteran or military status, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by applicable law . If you are a candidate with a disability, or are assisting a candidate with a disability, and require an accommodation to apply for one of our jobs, please email us at GMCANINQ@wellington.com .

Title: ESG Analyst, Financials
Description:
ESG Analyst, Financials
WELLINGTON MANAGEMENT

Wellington Management offers comprehensive investment management capabilities that span nearly all segments of the global capital markets. Our investment solutions, tailored to the unique return and risk objectives of institutional clients in more than 55 countries, draw on a robust body of proprietary research and a collaborative culture that encourages independent thought and healthy debate. As a private partnership, we believe our ownership structure fosters a long-term view that aligns our perspectives with those of our clients.

POSITION

Position

As part of the continued growth and globalisation of the firm's Sustainable Investment platform, we are seeking to recruit an Environmental, Social & Governance (ESG) Analyst to the Investment Research team. Based in London, this individual will conduct fundamental ESG research, bringing a deep understanding of the material ESG issues within their coverage sector ( Non-US Financials), and will effectively communicate differentiated investment insights to Equity and Fixed Income Portfolio Managers and Analysts across the firm, so that they can be incorporated into our clients' portfolios.

In addition, the ESG Analyst will be responsible for leading the stewardship activities for the sector by making voting recommendations to equity holders, and for maintaining and executing engagements on ESG topics with company management teams and Boards, in collaboration with other investors at the firm. He/she will also have the opportunity, as appropriate, to represent the team and communicate the firm's ESG integration process to clients, consultants, and prospects.

Essential Skills:

The following skills are required for the role:

* Investment acumen and passion - we are seeking an ESG Analyst who is passionate about both capital markets and sustainability issues, and has experience analyzing ESG issues in their research/investment process. The ideal candidate will bring subject matter expertise on governance topics and environmental and social issues, along with an understanding of how these issues can impact the financial performance of Financial companies, and an investment thesis;

* Superior collaboration and influencing skills - the successful candidate will enjoy contributing to a highly collaborative investment environment, and will embrace the benefits of overlapping lines of idea generation. He/she will build strong, trusting relationships internally with colleagues, and externally with clients, prospects, and company management teams/Boards. The ability to provide a point of view and to challenge the status quo is critical, as is the humility to admit mistakes, and a desire to learn from others. He/she must recognize the benefits of diverse perspectives. The ability to communicate (both verbally and in writing) action oriented investment recommendations clearly and with conviction, and contribute to an open sustainable investment dialogue is important.

* Growth mindset - the flexibility and openness to continue learning, evolving and growing as an ESG Analyst. He/she will have a global perspective and creative approach for thinking about innovation and the evolution of sustainable investing and ESG.

Qualifications:

Additional qualifications and individual characteristics are likely to include:

* Strong academic credentials (advanced degree/CFA preferred);

* A minimum of 7 years' research experience in a related role, ideally at an Investment Management organisation, Investment Bank or Ratings Agency. Significant experience of the Financials sector is essential;

* Strong work ethic and attention to detail;

* Ability to set priorities and execute a research agenda effectively;

* Capacity for differentiated thinking, and ability to problem solve effectively;

* Excellent written and oral communication skills;

* Strong interpersonal skills, and experience in a collaborative, team-based, results-oriented environment;

Title: ESG Analyst, Sovereign Debt
Description:
ESG Analyst, Sovereign Debt
WELLINGTON MANAGEMENT

Wellington Management offers comprehensive investment management capabilities that span nearly all segments of the global capital markets. Our investment solutions, tailored to the unique return and risk objectives of institutional clients in more than 55 countries, draw on a robust body of proprietary research and a collaborative culture that encourages independent thought and healthy debate. As a private partnership, we believe our ownership structure fosters a long-term view that aligns our perspectives with those of our clients.

POSITION

Within the sustainable investment platform, we are seeking an Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) Analyst to join our Investment Research team. Based in Boston or London, the ESG analyst will bring an understanding of the material ESG issues relevant to global sovereign debt and effectively communicate differentiated investment insights to portfolio managers and analysts to be incorporated into our clients' portfolios.

Wellington views investment research as its core competitive advantage; the ESG analyst will be a regular contributor to the investment dialogue, including in our daily investment meeting. The ESG Analyst will work with our emerging and developed markets sovereign debt teams to define Wellington's approach to ESG sovereign debt coverage, establish and help execute an engagement agenda with sovereign issuers, and consider research partnerships to further our effort. We expect the analyst to be an important contributor to the Emerging Market Debt team's investment process.

In addition to conducting fundamental ESG research and engagement and working with portfolio management teams and analysts, the ESG Analyst will have the opportunity to represent the team and communicate our ESG integration process to clients, consultants, and prospects.

ESSENTIAL SKILLS

The following essential skills are required for the role:
  • Investment acumen and passion - We are seeking an ESG Analyst who is passionate about both global markets and sustainability issues and has experience analyzing ESG issues as they pertain to sovereign debt in the investment process. The ideal candidate will bring subject matter expertise on governance topics and environmental and social issues, along with an understanding of how these issues can impact an investment thesis, specifically in sovereign debt.
  • Superior collaboration and influencing skills - The successful candidate will enjoy contributing to a highly collaborative investment environment and will embrace the benefits of overlapping lines of idea generation. The ESG Analyst will build strong trusting relationships internally with colleagues and externally with clients, prospects, and local government/regulatory agencies. The ability to provide a point of view and challenge the status quo is critical, as is the humility to admit mistakes and a desire to learn from others; s/he must recognize the benefits of diverse perspectives. The ability to communicate (both verbally and in writing) action oriented investment recommendations clearly and with conviction and contribute to an open investment dialogue is important.
  • Growth mindset - The flexibility and openness to continue learning, evolving and growing as an analyst. The ESG Analyst will have a global perspective and creative approach for thinking about innovation and the evolution of sustainable investing and ESG as it applies to evaluating sovereign debt globally.
OTHER QUALIFICATIONS

Additional qualifications and individual characteristics include:
  • A minimum of 7 years of experience in a related role ideally at an investment management organization. Prior experience working for a multilateral agency or international financial institution (e.g., the IMF, World Bank, central bank) would be viewed favorably;
  • Demonstrated ability to employ quantitative modeling and research skills to assist in economic and market analysis;
  • Strong work ethic and attention to detail;
  • Ability to set priorities and execute a research agenda;
  • Capacity for differentiated thinking and ability to problem solve effectively;
  • Excellent written, oral and interpersonal communication skills;
  • Independence of thought, intellectual curiosity, and an entrepreneurial nature;
  • Ability to work well in a small, collaborative team, while also communicating and interacting with a broader group of investment professionals;
  • Global perspective;
  • Strong academic background, ideally including an advanced degree in Economics; and
  • Ability and willingness to travel.
SKILLS

JOB TITLE
ESG Analyst, Sovereign Debt

LOCATION
London

Title: IM EMEA Media Director
Description:
IM EMEA Media Director
BNY Mellon Investment Management is one of the world's largest investment managers. We believe that the right results begin by being relevant to every client whether that's; access the way they want it, diversifying strategies, reassurance, or quality insights for better informed decisions.

That's why we have designed a model that is truly built around investor's needs - bringing together world-class investment managers with best of breed talent and unique cultures to deliver investment outcomes. This is combined with the global scale and strength of BNY Mellon Investment Management - connecting investors with opportunities across every major asset class in more than 100 markets and 35 countries.

Today, we have eight investment management firms in our stable: Alcentra, ARX, Dreyfus Cash Investment Strategies, Insight, Mellon, Newton Investment Management, Siguler Guff and Walter Scott.

We believe this is how investing should be and we are looking for talent to help us deliver on our promise.

BNY Mellon Investment Management is part of the BNY Mellon group (the corporate brand of The Bank Of New York Mellon).

Overview:

Social Media is a core part of the Global demand strategy and the global role is responsible for developing the Social Media strategy and execution plan for BNY Mellon Investment Management. This involves working closely with key stakeholders in Marketing, Sales and Compliance within BNY Mellon Investment Management and also counterparts in the Investment firms & Corporate teams. As well as setting out a clear vision, KPIs and roadmap for the firm, the expectation is that this role will act as a centre of excellence, providing best practice and consultancy for marketers and sales to enable delivery at scale

To lead the formulation, development and implementation of paid strategy and plans for global markets. In doing so the role involves a deep understanding of the financial media in order to define and implement a robust strategy.

The role also involves evolving the existing media strategy and is not limited to just BNY Mellon investment management. The Global Media Director will need to work across the enterprise to forge relationships with marketing contacts to enable joint media initiatives to offer best value both in terms of economies of scale and value to target audience

Additionally working with the marketing team to ensure the effective execution of campaigns by supporting with media at global, regional and local levels, the enhanced use of data, in real time, is expected in order to illustrate success and examine future media investment.

Responsibilities:
  • Create an implement a strong vision for the new media function
  • Identify and adapt media strategies at an appropriate level for the differing requirements of field marketing teams (global, regional, local)
  • Review and, where necessary, change the existing media agency relationships
  • Plan and manage annual budgets in line with business requirements. Ensure that the elements of the media plans required to support marketing plans are employed in the most efficient manner and that agreed deliverables are delivered according to the defined schedule.
  • Build relationships across the enterprise, liaise and consult on media strategy and provide additional support an implementation where required
  • Develop a data led strategy to track results and outcomes from all media investment
  • Increase value for money within media. This may include more budget being allocated to media away from other channels or agencies, increased spending efficiencies, better alignment with audiences and reduction of outlay on non-value add activities.
  • Establish and agree processes around the development, delivery and compliance of all media related materials eg adverts to deliver to campaign activities on time.
  • Be involved with and consult on best practice around awards and events participation.
  • Work as part of the Marketing team and contribute towards making internal and external processes flow smoothly and efficiently
  • Keep sales, client services and sales support personnel fully informed of all media developments affecting the regions at all times.


Qualifications

Core Competencies:
  • Building Organizational Talent
  • Change Leadership
  • Client Orientation
  • Developing Partnerships
  • Driving Execution
  • Operational Decision Making
  • Global Acumen

People Management Competencies:
  • Attracting & Retaining Organisational Talent
  • Developing & Coaching Others
  • Managing for Results

BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.
Our ambition is to build the best global team - one that is representative and inclusive of the diverse talent, clients and communities we work with and serve - and to empower our team to do their best work. We support wellbeing and a balanced life, and offer a range of family-friendly, inclusive employment policies and employee forums.

Title: IM EMEA - Specialist, Product Management
Description:
IM EMEA - Specialist, Product Management
BNY Mellon Investment Management is one of the world's largest investment managers. We believe that the right results begin by being relevant to every client whether that's; access the way they want it, diversifying strategies, reassurance, or quality insights for better informed decisions.

That's why we have designed a model that is truly built around investor's needs - bringing together world-class investment managers with best of breed talent and unique cultures to deliver investment outcomes. This is combined with the global scale and strength of BNY Mellon Investment Management - connecting investors with opportunities across every major asset class in more than 100 markets and 35 countries.

Today, we have eight investment management firms in our stable: Alcentra, ARX, Dreyfus Cash Investment Strategies, Insight, Mellon, Newton Investment Management, Siguler Guff and Walter Scott.

We believe this is how investing should be and we are looking for talent to help us deliver on our promise.

BNY Mellon Investment Management is part of the BNY Mellon group (the corporate brand of The Bank Of New York Mellon).

Product Strategy Role

The role is focused on idea generation, investigation and creation of forward looking investment management products and strategies in an effort to continue to position BNY Mellon Investment Management EMEA as an industry leading investment management firm.

Critically, the individual is expected to execute on the following three areas:
  1. Product Strategy - independently create and thoroughly test and support a view on new product creation and industry direction. This requires the individual to thoroughly investigate ideas and build comprehensive business cases, communicate across the BNYM IM organisation, and achieve buy-in of key product initiatives with key stakeholders and through presentation of business case to the Product Committee. Exceptional research abilities and attention to detail are the attributes sought as is the ability to effectively work with our Investment Firm partners in all areas of current and forward-looking product developments.
  2. Sales support and ongoing product management - creation of product positioning versus peers; analyses of costs/charges, performance, AUM, net flows of existing products; recommend changes to existing products to evolve them for current and future client needs. The expectation is that the individual will become a subject matter expert in one of our key franchise areas
  3. Governance - ensure products are suitable for associated target markets and that product governance is effectively managed for the Manufactured and Non-Manufactured products IM EMEA distributes. This role will be actively involved in the annual Assessment of Value activity and in Product Distribution and Oversight initiatives. The Product Strategist will manage our Focus and Strategic Focus lists, achieving buy-in from key stakeholders for any changes.

Overall, we are looking for a hungry, focused, self-starter who is meticulous in research and has a strong curiosity to earn a deeper understanding of the investment management product lifecycle and support the future growth of IM EMEA.

Qualifications

Key Skills Required:
  • Strong understanding and experience in the asset management industry, investment techniques and pooled product structures in particular UCITS structures domiciled in Ireland and the UK.
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal with absolute attention to detail.
  • Good interpersonal skills demonstrated by an ability to credibly liaise with senior management as well as developing good working relationships with peer group colleagues.
  • A proactive approach to resolving issues as well as identifying developing opportunities.
  • Strong organization, time and project management skills.
  • Desire to learn about new aspects of investment management in particular ESG, Responsible and Sustainable Investing
  • Educated to degree level or equivalent qualifiers - IMC or CFA qualifications would be an advantage
  • Experience of Bloomberg, FERI, Lipper, Morningstar and other market analysis tools
  • Languages would also be useful but not essential. Continental European languages such as Italian, French, German or Spanish would be particularly useful.

Title: IM EMEA - Global Brand & Campaign Manager
Description:
IM EMEA - Global Brand & Campaign Manager
As Brand Manager - this role acts as a 'brand guardian' to maintain brand integrity across all company marketing initiatives and communications. The Brand manager will manage and lead the direction of core brand assets and campaigns including flagship event assets that are created centrally and can be adapted for local needs by the field marketing team.

The role also includes the management of global campaign priorities, in particular working with field marketing teams and wider team to ensure engagement and buy in to core campaigns.

As the BNY Mellon Investment Management CX project is an integral deliverable over the next few years, the role will also support the CX transformation lead on execution of the CX communications.

This is an important and highly visible role that will involve and close cooperation with members of the organisation both within marketing, but also senior execs across the business.

Responsibilities:
  • Work with the CMO/CXO to ensure effective brand management, including the setting of style guides, brand guidelines, brand vision and value proposition for short as well as long term.
  • Planning and execution of all global brand campaign assets as agreed by CMO/CXO and in accordance with the annual business plan.
  • Maintain a focus on competitor and customer insights analysis to support to support the amplification of BNY Mellon Investment Management brand and its product franchises. Lead an ongoing focus on the annual global brand report and create an action plan around it.
  • Work as part of the Marketing team and contribute towards making internal and external brand processes flow smoothly and efficiently.
  • Lead the development of central brand assets for flagship events and work with regions to deploy those assets. Identify and deliver best-in-class brand experiences at all events.
  • Act as a point of referral and escalation for branding considerations and requirements.
  • Liaise with key functions across marketing to ensure smooth roll out of marketing materials to the required brand standards
  • Plan and manage annual budgets in line with business requirements and within the boundaries of any delegated marketing spend allocated to this function.
  • Contribute towards the overall development of the company's brand and visual identity, ensuring compliance with the brand guidelines for all advertising, fund promotions, corporate gifts, conferences and corporate hospitality initiatives and/or sales campaigns.
  • Key point of contact for core brand agencies and ensuring they are effective - including chairing core status meetings as required.

Generic Management Responsibilities:

General
  • Provide accurate and appropriate management information to Senior Management.
  • Comply with all corporate policies relevant to the functions managed including Health and Safety Policy.

Financial
  • Manage any delegated budget in a manner that will best serve LOB's best interests and provide the Finance Department/Marketing Operations with monthly tracking and projection information.

Compliance
  • Be aware of current regulatory and legal obligations of the function managed.
  • Report any suspected breaches to the Compliance or Legal departments, as appropriate, immediately on discovery.

Risk Management
  • Monitor, document and report business risks and internal controls of the function managed, alerting Senior Management immediately of any significant changes.

Business Continuity
  • Maintain and test a current and effective continuity plan to ensure an appropriate response to any disruption to systems, information services, communications and office facilities.


Qualifications

  • Change Leadership
  • Client Orientation
  • Developing Partnerships
  • Driving Execution
  • Operational Decision Making

Title: Derivatives Data Analyst
Description:
Derivatives Data Analyst
WELLINGTON MANAGEMENT

Wellington Management offers comprehensive investment management capabilities that span nearly all segments of the global capital markets. Our investment solutions, tailored to the unique return and risk objectives of institutional clients in more than 55 countries, draw on a robust body of proprietary research and a collaborative culture that encourages independent thought and healthy debate. As a private partnership, we believe our ownership structure fosters a long-term view that aligns our perspectives with those of our clients.

POSITION
The Company
Tracing our roots to 1928, Wellington Management Company, LLP is one of the world's largest independent investment management firms. With over US$1 trillion in assets under management, we serve as a trusted adviser to institutional clients and mutual fund sponsors in over 60 countries. Our innovative investment solutions are built on the strength of proprietary, independent research and span nearly all segments of the global capital markets, including equity, fixed income, multi-asset, and alternative strategies. As a private partnership whose sole business is investment management, our long-term views and interests are aligned with those of our clients. We are committed to attracting a talented and diverse workforce, and to fostering an open, collaborative culture of inclusivity, because we believe multiple perspectives lead to more informed investment and business decisions. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we welcome people with diverse life experiences, fresh ideas, and specialized subject-matter expertise.

Overview
As part of the global Derivatives Operations group, the Derivatives Data Analyst (Analyst) will be responsible for supporting the collateral and margin processes for Futures, Listed, Cleared OTC, and Bilateral products across the post-execution lifecycle. This will encompass the reconciliation and instruction of daily margin requirements, processing of accounting postings, post-value control reconciliations, as well as managing queries and troubleshooting issues from both internal and external parties. The analyst will also support the settlement and lifecycle event processes such as monthly resets for Equity total return swaps, credit events/rolls and OTC option premiums/unwinds. Working with our Technology team, Brokers, and third-party providers, the Analyst will continually look for opportunities to create efficiencies within the aforementioned tasks through workflow and technology to improve the overall control framework. The Analyst will have significant interactions with our client relationship teams, Boston-based Derivatives Operational team and our outsource partner, State Street IMS West in support of setting up new client mandates, ensuring trades are captured and messaged correctly, responding to client inquires and trouble-shooting critical issues.
Responsibilities
  • Daily review of margin calls from Brokers and investigation of discrepancies
  • Daily post-value cash reconciliations of collateral and margin movements
  • Daily control reconciliations including holdings, collateral, and currency balances between our internal accounting, clearing brokers, custodians, and clearing houses.
  • Process events that impact Cleared and Bilateral OTC Derivatives positions including resets, premiums, unwinds, credit events/rolls, corporate actions, and client transitions
  • Serve as an escalation point for incoming queries and issues raised by portfolio managers, trading, clients, custodians, and brokers.
  • Work closely with the internal reconciliation team to resolve cash/position accounting breaks
  • Identify and drive process improvement opportunities to improve front to back efficiency and controls
  • Participate in industry working groups to identify new clearing opportunities and potential challenges of regulatory changes.
Qualifications
  • Strong knowledge of a variety of Derivatives products and their lifecycles
  • Back and middle office operational experience at a sell-side or buy-side firm with exposure to both Cleared and Bilateral Derivatives preferred
  • Highly motivated with strong communications skills, high attention to detail, and a problem-solving/analytical mindset
  • Must be both team-oriented and a strong independent contributor
  • Track record of driving process improvements
  • Strong Excel and SQL skills preferred
SKILLS

JOB TITLE
Derivatives Data Analyst

LOCATION
London

As an equal opportunity employer, Wellington Management ensures that all qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, religion, creed, national origin, age, ancestry, disability (physical or mental), medical condition, citizenship, marital status, pregnancy, veteran or military status, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by applicable law . If you are a candidate with a disability, or are assisting a candidate with a disability, and require an accommodation to apply for one of our jobs, please email us at GMCANINQ@wellington.com .

Title: Website Product Owner
Description:
Website Product Owner
WELLINGTON MANAGEMENT

Wellington Management offers comprehensive investment management capabilities that span nearly all segments of the global capital markets. Our investment solutions, tailored to the unique return and risk objectives of institutional clients in more than 55 countries, draw on a robust body of proprietary research and a collaborative culture that encourages independent thought and healthy debate. As a private partnership, we believe our ownership structure fosters a long-term view that aligns our perspectives with those of our clients.

POSITION

The Global Marketing team partners with client-facing colleagues to drive marketing efforts that communicate the firm's investment capabilities, culture, and brand. We plan and execute marketing programs to position the firm's capabilities, culture and brand in the context of our client's business challenges, with the objective of retaining clients and growing our business.

The Website Product Owner is a new position within the Global Marketing team. This individual would be accountable for ensuring that it is easy for our clients, prospects, and consultant audiences to interact with us digitally via the web. This role will partner closely with our technology colleagues on the maintenance, management, and enhancement of our global websites.

As a global role in our digital center of excellence, the Website Product Owner will create and maintain our websites planned release program and drive the prioritization of initiatives and enhancements. The individual will collaborate with regional digital marketing leads and with our marketing partners globally to understand their business needs and ensure that our roadmap reflects those needs and prioritizes them appropriately. The role will also partner with groups outside of marketing (client service, HR, other) to ensure that their needs are also reflected in our websites roadmap.

The individual will be the primary resource to communicate, rollout and support training on new website features and capabilities and will work with our operations and technology partners to make sure that our 'operate the website' documentation and processes are kept up to date. This will involve partnering closely with other teams across marketing. The role will also lead governance functions related to our global websites and will collaborate with other teams across the Client Group on governance and coordination.

The role will also be the primary point of escalation for issue resolution, support coordination and vendor management. The role will also own and coordinate non-functional requirements, from accessibility, to performance, to tagging, to technical SEO, to privacy and information security. The individual will define reporting requirements and ensure that regular reporting is being provided to appropriate audiences.

Funds and thought leadership content are key components of our web experience, and this role will be very aware of the processes and capabilities required to keep this content and data up to date across our global web properties.

Lastly, and most importantly, the role will work closely across the Client Group to ensure that our clients, prospects and consultants (and other audiences) have a consistent, high quality experience (low in friction, high in value) across our website properties (marketing, servicing, other) and will help define and optimize core user journeys across the platform - in particular shared journeys across our global web properties.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Roadmap and Prioritization

•Maintain the web product roadmap (enhancements, features, etc.)

•Act as the Product Owner of the Web related agile teams (gather input from the regional teams, prioritize stories into PIs, run daily stand ups, sprint planning meetings, etc.)

•Work with business and UX teams to document requirements, identify solutions, etc.

•Apply a data driven approach to define, prioritise and validate the Product roadmap and backlog, using multiple data sources and customer insight (qualitative and quantitative) and to continuously drive improvements in the online user experience

Subject Matter Expertise & Operations

•Know how the CMS (and any integrations) work

•Make sure user documentation and process documentation is kept up to date

•Work with Technology on development best practices and deployment processes

•Work with Marketing on experience design and publishing best practices and processes

•Rollout and train users on new features/capabilities/integrations, and define and support self-service offerings

•Understand both backstage (hosting, CDN, infosec) and front stage (CMS, modules, templates, tagging, SEO) technology, teams and processes

•Understand the marketing and servicing web experiences and infrastructure and how the relate to each other

•Work with IT and QA teams to ensure that automated tests are up to date and capturing any issues

Governance

•Work with the regions to coordinate on cross experience enhancements and optimizations

•Ensure naming conventions are being followed etc.

•Work with Content COE and Design teams to make sure that templates, modules and components are documented and up to date

•Collaborate across teams to ensure standards are established and used across the platform (accessibility, SEO, analytics, performance etc.).

•Establish processes for new site launches, new feature launches, etc.

QUALIFICATIONS
•Deep digital expertise coupled with relevant investment management (institutional, intermediary, wealth), or financial services experience
•Knowledge of the Agile methodology
•Experience with different digital marketing channels - web, email, search, social, syndication, digital events and digital advertising
•Experience with CMS platforms, Email Automation (Marketo, Marketing Cloud), Technical SEO, Accessibility and Mobile, Google Analytics, Tableau and Salesforce CRM
•Critical thinking and problem-solving skills
•Excellent time and project management skills
•Strong interpersonal and communications skills
•Familiarity with HTML, CSS, JavaScript desirable
•Naturally curious and highly proactive

SKILLS

JOB TITLE
Website Product Owner

LOCATION
London

Title: Operational Risk and Governance Associate Director – Markets
Description:
Operational Risk and Governance Associate Director – Markets
Lead the engagement with our EMEA based markets-facing business groups, including Commodities & Global Markets, Macquarie Capital Equities, and the segregated Corporate Operations Division. This role will offer you an outstanding opportunity to apply your risk skills and financial markets experience to implement and further develop our Operational Risk strategy across the region.

You will work closely with senior business and risk management leaders across the group and be responsible for the continual refinement and implementation of the Operational Risk Management Framework. You will review and evaluate new business and change initiatives; ensuring that key operational risks are identified and managed, along with challenging the scope and outcome of business risk reporting, targeted assessments, significant incidents, key risk indicators, projects and assurance activities.

We're looking for a Risk expert with demonstrated experience in a similar Markets Operational Risk role from within an dynamic international financial institution or financial services firm. With a strong working knowledge of the regulatory environment in which we operate in, you will possess a strong commercial acumen and have an analytical mindset to make sound recommendations on operational risk issues. With leadership experience, you will effectively be able to build relationships with stakeholders locally and globally.

If you're passionate about Risk Management, have strong attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high quality outcomes, then we want to hear from you!

About the Risk Management Group

The Risk Management Group (RMG) is an independent and centralised function responsible for objective review and challenge, oversight, monitoring and reporting in relation to Macquarie's material risks. RMG designs and oversees the implementation of the risk management framework. Its divisions include Credit, Market Risk, Regulatory Affairs and Aggregate Risk, Financial Crime Risk, Compliance, Operational Risk & Governance, Behavioural Risk, Enterprise Support and Internal Audit.

Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. Title: Corporate Governance Liquidations Manager, 12 Month Fixed Term Contract
Description:
Corporate Governance Liquidations Manager, 12 Month Fixed Term Contract
Take ownership of the Corporate Governance aspects of this Project and come and join our dynamic London Liquidation Projects team on a 12 month contract with the possibility of extension.

You will provide key governance and company secretarial inputs into the project and support to senior directors, business group heads and support divisions on a global project to liquidate/dissolve entities that are no longer required. You will be the main corporate governance contact in the team and will take the lead on implementing the corporate governance/company secretarial elements of the dissolution step plans.

Your responsibilities will include:
  • conducting due diligence on entities proposed for dissolution/liquidation
  • supporting team members both in the FMG Liquidation Project Team and the local Governance team with regards to compiling, finalising and signing off on said due diligence
  • drafting board resolutions and related documents
  • attending and minuting Board meetings and following up on actions
  • working closely with key internal stakeholders (including Finance, Tax, Treasury, Compliance and Legal) as well as external advisers where necessary, to formulate and implement dissolution step plans
  • managing, advising and reporting on the dissolution of entities and assisting with the tracking of related cost savings.

You will be driven and self-motivated and will have strong company secretarial and corporate governance knowledge and experience gained in a similar, faced paced environment. You will have an appropriate qualification, ICSA is preferred, but above all will be able to demonstrate a passion for what you do. Your integrity and pragmatic approach to problems will be your strength along with the ability to communicate with people at all levels within our business. You are a team player, can multi-task and have a successful track record in a relevant corporate governance related role.

If this sounds like your next role, then please apply now!

About the Financial Management Group

The Financial Management Group provides financial, tax and treasury services to all areas of Macquarie. The group is focused on providing strategic analysis and advice to Macquarie's businesses and senior management, managing Macquarie's funding, liquidity and capital position, ensuring Macquarie continues to meet regulatory and compliance obligations and managing Macquarie's corporate affairs.

Title: Front End UI Developer
Description:
Front End UI Developer
Looking for a Front-End developer to participate in a global technology project to deliver new risk system and supporting front-office platforms in a fast-paced environment.

Commodities and Global Markets (CMF) group provides clients with risk and capital solutions across physical and financial markets, providing financing, financial hedging, physical execution and access to market pricing for clients exposed to commodities and financial markets. Technology team are key partners with the business.

Our small team of technologists means you will have an immediate impact on the production system, as well as being able to offer a variety of opportunities for our team members.

The close relationship to the business provides agile process means you can get the quick satisfaction from a job well done. Our flexible, open workspace encourages collaboration and supports working with the people who can best help you get the job done.

Key responsibilities:
  • Deliver high quality, low maintenance software solutions that is fast and efficient for our key commodities trading and risk systems
  • Provide architecture & design for the deal capture and management components
  • Work with technology stakeholders to devise solutions that will fulfill business requirements and meet organizational strategic goals
  • Foster strong working & collaborative relationships with the business & technology stakeholders across multiple locations
  • Contribute to process improvement initiatives.
  • Provide maintenance and enhancements to the existing applications.

You will be degree qualified in Computer Science or similar with proven development experience in Angular.

Specific Technical Skills:
  • Experience with recent versions of Angular
  • Experience with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3 and SaSS is required
  • Experience with basic shell scripting
  • Experience with RxJS preferred
  • Experience with E2E Testing tools preferred
  • Knowledge of Kubernetes, Docker

Non-Technical Skills:
  • Ability to provide analysis on complex problems and present findings in a cohesive and easy to understand manner
  • Collaborate effectively within a global IT environment across multiple locations
  • Adaptable, accountable, solution orientated and possesses excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Strong communication and documentation skills

If you would like more information, please visit www.macquarie.com/careers

The Corporate Operations Group brings together specialist support services in Digital Transformation & Data, Technology, Market Operations, Human Resources, Business Services, Business Improvement & Strategy, and the Macquarie Group Foundation. The Corporate Operations Group's purpose is to power the entrepreneurial enterprise.

Title: Senior Analyst – RAAR EMEA, Stress Testing and Capital Management Oversight (Scenario design focus)
Description:
Senior Analyst – RAAR EMEA, Stress Testing and Capital Management Oversight (Scenario design focus)
Join our Regulatory Affairs and Aggregate Risk (RAAR) team and play a key role in stress testing and the second line oversight of capital management across our EMEA businesses and regulated entities.

The RAAR team in the EMEA region is focused on prudential rule interpretation and risk oversight for local regulated entities (including a UK and European Bank and a number of UK and European Investment and Asset Management Firms), stress testing, capital management oversight, recovery, resolution and wind-down planning, and economic capital assessment for the EMEA non-banking entities in the Macquarie group.

As a member of the team, you will play a key role in managing and coordinating the enterprise-wide stress testing exercises for Macquarie's EMEA regulated entities (including UK and European banking entities, investment firms and asset managers). This involves risk identification and design of stress scenarios, scenario execution in collaboration with Finance and Treasury colleagues and risk specialists, and the analysis of stress testing results. In particular, we would like to see you bring knowledge to and take a leading role in the risk identification and scenario design part of the stress testing framework.

Your work on stress testing will cover capital management (i.e. internal capital adequacy assessment processes), Recovery Planning, reverse stress testing, climate risk scenario analysis, and other ad hoc needs (e.g. assessment following a material change in business strategy). You will also have the opportunity to collaborate with liquidity management teams to drive alignment between capital liquidity stress testing exercises.The role offers plenty of exposure and the opportunity to lead material components of the stress testing framework, as well as the chance to collaborate with stakeholders across the organisation, including Finance, Risk, Treasury, Front Office, senior management and Global teams.

To be successful in this role, you will need to bring the following key skills and experience:

- a sound knowledge and experience in stress testing, with a focus on the design of stress scenarios
- experience with risk identification, scenario development, defining scenario shocks and ideally, familiarity with scenario shock expansion tools (e.g. Oxford Economics)
- familiarity with UK and EU regulatory requirements and a keen interest in remaining up to date with the latest changes
- strong interest in macroeconomic and market stress themes
- prior experience in a similar role within a financial institution, consultancy practice or regulatory body
- an academic background in economics of finance
- strong numerical and analytical skills with great attention to detail
- strong verbal and written communication stills.

If this sounds like the right opportunity for you to take the next step in your career, please apply today.

About the Risk Management Group

The Risk Management Group (RMG) is an independent, centralised unit responsible for ensuring all risk across Macquarie are appropriately assessed and managed. Its divisions include Behavioural Risk, Compliance, Credit, Financial Crime Risk, Internal Audit, Market Risk, Operational Risk, Regulatory Affairs and Aggregate Risk, and RMG Enterprise Support.

Title: Spanish or German speaking Senior Analyst or Associate, Infrastructure Projects & Principal
Description:
Spanish or German speaking Senior Analyst or Associate, Infrastructure Projects & Principal
As an Analyst or Associate in our team, you will be involved in investment of the Macquarie Capital balance sheet as principal in infrastructure projects and companies across Europe, encompassing both greenfield project development, including PPPs, and brownfield principal investments, including core+/value-add infrastructure, spanning the energy, transport, social and digital infrastructure sectors. The role is to join the Infrastructure Projects and Principal team in London raising and negotiating committed external debt and balance sheet equity for infrastructure opportunities, building financial models, negotiating commercial contracts, conducting due diligence, market and industry research, preparing materials to support an transaction for both internal and external stakeholders and engaging professionally with our counterparties, such as industry partners and global co-investors, due diligence advisors and client representatives.

Recently the team has completed such transactions as the £1.2bn Silvertown Tunnel PPP project in the UK, and the acquisition of a Fibre-to-the-Home network from MasMovil in Spain, and won various industry awards such as Financial Advisor and Sponsor of the year (both for the second year running) at the 2020 Partnership Awards.

You will have an outstanding academic record and combine the knowledge obtained in your undergraduate degree (preferably in Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Engineering or Law) with your previous experience (2-4 years) within the infrastructure and/or energy (excluding oil and gas) sectors in either Investment Banking, Project Finance, Project Development, Principal Investing, or an Infrastructure Fund to quickly make an impact. There is a strong preference for candidates with relevant principal investing experience within the digital/data infrastructure, core+/value-add, civil or social infrastructure sectors. Spanish or German language skills will also be required.

You will use your expertise in project finance modelling to evaluate performance under various operating scenarios to analyse the impacts of different capital structures. Your knowledge of all stages in infrastructure transaction execution, including origination, diligence, and execution of equity, debt, and M&A transactions will enable you to summarise and present the results in a succinct manner.

If you have experience of arranging and structuring equity or debt for greenfield infrastructure projects and/or brownfield infrastructure transactions, including core+/value-add infrastructure, in the energy, transport, social, digital infrastructure sectors, in a comparable organisation, we want to hear from you.

About Macquarie Capital

Macquarie Capital offers global capability in M&A Advisory, Debt and Equity Capital Markets, Principal Finance, and Equity Trading and Research underpinned by deep specialist expertise across a range of sectors. Our people are empowered to think innovatively to address client challenges and originate opportunities, thinking beyond individual transactions to become a trusted adviser and partner over the long haul. From origination to execution, our unique combination of ideas, capital and expertise is transforming opportunity into reality for our clients and partners around the world.

With staff in 35 offices transacting across 31 countries, Macquarie Capital is a truly global business. A role in the team will expose you to a dynamic working environment and the opportunity to contribute to high-profile transactions whilst working in a business with the best people in the industry.

Title: Originator (Analyst), Upstream Lending (EMEA)
Description:
Originator (Analyst), Upstream Lending (EMEA)
Join our Commodities and Global Markets business as an Analyst in our Upstream Lending team in London.

You will be responsible for originating, structuring and delivering / managing complex transactions as part of a team specialising in the provision of finance (primarily structured debt, reserve based lending, prepayments, etc) to upstream oil & gas companies, focused on the EMEA region.

Main activities will involve transaction origination, structuring, risk assessment, negotiation, documentation & ongoing deal/relationship management post close.

Ideally you will have some sales and origination experience, preferably gained in a utility, energy major, research unit or a financial institution.

Knowledge of upstream oil and gas would be useful. A detailed understanding of financial modelling / MS Excel is critical.

We would value candidates educated to Masters level in a relevant subject with a focus on numerical analysis, although this is not essential.

If this sounds exciting, please apply now.

About Commodities and Global Markets

Commodities and Global Markets provides clients with an integrated, end-to-end offering across global markets including equities, fixed income, foreign exchange and commodities.

Title: Enterprise Data Management, Manager
Description:
Enterprise Data Management, Manager
As a Manager in the Financial Management Group's Data Office, you will help drive the rollout of the Enterprise Data Management and Data Governance requirements in the EMEA and Americas regions.

Reporting directly to the Enterprise Data Management lead in EMEA, you will help drive:
  • the task to bring Financial Management Group data under governance through critical data element identification, definition and mapping
  • the implementation of data management capabilities and processes (e.g. Data Quality Management, Metadata Management, Master and Reference Data Management)
  • stakeholder engagement at all levels of the organisation to understand priorities, risks and issues
  • the design and implementation of data governance
  • the development and execution of information management (data management) strategies and roadmaps.

You will bring a relevant Bachelor's degree, coupled with excellent stakeholder management and influencing skills. Previous experience with Enterprise Data Management programs including BCBS239 deployment would be highly regarded.

Your experience in a financial services organisation preferably with regulatory reporting experience will be highly advantageous but is not necessary if you come from another large, complex organisation. In addition, you will be able to demonstrate the ability to communicate with cross functional teams, possess a high level of written and verbal communication skills, and be an influential member of the team in order to motivate project stakeholders.

If you are genuinely passionate about continuous improvement and delivering seamless high-quality projects, we would like to hear from you.

Title: Java Engineer
Description:
Java Engineer
We are looking for a talented developer with 2+ years of experience to join our Transaction Reporting team. As part of the team, you will help build out our cloud-based platform and support the existing systems. We offer the opportunity to use the latest technologies like Akka, Docker, Kubernetes and EKS to deliver highly scalable and robust systems, which are responsible for meeting Macquarie Group's regulatory transaction reporting needs. You will be working with multi-talented and diverse teams in multiple geographical locations in a fast-paced, challenging environment.

To succeed in this role, you need to be a self-motivated individual and possess excellent communication skills to engage with stakeholders. You have a resilient character and relish opportunities to stretch yourself.

Your responsibilities:
  • Deliver well tested technical JIRAs.
  • Contribute to design and refinement sessions; interact with users to understand their needs.
  • Ability to prioritise and meet deadlines in highly innovative and fast paced environment.
  • Work in a geographically dispersed team
  • Support automated system testing, user testing, and production implementation.
  • Provide L2/3 support

Must have:
  • Experience with
    • One or more JDK languages - we primarily use Java 11 but are happy to hear from candidates using Scala, Kotlin or others!
    • SQL Databases (Postgres 12+ preferred)
    • Unit testing and TDD
    • Git
    • Messaging formats - XML, JSON
  • Desire to
    • Build robust long-lived cloud-native applications.
    • Use their strong interpersonal skills to derive requirements from stakeholders.
    • Support what we deploy in production.
    • Challenge, innovate and help drive our deliveries and shape our technical direction.
    • Take on board feedback and use this to adapt and grow.

Nice to have:
  • Experience with
    • Frontend Development
    • Stash
    • API Design (particularly using Spring Boot)
    • Middleware and communication (Solace, RabbitMQ, SQS or others)
    • Messaging formats - Protobuf
    • Docker
    • Kubernetes
    • AWS
    • NoSql Databases
    • Atlassian JIRA
    • Agile/Scrum working and methodologies.
    • Bamboo
    • uDeploy
    • Argo CD

Title: Fund Management Associate, Infrastructure & Real Assets
Description:
Fund Management Associate, Infrastructure & Real Assets
Macquarie Infrastructure and Real Assets division has an opportunity for a qualified accountant with some post qualification experience to join the team in our London office.

Work within the Fund Management team as an Associate, where you will be a key member of a team responsible for management and statutory reporting for the Infrastructure & Real Assets business in Europe.

You will be responsible for managing the finance and operations of the Macquarie Infrastructure and Real Assets investment vehicles, which invest into infrastructure and real assets throughout Europe, with the aim of providing income and capital growth to investors. Your role will focus on the Infrastructure and Renewables products, gaining exposure to the flagship Macquarie European Infrastructure Funds and the Macquarie Green Investment Group Renewable Energy Funds.

Your experience in a similar type role- for example, working on closed-end or open-ended private equity funds would be advantageous, although not essential. You will however be degree-educated, coupled with a formal accounting qualification with post qualification experience.

Your responsibilities will require you to:
  • have oversight of external service providers and asset finance teams, including reviewing financial statements, tax calculations, fee calculations and reconciliations
  • coordinate and prepare financial statements and other reporting obligations for our Funds and their subsidiaries, including, where required, liaise with asset finance teams, other internal MIRA specialist teams, external service providers, auditors and other commercial counterparties
  • be involved in treasury management, budgeting and forecasting for the funds including optimising the FX and hedging requirements of the Fund and managing investor drawdown and distributions
  • provide accounting consultation and advice to the business teams and asset finance teams
  • assist on transaction advisory and execution work-streams through the acquisition, ownership, and divestment lifecycles
  • co-ordinate ad hoc reporting or responses to individual questions or due diligence requests from Investors
  • attend Fund and subsidiary Board Meetings involving the review of board papers and presentation of these papers to entity boards as required and providing board members with information and analysis to make decisions related to the financial management of these entities.

Your technical competencies will enable you to deal with complex group structures and accounting issues, high level of IT literacy and advanced excel skills, partnered with your experience and understanding of IFRS, consolidations and multi-currency environments will be well utilised in this role.

You will have excellent written and oral communication skills, be a highly motivated, proactive and resilient individual. You will demonstrate sound business judgement and possess strong interpersonal skills which will give you the ability to liaise with stakeholders at all levels.

About Macquarie Asset Management

As at 31 March 2020, Macquarie Asset Management has $A606.9 billion of assets under management.

Title: Big Data Lead
Description:
Big Data Lead
As a Lead Data Engineer, you will be working on a global initiative to take our data platforms and practice to the next level.

You will be leading the data and analytic solutions for our trading businesses. The existing platform is one year old, and this is an opportunity to contribute to the evolution of the platform and the team.

You will bring to the team senior experience of working in big data environments. You will apply your knowledge around continuous improvement and integrating new services and third-party products.

Knowledge of the following would be useful:

• Experience with open source big data technologies. (Spark, Presto, Airflow, Cloud Storage)

• Public cloud infrastructure (networking, instances, security) and services (e.g. lambda, RDS etc.).

• Containerization (ideally with Kubernetes).

• Data prep, transformation, and pipe lining (ideally spark).

• Logging and Monitoring solutions

• Coding languages: Python/Java/Scala/Bash

If you would like to apply your skills is a fast-paced environment, building next generation data platforms for our market leading trading business, please apply now

Title: Desktop Engineer
Description:
Desktop Engineer
Work in a team of engineers who are responsible for the design and deployment of solutions using Technology services like Windows 10, Configuration Manager, and hardware devices.

As a Desktop Engineer, you will join the Devices and Desktop Services team, which supports and enables our global activities by providing a global desktop platform. This area has seen significant growth in the past few years and focuses on group-wide, user-facing technologies that enhance the way the group collaborates and does business. The team is currently engaged in several projects including cloud-based productivity and collaboration tools, enhanced mobility and BYOD, virtual desktop enhancements, Windows 10, MacBook, security product upgrades, and various business-driven projects.

With your self-starter attitude and broad range of experience in the enterprise IT world, you will be responsible for helping to support the Windows 10 desktop experience for our businesses around the globe across a range of device options utilizing Configuration Manager Current Branch. You will also help in enhancing or replacing existing operational processes for Windows 10 to provide the best possible end user experience.

You will need to have:
  • Windows 10 Windows Defender, Active Directory Group Policy, Configuration Manager Current Branch, Scripting skills with Windows PowerShell.
  • In depth knowledge of System Centre Configuration Manager infrastructure and system maintenance (SCCM Admin / troubleshooting skills)
  • A strong interest in delivering and enhancing user experience and productivity through mobile solutions
  • Basic understanding of Enterprise technologies (firewalls, routing, Windows and Unix servers, storage, virtualisation, and cloud technologies)
  • A demonstrated ability to exhibit technical credibility with both IT and business stakeholders
  • Ability to take initiative, work independently, and manage tasks to a timeline.

If you are excited to join a progressive technology team then apply now.

Title: Macquarie Insurance Facility – Associate
Description:
Macquarie Insurance Facility – Associate
The Macquarie Insurance Facility is an aggregated insurance buying programme that was originally created to deliver portfolio benefits to Macquarie owned and managed assets. Through its scale and buying power, it has delivered savings in excess of US$215m to participating businesses. In addition to the Macquarie assets, it is now accessed by over 40 Private Equity firms and Infrastructure Funds representing 450+ portfolio companies. Together, the Macquarie assets and third-party businesses represent 450 companies and over US$1bn of premium spend, making it one of the largest buyers of insurance in the world.

Joining our EMEA Macquarie Insurance Facility team as an Executive, you will perform duties to optimize the usage and delivery of this function within Macquarie and to third parties. You will have regular interaction with brokers and key insurance markets and be responsible for embedding and developing relationships with portfolio companies and third-party prospects. You will ensure we are integrated into insurance placements and renewal processes and assist Macquarie deal teams with M&A insurance (e.g. W&I, tax and title).

This role within the team will increase technical insurance competencies allowing greater consultative and problem-solving abilities. This will enhance our relationships with customers, grow new relationships and thereby increase revenue.

Your responsibilities will span across two key areas:

Brokers and key insurance markets:
  • oversee the asset portfolio and help manage renewal process throughout calendar year, with a specific focus on EMEA.
  • work closely with main brokers and their associated central teams - attend weekly meetings and hold regular telephone conversations.
  • utilise your existing knowledge of broker networks to help generate future opportunities.
  • maintain communication with key insurance markets focusing on current deal activity and risk appetite
  • be responsible for managing / delivering appropriate insurer pipelines and understand specific strengths and weaknesses of each insurer based on past performances.
  • articulate our offerings and market value to brokers and insurers.
  • work closely with asset managers within Macquarie in order to understand the individual businesses with a specific focus on insurance opportunities / requirements, particularly M&A insurance products.
  • participate in broker / insurer sponsored events to communicate offerings / capabilities to asset managers, portfolio companies, third parties and colleagues.
  • track insurer agreements and have a thorough understanding of which markets can be utilized in which territory per line of business and dovetail with new business opportunities.


Portfolio companies & third-party prospects:
  • meet with portfolio companies and understand their insurance requirements, the current programmes and any potential changes to the business that will affect insurances.
  • create and embed a renewal process into the current culture. Achieved by visiting portfolio company / third party during the renewal cycle and matching their renewal objectives with our abilities.
  • attend prospect meetings and present on our offerings
  • co-ordinate and facilitate client forums, workshops and other client events.


Your prior experience within an insurance position liaising with different stakeholders within an insurance transaction, including but not limited to, managing colleagues internally or other parties external to your firm, will be beneficial in this role. You will have broad and regular experience of dealing with clients and/or insurers and/or brokers. Your strong communication and interpersonal skills, enthusiasm, motivation and the ability to be proactive will be welcomed in this role.
