Title: Senior Business Analyst, 6 Month Fixed Term Contract
Description:
Senior Business Analyst, 6 Month Fixed Term Contract
We have an excellent opportunity for a Senior Business Analyst with a background in financial services to join Macquarie's Financial Management Group as part of the EMEA Project and Change team.

You will have demonstrated experience in business analysis and project delivery within an Agile project framework, with emphasis on platforms and understanding system integration across multiple systems. You must be confident working across various business groups and functional teams, within capital and liquidity reporting change projects.

Your key responsibilities will include:
  • initial focus will be initiating the Capital Requirements Directive 5 (CRD V) project (operational readiness for compliance with the European Banking Authority's suite of CRD V requirements)
  • as a key member of an Agile project scrum team, involvement will extend through the project lifecycle, assisting with planning, impact assessment, solution design, testing and implementation
  • engaging with project managers, business subject matter experts and technology systems owners to supplement existing business and systems knowledge to document current and future state processes and conduct change impact analysis'
  • creating/ updating business requirements for new and refined requirements
  • working closely with the technical analysts to ensure business and functional requirements are correctly translated into technical specifications
  • documenting and owning business acceptance test cases
  • executing detailed data-testing, validating results against documented requirements
  • identifying and investigating unexpected behaviours / patterns in input and output data
  • managing, reviewing, and analysing testing issues and identifying options and recommendations
  • supporting the business through execution of business acceptance/user acceptance test cases
  • documenting of target business process and business readiness task list
  • internal stakeholder management.

You will have experience working on projects in the financial services industry. You will also have experience within financial institutions and having worked on regulatory capital and liquidity projects previously. You will have a proven track record of delivering project outcomes; proven experience as a business analyst working on regulatory change projects and/or new platform implementations; the ability to relay information to key stakeholders succinctly and with clarity and an understanding of key testing principles and proven testing experience on data-focussed projects.

To be successful in this role you will need to be comfortable working with and interpreting large volumes of data. You will also need to be familiar with Data modelling EBA taxonomy and / or Axiom would be highly advantageous.

You will also have:
  • an analytical mindset, with a close eye for detail
  • experience working with Agile would be advantageous
  • ability to coordinate multiple assignments and work independently
  • strong experience in project documentation and experience in all stages of project life cycles including analysis, design, build and test support and implementation
  • demonstrated stakeholder engagement and management skills
  • a flexible, proactive, solution-oriented approach.

If this sounds like your next role, then please apply now!

About the Financial Management Group

The Financial Management Group provides financial, tax and treasury services to all areas of Macquarie. The group is focused on providing strategic analysis and advice to Macquarie's businesses and senior management, managing Macquarie's funding, liquidity and capital position, ensuring Macquarie continues to meet regulatory and compliance obligations and managing Macquarie's corporate affairs.

Title: Data Engineer - London
Description:
Data Engineer - London
As a Data Engineer in the Data and Analytics team, you will be working on a global initiative to take our data platforms and practice to the next level.

Using the latest technologies and techniques, you will be developing analytic reporting solutions as part of an agile team for our trading businesses. The platform is one year old and this is an opportunity to contribute to the evolution of the platform.

We are looking for an experienced data engineer. Experience in Spark and building data pipelines is a must. Containerization/Kubernetes experience is highly desirable, as is experience in application monitoring solutions such as Grafana/Prometheus.

This is a rapidly evolving area and we want people who will bring a learning mindset. Your success will be enabled by the ability to communicate effectively with a diverse set of stakeholders. If you can code, love data and want to work on innovative projects, then apply now!

The Corporate Operations Group (COG) brings together specialist support services including workplace, human resources, market operations and technology. COG's purpose is to drive operational excellence through business-aligned services with a focus on quality, cost and risk. COG comprises the following divisions: Business Improvement and Strategy, Business Services, Human Resources, Market Operations, and Technology.

Title: Software Development Manager –Investment Management – Indices
Description:
Posted by:
Toby Rees
Recruiter
View profile & contact
Software Development Manager –Investment Management – Indices. A consultancy are assign a financial markets firm in the delivery of a number of new systems for their financial indices business and have an opportunity for a Software Development Manager to play a key role in managing development effort for the systems.

You will work in a buy-side aligned environment on portfolio/fund management related systems to manage and oversee offshore and onshore development activities for both fixed income and equities products. This is a Microsoft-stack technology environment with a distributed development team working in an Agile/SAFe deliveries.

You should apply for this role if you are/have:

  • 10+ years in financial markets software development/development management
  • Front office/portfolio management systems experience for asset, investment or fund management
  • Strong experience in the C#/.NET technology stack with strong database experience
  • Experience with systems supporting fixed income or equities businesses
  • Demonstrable experience managing offshore development teams across multiple geographies
  • Degree educated or higher from a leading academic institution

This is a £750-850/day role based London initially for five months.

Title: HR & Payroll Assistant
Description:
VTB Capital’s goal is to be Russia’s Investment Banking powerhouse. We want to be the firm that is a natural choice for all Russian Investment banking and asset management products. A choice our clients around the world make routinely and with confidence. Our mission is to exceed client expectations by providing first class financial services. To create value for the benefit of our clients and for economic and social progress globally.

Principal Accountabilities

​Payroll

  • Assist in processing Payroll – collect payroll documentation and complete input spreadsheet in an accurate and timely manner
  • Liaise with 3rd party payroll provider
  • Assist in setting standards and propose timetables for data which will allow efficient and effective processing
  • Assist in advising colleagues on appropriate procedures in line with VTB’s guidelines
  • Assist in regular review and reconciliation of all relevant control accounts
  • Maintain adequate documentation of all payroll/payments in accordance with VTB’s policies and procedures
  • Assist in maintaining all written procedures relating to Payroll processing
  • Ensure that issues are promptly identified and followed up and that any queries or requests for information are responded to promptly
  • Ensure that all month and year end activities are carried out to the agreed timetable
  • Assist with external audit requirements
  • Assist in good internal and external relationship management
  • Preparation of ad hoc reporting as required
  • Ensure payroll and third party payments are reconciled, funded and charged correctly and in a timely manner to the General Ledger
  • Undertake such duties as reasonably requested by the Line Manager

HR

  • Support HR Business Partner
  • HR invoice submission. tracking, analysis, approval and collation to forward  to accounts payable
  • Undertake such duties as reasonably requested by the Line Manager

Key Competencies & Qualifications

Technical

  • Previous payroll experience
  • Strong PC literacy including excellent practical knowledge of Excel, Word and Powerpoint
  • Previous experience of data management/ maintenance and responsibility for accuracy of data within HR systems

​Personal

  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills
  • Drive, ability to work under pressure, flexible
  • Ability to prioritise/ strong organisational skills
  • Keen attention to detail
  • Team player

Title: Senior Energy and Infrastructure M&A Lawyer
Description:
Senior Energy and Infrastructure M&A Lawyer
Take ownership of your career and join our Macquarie Capital legal team, based in London. The team sits within and works alongside the Macquarie Capital business group and has day-to-day interaction with the Macquarie Capital and Green Investment Group deal teams based in London, Edinburgh, Frankfurt, Paris, Amsterdam and Johannesburg and was recently named Financial Services Team of the Year (Legal 500 UK Awards 2020).

You will provide robust legal advice (including reviewing and negotiating transaction documents), focused on the Infrastructure and Energy business in the Macquarie Capital and Green Investment Group business, including mergers & acquisitions, financing and disposals by Macquarie Capital and Green Investment Group as principal investor, consortium and joint venture arrangements, development and construction stage infrastructure and renewables investments, public private partnerships and project finance. You will also be involved with coordinating and managing the provision of external legal advice to Macquarie Capital and Green Investment Group and assisting in dispute resolution.

You are an experienced M&A Lawyer with 3-7 years' post qualified experience in your relevant jurisdiction and have strong experience in either mergers and acquisitions or projects (candidates with both and/or strong infrastructure M&A experience preferred), gained from working in a law firm or in-house. Experience working on infrastructure and/or renewables projects would be beneficial as would Spanish language skills.

Organised and proactive in your approach, you will bring initiative, self-direction and a high attention to detail. Your strong sense of personal motivation will see you complete projects and provide advice in a timely manner.

If you are enthusiastic team player and want to take your career to the next level, we want to hear from you!

About Macquarie Capital

Macquarie Capital offers global capability in M&A Advisory, Debt and Equity Capital Markets, Principal Finance, and Equity Trading and Research underpinned by deep specialist expertise across a range of sectors. Our people are empowered to think innovatively to address client challenges and originate opportunities, thinking beyond individual transactions to become a trusted adviser and partner over the long haul. From origination to execution, our unique combination of ideas, capital and expertise is transforming opportunity into reality for our clients and partners around the world.

With staff in 35 offices transacting across 31 countries, Macquarie Capital is a truly global business. Title: Risk Enterprise Support (RES) Projects & Change Analyst (FTC or Perm)
Description:
Risk Enterprise Support (RES) Projects & Change Analyst (FTC or Perm)
This is a great opportunity for you to join our Risk Management Group, an independent, centralised unit responsible for ensuring all risk across Macquarie are appropriately assessed and managed.

The EMEA Risk Enterprise Support Projects & Change (P&C) team works closely with global colleagues to deliver both internal and external change initiatives. The team are responsible for the implementation and governance of the Risk Management EMEA project portfolio.

In this role you will join an experienced project team supporting them with your business analysis skills, using proven change management tools to identify and implement change as well as assist in the delivery of key regulatory change initiatives. You will also act as a key contact prioritising EMEA project portfolio with global project roadmaps and ensuring regional change and needs are considered in the global Risk portfolio.

As an experienced Project and Change Manager at this level, you will have a proven record of strong stakeholder management, ideally with knowledge of risk management frameworks and processes and have gained experience in shaping and delivering solutions that manage both our external obligations and allow our Risk Management Group to effectively manage risk.

As a member of the RES Projects & Change team, you will be responsible for:
  • Supporting the EMEA PMO lead in managing and reporting the EMEA Book of Work, prioritising and understanding the scope of regional and global initiatives
  • Identifying, assessing and implementing change using business analysis, continuous improvement techniques and project management tools. This will include the delivery of small-medium sized projects.
  • Supporting the P&C team with the delivery of change in the region ensuring effective management of project scope, capacity resourcing and reporting
  • Working with Sydney colleagues, own the delivery of the EMEA PMO and ensuring the team adhere to project governance tools and framework
  • Build strong and effective relationships with regional and global stakeholders to include regular reporting of progress to management and project stakeholders at all levels of the organisation
  • Identify, communicate and manage risks to delivering solutions

The role provides an opportunity to work across all risk divisions including Credit Risk, Environmental and Social Risk and Compliance as well as being involved in varying levels of project size allowing a broader variety of project work and stakeholder engagement. This is an opportunity to develop your experience and assume responsibility of full ownership of the project life cycle and delivery.

You will bring with you:
  • proven business analysis skills and experience with some project management history and understanding of project and portfolio management practices, strong planning and organisational skills are key
  • previous experience in a financial institution with exposure to regulatory change and risk framework initiatives in the Risk domain
  • exceptional written and verbal communication skills including powerpoint, chairing meetings, presentations, relationship building
  • ability to adapt to change in an agile environment
  • ability to work efficiently in a geographically dispersed team with global stakeholders
  • experience in using project management tools (e.g. Jira) and data analysis platforms (e.g. Power BI) desirable

If this sounds like you then we would love to hear from you, please apply via the link below.

Title: Business Compliance Analyst (Asset Management)
Description:
Business Compliance Analyst (Asset Management)
Are you ready to take the next step in your Compliance career? Do you have Compliance experience in Asset Management?

We are looking for a Compliance Analyst to join us and support our Asset Management businesses across EMEA.

In this wide and varied advisory role you will be focused on providing guidance to senior stakeholders in both our Macquarie Infrastructure and Real Assets (MIRA) and our Macquarie Investment Management (MIM) businesses. Reporting to the EMEA Regional Head of MAM Compliance in the UK, you will work closely with members of the MAM Compliance team in the UK, Germany and Luxembourg.

We are a dedicated team aligned to Macquarie Asset Management (MAM), which forms part of the wider Risk Management Group (RMG). You will utilise your proven relationship and stakeholder management skills to advise and oversee Macquarie Group's compliance requirements for MAM. You will also be responsible for reviewing and approving marketing materials, assisting with compliance reviews and approvals of new transactions, products and funds, and the preparation of regulatory compliance reports.

To be successful in this role, you will have previous experience within the AM industry (including experience in a legal or regulatory role) preferably within a private equity, multi-asset Manager, or UCITS manager. You will be familiar with the UK and European regulatory regimes relating to asset management and any other European knowledge & experience would also be desirable. Furthermore, a solid understanding of both AIFMD and MIFID, and knowledge of AIFs and UCITS are required.

Apply now to be considered for this exceptional role.

About the Risk Management Group

The Risk Management Group (RMG) is an independent, centralised unit responsible for ensuring all risk across Macquarie are appropriately assessed and managed. Its divisions include Behavioural Risk, Compliance, Credit, Financial Crime Risk, Internal Audit, Market Risk, Operational Risk, Regulatory Affairs and Aggregate Risk, and RMG Enterprise Support.

Title: Associate, Value-Add Infrastructure Investing
Description:
Associate, Value-Add Infrastructure Investing
This is an excellent opportunity for an experienced Associate to join our award winning team and be involved in investment of the Macquarie Capital balance sheet as principal in infrastructure companies and projects across Europe, with a primary focus on value-add infrastructure businesses, spanning the energy, transport, social and digital infrastructure sectors.

You will join our Infrastructure Principal and Projects team in London raising and negotiating committed external debt and balance sheet equity for infrastructure opportunities, building financial models, negotiating commercial contracts, conducting due diligence, market and industry research, preparing materials to support an transaction for both internal and external stakeholders and engaging professionally with our counterparties, such as industry partners and global co-investors, due diligence advisors and client representatives.

Recently the team has completed such transactions as the acquisition of a Fibre-to-the-Home network from MasMovil in Spain, and the £1.2bn Silvertown Tunnel PPP project in the UK, and won various industry awards such as Financial Advisor and Sponsor of the year (both for the second year running) at the 2020 Partnership Awards.

You will have an outstanding academic record and combine the knowledge obtained in your undergraduate degree (preferably in Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Engineering or Law) with your previous experience (3-5 years) within the infrastructure and/or energy (excluding oil and gas) sectors in either an Infrastructure Fund, Principal Investing, or Investment Banking to quickly make an impact. There is a strong preference for candidates with relevant principal investing experience within the value-add infrastructure sector.

You will use your expertise in modelling to evaluate performance under various operating scenarios to analyse the impacts of different capital structures. Your knowledge of all stages in infrastructure transaction execution, including origination, diligence, and execution of equity, debt, and M&A transactions will enable you to summarise and present the results in a succinct manner.

If you have experience in value-add infrastructure transactions in the energy, transport, social and digital infrastructure sectors, in a comparable organisation, we want to hear from you.

Macquarie Capital offers global capability in M&A Advisory, Debt and Equity Capital Markets, Principal Finance, and Equity Trading and Research underpinned by deep specialist expertise across a range of sectors. Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Business Analyst
An opportunity for an experienced Business Analyst to work in the Regulatory Reporting Technology team in London.

You will partner closely with the business to support regulatory risk management and reduce operational risk. You will work within an Agile project team to deliver reform changes, strategic projects and operational improvements to meet the needs of our shifting regulatory landscape globally.

Your work will be wide ranging, covering elicitation and documentation of multi-jurisdictional regulatory requirements, collaborating with technologists to design and implement solutions, working across internal and external system dependencies.

We're offering a fast-paced, project delivery environment and a chance to draw on your problem-solving skills to achieve optimal outcomes for our stakeholders.

You will have experience within financial services covering trade lifecycle events, preferably across global regulatory reporting requirements and demonstrable ability to co-ordinate peers to support implementation and achieve team deliverables within an Agile/Scrum environment.

If you have experience of the regulatory landscape and/or human-centred design that would be useful.

Working in Technology at Macquarie, you'll be part of a high performing team and sit side-by-side with business stakeholders. Our flat structure means that you'll directly contribute to our strategy, while taking ownership of a diverse range of projects utilising the latest technologies.

Title: Internal Auditor
Description:
Internal Auditor
As an experienced Internal Auditor, you will assess the design and operating effectiveness of controls to provide independent assurance to the Board and senior management. In this role, you will continue to develop your understanding of the abovementioned businesses and establish effective relationships with stakeholders to aid in the timely identification of issues and the delivery of audits, working toward leading audits. You will prepare risk-based work plans and work papers to professional standards in line with Internal Audit's methodology.

To be successful in this role, you will have prior Internal Audit or risk management experience, preferably in a financial services institution, excellent communication skills and the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels.

This role offers you a fantastic opportunity to work with our most dynamic and varied operating groups, Macquarie Capital and Macquarie Infrastructure and Real Assets. You will not need this domain experience to be successful in this team, but you will have the chance to develop your auditing skills in a truly dynamic environment. Working as part of our Risk Management Group your audits will lead to tangible improvements to the Groups management of risk. You will achieve this while working within a global team from a diverse range backgrounds, all of whom have deep knowledge and expertise in financial services and related areas. Whilst the role is based in London, you would be joining an internal audit team that is represented in Sydney, New York, Singapore, Jakarta, Gurugram and Hong Kong. Travel may be required as our business units are also represented across the globe.

If you possess relevant experience and a commitment to delivering high quality outcomes, apply today.

Title: Vice President, Financial Institutions Group - Advisory & Capital Solutions
Description:
Vice President, Financial Institutions Group - Advisory & Capital Solutions
Join our highly successful and growing Financial Institutions Group team in London, as a Vice President within the Advisory & Capital Solutions division of Macquarie Capital.

Our Financial Institutions team provides advisory and financing services, including M&A, Principal Investment and Leveraged Finance to Financial Institution clients. In addition, our Principal Finance team focuses on making direct private investments across the capital structure from common equity to structured senior debt using our balance sheet. Both of these teams are active in Financial Institutions, while also being active in other sectors that include industrials, TMT, Healthcare and Infrastructure with dedicated investment professionals based in London, New York, Hong Kong and Sydney.

As a Vice President, you will be involved in the execution of transactions from the outset and will be work closely with the senior team to generate and execute advisory transactions whilst managing the junior team, providing guidance on financial analysis and reviewing financial models. You will be key in designing and leading the production of presentations, information memoranda and other analysis for internal and external audiences and will lead due diligence processes on behalf of clients.

To be successful in this role, you will have at least 6-8 years of relevant experience in a comparable organisation, with strong experience in M&A within the Financial Institutions sector, preferably within the asset / wealth management, life insurance, fintech or specialty lending sub-sectors, and an excellent academic record. You will be a self-starter with the ability to demonstrate your deal execution experience and financial modelling skills. The ability to speak any foreign languages (particularly French, German, Belgian or Dutch) would be advantageous.

If you are currently working as a Senior Associate or Vice President with relevant experience and are looking for a challenging new role with scope to grow within an already successful team, we want to hear from you.

Macquarie Capital offers global capability in M&A Advisory, Debt and Equity Capital Markets, Principal Finance, and Equity Trading and Research underpinned by deep specialist expertise across a range of sectors. Title: Group Treasury Funding, Senior Manager
Description:
Group Treasury Funding, Senior Manager
Group Treasury is a division of the Financial Management Group and is responsible for the management of the funding, liquidity and capital position of the Macquarie Group.

Join Group Treasury's funding team in London as a Senior Manager. This is a great opportunity to be exposed to the inner-workings of an international group and work in a non-hierarchical, merit-based environment.

You will be part of a team that plays a broad role in ensuring that Macquarie's entities in the EMEA remain well funded and adequately meet their liquidity requirements.

In this role you will be required to:
  • assist in the preparation of liquidity reporting and modelling
  • enhance Macquarie's liquidity policies and assist in the preparation of regulatory documents such as ILAAPs
  • help to implement regulatory change across our businesses and work with our businesses to assess the liquidity impacts of their transactions
  • analyse and support the execution of funding strategies
  • develop relationships with internal and external stakeholders within the region.

This is a challenging and dynamic role that will suit someone with a strong understanding of liquidity and who has had exposure to other areas of Treasury such as funds transfer pricing or funding execution.

You will have had experience in leading projects, managing to tight timeframes, and delivering high quality outcomes. In this role you will work closely with other teams within Macquarie and will be required to present your work to senior management and committees.

If you have strong analytical skills, enjoy problem solving and can interpret and communicate complex information to a wide range of stakeholders then this is the role for you.

To thrive in this role, you will have:
  • a tertiary qualification, preferably in a business/finance/economics or related discipline and with at least 6 - 8 years of experience within banking and finance
  • experience of liquidity risk or balance sheet management and an understanding of liquidity, funding and other treasury matters
  • have an ability to think critically and strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills with a high level of attention to detail
  • be able to present compelling and persuasive arguments to senior stakeholders including the ability to interpret and succinctly explain complex data
  • have strong numerical skills, in order to analyse and critically assess financial information
  • have advanced software skills (Microsoft Office) - experience with database querying or visualisation tools will also be an advantage
  • be an organised, highly motivated and flexible team player, willing to collaborate with a broad range of stakeholders including with global Group Treasury colleagues
  • be able to manage tight deadlines and manage projects with multiple stakeholders and dependencies.

If this sounds like your next role, then please apply now!

About the Financial Management Group

The Financial Management Group provides financial, tax and treasury services to all areas of Macquarie. The group is focused on providing strategic analysis and advice to Macquarie's businesses and senior management, managing Macquarie's funding, liquidity and capital position, ensuring Macquarie continues to meet regulatory and compliance obligations and managing Macquarie's corporate affairs.

Title: Fund Management Associate, 6 months fixed term contract, Private Credit
Description:
Fund Management Associate, 6 months fixed term contract, Private Credit
Macquarie Infrastructure and Real Assets division has an opportunity for an experienced candidate to join the Fund Management Team supporting the Private Credit business in our London office, on a six-month fixed term contract.

Our Infrastructure & Real Assets division helps finance essential real assets, including infrastructure, social housing and healthcare accommodation, through the provision of private credit. Through its managed funds and partnerships with clients, our Private Credit team oversee approximately €9.7 billion in debt investments as at 31 March 2020. Macquarie's infrastructure debt asset management business, Macquarie Infrastructure Debt Investment Solutions is housed within the Private Credit division.

In this new role, you will be a key member of the team responsible for the oversight of all financial, regulatory and investor reporting working closely with both internal and external stakeholders including managing client / investor relationships and oversight of a number of external service providers, auditors and other commercial counterparties.

Utilising your operational and relationship skills, you will work closely with the wider Private Credit business as well as administrators managing the life cycle of financing transactions, from the execution phase through to oversight of the day-to-day transactional activities including coordinating the flow of funds from investor to borrower via an array of Fund products or Separately Managed Accounts. You may also be involved in the client settlement process; checking loan and supporting documentation's accuracy and completeness to enable settlements, which requires you to have a thorough understanding of both the legal and operational aspects of transactions.

You will be involved in various aspects of treasury and liquidity management for the Funds including optimising the FX and hedging requirements of the Fund and managing investor drawdowns and distributions. You will also be involved in ad hoc investor reporting as well as responding to individual questions or due diligence request from Investors.

You will help drive policy adherence across the team and help ensure a robust risk management control framework is in place.

Your experience in a similar type role - for example working on closed-end or open-ended private equity or debt Funds would be advantageous, although not essential. Being tertiary qualified with advanced Excel skills, you will combine your experience in Fund Management or Loan operations with your attention to detail to form an integral part of a very successful Fund Management team, delivering a high level of service to our stakeholders and clients.

Your technical competencies will enable you to deal with unique and varied Fund structures and your high level of IT literacy and your experience and understanding of IFRS and multi-currency environments will be utilised in this role.

Your strong prioritisation skills, being able to deliver within tight timelines, your effectiveness in planning and ensuring quality output will be essential in this role. You will have excellent written and oral communication skills, and be a highly motivated, proactive, and resilient individual. You will demonstrate sound business judgement and possess strong interpersonal skills which will give you the ability to liaise with stakeholders at all levels.

Finally, you will be degree-educated, coupled with a formal accounting qualification with PQE.

About Macquarie Asset Management

Macquarie Asset Management is a large scale, global asset manager, providing clients with access to a diverse range of capabilities and products across infrastructure, real estate, natural resources, private credit, fixed income, equities, multi-asset and liquid alternatives. As at 31 December 2020, Macquarie Asset Management had $A550.9 billion of assets under management.

Title: Devices and mobility Engineer
Description:
Devices and mobility Engineer
Work in a team that is responsible for multiple end-user services across the enterprise, encompassing Desktop, Virtual Desktop, Mobility and Print. In this role your focus will be on the Enterprise Mobility Management space.

This role will be focused on:
  • Provide 3rd Level operational support for technologies in the Devices and Desktop Mobility space, including troubleshooting Workspace ONE related incidents
  • Understanding and owning the restricted mobility platform in EMEA
  • You will be accountable for the technical delivery of project-based work (regionally and globally) and will be pivotal to our team successfully delivering a global device strategy for the group
  • Reducing Failure Demand and looking for automation opportunities
  • Continuous improvement - constantly reviews the global design to provide the best possible end-user experience for the business.
  • Documenting and training global technology support teams and end users where appropriate
  • Ensuring appropriate resiliency plans are in place

A background in Workspace ONE Enterprise Mobility Management, UEM design understanding, networking, and automation in large enterprise environments is key to be successful in this role. In addition, your technical skills will include:
  • Sound knowledge of Mobile Device Management technologies, preferably VMware AirWatch / Workspace ONE and Intune
  • Experience in design, implementation, deployment and management of iOS and Android operating systems design and/or implementation and management of MacBook's would be advantageous
  • Sound understanding of Microsoft Office 365 and associated technologies including Exchange, Intune, Active Directory, SAML and PowerShell
  • Experience of supporting and managing Virtual Desktop / Applications (Citrix XenApp / XenDesktop, VMware Horizon) desirable
  • Some knowledge and experience of F5 APM and Aruba ClearPass advantageous
  • Strong understanding on AWS / EC2 / S3 / RDS where the Workspace ONE Application Servers are placed
  • Strong problem-solving skills with an end-user focus, specifically in a global and dynamic business environment

Find out more about Macquarie careers at www.macquarie.com/careers

Title: Asset Manager (Specialised Asset Finance)
Description:
Asset Manager (Specialised Asset Finance)
As an Asset Manager within our Specialised and Asset Finance (SAF) division, you will play a critical role in making informed financial risk decisions.

SAF provides innovative and traditional capital, finance and related services to clients operating in Global markets. With offices in Australia, Asia, North America, and Europe, SAF specializes in:
  • Leasing and Asset finance.
  • Tailored Debt and finance solutions.
  • Asset Remarketing, Sourcing, and Trading.

Working primarily on equipment valuations and residual value analysis for loan or leased equipment, you will oversee collateral analysis for relevant financing structures, expected use and various transactional data to provide information to determine equipment future residual valuations.

Using your previous experience within a similar related role, you will also provide guidance to key stakeholders, on technology, application, structure of maintenance parameters and return options to preserve value in the equipment, control and assurance of the security pools, end of lease management requirements and carry out regular audit practices across the equipment remit.

You will monitor and manage key equipment risks throughout the transaction cycle, requiring on-site inspection of the equipment (especially in international markets and often remote locations), attend auctions and industrial clearance sales, provide analysis of current market and industry conditions and evaluate alternatives regarding the current or potential future disposal of equipment.

Reporting to senior management, you will leverage your exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills to provide regular updates on business activity, ensuring you are regularly keeping up to date with industry standards, new developments and future value implications.

You will be comfortable collaborating across different business units to ensure best practice, consistency and process are always applied.

The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 5 years' experience in one of the following areas but will also be expected to provide valuations across this full range of sectors in which Macquarie's SAF EMEA team operates:
  • Energy assets: thermal reciprocating engines (gas or diesel), solar panels, batteries and ancillary balance of plant
  • Resource Industries: mining equipment, heavy construction machinery or industrial
  • Exposure to alternative fuel vehicles (EV, FCEV, Biogas) would be an advantage.

An extensive international network with Brokers /Auction Houses / OEM Dealers would be an advantage and you will have or working towards a RICS qualification or equivalent professional qualification. Experience in sales and/or business development will be highly regarded and an exposure to a corporate or banking environment would be considered a plus.

You must have the ability to travel domestically and internationally regularly and work and support remote client engagements across EMEA.

If this sounds exciting, please apply now!

About Commodities and Global Markets

Commodities and Global Markets provides clients with an integrated, end-to-end offering across global markets including equities, fixed income, foreign exchange and commodities.

Title: Group Treasury Capital Manager/Senior Manager
Description:
Group Treasury Capital Manager/Senior Manager
We have an opportunity for someone with your experience to assist with our UK and European operations. The primary focus is expected to be supporting Group Treasury's EMEA Management Team with a focus on the capital management of Macquarie's UK and European regulated entities and on the production of Internal Capital Adequacy Assessment Process (ICAAP) and capital management framework documents.

As part of a small, specialised team in EMEA, you will have the opportunity to gain broad exposure to the activities of Macquarie divisions operating in the region and to build close relationships with these businesses and other support functions.

Your key responsibilities will include the production and coordination of the ICAAP documents including project planning and managing stakeholders across a wide variety of teams within Macquarie. You will also be supporting in the capital management of Macquarie's EMEA regulated entities, including maintenance of capital management framework documentation, monitoring developments in UK and European prudential standards, impact analysis and implementation of regulatory change and other regulatory change initiatives.

Monitoring and oversight of capital adequacy of regulated entities, including committee and Board reporting will be a significant part of your role as well as reviewing business proposals in the region to help identify and address the impact on capital requirements for local entities and liaise within the team and other support functions to ensure these are considered for regulatory reporting and capital management purposes.

To be successful, you will have the confidence, drive and problem-solving skills to innovate and deliver great outcomes.

You will also have:
  • a tertiary qualification, preferably in a business/finance/economics/mathematics or related discipline
  • have 5 - 8 years' experience within treasury, prudential risk, or regulatory disciplines and have experience producing ICAAPs under the European regime
  • have a strong level understanding of capital adequacy regulations particularly EU prudential regimes including CRD / CRR, and the Pillar 2 / ICAAP framework. Given Macquarie's regulatory footprint in EMEA, you will also be willing to work on a variety of regulated entities in EMEA, including the UK, working to understand local rules and regulatory topics related to investment firms
  • ability to assess and interpret regulatory policy, and communicate impacts to Macquarie businesses, senior management and committees
  • understand, analyse and assess impacts of upcoming changes to regulatory regimes related to capital management as well as partake in regulatory change programs
  • an ability to think critically and have strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills with a strong attention to detail
  • have strong numeric skills, in order to monitor and critically assess financial information
  • be an organised, highly motivated and flexible team player, willing to collaborate with a broad range of stakeholders including with global Group Treasury colleagues
  • be able to manage tight deadlines and manage projects / stakeholders with multiple dependencies.

If this sounds like an interesting opportunity to you, then please apply now.

About the Financial Management Group

The Financial Management Group provides financial, tax and treasury services to all areas of Macquarie. The group is focused on providing strategic analysis and advice to Macquarie's businesses and senior management, managing Macquarie's funding, liquidity and capital position, ensuring Macquarie continues to meet regulatory and compliance obligations and managing Macquarie's corporate affairs.

Title: Senior Associate or Vice President, Infrastructure Advisory
Description:
Senior Associate or Vice President, Infrastructure Advisory
Take control of your career and join Macquarie Capital's London Infrastructure Advisory team as a Senior Associate or Vice President.

The team currently provides advisory and financing services, including M&A, ECM, DCM Principal Investment and Leveraged Finance to a global client base including corporates, private equity, infrastructure and sovereign wealth funds. We are looking for an experienced Senior Associate or Vice President with strong M&A experience within the Infrastructure space.

You will work with the senior team to originate and execute opportunities, assisting them in all transaction execution activities and marketing with an emphasis on financial analysis. You will prepare financial models and pitch books for transaction execution and marketing purposes as well as model cash flows / financial projections to support transactions. You will also have the opportunity to attend relevant meetings with clients and senior leaders as well as industry conferences.

To be considered for this position, you must have between 4-7 years of relevant M&A experience preferably within the Infrastructure sector and an excellent academic record. You should be able to demonstrate your deal execution experience and be regarded as an outstanding performer amongst your peers. You should also have strong financial modelling, valuation and presentation skills and be an excellent communicator in both written and spoken English. Any other language skills will also be advantageous.

About Macquarie Capital

Macquarie Capital offers global capability in M&A Advisory, Debt and Equity Capital Markets, Principal Finance, and Equity Trading and Research underpinned by deep specialist expertise across a range of sectors. Our people are empowered to think innovatively to address client challenges and originate opportunities, thinking beyond individual transactions to become a trusted adviser and partner over the long haul. From origination to execution, our unique combination of ideas, capital and expertise is transforming opportunity into reality for our clients and partners around the world.

With staff in 35 offices transacting across 31 countries, Macquarie Capital is a truly global business. A role in the team will expose you to a dynamic working environment and the opportunity to contribute to high-profile transactions whilst working in a business with the best people in the industry.

Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
